title: Amazing city amazing hotel and unbelievable staff
text:
Totally Amazing , Location perfect , staff unbelievable!
We recently took a trip from Northern Ireland and on arriving we were met by Paige ! What a welcome and an amazing start to our trip ! 
It’s like being at home so welcoming ! Hotel is so central and the New York City pass is a must such a saving !
Food in the hotel was really good 
We had a family room and it was so perfect ! 
I have to say I can’t wait to come back it really is a fantastic city made even
More great by Paige and the team at the west house hotel
Thankyou

title: Most amazing staff ever!!
text: This hotel has the most superb staff of any I have ever experienced anywhere!  I happened upon this hotel while in a challenging situation.  Everyone went so far above and beyond to help me that I thought it necessary to post a review (which I rarely do).  I am truly overwhelmed by the kindness and graciousness of the staff.

title: Great location, amenities, and staff!
text: Extremely happy to have stayed here. The views of the terrace were outstanding and the staff were beyond nice! The amenities were a huge bonus. Also, I did want to give a huge thank you for everyone who helped me so much! Thank you Erikka for being above nice to us and caring for us and making us feel like family. Definitely coming back here!

title: Excellent mid town choice without breaking the bank.
text: First off, the staff is VERY professional. Amina and the entire front desk team was accommodating and very cordial. They were honest about what they could do and could not do. That’s all I ask as someone that travels frequently. The hotel was very clean and the amenities were good. Excellent mid town choice that won’t break the bank.

title: Great Hotel in the Perfect Location!
text: The hotel staff were very accommodating and provided great service, especially Vanessa. The room was clean and the food and drink service was great. Thank you for the upgrade as well! It’s also right near Central Park and in a convenient location.

title: Very nice experience
text: Amazing hotel , great location . Our suites were perfect . You do pay a service fee of 55 per person which includes a happy hour , last night was Mexican food , includes beer , wine ,Preseco  , soda . Service was excellent , clean rooms  and overall  a very nice atmosphere .

title: A Nice Boutique Hotel
text: The hotel has a great location and welcoming lobby. The receptionist was not. She called a manager in order to fix a misunderstanding since this boutique hotel is part of two others in the same building. The room had no view. The AC was noisy during all the night and no amenities but two bottles of water. In my opinion, it’s overpriced and reception staff should be more accommodating. The breakfast reminded me to cruises’ ones, where people are dressed to go to the swimming pool not to a fancy terrace lounge. I love the well dressed folks!

title: Exceptional Hotel
text:
Great hotel. Location was perfect, close to Time Square, Central Park and the subway. 
This hotel is beautiful. Staff are warm and friendly, genuinely there to help with any request. Breakfast and Happy Hour are superb. Finally, hotel is exceptionally clean and the linens are top notch.

title: Perfect location nice staff
text:
Our flight arrived early as usual, they let us leave our luggage there so we can walk around the city , before the room was available.
They always have a nice hot chocolate, it was very cold when we were there, this was a nice touch.
Breakfast good, not fantastic, could have more variety of fruits, but very cozy place to have breakfast, sometimes crowded but nice .
The gym is perfect, lots of treadmills.
The location is PERFECT.
The only thing they didn’t get a 5 stars it is because they don’t have a coffe machine in the e room. Most of the hotels has it.

title: Home away from Home
text:
Nick & Moe at the reception - Home Run!
Room - Home Run!
Breakfast & Evening Beer, Wine, Food - Home Run!
Staff, Location, Hospitality - Home Run
Let's just call the West House a Grand Slam of the place to stay in Manhattan!!

title: Memorable experience beyond expectation in NYC
text: The property is next level offering a memorable experience from the lobby to the guestrooms. Amazing City Views and extras. Best part is the friendly and helpful staff. From Vanessa at the front desk at check in, to the concierge and everyone in between, making the most memorable experience beyond expectation in NYC. I will stay here every time I visit if possible.

title: 5 Star Hotel with 5 Star Treatment
text:
I spent 4 days at the West House with my partner on a trip of a lifetime.
The extraordinary service from the staff made the stay that much more special.
A special mention to Pagye, who for me and my partners engagement, pulled out all the stops to make our stay as luxurious as possible!
The location of the hotel couldn't have been better for a first visit to New York with views of Broadway from our window!

title: Don’t Take a Chance on Fraudulent Charges. Too bad, it’s a great hotel otherwise.
text:
We had an amazing time and loved the hotel, amenities, staff and rooms. However, one of our 3 rooms was in a corner and was VERY warm so we requested fans to help pull air in from outside and left the windows open for the 5 nights we were there. Thought everything was fine after that until we checked out and received a $500 smoking penalty that no staff at WestHouse could help us with. I was referred to the director of front desk at Park Central to dispute the charge and she has not responded to any of my calls, emails, or messages left with her staff. We are not smokers and in no way should have been charged with it. 

It’s unfortunate that they are fraudulent with their charges and won’t respond when you try to take the high road and not give them a bad review. We had planned to stay there the next time we were in NYC, but we will absolutely find a different hotel after the horrible service from management around a fraudulent claim and charge.

title: Fraudulent claims on credit card by the hotel once we had departed!
text:
Terrible customer service geared up for fraud. They will attempt to charge you $500 for smoking in the room 'as a sensor said so'..... Neither of us smoke or vape. Its robbery. Avoid avoid avoid. 
No customer service to deal with the said fraud. They are geared up to rob you once you have left. 
There is an awful lot of hotels in NYC. Avoid the headache!!!

title: Best experience
text:
Amazing experience all
Around 
Accommodations the best , service outstanding 
5 star recommendation 
We love Paige! She was the best concierge ever!
Going to the westhouse anytime we visit NYC! The location amazing , the staff 
Incredible - rooms are large and beautiful 
Extremely well managed and 5 star clean!
Highly recommend!!!!

title: Save yourself
text: This was billed as a 4/5 star hotel.  No way.  The pictures on line must of one good room.  The ceilings are low, my toilet didn't work - even though I asked for it to be fixed.  When I checked in, the front desk man said he's text/ call me as soon as my room was ready - he did not! I started receiving a few texts from different people within the hotel which were confusing.  I finally asked if my room was ready - and the same man - said oh yes - I forgot to call you!! :/

title: The BEST experience!!
text: Had the best experience last month. Was there for 4 nights with girlfriends and everything was wonderful. The manager Pagye was super attentive to our needs and even brought a portable AC to my room when I mentioned in passing that  the heater in the room worked too well. I did not even have to ask her! All of the staff was fabulous, including Sonia who was wonderful when we enjoyed complimentary breakfasts and appetizers/drinks daily on the 23rd floor. I will definitely be back and highly recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing place
text:
Amazing hotel, chosen for two double beds,  to celebrate my daughter’s 18th birthday.  Above average price but definitely worth every penny.

On floor 19, had a rooftop view from room but nothing recognisable.  They had a terrace on 23rd floor with a view along 7th avenue into Times square and the very top of the Empire state building.  Beautiful place for an evening drink even in Feb.

Hotel room was lovely, beds very comfortable, limited space around sink  but good shower with large cubicle.

No kettle (missed that) but an empty fridge.

They provided free of charge, in our room on arrival,  birthday balloon, t shirts, key rings, american candy, fruit and cakes.  A really lovely surprise.  

Breakfast was a limited range but tasted wonderful mix of cereals, breads and hot food.  The drinks and canapés between 5-8pm were of excellent quality.  We didn’t eat out much - happy with the food in the hotel.  It’s inside but they do have an outside terrace which was open.  Just had a tip jar so no pressure to tip.  

10 min walk to Times square, 5 min walk to central park and subway outside. Bottled water provided in room.   

Really nice stay and would stay here again.

title: Great stay!
text:
I stayed at the Westhouse in NY for a week in Feb. 
The room was on the 25th floor and was large, clean and bed was incredibly comfortable!

Pros: 
- Very big rooms
- Comfortable beds
- Good amemties 
- Staff are incredibly helpful and friendly 
- Great location walking distance to TS and Rockefeller centre

Cons
- Very loud location (but you'll get this anywhere in NY) 
- No room service availabile
- You will be charged an extra fee per night when you check out, its refunded at check out but I wasnt aware of this so was a little surprised 
- Towels are very thin and small

Overall I highly recommend the Westhouse for your next stay.

title: The Best Hotel in New York
text: This hotel is absolutely amazing, do not stay anywhere else and please ignore any negative comments, the staff were so attentive, the rooms were luxurious, the food was delicious, and the Tapas and complimentary drinks from 5-8pm everyday was such a bonus. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. Thank you everybody x

title: Best place to stay in NYC
text: Best girls trip EVER!  Six of my closest friends and I decided to visit NYC together and the WestHouse Hotel was PERFECTION!  Amazing location (55th and 7th), unbelievable service, and big rooms for NYC.  Payge was an exceptional hotel manager and went above and beyond to make us ladies feel special.  Sonia and her team on the 23rd floor treated us like Queens and catered to all our needs.  Can't wait to return for our Galentine's trip in 2025 - our trip is already booked!  Thank you to the entire staff for making us feel special.

title: The BEST HOTEL !
text:
Once again the Westhouse has truly out done themselves. The staff, the amenities, the location , everything is AMAZING! 

Not once have I ever been disappointed as per my experience. The staff is so friendly & welcoming. They make you feel like family & will always accommodate your needs. This hotel is so clean, with nothing but the comfiest beds & spacious rooms.

The location is incredible within walking distance to all your needs. The subway is right out the building & there is a market less than a 2 min walk open 24/7. 

Payge in particular went out of her way to extend our stay upon request & managed to provide us with an incredible room.  

Thank you for always providing such an incredible stay for me. I cannot wait to come back & see all the lovely staff as soon as I can!
Thank you!

title: Way overpriced
text: Hot room with paper-like sheets that made noise when you move. No A/C or fan air flow. Bathroom so small you had to straddle toilet to close door. Breakfast was powder scrambled eggs and cold diced potatoes. No options for Gluten free bread or pasta. This Hotel is way over priced.

title: Best place to stay in Manhattan.
text:
This was my best trip to NYC. The Westhouse was amazing. Payge was the most attentive and exceptional manager I have ever met. The staff across the hotel was flawless. 
Sophia and her team on the 23rd floor were incredible and catered to all of our needs. 
We already booked our trip for 2025. 
Can’t wait to come back. 
We might have to plan another trip sooner. 
Thank you to the whole staff at the Westhouse Hotel.

title: An amazing experience
text: Was my first time in NY and I could have not choose a better place to accommodate my memories , the hotel was breathless, the terrace at the breakfast room has a stunning view of NY, I would encourage everyone to try this hotel

title: Stay away
text:
This place is a front for some kind of scam. No services and just plain grim and creepy. They are probably housing migrants on the majority of floors not accessible by the elevator. My son and I left early the next morning for another hotel after getting in late. We couldn’t even sleep it was so creepy. 
Try it for yourself if you have doubts. I’ve been all over the world and have stayed in all sorts of accommodations, but this place gets the strangest, creepiest award.

title: My New Go-To in Manhattan
text: I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. It's in a perfect location, halfway between Central Park and Broadway district. Donna at check in was so helpful and friendly. The room was a good size for NYC, and it was clean and comfortable. The evening wine/ snack gathering and breakfast were unbelievable. The staff were so kind, and nothing was too much to ask for. Sonia H went above and beyond, taking pictures of our group and making sure we had refills. As often as I go to NYC, I can't believe I've never stayed here, but I will definitely be back!

title: 3 great nights in great location
text:
Stayed for 3 nights and can honestly say this hotel didn’t disappoint.

The location is amazing near both Central Part and Tile Square, everything is on your door step! 

Getting to use the Terrace for Breakfast and Afternoon nibbles and drinks is well worth the $55 a day charge ….

Breakfast was fresh with hot and cold offerings and in the evening you can enjoy hot and cold nibbles with endless wine , fizz , beers and hot/cold drinks . 

We were in room 1915 and it was very spacious with good views of the city , I would say a little dated but that me just being picky. The bed was mega comfortable, so all in all room hits the mark! 

We found all the staff really friendly and welcoming.

Only thing I will say is we were there for our Honeymoon and we emailed in advance and nothing was provided to enhance our experience, not even a little welcome card so it did miss the personal touch. 

We would 100% stay again.

title: Very nice experience!
text:
The service at the Terrace room is great! 
Great thanks to Sonia Martinez!, who serves the clients with a big smile.
The staff is keeping the place clean and making sure the buffet is filled with food and drinks.
The rooms are also clean and the staff is very friendly.

title: Unexpected charges
text: We stayed for two nights.  After we checked out, we were charged almost $400 in "Residence fees".  At no time during our stay did anyone ever mention these fees.  I have called the hotel several times since we checked out to discuss these fees and no one has had the courtesy to even call me back.

title: My go-to NYC hotel
text: Lovely boutique hotel.  Clean, well decorated and reasonable NYC rates.  The breakfast and late afternoon snacks and drinks are wonderful and adds to the experience.  The only NYC hotel I use.  Great location too.

title: It feels like you're staying with family!
text: Since 2017, WestHouse has been my “NYC Home Away from Home.” It is not merely a FABULOUS place to stay — offering the best location, services, amenities and value — but it is where my NY “family” resides because when I walk into their lobby, I am met by MO AT THE FRONT DESK beaming his gracious, welcoming, shining smile and asking how he can make our stay the very best ever... and then PAGYE THE VIP CLIENT SERVICE MGR offers kind assistance with her warm, generous, big-hearted, signature style, making our vacation dreams come true! Truly, ALL of the staff offers exceptional customer service with genuine sweetness. They really want you to enjoy your stay and their care is felt in every detail! Each visit exceeds our expectations so we plan our return visit because we fall in love all over again with NYC! The room is so comfy... the bed is so cozy... the location is perfect for walking everywhere... and the Terrace food and beverage is the best kept secret in the city (shhhh... don’t tell anyone!!!). Thanks for another magnificent stay, WestHouse! We know we'll be seeing you again soon :)

title: Decent Hotel, Beautifully Situated…
text:
First of all and as others have mentioned, this is not a 5 star hotel - I’d say 4 star but nevertheless we enjoyed our stay here just before Christmas. The bed was huge and comfortable and there was a superb rainfall shower so that’s two of my main prerequisites sorted straight away. The staff that we interacted with were all friendly and helpful but we must single out the British rock music loving Mexican barman Raph who we had some great laughs with although strangely not much past 11pm when the bar inexplicably shut.

The room itself was very small and the a/c was a bit noisy but worked ok to be fair but our room needed more lighting, far too dark.

I must admit that I wasn’t happy with the resort fee, something like $500 inches taxes for four nights but I should probably take that up with British Airways holidays who stated that we had B&B but you have no choice but to pay the resort fee which includes breakfast. Oh well, I didn’t want to spoil our break so bit my lip which is most unlike me and paid it.

Would I recommend staying here, yes I would because they do try and resolve any issues you might have, are very friendly as mentioned and it’s wonderfully situated just a block from Central Park and right next to 57 Street subway station serving important lines N, Q, R and W which we used daily.

title: Over charged and Hotel won't correct it
text: Everything was great while at the hotel but have had an impossible time getting anyone at the hotel to respond to an overbill on the room.  I was charged $577 for a smoking charge that never happened and have emailed the property 5 times and called many times more.

title: Perfect location for our NY holiday
text: The Westhouse was perfectly located for our NY holiday - close to Central Park, Broadway, museums, shopping, great restaurants and the subway. Amenities were great and staff very accommodating and helpful.

title: Excellent cost x benefit!
text: Hotel with a unique location. Next to Broadway and Times Square, 3 blocks from 5th Avenue and a few blocks from Central Park. We did practically 60% of the itinerary on foot. The resort fee that is currently charged by all hotels in NY entitles you to a great breakfast and also a very tasty Happy Hour on the 23rd floor. If you want, you can save a lot with this. We stayed in the queen room, the bed seemed a little small but comfortable. I recommend Westhouse as an exceptional option in NY!

title: Luxury at its finest!!
text: This is one of the best hotels in NYC!!! The rooms are amazing, the food is great, and the employees are amazing. One of the managers, Pagye, personally helped me and ensured that I had the best stay on my trip. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit NYC.

title: An absolute gem of a hotel in a fantastic location
text: We stayed at the WestHouse hotel 22-29 December and can’t recommend this hotel highly enough. From the moment we checked in till when we left we were made to feel very special. The only thing you’ve to be aware of is the $55 per person per night resort tax, which may seem a lot but for that you get a fantastic breakfast in the morning and in the evening between 5-8 food and alcoholic drinks. Drinks include beer, wine and champagne. Soft drinks, tea and coffee are provided throughout the day. The location is fantastic, only minutes from Central Park, 5th avenue and the theater district with loads of subway stops nearby. When we checked out they kept our luggage in a secure location (free of charge) and gave us a card so we could still use the facilities in the hotel. Looking forward to my next stay at the WestHouse ❤️

title: Wonderful hotel on a human scale. To recommend without any hesitation.
text:
Magnificent hotel in a wonderful location (close to everything).
Professional and quality welcome. My room (2407) was superb. I had a terrace with a breathtaking view of New York (this is exceptional in New York). Well appointed and very clean room. Quality breakfast.
Smiling and helpful staff. I would particularly like to thank Marcello and Viktor who do everything to make the residents feel good. I would also like to single out the two people of Moroccan origin at reception for their kindness and dedication. I really enjoyed the aperitif buffet between 5 p.m. and 8 p.m.
I have come to New York about thirty times. I have stayed in the best hotels there. This one is really a top on a human scale.
Thank you WestHouse Hotel.

title: AMAZING!
text: We were introduced to Pagye at the hotel from a mutual friend who stays at The WestHouse. Pagye immediately responded and set up our reservation and went above and beyond the entire time we were there. The staff, the service, the communication, the location, the food, etc… were all exceptional.  We are world travelers and have stayed at numerous hotels and we can honestly say this hotel is 5 star all the way. Great job Pagye!! We will return because of the service you and your team provided! Shout out to Payge, Jessie & Hazma all ROCKSTARS!🤩 thank you!

title: Worst 5 star hotel I’ve ever stayed in
text: Poor throughout. 5 star price without the 5 star experience. Bed being comfortable was the highlight of the hotel, but the rest of it lacked “a customer first approach”; which should be a non-negotiable.

title: Not worthy of 5 * classification-Very old and tired-at best a 3.5*
text:
If you are looking for 5 * then stay clear of this Hotel.!

It is very old and tired,ack of maintenance ,stained and broken furniture.
The online pictures aint  what  you get …
Such a disappointment..Breakfast and dinner as part fo the ‘residents fee ’is below average at best.
Promises made by staff not kept.
Go stay somwhere else…..or experience the disappointment ..at a 5* price!
Great location though!

title: Wonderful Winter Break
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights just before Xmas to finish off 2023 on a high.

The hotel and staff were terrific from the get go. Check in was good and we got into our room on 24 floor early which was a Brucey bonus. We even had a balcony overlooking the city looking south towards Times Square which was fab. 

The location was spot on with a subway station about 50 yards from the front door. Central Park about 5 minutes walk as was the Rockefeller and Times Square. 

We were aware of the daily fee for breakfast and dinner so took advantage of it every day. In the evening we were well looked after by Victor and Raphael. They were good fun and meant our glasses were never empty. 

There was loads of choice at breakfast so most people should be satisfied. Never found it too busy but were up and at it early with the time difference.

The evening tapas had a different theme each night and there was Prosecco, red, white wine and a choice of beers to wash down the grub. Each plate/urn of food was always kept full so you could graze as you wished.

It was over $100 per day for two but considering the costs in NYC I would say it was well worth using the eat in option.

The room was a good size with the stunning city views and it was kept immaculately on a daily basis.

The restaurant and balcony is on floor 23 so we could walk there and back via the stairs.

So to sum up we had a fabulous mini break and would defo recommend it to anyone needing a wee bit of comfort in the city. As per usual in a hotel the friendly staff made all the difference to our stay.

Great work WedtHouse

title: OK but not great and no advertised Champagne, just sparkling wine.
text:
We booked luxury king bedroom for a 4 night stay and was allocated room 1920.  When we checked in we were told the resident fee was included in the booking fee so nothing further to pay and I double checked on checkout and was told the same.  So imagine my surprise to find they took the fee of $504 without providing a bill or talking to me about it on checkout. I never signed anything.  When I queried this there was no apology.  They seemed to think I was querying the fee when I was actually querying why they told me one thing to my face on both checkin and checkout. This left me with a very bad impression.   
The hotel is old so expect the normal wear and tear.  What I didn't expect was a very noisy aircon in the room and serious lack of light in the main bedroom.  The buffet staff are fantastic and we didn't mind tipping them at all, totally worth it, they were running around and making sure everyone was happy.  I have to say though if you are expecting Champagne there isn't any.  There is American sparkling wine which seems to be what you get when you ask for Champagne or Prosecco.  
So the $10 question; would we stay again.  Probably not as there as so many wonderful restaurants in NYC that I could have spent the $504 on.

title: The Best Experience Yet!!!!
text:
My visit to Westhouse New York has been the best experience yet. I’ve traveled to New York several times but Tarik, Schpresa, The Doorman and The Terrance Staff has made this experience so impeccable. Tarik  provided me with a room upgrade to a suite with  a terrace during our stay, this was  very generous of him.  Everyone is kind and helpful and informative. The breakfast and happy hour at The Terrace is phenomenal. This has become my favorite hotel in NYC. The Customer Service is Priceless!!! 

Thank You Tarik, Schpresa, The Doorman and The Terrance Staff

title: Don’t waste a Christmas in this place
text:
We were very excited about our 8 night stay in NYC for Christmas with our kids and their partners.  Unfortunately westhouse is nothing like what it promoted. It’s 3 star at best. Think no room service, no turndown, no mini bar or snack to purchase.

When we checked in, two one bedroom suites one was assigned to a view of a brick wall. When I ask about it I was told the 3rd party we booked through couldn’t guarantee a city view, so we took them for the first night. I challenged it the next morning and showed them the booking confirmation from Luxury Escapes and they agreed to move one.  (I also called Luxury Escapes at the same time) we moved one room and have one good view and one very ordinary view.  

The rooms are very old. Ours has stains with urine under the toilet, cigarette burns in the couch and wallpaper pealed on most edges. Some days you get water in the room when it’s made and some days you call and ask for water and wait four hours and call again. Some days you get 5 towels, some days one, some days four facecloths and some none, today we have four pillowcases on the sofa nicely ironed (but do we need to change them ourselves) my son used the iron in his room to iron a shirt and it pumped out rusty water on it, so he needed to come done to ours via the stairs (more on that later) to iron a shirt. I’m convinced that the guest service number goes off site as they are so much more professional than people that work in the hotel. 

The shower doesn’t drain in both rooms. I called day two to ask for it to be serviced and was told that it would be the next day at 10am. 4 days later it hasn’t. My wife and I take turns at flushing the toilet to get the water out of the shower when using (I know it disgusting but we have no choice, when I called Luxury Escapes I was offer a 2 day refund that they will only give me as a credit (so I need to use them again) and it was made very clear if I move we would get nothing and I would need to pay for a new hotel 3 days out from Christmas in NYC. Hence we had to stay!

As far as the buffet goes think nice airline lounge food but set in a food court with people waiting over you shoulder to grab your seat as it is so busy (don’t judge them, you will be one of those people looking for a table for your family) the wine is the same cheap stuff ever night,  don’t get excited about champagne in other reviews it’s Prosecco, Stella Artois, and really bad red and white wine. 

We assumed wrongly that the hotel would do something special for Christmas Eve, the only thing they did is not open the bar so you could only use the free bar with the fore mentioned bad wine. Nothing special at all just another disappointing night. 

The lifts are horrendous, the hotel shares a list bank with the hotel next door. They have two shafts each. The ones next door have signs all over saying they are investigating $$ in fixing them. On our side nothing, and normally only one of the two work. So you need to wait 5-10 minutes each time you want to use. Sometimes we have needed to get out when it gets stuck with the door half open to walk up a flight of stairs to call a lift again so you get the other one, unfortunately people are so accustomed to it and just joke and laugh at passing each other walking up and down the stars (remember this hotel is 25 floors)

Anyway as mentioned Luxury Escapes have given us a 20% discount on this overwhelming disappointing experience we are stuck in, I had no choice but to accept it but really wanted others to be cautious, it’s nothing like what we expected for the price and listening to others in the lounge we are not the only ones feeling this way!

title: Fantastic.
text:
Fantastic. Fantastic location.
Fantastic breakfast. Fantastic happy hour. Fantastic rooms. It's the sixth time we've come to New York, but the first in this hotel.
Well what can I say, everything was perfect.
Cleanliness of the rooms, reception, ladies of the rooms, everything excellent. The breakfast was rich and good. The happy hour was a surprise, prawns and much more with good Italian wine. When we return for the seventh time I really think we will return to this hotel. The only negative note is that at check-in they hold a $900 deposit on your credit card which lowers your spending limit. So do your math.

title: Mixed Feelings, not 5 star
text: Mostly definitely not 5 star, the hotel does not look no where near as good as the photos on their website.  Most staff friendly apart from one lady on reception who preferred to be on her phone rather than attending to the hotel’s customers.  The resort fee is a bit high, seems people get charged different amounts.  We were charged 55 dollars per person and then tax on top of that making it 367 dollars for 2 of us for 3 nights.  The furniture was all worn in the bedroom with a cracked dirty mirror, not luxury at all.  Had a room on the 21st floor that looked onto a wall and there was some sort of generator noise outside the window the whole time. The room temperature was unbearable at times even though we had no heating on. The lifts are an actual nightmare, they were constantly not working or took absolutely ages to come. Some people actually got stuck in them during our stay.  I’m still waiting for the 300 dollars put on hold on my bank account card to be realised back to my account.  I feel a bit cheated at the amount we paid for this hotel.

title: Be vigilant with your bags!
text: After having an enjoyable stay I was very disappointed to discover that money had been stolen from my purse whilst in the care of the hotel   My luggage and bag were left in their luggage room which I thought was safe however, it obviously was not!  Very disappointed and upset after a pleasant stay.

title: 5 star expectations = 3 star reality
text:
The hotel, though marketed as a 5-star establishment, fell disappointingly short of my expectations for what a true 5-star experience should entail. The room, in particular, exuded a dated and worn-down ambiance, with a lackluster selection of basic TV channels. Instead of a picturesque view, my room presented an unimpressive sight—a rather uninspiring brick wall.

Adding to the list of grievances were noticeable flaws such as holes in the ceiling adorned with flaky paint, a broken door handle that hindered easy access, and an elevator that seemed to spend more time out of order than in operation. Despite these drawbacks, it's worth noting that the hotel's location stands out as its redeeming quality—undeniably convenient.

For those seeking a genuine 5-star experience, my advice would be to explore alternative accommodations. In truth, this hotel, at best, merits a 3-star rating.

title: Midtown Hotels
text:
Excellent hotel in great location. 
Great service and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean and generous in size . This is one of my favorite hotels to stay, in midtown, new york

title: Stollen Items
text: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights and I left my AirPod pros in the room. I came back to them missing along with some other items. I’d be careful if you’re staying here - I have a few stars because the breakfast and dinner staff was amazing.

title: Positve people make my day
text: The hotel is very clean and everything is new.  A positive attitude in the service industry is vital and everyone there is positive and eager to make my stay a good one.  Payge in the lobby helped me with my questions and guided me on the amenities.

title: Mixed experience at Westhouse
text: Not a 5* hotel as advertised; at most 4*. Stayed 6 nights and were delighted upon arrival to hear we had a “good view” room; which turned out to be the adjacent Westhouse/Park Central hotel wing, not the city. Rooms are small but comfortably appointed. Our first days most of the elevators were out of order, leading to long and crowded waits for the service elevators. Heating/AC control in the room was nonfunctional, hallways very hot and had to cool room by opening the windows. Housekeeping personnel were nice but inconsistent in restocking room water, washcloths and bathmat (don’t they have a checklist?). One of the best features was a stellar breakfast but I wish the “resort fees” were just part of the room charge because it’s annoying and unnecessary to have it separate. Great location in Midtown. Mixed experience for us overall which was disappointing because we enjoy NYC and had wanted to try Westhouse.

title: Highly recommend
text:
Vanessa was fabulous it was my 45th birthday with husband and another couple. Balloons and lovely cake in the room. The hotels really nice great rooms and location. Breakfast is exceptional and from 5-8 beers wines Prosecco and evening snacks enough for dinner with themes every night. Can’t recommend this place enough. Tanners Salon is great for drinks opposite too. 

Big thank you to Vanessa she is super helpful front staff member.

title: The WestHouse Hotel is THE place to stay in N.Y. City
text: We recently visited New York City and stayed at the WestHouse Hotel, which was a great decision. Vanessa at the front desk was friendly, helpful and all-around amazing and the rest of the staff was accommodating in every way possible. The free breakfast was like a 5-star buffet and the room was perfect to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. The location of the hotel is within walking distance to Times Square, Broadway shows, Central Park, Carneige Hall and shopping on 5th Avenue. I highly recommend the WestHouse Hotel and will definitely be staying there next time we visit!,

title: Book elsewhere if you don't want to sleep in a sauna ...
text: The location of this hotel is great and the terrace Happy Hour/Breakfast is a nice addition.  This is not free, you pay for it in a separate resort fee upon check in.  I stayed 2 nights and will not be staying again due to the following reasons.  My room thermostat was on 81 degrees both nights, I requested a new room but none were available so sent someone to fix, it never got fixed and I had to sleep with the window open both nights.  Having the window open let in an extreme amount of outside noise making it impossible to sleep.  My co-worker who I was traveling with had the same experience with the heat in her room. The sink drain in my room never drained, also not fixed.  The elevators were broken both days so walked 23 flights of steps the first few times then took the service elevator along with other guests which made the WestHouse employees very angry.  The worst part was the overall customer service from the front desk employees.  They were not surprised by any of these issues which makes me think all are very common.  They did nothing to help make any of these situations better, attitude.  Very expensive for a sub-par experience.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: The hotel and staff were fantastic. I am usually someone that gripes about the price vs. the service, but my expectations were exceeded in every way. You don’t always get what you pay for, but my family’s experience here, we felt that we had gotten more. Would be very happy to return here when the chance arrives.

title: Bad! Room 1901
text:
Bad service.. house keeping for room 1901 is terrible
One day she forgot to put bottel of water.. I called housekeeping for 2 bottle of water and she said she will deliver it but they didn’t.. they don’t offer room service “food” rather than u should order ur food from Uber Eats and they don’t send it to ur room they asked you to come down to get ur food.. the u feel is too old ! When checking out I called the concierge and front desk and service desk 4 times to send some to get my lagguage i called at 11:20 and they didn’t show up until 12:05 !! The elevator was shutted down

title: Attention Resident Fee
text: Attention nous avons payé 63$ par jour et par personne de taxe Resident fee. Hotel réservé par le biais de air France !!!! Taxe qui n'a pas été annoncé par l'hôtel à l'arrivée. On nous a juste demandé notre carte à la réception pour une garantie comme une caution, sans explication. Surprise à notre retour en France avec un paiement carte de l'hôtel de 583€ sur notre compte. Après vérification de la réservation, le montant de la taxe était noté page 5 du descriptif voyage, rien n'apparaît sur la facture. Une pratique honteuse. Vraiment déçu car nous avions passé un bon séjour.

Very clean hotel, enjoyed my stay awesome manager Pagye and staff were so attentive, loved the delicious hot chocolate in the lobby, kept me feeling warm & toasty. The 23rd floor terrace has an amazing view will return soon

title: Great Hotel with  fantastic staff. Cannot beat location and value
text: Stay was basically perfect. In NYC for a long anniversary weekend. Staff made it wonderful: balloons, treats in room. Rooms all mini-suites. Cannot beat location--3 blocks from MOMA; subway 100 ft away.

title: Thank you, Pagye and Westhouse Staff. Great Hotel.
text:
Wonderful place. Very clean hotel.  Great location. Hotel lobby smells great.
Very kind staff. Great food. Nice rooms.

I would like to thank Pagye - she is a manager. She went above and beyond to help me with requests I had for my arrival and room. 
She is always a pleasure to deal with.

Thank you so much, Pagye and staff at Westhouse for always being so helpful and making our stay a fabulous one.

title: Westhouse Hotel stay and service level
text: This hotel is the only hotel I will stay in NYC. In additional to the perfect location, the hotel staff is out of this world. The hotel manager Pagye Gibbs-Luke knows what hotel guests expect today and she exceeds all expectations. From the front desk staff to the housekeeping staff, everyone had a smile on their face and were eager to help and make our stay memorable. I spend over 100 nights a year in a hotel and I can honestly say that the person managing makes all the difference. It's evident that from the moment we checked in until we left Pagye and her staff wanted to make sure no stone was left unturned. I cannot wait to go back to NYC and see Pagye and her staff.

title: WestHouse Experience
text:
The location is ideal, just a short walk from Times Square and directly adjacent to the N,R,W,Q Subway. Our room was spotless with a great view, although be aware that only rooms facing 55th have this view! All of staff were very helpful and courteous (especially Donna at the front desk). 
There was a $55 "Residency Fee" which seemed pricy but...  the "American" buffet breakfast provided a perfect stress free start to the day and the evening tastings with beer/wine and non-alcoholic drinks provided a relaxing finish to a busy day of sightseeing. It certainly helped that Rafael and Victor (two amazing staff) worked tirelessly to keep the trays and glasses filled! We would highly recommend this hotel.

title: AMAZING HOTEL!!!!
text:
The Westhouse is a hidden Gem in all of NYC! I cannot say enough great things about the hotel & the customer service. 

Payge, Mo, & all of the front desk staff are the most lovely people you will ever meet. They go out of there way in any possible way to ensure your stay is as smooth as possible. I truly feel like the Westhouse is my home away from home. They always have a smile on their face & welcome you with open arms. 

The rooms are incredible. They are beyond spacious and the beds & pillows are the COMFIEST of all time. The rooms are always in top clean condition with all the required amenities neededed. 

The hotel is in an amazing location with a 24 hour market open just a block away. There is a subway station right outside the hotel to make easy access for anyone. The restaurants & shops all are within a 20 minute walk which is beyond amazing. 

Once again I cannot say enough good things about this hotel & service. You MUST VISIT!! This is the ONLY hotel I will ever stay at when visiting the city. 

Thank you Westhouse for making my home away from home incredible!

title: Pleasant Experience
text: Pagye is a delight to work with and was so good booking our rooms on short notice.  My co-worker stays here frequently, and I am so happy he introduced me to this hotel as well.  You will not be sorry if you book here.

title: Excellent Choice for our Marathon Stay
text: The Westhouse Hotel was an excellent choice for our stay for the New York Marathon. My room on the 24th floor came with an amazing view of the city. The room was large, peaceful and came with everything I needed. Breakfast was in the Terrace on the 23rd floor and we could also enjoy evening nibbles there. It was most convenient being able to walk back to the hotel after completing the marathon.

title: Wonderful stay!!!
text: We visited NY for our wedding anniversary and also a birthday celebration. We could not have selected a more perfect hotel for our celebrations. We requested an upgrade and initially that was an issue when we checked in due to the NY marathon weekend. Pagye and the other Concierge staff then took action and we were upgraded to a wonderful suite on the 25th floor and a view down 7th avenue. We also received a bottle of sparkling wine and some other great surprises in our suite. The breakfast options are really good and the selection of tapas are rotated every evening. We had a wonderful stay and will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY. Thank you to all the staff for looking after us.

title: Simply the Best Boutique Hotel in NYC!!!!!!!!
text: Simply the Best! As a frequent traveller, I can assure you this boutique hotel will not disappoint. From the gracious greetings at the front desk from Mo I new right away I was going to love this place. Paige, the VIP Manger was so attentive to ensure our stay was nothing less than perfect. Thank you Paige. Our room was spotless, fairly large with 2 Queen super comfy beds with nice crisp white sheets. It was a pleasure to come home after a long day of touring to simply enjoy the room. The decor is updated and pleasing to the eye. To top off this incredible experience, a highlight that is included in the rate is tapas, with wine and beer every night from 5-8  to mix and mingle or simply unwind in the comforts of home. The buffet breakfast is well stocked with a great selection of hot and cold items to please every pallet. Again the staff making this happen are super friendly, attentive and wanting to please. Location is ideal, we walked down to Soho and back and hit the shops and sights that are all in walking distance. Need I say more, book early as it can sell out fast as word is out. A.Day

title: Westhouse Hotel a five star experience
text: I've stayed at the Westhouse numerous times over the past couple years. Tremendous hotel and the staff is very welcoming and friendly. Pagye Gibbs-Luke is my contact for making reservations and taking care of anything I need and always come through for me. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Graciousness during a hectic time. Our work schedule and clients can be very stressful. Just know that Pagye is taking c
text: Whenever we stay at the hotel, Pagye Gibbs-Luke has been so helpful and gracious. She really makes our stay easier and very pleasant. She’s most definitely gone out of her way on many occasions to accommodate us. I just want to thank her so much.

title: Home away from Home
text:
One of the core reasons I choose the Westhouse time and time again is the people both the staff and the people from around the world. At any time during breakfast or early evening drinks, you can hear a multitude of different languages and experiences that make you feel you are truly in NYC. The hotel speaks for itself, with rooms larger than many other NYC hotels, and amenities as expected for a high-rated venue. I would also be remiss if I did not mention the concierge Pagye GL who for the past year has gone above and beyond in making our stay comfortable and in some cases accommodating picky travellers (thank you).

I can recommend the Westhouse and suggest that when considering your options to explore and research what they have to offer.

title: Consistently exceptional, reasonably priced stay.
text:
I returned to the WestHouse in July while I attended trade shows in New York. The friendliness and professionalism of the entire staff is exceptional. I always appreciate the warm greeting and friendly smiles from the Bell Men and front desk personnel. 
My room was clean, well appointed and comfortable. The buffet breakfast on the Terrace was very good and beautifully prepared. The large variety of foods was excellent.
I will not go anywhere else in New York. I look forward to returning in January.

title: Awful! Don’t waste your money!!!
text:
We are 3 nights into our 5 night stay and this is absolutely not a  5 star hotel it is advertised as. 

If you’re considering booking to stay here I’d look elsewhere as you’ll get better value for money.

Before I lay into them I’ll make it clear we travel often and I am very much an optimist who is easily pleased so for me to give a poor review is not something I do lightly.

The location of the hotel indeed is great and the beds are really comfortable- but apart from that it’s awful.

The rooms are small - I know in NY space is tight but we paid extra for a ‘luxury’ room, which has a good view, but it certainly isn’t a luxury room. 

Our room 2212 (on the 22nd floor) happens to be the floor below the restaurant (on the 23rd) where breakfast is served. 
From 5.30am EVERY morning you can hear the rolling of carts in & out constantly and people dropping things on the floor. This room has been converted from a bedroom to the breakfast room overflow/prep area for staff. This has woken me up every morning & disturbed our sleep, this is persistent and ongoing until end of service at about 10am. I know the kitchen has to be somewhere, but above a guest bedroom, seriously?

There is a teeny tiny wardrobe, more like a cupboard, which has 5 hangers in (so I had to ask for some more), and because the room is so small there is nowhere to store your suitcases meaning it intrudes into your space even more. We are having to store some of our clothes on our cases as there are no drawers or anywhere to put anything 🤷🏽‍♀️ 

There is a small dressing table which has the thinnest & most peculiar drawers which are not practical as you can’t fit anything in them so a pointless piece of furniture.
The room is quite dark so I asked for an extra lamp which was provided. 
The blinds at the windows are mucky & while this isn’t a huge deal if you’re saying you’re a 5 star hotel it shouldn’t be dirty. 

Breakfast…. On our first day they ran out of plates by 8.30 so I asked the waiter if they had any… and their solution was paper plates! I actually laughed out loud thinking this was a joke and felt I was at a kids party! 

I am so disappointed in this hotel and the fact they have the audacity to charge well over $300 a night for this room is disgusting, they should be ashamed!!

I would absolutely not stay here again. Don’t fall into the trap of the great looking snazzy photos on the website, it’s a complete con. 

Don’t stay here, look for better!!

title: Exceptional service, memorable experience.
text: I had the pleasure of experiencing top-notch service at this hotel, thanks in large part to Pagye, the Operations Manager, and the VIP service team. Pagye’s attention to detail and commitment to making my stay exceptional were truly outstanding. Pagye's leadership and dedication were evident in every aspect of my visit, from seamless check-in to personalized amenities. Her attentiveness added an extra layer of luxury to my stay. I can't express how much I appreciate her efforts. If you want a hotel experience that goes above and beyond, this is the place to be. Thank you, Pagye and the VIP team, for making my stay truly unforgettable!

title: Great location and customer service
text: We stayed at the Westhouse hotel for a week and really enjoyed our stay. From the moment of our arrival everyone was very helpful and welcoming. Donna was especially helpful throughout our stay, going out of her way to assist us during our arrival and check in process. She was always very friendly whenever we encountered her and was always happy to answer any of our questions. She helped to make our stay a great experience. The hotel was in a great location, convenient access to the which train just few steps from the door. We really enjoyed our stay and would be happy to stay again. A thank you again to Donna for helping to make our stay a wonderful experience.

title: Hidden fees, overcrowded and poor service
text:
Hidden fees and poor service. 
They charged for a resort fee that was never mentioned before (€52 per person per night).
The hotel has too much rooms for the elevators that it has (2 elevators) and the breakfast room is too small. 
Everyday you have to wait for a table for breakfast and line for elevator between 10 to 15 minutes. 
Employees also don’t care very much for what you ask…
This hotel was a poor experience. Not going again.

title: Wonderful Experience for Me and Baby
text: We had an amazing stay at the Westhouse thanks to their thoughtful staff, especially Pagye. This is our fourth stay there with an infant and she made our experience easy. The pack and play was set up for us, the sheets were there for baby too and our rooms have been exceptionally clean every time. PLUS they have a great happy hour with complementary food in the morning and evening. Honestly, I've been recommending it to all my friends who travel to NYC. The location is great too, close to trains and I've gotten a cab or uber in less than a minute. We will be back soon.

title: Cream of all hotels in NYC, hands down 5/5
text: The Westhouse is hands down the cream of all the hotels in NYC. I have stayed at many other hotels and have never felt as satisfied as when I am fortunate enough to get a room here. My recent visit has reconfirmed this hotel has all the comforts of home and more. The beds are incredibly comfortable with bedding that satisfies the soul. The rooms are spacious, clean with a lovely decor. I had the best night sleep after a long day of touring the city. Unlike many hotels, Westhouse offers complimentary drinks and tapas every night that never disappoints. It is an oasis on the 23rd floor that you can enjoy an evening of relaxing if you're too tired to hit the streets after a busy day, like myself. I cannot speak highly enough about my experience at this hotel. I would like to keep it a secret (so there's always space for me), however, I owe this review to the VIP Manager Paige and Armani for making our stay at the Westhouse such a pleasure. Thank You. I would also like to note that each and every employee at this hotel is incredibly friendly, gracious and welcoming, need I say more. Linda

title: Undercover Gem
text: Great customer service, well maintained property and excellent location in mid town.  Very walkable to most all midtown attractions.  Hotel also offers complimentary breakfast and afternoon cocktails, which is appreciated.

title: Decent rooms, poor staff
text:
I visited this hotel due to the great reviews but found it to be somewhat lacking.  I had a suite but when reporting that many of the plug sockets and none of the USB ports worked I was given a response along the lines of “oh well, bad luck”.

That seemed to be the theme of this hotel, generally poor disinterested service.  I put laundry in for same day service, arriving back at midnight my laundry was nowhere to be seen.

None of the staff knew where it was, finally at 1AM the duty manager delivers the laundry but then appears to think he has done me a favour rather than the inconvenience that the whole episode was.

Breakfast was OK, I did not experience the indulgence hour.

Overall OK rooms but poor service.

title: very expensive hotel for the experience it delivers
text: Hotel sells the experience of being in a boutique hotel, and charges a lot for it. But the experience fell far short of what is expected from a boutique hotel. The hotel staff are not focused on serving customers well and understanding their needs, thus transforming an experience that should be special into something trivial, which we could find in lower-priced hotels.

title: Superb staff!
text:
Westhouse is a great hotel for bussiness or pleasure 
Location is fantastic
Rooms are good size very clean. Comfy beds and linens
The staff is exceptional! Pagye and her team, Donar and Vanessa are fantastic
If you need help with your room, what to do or see in New York, transportation ,whatever you.need they are there for you. They always make me feel right at home, a nice way to walk into a hotel in a major city!

title: Absolutely recommended!!!
text: This is my 5th visit to NYC and the Westhouse Hotel is the best by far! Excellent rooms, bar and customer service. Their staff really knows how to make visitors feel very comforable and happy. Pagye, Donmar and Vanessa are extremely kind and helpful, and they give the best service you can imagine. I completely recommend this hotel and no doubt that I will come back here in my next visit to Manhattan. VERY SATISFIED CUSTOMER HERE! ;-)

title: Not as good as I expected
text:
Stayed 24-28 August

Positives
Great location
Really enjoyed evening canapes and drinks.  The staff on 23 Floor are really friendly and helpful
Great view from our room and balcony on 23rd floor
Comfy bed
Nice bathroom with a good shower

Negatives
Both elevators broke down during our stay and when they worked were slow.  We waited 15 minutes one evening for an elevator (and were on 21st floor)

Room was tired, furniture damaged, bed sheet didn't fit the bed so the mattress was exposed, lack of amenities in the room  - definitely not 5 star.  We paid for a luxury king and whilst the bathroom was nice, the room was not what we expected.

The breakfast room is far too small for the number of guests - difficult to get a table - you have to wait around and then grab a dirty table as someone leaves. Not what I would expect for 5 star.  There is a good selection of food but the constant queueing, bad quality coffee and lack of personal service makes it a poor experience.  It is not a nice way to start your day! We stopped going to breakfast halfway through our stay and ate out instead which was annoying as we were paying for breakfast.  As the space is too small for the number of guests they need to rethink offering breakfast as part of the resort fee and allow people to opt out and pay less.  

No bar, no room service.  We really like to have a drink in our hotel bar when we get back from dinner.  There is a bar in the lobby and its nice but just not in use.  They really need to open it.  I think its odd they lack facilities yet have a five star rating.

Overall I would rate it 3.5 out of 5 and believe it is better suited to a 4 star rating not 5 star.

Would I go back?  No, I don't think I would and have booked another hotel for my next trip in March.

title: Este hotel é no máximo 2 estrelas
text:
O hotel é ruim, o banheiro é horrível,sem banheira, os vidros embaçam, pastilhas no chao.
Moveis antigos, metais enferrujados, espelhos deteriorados.
Alem de tudo,  deixaram a janela do meu quarto aberta e já chamei 3 vezes, o serviço de quarto, ainda não tive resolução, imagino alguem que nao fale Inglês.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in NYC, including terraces with city views!
text: Room had a lovely terrace with beautiful city views, which is a rare treat for an NYC hotel. The room was also spacious and comfortable. There's a lovely breakfast and evening reception all included in the room rate in the upstairs lounge, which also has a terrace. Fitness room was clean and well equipped. Great stay overall!

title: AC is very bad. They don't even bother to fix it no matter how many times you call
text: Very bad customer service. I kept calling for more than 3 times to. Fix the AC. And they didn't bother. After calling 5 times and waiting for almost one hour. They sent someone. And it appeared that they lowered it fr the master control. Nothing was wrong with it. They just kept the minimum as 25c. It's a bad experience overall

title: Ótimos dias em  Manhattan
text: WestHouse Hotel é uma excelente escolha par os seus dias em Manhattan. Tem uma localização privilegiada, fica a 300m do Central Park, tem mais de uma estação de metro perto, tem mercado, farmácia, restaurantes, lounges, tudo que você precisar a poucos passos de caminhada.  Os quartos são relativamente amplos (em NY, Manhattan, normalmente os quartos são bem pequenos). O café da manhã era bem movimentado, às vezes chegava a dar lotação, mas as opções oferecidas eram ótimas. Ovos mexidos, bacon, linguiça, frutas, iogurte, cookies, pães, bolos, suco, café, água. E a "cereja do bolo", fica para o happy hour, diariamente das 17h até 20h, com opções de bebidas alcoólicas e não alcoólicas, todos os dias um menu de comidinhas diferentes, salada, pães, cupcakes , camarões e até almondegas, e isso tudo estava incluído na nossa diária, em alguns dias nós optamos por nem sair para jantar pois o happy hour estava tão bom que nem foi preciso. Nos dias que estivemos lá choveu direto, eles tinham guarda-chuvas para emprestar, foi muito bom! Hotel tem um custo elevado, mas está compatível ao que é entregue para a localização.  Eu recomendo e eu voltaria!

title: Fantastic Staff and Midtown location
text: What a great location in midtown and what a fantastic staff. Thank you Pagye to you and your team what an amazing experience. Highly recommend this property. Great amenities with nice well equipped workout facility.

title: Great hotel, wonderful location & amazing staff
text:
This has been my second long stay at Westhouse. The location is great, the accommodations are of high quality. The cleaning staff do a great job . Breakfast is varied and tasty. And it seems like there is a lot of thought into everything.
But lost important is the staff.Everyone has been very helpful and nice.Especially two of the managers, Pagye and Armani who went put of their way to assist with a few issues I had. Great job and much appreciated!!

title: The Best of the Big Apple with all the trimmings!!!!
text:
Talk about being on top of the world!!!! It was everything I dreamt of and more. Ideally located and with an amazing staff, you will feel so pampered! Pagye and her team made us feel like royalty. Real VIP. Our rooms were very comfy and nicely done. To top it off, we were celebrating our birthdays, and as soon as Pagye found out we had a surprise celebration waiting when we returned to the room. I highly recommend the WestHouse Hotel to anyone wishing to do the Big Apple in grand style and all the fanfare!!! 
Ask for Pagye, you'll be glad you did!!!

title: Made for Manhattan
text: This hotel was reccomended for me by my very fussy sister. Turns out she was right. A top class service great amenities and conveniently situated. The staff and service warm friendly and very helpful. Even though it rained for three days our visit was wonderful.

title: Perfect stay
text: The staff were excellent and the rooms are great.  The breakfast in the lounge is a terrific amenity and perfect for any business stay.  Thank you to Pagye for above and beyond service.  I look forward to my next visit.

title: Business Trip
text: Always our go to place in NYC. Excellent service all around from the room service staff, to the lounge attendants, to front desk staff. Very friendly, very helpful and very accommodating.  A special shoutout to PAGYE for her excellent service

title: NYC haven
text: I've stayed at WestHouse several times.  The rooms are beautiful and replete with top amenities.  Pagye has coordinated all my visits and the staff is friendly and accommodating.  The hotel is centrally located near Carnegie Hall and features wonderful meals and snacks throughout the day.  I look forward to returning!

title: Pagye was amazing!
text: My experience at the Westhouse hotel was truly amazing. Specifically, Pagye made out stay the best it could be. I would most definitely stay here again and recommend to all of my friends and family!!!

title: Great Stay!
text: The hotel was great! Rooms and accommodations were fantastic and the service was on point. Overall very enjoyable stay as well as a great location. In addition Pagye was fantastic! Will definitely be back!

title: Quiet Business Hotel
text: From the booking experience to the check in and stay, all were five-star experiences. I was greeted with a warm welcome, and received information about the property which included the club experience on the 23rd floor. That is a step above and provided added value as I can go up and grab a pastry/tea in the morning then head straight out to my meeting, without having to worry about where I would go out for breakfast. The room size was larger than average for the area. Would like to mention a special thank you to Pagye Gibbs Luke who was extremely helpful with my booking stay. Can't wait to go back.

title: The way hospitality should be
text:
I checked in on a rainy Monday morning. As soon as I saw the welcome mat that said Westhouse, I took a picture; as it reminded me of a scene from a movie.  As I grabbed my luggage out of the trunk of my Uber and whirled around to enter the 1st floor lobby door, a door person from inside the lobby swung open the door for me with a smile, and said, “welcome to Westhouse, sir … right this way. 

Vanessa checked me in, with an amazing combo of grace and intention … she was the epitome of “polished without pretense”.  Smooth check in, and gave me the information I needed to know about all the amenities.  

The Terrace on the 23rd floor, was also a great touch.  Appetizers, wine, beer, cappuccino, tea, water, etc … all with spectacular midtown Manhattan views. 

My room on the 25th floor, also something out of a movie … 

I highly recommend staying at Westhouse. It’s a New York experience I won’t soon forget, and I’ll be bringing my wife back to experience it all over again.

title: A centre ice jewel
text: The Westhouse is a centrally located property with a boutique feel. The onsite service from Manager to front desk to housekeeping to engineering are friendly, responsive and courteous. In particular the Manager Pagye is extremely competent and helpful. Check it out and meet Pagye...you won't regret it!

title: Great Beds, location and service.
text:
The most important thing for us are the beds - it doesn't matter how good everything else is if you cant get a good nights sleep - especially when you've been walking 10 miles a day to see the sights and out of your timezone - the beds were a delight, super comfortable and the sheets & covers were top quality.  We were there for our daughters 18th birthday and Pagye had arranged a surprise cake, decorations and treats for her as well as an upgrade on the room.  The communications were really good thorugh pre-arrival and also when there- thank you Pagye.  If you can get a higher floor the views rae great, you get old New York and all the new sights and you may be able to see all the way down into Times Square, we were in 2006. 

The breakfast buffet was good, a good choice for an all round breakfast, my only improvement would be some hot plates to keep the hot food hot. 

The evening buffet changed everyday and it could certainly be enough for an evening meal. Drinks were freely available.  Our only suggestion would be that once the evneing service finishes everyone needs to vacate, including the terrace, some way to extend this with a paid bar service would be very welcome as I do not think they had a bar running in the hotel.  I must mention the team who work the buffet they were all stars and worked hard to keep it topped up, looking good and collecting all the used plates, super freindly crew. 

Overall I thought the resort fee was good value - if you can make use of it everyday and you drink.   We couldn't make the evening on 2 of the 5 nights and our daughter is not a drinker/allowed to drink in the USA. That said NYC is crazy expensive so on balance its a benefit. 

Location was great, subway next to the entrance and another two around the blocks so lots of options to get up and down town. 

A great bar acoss the road for late night drinks. 

Overall we were very pleased and look forward to returning to the WestHouse Hotel soon.

title: Perfect spot
text: Payge was amazing. Room was beautiful. We have made this an annual tradition. Fantastic customer service, great free happy hour drinks and food and awesome breakfast. Could not have a better location.

title: The hotel is a “sleeper” the Manager Pagye a “keeper”
text: The property is very well located and clean quiet. Awesome truly over the top breakfasts inckuded. The Manager Pagye is wonderful. She knows the property well, has a positive attitude, and always willing to help! Give her a bravo when you go!

title: Best stay in NY in a decade.
text: My stay at the west house  hotel in midtown Manhattan was the best stay I’ve had in NY in memory.  The property was super clean. My room was brand new.  Most importantly to me was the staff- I felt safe because where ever I looked I saw a properly  dressed employee. Paige was in the lobby every time I was there and was positive and very helpful. The bar and service was amazing. Tons of restaurants nearby. Location great. Didn’t have to wait long for taxi or Uber.

title: ‼️🚨Prix payé 40% plus cher que le prix de la réservation
text: Une politique de prix malhonnête et avec un gros manque de transparence…les prix affichés ne correspondent pas à la réalité en effet vous paierez 40% du prix en plus avec des taxes alors anticipé pour avoir le vrai prix…GROSSE ARNAQUE, je ne conseille pas cet hôtel pour sa politique de prix attirante et mal honnête

title: Fantastic service
text: They were overbooked due to issues with flight cancellations and the UN.  Pagye was amazing getting us another room upgraded and couldn't have been nicer or more accomodating throughout our stay - can tell she really cared.  Already planning our next trip and will be our go-to in NYC.

title: Very good stay
text:
Very nice first experience in New York in this magnificent hotel. Very welcoming and very helpful staff. I will go back there.
the location is very good in the heart of Manathan between times square and central park.

title: WONDERFUL!!!
text:
Wonderful Hotel!!
We normally come to the WestHouse when visiting New York. We will not go anywhere else!!
Top notch service and great rooms. Love the all inclusive breakfast and 5pm treats on the Terrace. Incredible views of the New York skyline on the Terrence.
Vanessa checked us in, as usual she was incredible, very friendly and professional, the best..

We will be back soon…

title: A great place to stay!
text: Great stay, comfortable bed, good views, and helpful staff, especially Pagye who was extremely attentive! The room was spacious and exceeded my expectations. The breakfast and dinner was a nice perk, with good food all around.

title: Would stay here again
text:
Positive:
Very helpful friendly staff
Enjoyed breakfast and evening light buffet, plenty choice and inclusive drinks which is helpful!
Room very comfortable, bed lovely and soft, good bathroom facilities
Maids very attentive on a daily basis
Excellent location just outside the busy Times Square 

Room for improvements:
Air conditioning dodgy despite reporting it
For a 5 star hotel I would have expected some more room amenities such as bathrobes
Size of room small

All in all, I would stay here again

title: Great Stay at WestHouse Hotel
text:
We visited in August to celebrate our wedding Anniversary.
The experience from the moment we entered the lobby, was beautiful, we were greeted by very friendly staff. Pagye was amazing, she went above and beyond to ensure our stay was memorable, and it was.
When we got o our room we were pleasantly surprized with anniversay decorations, balloons and a platter. The room decoration was elegant, the bed and furniture was very comfortable. The terrace outside the room was lovely  it provided a spectacular view of the city. The buffet provided lots of options, the food was delicious.
I will absolutely recommend this hotel to all, I will definitely be back.

Sincerely,
Francine

title: The only place I stay in New York City
text: Every time I travel to New York City, WestHouse becomes my home away from home. It is a small, lovely, well appointed boutique in that is perfectly located — near Columbus Circle and Central Park, and Broadway. Excellent subway lines right out the door to get anywhere else. Most of all, the personal attention to your stay is such a nice feature. I’ve gotten to know Pagye-Gibbs Luke, who is a wonderful host. Because of Pagye and others at WestHouse, it is the only place I stay when I’m in town.

title: Delusa
text: Sulla carta un 5 stelle, di fatto un mediocre 4 stelle se becchi la stanza sbagliata come nel nostro caso, la 2514, affaccio interno su una miriade di altre finestre per cui era impossibile tenere la tenda aperta anche di giorno e al mattino puzza di cucina. Discreta ma ripetitiva la colazione, il personale della sala colazione non particolarmente cortese soprattutto tra i più anziani. Nota di demerito anche per una delle recepionist ( una signora anzianotta) che una sera ha iniziato a sbattere violentemente la penna sul vetro della porta d’ingresso perché non avevamo letto il cartello dove c’era scritto che dovevamo passare la chiave per entrare. Inoltre le prese USB in camera non funzionano o funzionano male, quindi abbiamo chiesto un adattatore per poter ricaricare i cellulari, ce lo hanno fornito con una cauzione di 50$, peccato che al check out l’adattatore è’ stato restituito la cauzione NO. Nota positiva la posizione.

title: Beautiful Hotel, well placed
text: Beautiful hotel, near Central park, friendly stuff, and a 23rd floor beautiful terrace for excellent breakfast and an everyday very happy hour. The only problem were the two elevators that both broke down for a day, but fortunately we could use the service elevators instead. I recommend this hotel

title: A Memorable Stay with a Few Hiccups
text:
I'd like to provide some feedback and a review of my recent stay at the West House Hotel.

Firstly, I want to commend the staff at the West House Hotel for their exceptional professionalism and courteousness. Their hospitality truly enhanced our overall experience during our stay.

My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our time in our hotel room; however, there was one aspect that left us somewhat disappointed. The handicap shower in our room was quite small and felt uncomfortably tight. It was not ideal for a comfortable shower experience.

On the flip side, the views from our room were absolutely breathtaking. We were treated to stunning vistas of the surrounding city buildings, which added a special touch to our stay.

Location-wise, the West House Hotel is perfectly situated for anyone looking to immerse themselves in the vibrant energy of New York City. It's conveniently close to the action, with Central Park and Broadway theaters just a stone's throw away.

One thing I'd like to mention is that my family and I follow a plant-based diet, and we were hoping for more accommodating breakfast options at the hotel's 23rd-floor breakfast area. Unfortunately, the selection was quite limited, primarily consisting of fruits. This left us somewhat disappointed as we were hoping for a more diverse breakfast menu.

In summary, the West House Hotel offers great value for its price and boasts an excellent location in the heart of Manhattan. If I were to book again in the future, I would certainly request a room with a larger shower to enhance the overall comfort of my stay. Despite this minor setback, I would highly recommend the West House Hotel to anyone seeking an enjoyable and conveniently located stay in New York City.

title: Home away from Home
text: Our family chose this location for my daughters 22nd Birthday. From the moment we arrived until we left we were greeted with such enthusiasm and energy by all the staff. The VIP Manager, at this hotel goes above and beyond for her clients. I cannot say enough about their kind spirted attitude which made us feel so welcomed. The rooms have great space for NYC and the beds/duvet/pillows are super clean and comfortable after a long day in the city. Prior to our dinner we enjoyed the complimentry appetizers and cocktails on outdoor terrace overlooking broadway making it such treat to watch the lights at night. The location was perfect as we were able to walk to all the attractions including Soho.  After sifting through a variety of hotels in NYC over the years, we are thrilled to have finally found our new home away from home. Thanks to Paige and all staff for your hard work and dedication to making this place so special. If NYC is on your bucket list, look no further. Linda

title: Amazing Stay - Highly Recommend Central Location
text:
My sister and I were in town celebrating my sister's bachelorette weekend and it was our first time staying at WestHouse. I can honestly say that it was the best stay we've had in NYC! 

Pagye, WestHouse's VIP Client Services Manager, was so sweet and thoughtful in helping decorate our room to surprise my sister - even providing treats and balloons. She really went the extra mile to ensure we enjoyed our stay. On top of this, the kitchen and waitstaff were a delight - always aiming to provide the best service and make guests laugh. The front desk and concierge were also very kind and friendly. Finally, housekeeping left the room immaculate each day and always made sure to greet us when we passed by. 

One of the selling pieces of staying at WestHouse is the breakfast and happy hour. It's basically like having two meals included in your stay (+ alcohol). It really added value for us and is one of the many reasons we will return on our next stay. We so enjoyed our evenings spent on the terrace overlooking the city with a glass of vino. 

The hotel itself is clean and well-kept. The decor is a little dated but still in good condition all the same. The beds are deliciously cozy. The hotel is also very centrally located with easily accessible subway stations. 

Overall - I cannot recommend WestHouse enough. Thank you for such a fabulous weekend WestHouse!

title: Highly Recommend
text: I had the most amazing stay at West House. The staff displays top tier hospitality. Pagye checked on us and made the stay just that more pleasant. She and the rest of the staff gave the most fantastic and accommodating service. Very nice and very clean hotel. I highly recommend.

title: Outstanding Staff
text: The service was probably the best I have experienced at a hotel. The staff went above and beyond and they were friendly and accommodating. The breakfast and happy hour were a nice addition very tasty. The neighborhood was felt safe during the day and it was in a great location. I would love the chance to stay here again.

title: First NYC Visit
text:
Fabulous Manhattan location within a few minutes walk to Central Park, MoMA, St. Patrick's Cathedral,  Times Square and other popular NYC attractions.  I eagerly anticipated my stay at the WestHouse but was ultimately disappointed in service and amenities. 

I booked through my Magellan membership and so received an excellent rate on a king room. The bed was amazingly comfortable, my request for a top-floor room was honored and the fitness center was spotless and well-equipped.  However, for a five-star hotel, the room lacked basic amenities.  I had to request a robe. I did not have slippers in the room nor any kind of clock or alarm. The furniture was worn. The bathroom had zero counter space and poor lighting. 

I took advantage of the Terrace Lounge food offerings, including daily breakfast and evening "Hours of Indulgence ". For the most part, food offerings were fresh, though limited for those who prefer healthier options. Beer, wine and prosecco was available in the evenings. Desserts were lackluster. Coffee, available during breakfast hours only, was bad (which I had read in previous reviews). 

I was disappointed that front desk personnel did not inquire about my stay upon checking out. And don't expect valet service.  I prefer handling my own luggage - but not everyone does. The young man who hailed taxis for me did a great job.

title: WestHouse experience
text: This hotel was really 5 star. We were warmly welcomed each time we passed through the doors. Staff were very friendly and very accommodating when asking questions. Matt Koval did an outstanding job getting us to and from the airport with VIP status. We would highly recommend WestHouse to stay at. Close to everything and we walked everywhere or caught the subway, easy system to navigate!

title: Awesome hotel!
text:
We stayed in an Executive Suite room, which was gorgeous and spacious. Awesome view of Times Square and the terrace was great. Could hear traffic noise at busy times but we slept fine as we were so exhausted from all the excursions! 

Pros: excellent location - walking distance to Times Square, and right next to a subway station. Also Starbucks on the corner and plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. All of the concierge staff but particularly the men on the door were absolutely fantastic. Great energy, super friendly, always took the time to ask us how we were and what our plans for the day were, I didn’t catch their names but th y deserve a raise! Vanessa was fantastic too.
