Floor 23 was available for breakfast and canapés, drinks etc at 5-7pm. Decent choice of food in there and was lovely to sit out on the terrace when seating was available. 

Cons:
One lift wasn’t working so at busy times had to wait for ages for a lift. One person mentioned the lift stopped working and someone got stuck. The service lift was available to use but that wasn’t a fully pleasant experience as it was hot and smelly in there. Had to ask for a shower cap. Shower was not detachable and quite old but water temp was perfect.  

I’d definitely stay again!

title: My amazing time at the Westhouse Hotel
text:
As someone who has been visiting New York my entire life the Westhouse is the only hotel I will ever stay. All of the employees & staff are extremely friendly welcoming & helpful. They all make sure you feel comfortable, happy & at ease. Customer service is 10/10! 

The facilities are beyond incredible. The complimentary breakfast is fantastic with a wide variety of food and beverages. Not to mention 
 the hour indulgence with food & cocktails at 5:00PM is wonderful. It is something very special that this hotel offers. 

I always look forward to coming back to the Westhouse. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel & staff. 

The location is perfect, with lots of nearby shops & restaurants. For anyone considering going YOU MUST VISIT! 

Payge & Armani hold a special place in my heart as they make sure you are ALWAYS HAPPPY. Thank you so much ! I cannot wait to return soon!

title: Upcoming Stay
text:
This review is for an upcoming stay. I stayed at the Westhouse Hotel NYC back at the beginning of August and had an AMAZING experience. I called the hotel and spoke with Payge and I am trying to duplicate my experience.
She was efficient, friendly and very helpful. This is my go-to hotel when I visit NY 6 times a year. Thank you, Payge and Westhouse Hotel. Ken

title: WestHouse NYC Review
text: We had an amazing 4 nights staying at the WestHouse in midtown Manhattan.  Would have loved to stay four more!  The daily breakfast and social hour are amazing benefits of staying at the WestHouse.  The staff-  especially Pagye Gibbs-Luke were wonderful to deal with- and provided an amazing customer experience.  we look forward to our next stay !

title: Excelent room and service even better
text: I've been in the hotel for a weekend in August and had such a great moment. The facilities are very good. Although the room is not that big compared with other hotels at the same level since we are in NY. The staff is also really nice and willing to help. Sonia in particular made my weekend, I want to make a surprise to my wife, and she make it happen. Without Sonia I would have a completely different experience.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Great boutique hotel in mid-town Manhattan with a great staff especially Pagye. Been staying here for years and enjoy the open gym, great breakfast, happy hour treats, clean larger sized rooms, and location.

title: Great Hotel near Central Park
text: Retro and upscale feel, highly recommend. Staff was courteous and kind. Terrace room is a must for anyone staying. Extremely well done, you will not be disappointed. Go there every morning and evening

title: Um local elegante e que você se encanta com todos os detalhes.
text:
O hotel é maravilhoso. destaques: 

1. A equipe. desde a recepção, concierge, todos... em especial a atenção que deram por eu e minha esposa estarmos nos casando na cidade. 

2. Localização. perto de tudo. tudo que você precisa esta a poucas quadras. 

3. Quartos. super confortáveis. espaçosos. grandes. 

4. Academia. uma pequena academia que você consegue fazer um bom treino de musculação. 

5. Social Hour cortesia muito agradável. o staff sempre sorridente e solicitos. 
 
Semestralmente vou a NYC e certamente em todas as vezes eu escolherei o Westhouse como minha casa longe de casa. 

Um muitíssimo obrigado a Pagye Gibbs-Luke e Danna pela acolhida e atenção.

title: Enjoyable stay
text: We stayed for 2 nights in room 1926 - we loved the room and it was very quiet and peaceful.  Great location close to subway and Central Park and comfortable walk into Times Square. Breakfast was perfect as were the drinks at the evening reception. We were looking forward to filling up on the evening buffet but it was not to our taste unfortunately. My husband in particular is a fussy eater so could only eat the cake on the 2nd night and a cheesy thing on the first. We would have preferred cheese, biscuits, bread to be available but that’s personal choice and I’m sure many would have been happy with the food provided. I’ve read previously complaints about the resort fee and some people mentioned it during our stay. However we booked through Expedia and the pricing was very clear showing the overall cost and then breaking down the payment to be made direct to the hotel and the payment made on booking. Overall the cost was similar to other properties of equal quality with the benefit of the generous drinks available.  We would definitely book again in the future but would bring some snacks for dinner.

title: Not what I expected
text: Maintenance was loud on the phone most nights. A bit unprofessional especially when we can hear their personal conversations. There was one guy at the front desk, sometimes sat over to the side but just had a blank stare most of the time. Greeted me like he doesn’t want to be there and had an attitude when he brought me a cork screw. I do understand the DND sign needs to be taken off before delivering anything. That is on me.  but it’s not what you say, rather how you say it and your facial expression. Never once during my stay did he smile, speak, even acknowledge the guest as someone who wants to be there. One last thing, if you’re gonna charge people thousands of dollars to stay here, you could atleast have room service or an elevator that consistently works. And get the fire alarms fixed for heavens sakes.I could’ve stayed at the Marriott for cheaper and got a better experience.

title: Parfait
text:
Tresbel hôtel et personnel très sympathique. 
Nous sommes arrivés le jour de l anniversaire de ma fille et la manager lui avait fait faire un gâteau avec des ballons et elle lui a offert une peluche et un tee shirt.
Le soir il y a un buffet apero offert avec les boissons de 17h à 19h ..très appréciable quand on sait les prix pour manger à NY

title: WestHouse de lo mejor en New York
text: Nuestra check in y check out nos lo realizó Vanessa y fue súper atenta, nos brindó un excelente servicio, la habitación que nos asignaron fue la 2013 y tenía una vista genial hacia Manhattan  y parte de Broadway, el desayuno nos sorprendió ya que estaba muy completo, y por la tarde el brunch solo lo probamos un día de nuestra estancia pero están bastante bien, bonita habitación y buen servicio a cuartos, muy recomendable por ubicación también, en gral le doy una calificación excelente

title: Great Family Stay
text:
This hotel was perfect for me and my family.
It was a couple clocks from Central park and Times Square so easy to walk to plenty of attractions and great meal choices. The concierge lounge was perfect for dinner snacks and breakfast each morning.  
The only challenge was the Elevators. One was down all weekend so you could wait some time before getting an elevator. 
Pagye was amazing with setting up our booking and checking on us throughout the stay. Winston with valet on Saturday midday and Monday morning was very helpful and pleasant as well he greeted my boys and helped them with the bags and it made for a great welcome and farewell.

title: WestHouse is Exceptional
text: My stay at WestHouse was exceptional. From checkin to my room to the my housekeeper, the team made experience memorable. This was my first time staying and I will definitely book at WestHouse next time I'm in town. Huge fan and Im recommending to my friends.

title: Family break
text: Hotel is advertised as 5 ⭐️ that it’s not. No bar and $55 per person per night for free drinks & food from 5pm to 8pm. You have to pay this regardless whether you use it or not, not sure if this is standard practice in NY but felt like a rip off to me,

title: My favorite hotel in NYC!
text:
My favorite hotel in NYC.. soon yours too! Thanks me later ;)
In my opinion, this hotel is an absolute 10/10. And believe me… I’m a picky person. I like this place so much I have returned again this year, felt like coming home! The things I like about the Westhouse hotel:
1) Super friendly staff and the best service! Client services manager Pagye is going the extra mile to make you feel like a VIP
2) cosy, clean and quiet rooms
3) super comfy beds
4) high quality furniture incl work desk
5) great breakfast selection
6) happy hour from 5-8pm including food and drinks with a different cuisine each night. Very convenient if you get back to your hotel after a long day of work and you don’t feel like going out for dinner again.
All in all, no need to look further!

title: Ottimo hotel, vecchio stile, posizione strategica
text:
Siamo stati in una suite per 3 persone. Pulitissimo ma vecchio stile.
Colazione buona ma pochi tavoli per gli ospiti.
La posizione è fantastica, a due passi dalla Quinta strada e dal Central Park.
La stazione della metro è a pochi metri, strategica per potersi muovere a New York.

title: It should be renamend PaigeHouse
text:
Great location, great rooms and an excellent service of the Great Paige team. The Westhouse is a true gem. Just one suggestion: increase thecroom price and skip the residence fee. If you din’t use the afternoon tapas and drinks, this feels you overpay, which you don’t if you compare room prices with others.
PaigeHouse - see you soon

title: Great Stay in NYC
text: We had a great experience at WestHouse.  The staff were friendly and the rooms (albeit quite small) were very comfortable and clean.  The hotel is also conveniently located in the theater district, thus we were able to walk to all our shows and if you do need to get around, the metro is right next door.  There is also plenty of restaurants and coffee shops within a 5 minute walk.   The hotel also offers complementary breakfast and evening happy hour with drinks and mini snacks.  If you drive, there is parking on site, but it's valet and it's $90 per 24 hours for a SUV and $80 per 24 hours for a sedan ... be reminded it's not "in" and "out", which means once they park your car in the garage you don't have access to it until you leave.  Overall, we enjoyed our stay and will be back.  With the exception of parking (which was quite expensive) ... it was great value for money.

title: Gem in Midtown
text: My stay at WestHouse Hotel was wonderful.  The hotel is beautiful and my room was quiet and the staff kept it clean.  The location is central to so many things.  It was a delight to be able to walk almost everywhere.

title: Amazing stay
text: The hotel was a great location for my trip and the staff members were very hospitable. The staff at the terrace were amazing during the happy hour and breakfast hours. Our host Sonia M. was amazing, she was extremely knowledgeable about the services and provided amazing service.  Looking forward to visiting this hotel again.

title: Westhouse NYC is amazing!
text: Everything about the WestHouse is incredible.  The entire staff is amazing.  Pagye Gibbs-Luke is a fantastic Conceirge, Head of Reservations, all in one source there.  Erik Palmer as GM and his entire team can't be beat.  The location and lounge simply are some of the tops in the city.

title: Highly recommend
text: Westhouse was the perfect spot for our family. It was clean, smelled amazing and was a great location. The beds were very comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfast and the happy hour on the beautiful terrace. All of the staff was professional and kind but Sonia Martinez, who was in the terrace for happy hour, went above and beyond for our family. I would highly recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing Staff and great location
text: I come to the city for work often and bring my family. There's nowhere else I would stay. Location is great and the service is exceptional . The staff is outstanding - Pagye in client services is super friendly and responsive to all of our requests. The rooms are kept immaculately clean. The concierge lounge offers more than we expected - coffee and beverages available all day long!

title: Fantastic location service and rooms...
text:
The WestHouse has an amazingly central, midtown location to satisfy both business and holiday travelers.

It has a wonderful lobby, particularly the bar off the lobby.  Check-in is a pleasure and can be done online before arrival.  The rooms are well-laid out and comfortable.  The service at all levels is excellent - they even have a very attentive VIP Concierge!

I wholeheartedly recommend the hotel to business and vacation travelers!

title: Excellent hôtel et très bien situé
text:
Emplacement idéal
Chambre spacieuse et bien insonorisée … pour NYC
Climatisation relativement silencieuse (Vs Clim aux USA)
Chambre propre, bien équipée et personnel sympathique 
La terrace avec son petit de jeûner et les encas est un super endroit !

In fine enchanté de ce choix d hôtel !

title: Excellent standard and service
text: Well appointed hotel, with excellent service at front desk and cleaning of rooms. Lovely breakfast and outside deck with downtown view. Also, nice evening drinks/snacks. Only minor drawbacks (1) no bench press in gym, (2) staff eager to close balcony at 830pm.  Relaxing outside on the deck for another hour or two on a beautiful evening would have been nice.

title: The perfect Manhattan hotel.
text:
This hotel has everything - great location in midtown Manhattan, close to so many NY attractions and yet quiet, plus superb  friendly service from everyone from the concierge to the food service personnel. I stayed at Westhouse with my daughter and granddaughter and couldn’t have made a better choice. A big plus was the Resident Privilege of breakfast and of evening tapas which included desserts and complimentary beer and wine. The quality of the food offered was outstanding, the quantity ample. The variety was superb, even keeping a picky teenager happy! We all loved staying there.

This hotel is a gem, it is the only place I will stay in while in NY, I can’t wait to go back.

title: Amazing hotel, location and cleanliness
text:
5 Stars for this hotel expierence from check in (at 5am) to checkout. Pagye and her team have been professional, polite and attentive. The floor / house keeping staff were very attentive and the rooms were super clean. They still do a great cleaning daily.
The lounge on the 23rd floor is AMAZING, which comes with our destination fee.
Thank you for a great NY trip. I will be staying here again on all my NY trips.
Sincerely, Ken

title: great rooms, great service
text: My stay at the Westhouse was fantastic.  Always is.  One of their managers Pagye was absolutely amazing in helping in any way possible.  She went above and beyond to make sure this stay was fantastic.  Because of her I will for sure be staying here anytime I am in New York.  Also, the bed and pillows are very comfortable!

title: Westhouse Hotel - Second to None
text:
I have been staying at the Westhouse Hotel for about a year and half now. I literally stay there about once a month.. This hotel is second to none. Pagye Gibbs-Luke always is a gracious hostess....
She always goes out of her way to make sure I have a nice stay and checks in on me from time to time. The Breakfast and evening assortments of food and beverages are literally fantastic. The rooms are great, spacious, and always very clean and comfortable. BEST hotel in NYC

title: Wonderful Place to Stay in the BIG CITY
text: The room size was very nice for a couple. Very clean and the staff was excellent. The only thing missing was a Keurig for morning coffee and tea. Nice view and easy access to all that NYC has to offer

title: Home away from home - Highly recommend!
text: We love the Westhouse - it is our home away from home when we are on business in NYC. Pagye and her team go above and beyond! They make us feel incredible special and important. They get to know us, and we have gotten to know them as well. It's more home and less hotel because of the wonderful relationships this team creates with you. The happy hour and breakfast is a beautiful addition, the views are to die for, and you cannot beat the location! We look forward to seeing you soon!

title: Frais surprises à l’arrivée = fuyez
text:
Je ne peux malheureusement que me ranger derrière l’avis de nombreux voyageurs pour dire que cet hôtel est bien placé mais qu’il s’agit là du seul point positif.
C’est la douche froide quand vos vacances débutent que de devoir s’affranchir de 600 dollars de frais supplémentaires à l’arrivée !
Par la suite en découvrant la chambre qui nous est attribuée, les toilettes sont bouchées, la peinture du plafond se décrépît menaçant de tomber sur le lit…
J’ignore comment la classification de cet hôtel a été faite mais 5 étoiles n’est véritablement pas le bon standing.

title: Fantastic stay. Kourtney is amazing!
text: Fantastic Stay. We made good friends with Kourtney who worked the desk when we got home in the evenings. She was fantastic and made sure our stay was PERFECT. A prime example of the great staff here.

title: The best option innNYC !!!!
text: La experiencia fue mejor de lo esperado en pleno centro de Nueva York un area bien ubicada la habitación que Vanesa nos proporcionó era una de las mejores en esquina con balcón privado y todas las tardes de 5:00 a 8:00. Teníamos nuestro cóctel con una variedad de aperitivos ,snacks casi una cena completa que variaba día día comida mediterránea. Comida mexicana comida italiana , el desayuno muy variado con diferentes opciones desde bagel, salmón, fruta, huevos, tocino café en el estilo que quisiera ,la verdad, quedamos muy complacidos mi esposo y yo y seguramente cuando volvamos a Nueva York este será nuestro Hotel gracias Vanesa por todo

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I really enjoyed my stay at Westhouse hotel  . The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast and evening snack were terrific . The staff were very helpful especially Vanessa at the front desk who was a great help during my stay .

title: Fantastic experience!
text: We stayed at the Westhouse Hotel for a recent girl's trip. What a terrific experience! There are so many positives about this hotel but, by far the most remarkable is the outstanding service. Payge and her team are friendly, efficient, helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the buffet breakfast and the wine reception and goodies that are served each evening are a lovely touch. Blocks away from shopping, Central Park and shows make it an excellent choice. We will be back!!!

title: Beautiful hotel with the most amazing staff in all NYC
text:
This is over our 5th time staying at the Westhouse hotel. Each & every time we visit the service & quality continues to far exceed our expectations. The staff are incredible, they are always friendly, happy, positive & energetic. I have never felt more special snd welcomed at a hotel. Paige in particular is the most lovely human being with such a big heart who will go out of her way ANY DAY OR ANY TIME to ensure your stay is enjoyable.

The rooms are beautiful spacious with the most comfortable beds & pillows. The location is amazing with lots of near by shopping & restaurants. 

The complimentary breakfast & hour of indulgence at 5:00 PM are amazing with a large variety of food & beverages. Again all of the staff who serve you make sure they provide each & every customer with all the requirements they need. 

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel, & I would never choose to stay anywhere else in the city other than the Westhouse. I look forward to coming back soon & seeing all of the friendly staff with the most incredible service! 

HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text:
Always staying at a larger hotel when visiting New York and being treated like a number, we decided to stay at the Westhouse Hotel this time. A much smaller, boutique hotel where staff always address you when they see you.
The position is fabulous and just far away enough from the hustle and bustle.
The rooms are lovely and the bed, very comfy.
Staff are friendly and attentive and their breakfast is a great way to start the day.

title: Thank you
text: I would love to say many thanks to the team for a comfortable stay and special thanks to Vanessa, for her generous willingness to help resolve any issue and a beautiful smile that charges with positive energy for the whole day 💖

title: Hotel Excelente, com funcionários maravilhosos
text: Hotel maravilhoso!!!!! Os funcionários Pagye, Nick e Domar são excelentes no atendimento, bem atenciosos e educados. Nota maxima pra eles. Ótima localização e os apartamentos são bem cuidados. Eu recomendo!!

title: bien situé
text: L'hôtel est bien situé à la 55th, à deux minutes de Central Park, 10 min de Times Square. Dommage que le bar à l'entrée soit faux, il n'y en a pas, il y a un bar/salle en-haut avec vin, apéro, boissons, tout à disposition toute la journée gratuitement (c'est compris dans les fees) . Le petit-déjeuner est incroyable, avec un choix immense et tout est très bon, dont les patisseries. Les chambres sont grandes pour NY mais les meubles sont anciens et pourraient être changés, ça ne correspond pas à un 4 étoiles mais plutôt 3. La climatisation/chauffage est horriblement bruyante, impossible de dormir avec ! Au vu du prix quelques améliorations peuvent être prévues

title: Super hotel, food and bus tour!!
text: Best hotel I have ever stayed in!  Wonderful service, great onsite food in the Terrace, Page, Nick, Christian, Winston and Vanessa were knowledgeable and excellent to work with.  The rooms were very clean, beautifully decorated with very soft, comfy beds.  We went to MOMA, Hamilton, ate an amazing lunch at Gallaghers, booked a 6 hour bus tour thru Viator - guide Don was incredible and funny, great driver, Manuel.  Lovely sunset cruise, too.

title: Scam hotel. Hidden charges are declared when you check-in. Stay away
text: Staff is good. Hotel policies are a scam. They have a hidden charge of $55 per person per day for a breakfast that they force you to take. Worst breakfast ever and they don't disclose this when you book. They only disclose it when you check-in. Every other hotel gives you an option to chose breakfast or decline while booking. Specifically 5 star hotels. This hotel hides all this info. This is an absolute scam and unprofessional business practice.

title: Amazing hotel
text: We had an amazing stay as always at the westhouse. We have stayed many times at this hotel as we love the location, comfort and the friendly staff always goes out of its way to help. Especially Paige at the concierge desk who went out of her way to assist us. We couldn’t have had a better stay in  NYC thanks to the Westhouse and its extraordinary staff.

title: Attention aux frais cachés!!!
text:
Hôtel  de très bon standing , très bien situé. Personnel aimable et accueillant. Très bon confort de la chambre (Chambre Deluxe -2 grands lits- pour 3 personnes). Restauration (Petit déjeuner et "en - cas " de fin d'après midi) de  bonne qualité et variée. Par contre , des frais , autres que les taxes locales et de séjour attendues (State Tax et City Tax ) ,  nous ont été facturés , dès le check -in,  sans explication préalable.  Ce sont les Resort Fees , qui représentent des frais de services  proposés par l'établissement..... S'agit il du petit déjeuner (pourtant inclus dans le montant de la réservation  effectuée auprès d'un voyagiste) , du "Indulgent Hours" entre 17 h et 20 h , de l'accès à la WiFi ou à la salle de fitness (que nous n'avons pas utilisée ) ?  Ils étaient d'un montant de 36,66 dollars par nuit et par personne soit un total , pour 7 jours , de 770 dollars (qu'il faut rajouter au montant de la réservation de la chambre).Cette pratique est , malheureusement , très répandue dans les établissements de New York  !!! cf. commentaires à ce sujet sur la Toile.  
En conclusion, vérifiez bien avant de réserver....

title: not value for money
text:
except for the location the hotel is terrible.
house keeping is very bad. you ask for anything you will never get. 
i asked for a dental kit and i got it after three days after repeated reminders. i asked for a bottle of water and until the time i va tasted the room they didn’t deliver. 
room is small size and not value for money.

the reception people are very friendly and helpful particularly Mr Tariq and others

title: Outstanding stay
text: This is my second time staying at this hotel and this time was even better than the first.  Beautiful hotel, nicely appointed rooms, friendly and helpful staff, and some nice surprises: delicious breakfast and happy hour (which could serve as a dinner).  Happy hour includes complimentary wine, champagne or beer and a nice spread.  Thank you to Paige the manager for even including an upgrade to your room.  Can’t wait to come back.

title: Surprise ! All inclusive fees mandatory ! + 750$ for 2 nights !
text:
Extra fees mandatory !
What a surprise ! Our travel told us the Westhouse kept the info and finally extra fees were on the voucher we received after paying our reservation.
A bill of more than 750$ for 2 nights and a family of 4 including residents fees. What a pleasant gift for our check in.
We booked this hotel for its location but we had to pay for a mandatory « all inclusive » that was never part of the deal even for our travel.
Now, you pay for a 4 stars all inclusive package, at the desk you can drink Champagne but on the 23d floor you have a poor proseco. Everything goes on the same standard. 4 stars look like the lowest quality you can expect ! 
The best thing in this hotel, the employees. All of them are really kind. Hopefully !!

title: Hidden Fees
text: Overall the hotel lobby was nice and rooms were clean.  We were above the 20th floor and only one elevator worked all wknd.  It took 20 minutes most times to get up or down.  More importantly, we were not informed about a mandatory "residence" fee that was for breakfast, evening cocktail, wi-fi, etc.  So we unfortunately never had breakfast because we didn't know we were paying for it.  The residence fee was between $350.00 and $400.00 which appears on your credit card.  Just tell your guest, so they can plan their trip to take advantage of the benefits, since they are being charged.  Nobody likes hidden fees.

title: Excellent location and the hotel and service were exceptional! There is a charge of $55 day per person but well Worth
text: The food at breakfast and happy hour was delicious and the drinks were good. Wonderful atmosphere and service. Location was great, walked to Central Park, theater district, and Times Square. Would stay here again!

title: Lovely first time stay in NYC
text: We loved our stay at WestHouse. It was our first time in NYC and the hotel is perfectly located close to Central Park, Broadway and other attractions. Our room was lovely with super comfy beds. The breakfast spread and evening drinks and canapés were generous and tasty. The staff seemed to enjoy their jobs and were efficient and friendly, albeit not as friendly as you would find in hotels back in Australia.

title: No customer service
text: Nice room but noisy, in a well located but uncomfortable hotel, where you hardly receive customer service. If you travel for work, don't expect to get an invoice, I'm still fighting with the Hotel to get my invoice

title: Great location
text: Great location, decent breakfast. We were pleased with happy hour dinner options. We read some negative reviews and found them all to be inaccurate. We walked to Broadway shows and Central Park easily. The staff was super friendly and answered all our questions.

title: Pas un 5 étoiles et arnaque au "Resident Fees"!
text:
Le seul avantage de cet hotel est son emplacement idéal pour visiter NYC  et la literie de bonne qualité.
Pour le reste: le petit déjeuner buffet est basique dans un espace minuscule. 
La chambre, soi-disant upgradée était minuscule aussi, et très bruyante. 
Le personnel est assez peu aimable.
Le pire: nous avions réservé sur Veepee, le voyagiste étant Idiliz by MisterFly. Un voucher nous avait été envoyé précisant bien que tout était payé (nuitées + petit déjeuner inclus)  et disant à l'hotel de ne rien facturer en plus. Sauf qu'ils ont prélevé un "resident fee" de 55$ par jour et par personne sur la CB fournie au check-in en garantie! L'hôtel évidemment ne veut rien savoir, et nous attendons toujours la réponse à notre réclamation au voyagiste... C'est une pure arnaque!!!!

title: Great Hotel in a great location
text: I stayed one night in the hotel. in a one-bedroom suite. The stay was wonderful. The room is spacious and clean, with a great view, both towards the south (Seventh Avenue) and towards the east (55th Street). Initially I was given a room without a view, however I asked for a change, and my request was answered immediately. On the 23rd floor there is a wonderful terrace, where you can sit and eat breakfast, as well as enjoy the food at happy hour (which can definitely provide as dinner as well). Excellent location. In short - an excellent hotel, at a reasonable price, in an excellent location, including breakfast + dinner. I have no doubt that next time in New York, we will stay at this hotel.

title: Perfect location for a good price!
text: Great hotel with perfect location! Specious rooms with a good view. Breakfast terrace has a balcony where you can enjoy your coffee! Vanessa on front desk was super helpful and nice! We’ll definitely come back again!

title: Finally... clean, comfortable and hip at a reasonable price in Manhattan
text: You will not find a better stay for the price in Manhattan. Hip lobby, great views of the city from your room, close to Broadway, Central Park and Carnegie Hall. I brought a small group of friends for a concert and everyone loved the rooms; clean & roomy. Be sure to take advantage of the daily fee for breakfast & happy hour. The complimentary food during happy hour is plenty enough to call dinner. We will be back !

title: Great location, greater experience
text:
I went on a girls trip and took a red eye to New York. Check-in was a breeze, and being greeted with a reusable water bottle was so nice! It's also close to the subway so getting around to the different places we wanted to go was easy.

Staff was incredibly pleasant, made sure I had plenty of towels. The breakfast and hours of indulgence in the evening was amazing. Usually I do a little shopping for some basics, but I didn't need to this time. The water dispenser and coffee machines were life savers on more than one occasion.

I've already told my husband we need to stay here when we do a couples trip.

title: Excellent hotel, great location.
text: This is a very nice hotel in a great location.  Most sights are within walking distance. The rooms are good and clean. Some of the bathroom fixtures were tarnished, and some baseboards needed touch up paint. That being said, the hotel is clean and staff is clean and staff is wonderful. Loved the morning breakfasts and evening bar.  My experience was five star, but I wouldn’t say this is a five star hotel even though very nice.

title: Weekend Fun
text: Stayed in New York many times. My second stay at this hotel and will definitely stay again. Staff were helpful and friendly. Stayed in a luxury king room. Very good size for New York hotels.  Can’t get a better location in Midtown. Breakfast was very good and had some variety. Happy hour was great after a long day with free beer, wine and food.

title: A New York hotel with flare!
text: My recent 3 night stay at the West House was an amazing experience. The location is very convenient for shopping, the theater, sightseeing, and restaurants. My room was immaculately clean. The staff is super friendly and oh so accommodating. The European breakfast  had an assortment of hot and cold items which included fresh fruits, pastries, eggs, meats, etc. The combo coffee machine rivals any coffeehouse. The late afternoon Happy Hour has an impressive array of delicious appetizers and wines. Combine all that I’ve mentioned and honestly, the West House is a win win in my books.

title: OK Hotel - Great Location
text:
They list themselves as a 5 star but it is not a 5 star.  4 star would be more accurate.

Staff:  They are pretty friendly and helpful.  We had a couple of issues, one major and one minor.  Both were eventually resolved.  

Rooms:  This is where the major problem was.  We were checked into a Luxury King however it seemed small.  Plus in the hotel room pictures, it looked exactly like a King and not a Luxury King.  The hotel has various room sizes for Luxury King and we were in a smaller version.  We could not change upon checkin and we were in a rush to get out.  The next day, Page the concierge was very helpful and put us into a larger Luxury King.   The room number was 2207.  These rooms have NO bathrobes, slippers, coffee or tea.  Also bathroom amenities are 1 bar of soap and shower lotions in bottles.  So, it just can't be a 5 star.  The room was clean and the cleaning staff were very helpful.  

The bed was pretty comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet.  

Food/Beverage:  We stayed 3 days and had breakfast for 3 days and the evening lounge  food/drinks 1 time.  Both were ok and the staff once again were very nice, friendly and helpful.   I didn't see a bar or restaurant so probably does not have one.  

Location:  everything we wanted to do on this trip was within walking distance.  Carnegie Hall, MOMA, the MET and Central Park.  We also walked down to Times Square a couple of times.  It was good to see but I'm not a fan.  

Overall:  I can see that we may stay there again if that was the area we wanted to be in.

title: Not really a 5-star
text: I do not know how this hotel is rated as a 5 star. It has terrible service and sub-par amenities. The room had no slippers, no bathrobes, nothing in the minibar and no coffee machine. The service was also subpar. I called to have someone help me with my bags and no one came for 20 minutes. I called asking for an adapter and they told me to come down and get it. Definitely the worst 5 star I have stayed in to date.

title: Great hotel and helpful staff
text: Convenient location. Walking distance to Carnegie Hall. Was there to meet our friends then go to the airport together. Chris Ortiz was very kind with her luggages. He even brought drinks to the kids while we were waiting for the taxi in the lobby.

title: Perfect situated near Times square and Central park
text: Good hotel with al the amenities you can ask for. Nice breakfast and a nice outside veranda where you can sit and sip your drink during the complementary winehour. We will come back to the hotel and are very satisfied with our stay

title: Noisy AC spoilt an otherwise good stay.
text: Outside noise from air conditioning fans was constant all night. Noise reverberated throughout the internal well of the hotel. Switching off room AC made no difference to noise.  There was only a roller blind on the window, and the Roman blind and curtains were  just for decoration and didn’t  close. Better curtains may have helped shut out some noise and light. It’s a pity as the hotel was clean, in a good location, and all staff were very good. The breakfast and evening buffet were good, but not free as other reviews have stated. An additional $60 per person per day is added to cover this and the gym. Given high NY prices this was pretty good value for a tapas that was good as an evening  meal. No bar in hotel but access to bar in hotel next door. If it wasn't for the fan noise we would have gladly booked again.

title: Above & Beyond
text: For a quiet hotel with all the fancy pluses, not far from any NY attraction, but not in the middle of all the noise, this hotel is perfect. It's the staff that make it so amazing. It's classic NY chic with new elegance & all the extras. From being welcomed in, to the amazing scent throughout hotel, to breakfast, to all the neighborhood stores & restaurants, you can't find a better hotel...

title: Solid stay
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2023.
We had a 2 queen bed room  that we shared with our 2.5 year old son. Though it seemed like we were the only ones with young kids there. (not something I was too bothered by)
For our needs we found that it was a great hotel.
Pros:
- proximity to central park and times square - both like 5mins walk
- good enough spread at breakfast and food between 5pm-7pm (it varied everyday and was enough for us for dinner - especially with a toddler). I could see how some would go on to eat dinner out afterward, but not really an option 
- for NY I thought both the room and bathroom were a good size (not huge, but not as small as some that are in NYC)

Cons:
Our room was street facing and was a bit noisy (sirens, cars honking, etc), might recommend a courtyard view room. if you want a slightly quieter experience - although it is NY so there will always be some noise

title: Best hotel
text: When we checked in, the hostess Vanessa upgraded us to av3-sided suite. Great view on the 24th floor with a little glimpse of Central Park. The bed is very comfortable. We were able to benefit from the free happy hour between 5pm and 7pm on the 23rd floor with drinks and small food on the terrace. Very good experience. Thanks

title: So disappointing and extra fees are a true rip off!
text:
This hotel is advertised as luxury with free amenities. Far from it! Your free Wi-Fi, breakfast costs $55 per person per night in fees. The business center is a small desk with computer in the lobby. The lobby is decorated as if a bar exists.  It is all fake. The room….had to change 3 times!  The first two rooms were dirty. Bathroom was disgusting. Our light fixtures above the bed (8)….only 3 worked. Only positive is that there is daily housekeeping. 

I lived in NYC for 10 years and just returned for a family event. Chose to stay here as it was close to the event. Made a terrible mistake. Next time, I will choose to stay on one of the Central Park South hotels. 

If you want to luxury…this is NOT the hotel for you. It felt like an upgraded Courtyard.

title: Excellent base for New York trip
text: We stayed at the Wedthoise hotel as it was one of the few hotels offering two queen size beds, so that my daughter wouldn’t be in a fold out bed. Although more expensive the benefits were excellent, breakfast was provided and gave you a great start each morning as did the free bar and snack bar in the evening, all included in the price. The hotel team were welcoming and friendly, the room was comfortable and big enough for what we needed, and the location was perfect for exploring New York, with a subway station a minute from the door and a short walk to broadway, and Central Park.

title: Wonderful Experience!!
text: We had an amazing experience.  The location could not be more central...minutes to Central Park, sites and subways.  The hotel was very clean and quiet with a cool vibe. The customer service was incredible, the staff was so friendly and helpful.  And we really enjoyed the morning breakfast and evening happy hour/dinner on the roof!  I will definitely be coming. back!

title: Near perfect stay
text: Awesome staff, very helpful.  The property itself is nice, well kept.  Location is fantastic.  Close to the park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, etc.  Lots of restaurants close by.  The Terrace with breakfast in the morning, and munchies and a drink in the evening was perfect.

title: Superbe séjour
text:
Très bel hôtel lit très confortable 
Le buffet bien garni aussi bien le matin que le soir 
Un grand merci à Vanessa pour son accueil et pour sa disponibilité 
Hôtel proche de tous transports 
Je recommande

title: Great hotel, great service
text: Very good hotel that I highly recommend. I am in the hotel business and I pay attention to details. This hotel had all the details covered, great rooms with views, great location, great security privacy and wonderful service. I have to give a special shout out to Moe and Vanessa from the front desk and the housekeeping lady (I didn’t catch her name) who was in housekeeping. They were very pleasant. I don’t normally fill out these things in TripAdvisor, but I felt the need to do so here.

title: Disappointed
text: It pains me to leave a bad review, but I felt obligated to let people know ahead of time what to expect.  Pros, the location is wonderful, my daughter was performing at Carnegie Hall which made it ideal.  More pros, the daily breakfast is lovely as well at the 5-7pm happy hour and snacks.  More pros, the terrace is lovely and we enjoyed sitting out there during happy hour.  Ok so now the cons, our room was so hot no working AC.  Apparently the whole building shuts off access to AC if the outside temperature is lower then 60 degrees.  Our room was so hot and humid it was unbearable.  We called front desk they sent up a fan the fan was so old and dirty it blew black moldy dust all over the bed.  I just don’t understand how an entire hotel shuts down the AC system.  We tried opening window still no circulation plus the loud noises of NYC.  Cons, no room service, rude staff at front desk during evening, room needs major repairs and have to go to the fitness room after 7pm just to het water from a fountain.  I will not be staying here ever again.

title: Location location location
text:
If you want the best experience in manhattan, this is the perfect hotel for you. All the crew is very courteous and warm. The restaurant in the 23rd floor has the best view in their terrace while you are dining. Beer and wine is unlimited during the dinner. Tea and coffee is available the whole day. My man Victor will accommodate anything for your comfort. Thanks Victor! 
This hotel is in the middle of 5th street, broadway, Times Square and central park. Subway access is just meters away from the front door. Will definitely pick this hotel again in the future.

title: Cinque stelle, forse una volta....
text:
Necessita di molta manutenzione specialmente nelle camere (condizionatore obsoleto, mobilio, illuminazione, moquettes). 
Nulla nel frigobar (ma ottima la lounge al 23° piano sempre a disposizione). 
Nessun articolo da bagno in dose singola nè amenities nelle camere.
Coda al Checkin (lento) e camera non pronta alle ore 15.00.
Personale molto professionale e disponibile.
Colazione ottima. 
Posizione top.

title: Best experience
text: The room was impeccable and very spacious.  The staff was extremely accommodating and it was customer service at its best.  My room was easily upgraded and for the occasion of my wife’s birthday the room had a champagne bottle with delicious velvet cake waiting for us.  Thank you Armani!!!!

title: Amazing Hotel!!!
text: An incredible experience!  Every person we interacted with was incredibly friendly, helpful and so welcoming; Doormen, Front desk workers, housekeeping and the Terrace Team.   The rooms are incredibly comfortable and well taken care of.  The breakfast, snacks and happy hour are really tasty, convenient and allow you to minimize the amount of eating out!  We have stayed here 3 times and each time the service and hospitality is AMAZING!  Highly Recommended!

title: Impeccable.
text: Très bon hôtel, parfaitement situé entre Central Park, 5ème avenue, MoMa et Times square. Chambre impeccable, spacieuse, très propre. Personnel serviable. Attention juste aux « résident fees » qui ajoute 55 dollars par jour et par personne pour les taxes, le petit déjeuner et la collation du soir.

title: Fantastic luxurious hotel
text: Highly recommend this fabulous hotel. Everything was perfect, from the spacious room and bathroom, super comfy bed and delicious plentiful breakfast. Great central location, 10 mins walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue. Very helpful friendly staff.

title: 10/10 stay!
text:
We just got back from a lovely 4 night stay at this hotel! The hotel is super clean and the staff are very friendly. We checked in just after midnight so my only complaint is that the night manager didn’t give us much information in terms of payment or facilities. However, ALL the rest of the staff were always very friendly and helpful- from the reception staff to the team in the lobby to help with the doors and luggage!
The breakfast had good variety and although busy at times, it was very well staffed. Shoutout to the staff helping at breakfast who were always very accommodating - I am gluten free and they always brought gluten free bread for me. 
The room itself was very lovely and chic - just what you would expect from a boutique hotel! The only thing I can suggest for improvement would be to have a bath tub and maybe some new fixtures and fittings in the bathroom.
The hotel is in an excellent location - just a few blocks from Central Park and fifth avenue!
All in all we had a great stay and would definitely stay here again!

title: Correct mais ne devrait pas afficher 5 étoiles
text:
Je suis complètement d'accord avec l'avis précédent. Cet hôtel n'a rien d'un 5 étoiles ! Peut être plus près de 3. 
Il n'y a pas de room service, pas de portier à l'entrée de l'hôtel, personne pour vous accompagner en chambre et l'accueil est assez glacial. 
La "terrace" est tres agréable mais vraiment minuscule ... 4-5 tables maximum donc on est loin du roof top ! Et il n'y a pas non plus de bar ...
Il y a quand même du positif. Les petits déjeuners sont corrects et variés mais la salle est en effet trop petite. 
Les chambres sont bien et toujours très propres. 
Évidemment, l'emplacement est nickel !
Honnêtement, j'ai réservé cet hôtel par vente privée donc à un tarif très raisonnable et j'en ai eu pour mon argent. Par contre, quand je vois les prix pratiqués sur le site de l'hôtel, je trouve que le rapport qualité prix n'est plus bon !
Bref, je ne pense pas revenir dans cet hôtel lors de mon prochain séjour.

title: Nice hotel at a great location
text:
Overall a pleasant experience - great service and staff. 
The restaurant area and rooms might need better upkeep and maintenance. The fitness center was great though. The resort fee of USD 55 is a bit on the higher side compared to other places.

title: Great location and excellent customer service!
text:
Three great things about this hotel:

1. Staff is customer service focused!  They greeted us by name, we’re very accommodating to our requests, and surprised my daughter with birthday balloons and macaroons in the room!

2. Hotel is centrally located to subways, 5th Ave, Central Park, Rockefeller plaza, and Times Square. 

3. Breakfast and happy hour on the 23rd floor was a pleasant surprise!

title: Excellent hotel and right choice for New York trip!
text:
Location of the hotel is extraordinary! Service and stuff as well and leaves no wish unfulfilled. Breakfast and evening buffet meet expectation.
The rooms are satisfying big, just as Europeans needed some time to get used to wall shower. 😊
Deserves every recommendation!

title: Great location, food and happy hour.
text: Upside: Awesome location. Excellent food for breakfast and dinner. Good value for money. Comfortable bed. Downside: holding deposit still hasn’t come back 7 days later, my daughter’s comforter was taken in error by housekeeping, no sign of return. My daughter heartbroken as had since birth and we travel a lot and had never been mistaken as bed linen before. Request a room away from the elevator, noisy otherwise. Ironically quiet from the street. Had to ask for bathroom amenities such as a shower cap, as nothing in the room. Not sure if this was an oversight or not. Also no notepads and pens in the room. Thought that was only during Covid but still applies here, none available when I requested one either. Outgoing calls not working from my room either, so had to borrow very kind floor manager’s cell phone instead. Overall: 4 out of 10 and definitely 4 star not 5.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed in the city!! The service was great! They offer free breakfast and dinner + happy hour daily!! It’s part of the resort fee but usually you get charged that just for the gym — which is state of the art and 24 hours. The terrace is beautiful. I’d like to shoutout Leo and Victor who made the stay even more comfortable and deserves a vacation from management. Also Carlos who is an engineer 👨🏽‍💻 thank you for exceeding my expectations daily!

title: Wonderful place to stay in Midtown!
text: Loved our stay at the West House hotel... the breakfast was amazing- the nightly bar service and food on the terrace was wonderful each night and we utilized it nightly instead of going out to dinner before plays....the room was beautiful and we loved the bedding... we got a double queen and it was a nice size room. The location was perfect and easy to get around and take subways etc... easy to walk to Times Square and the Empire State Building , Central Park!  Would definitely  stay here again!

title: Hôtel décevant mais bien situé
text:
Cet hôtel est ravissant et les chambres sont relativement spacieuses et joliment agencées. Mais le service n’est pas à la hauteur du standing de l’hôtel, malgré la gentillesse du personnel.  
Le petit déjeuner est servi dans une salle triste, un peu sale et sur bondée sans aucun service (couverts en plastiques, gobelets en cartons quand il y a du monde).
L’hôtel est bien situé. Proche de Central Park.
Notre séjour s’est bien passé mais nous avons été déçus du standing.

title: Nice!
text: Nicely appointed hotel and an attractive price even before considering Happy Hour (with food) and Breakfast are included. We also enjoyed the 23rd floor outdoor terrace.  We hope to return given the great location which is in the heart of mid-town.

title: Spacious, comfortable and chique
text: Really great hotel. The service was great, super easy check in process. The room was spacious and very comfortable. And the location can’t be beat. The lobby is a chique space as well, great for a quick meeting and drinks with clients.

title: Best location for a NYC holiday
text: Awesome location to see all the holidays Must Do's in NYC. Really fun and energetic staff. The rooms are spacious. The club lounge was over the top. Food and drink both really lovely and plentiful.  The view from up there was fantastic

title: Bien mais…. Il y a à redire
text:
L’hôtel est idéalement situé proche de central Park et pas loin de Times Square. La literie est super bien vraiment. Après on parle d’un 5 étoiles et je crois pas que c’est mérité. La décoration commence à se défraîchir, on a demandé à changer de chambre car le lavabo de la première était vraiment bien cassé et ça faisait pas envie, les sièges  en tissu de la salle à manger sont hyper tachés. Vraiment rien d’extraordinaire. Si je compare avec le Sofitel de New York qui n’a que 4 étoiles , le WestHouse est beaucoup moins bien. En France je comparerai au niveau Mercure. 4 étoiles entrée de gamme. 
En plus le modèle tarifaire associé à l’hôtel est vraiment gênant : vous devez obligatoirement payer plus de 60$ taxes incluses par nuit et par personne pour bénéficier d’un petit déjeuner et d’une collation à 17h (très copieuse et qui peut presque suffire pour un dîner) . Pour ce prix là vous avez droit aussi au wifi et à la salle de sports. Donc avec ça  il faut faire ses choix entre manger à l’extérieur ou à l’hôtel. Donc pas forcément très intéressant comme modèle de tarification obligatoire.

title: Hidden gem
text: Lovely hotel right in the middle of everything.  The place is beautifully appointed, beds so comfortable, great showers, yummy breakfast and cocktail hour, but what makes the Westhouse extra special is the staff. Every time we stay there we’re welcomed like family, from the bellmen who rush out to greet the car to the front desk (all great, especially Vanessa) to the housekeeping crew:  I almost don’t want to share this review because it’s a hidden gem in NYC but they deserve the kudos.

title: Супер отель. Хотелось бы вернуться именно сюда.
text:
Очень понравился отель. Во-первых,расположение. Находится на Бродвее,в 2х кварталах от Центрального Парка,в 1 квартале от Таймс Сквер. Рядом много хороших ресторанов.

На 23 этаже подаётся вкусный завтрак и ужин с 5 до 8ми.На завтраке всегда помимо вкусной выпечки,колбасы,сосисок и всяких вкусняшек,каждый день ежевика,клубника,малина.

Единственный минус-полы в номере плохо убирали.

title: Thank u WestHouse :)
text: We had an amazing time at the Westhouse Hotel. Every employee is very kind and can help at any time. We will never forget the very kind and friendly Donna who helped us during our trip. We laughed so much together and felt like home ❤️ thanks to her & her amazing work.

title: peachy stay at westhouse
text:
the second i arrived, i felt right at home. the bellmen were helpful and came up to my uber right away to help me with my luggage. which felt like such a great relief after traveling and running around with them all day. the front desk attendant kevin or nick, not quite sure the name, was also kind and attentive. he mentioned our room wasn't ready yet but that we can leave our luggage at the hotel and explore the city. the room was tidy, beautiful, and exactly what i needed. 
 now let's get to the GOOD STUFF.
the terrace ! working from there was amazing. and the fact that breakfast, dinner, and happy hour was complimentary was a major win.
westhouse, i'll be back again!

title: Delighted to be back
text: We were so delighted to come back here after three years . This is a great hotel. Fantastic location within very easy access of everything. Super friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are very good and immaculate. Very quiet considering the location. We love this place and highly recommend

title: Dissapointing stay at Westhouse
text:
A weekend getaway with an awful experience at Westhouse. 
The hotel had not cleaned our room before arrival. There was rotten food in the refrigerator from the previous guest. The bathroom was dirty and when we called to complain they did little to resolve this issue. When I called the front desk for suggestions on local places to get a sandwich or bagels they said “ we can look on Google for you, but you can do that yourself” they were especially discourteous upon check in and were not polite when I asked for an explanation of room charges. The hotel itself seemed nice ( if room had been cleaned better begore check in) it’s was mostly the hotel employees which clearly had no regard for making the experience enjoyable. At this point in time, I would strongly discourage people from staying at this hotel and I myself would not chose to stay there again. 
Once more I’d like to emphasize that it was the employees that made this visit so unenjoyable

title: Absolutely wonderful!
text: I had such a wonderful stay at West House! The breakfast is divine, the decor is lovely, and the staff are incredibly attentive. The location is perfect. The hotel is right down the street from Central Park and right next to the Times Square Theatre District. I would absolutely stay here again!

title: Quiet retreat with friendly staff
text: Very nice hidden gem. Pleasant atmosphere with great full breakfast fare and evening complimentary food and beverage. Caring and friendly staff. Clean rooms with nice amenities. Easy check in and great doormen and all staff ready to meet your needs

title: The abundance of extras hit the wow factor.
text: I guess I lucked out when I reserved my room through an aggregator at an extremely low price. T the suite was enormous with a separate bedroom with its own temperature settings. Two massive balconies with fabulous views. The furniture is a tad dated, but there are so many amenities in the room. It is hard to complain about anything really. The people at reception were incredibly charming. The lobby is small, but has a bar in the back that doesn't seem to get a lot of action. The real kicker is the breakfast and late afternoon wine buffet. I couldn't believe how much food was there for both seatings, and you can eat inside or out on a considerable patio with lovely views. I could subsist on this alone, if I wasn't tempted to eat out on the regular. I would just check to see if the cost for this has now been absorbed into a resort fee. Otherwise, I would always stay here if I could.

title: Wow! (In a good way)
text: What a gem!  The hotel is beautiful, perfect location for tourists, but not touristy, and the service was possibly the best EVER! Shout out to Nick, Olisha, Christian and everyone else!  They are so friendly and accommodating.  We had a blast! In fact, we checked out, went to what is supposedly a super fun hotel, checked out of that after one night and returned to WestHouse, where we belonged!  Can't thank them all enough.  Breakfast and happy hour were good also and appreciate that handiness. Hope to see you all again, soon. Their goal is your home away from home, it was better...Great place to conduct business as well. No coffee in the room but cappuccinos and any other fancy delicious coffee in the hospitality room.  I liked that better! The view wasn't bad either, fantastic!!

title: WestHouse Hotel helped make our weekend Great!
text: Took my wife for her 40th. The hotel had a very homely lobby with very helpful and friendly reception and door staff. The room was perfect and they had even decorated the room with balloons and banner and complimentary champagne for our arrival, I dropped them an email prior to let them know but very helpful and easy to deal with. Will definitely be staying again and highly recommend. Plus the location is perfect, walk a couple of minutes north your in Central Park, walk 5 mins south you are in time square, a couple mins east we were on 5th! The subway right outside or even 2 blocks down takes you easily up and down town pretty much door to door...

title: Rude staff and hidden costs
text: the house keeper was rude and yelled at us for putting a do not disturb sign on our door instead of telling her directly. They also charged us an extra $53 usd per person per night without prior warning, costing an extra $375 usd for two people for three nights. This ‘residents fee’ was supposedly for breakfast and happy hour, despite being advertised as breakfast included and paying the cost in full already.

title: A New York City Gem
text: A Home Away from home with breakfast and a happy hour to absolutely die for. Location and staff make this my new go to when in the city. Rooms were comfortable and bedding kept me nice and warm given it was winter.

title: Must Stay!
text: Team was amazing in making sure we were well taken care of the entire stay. Location was great! We arrived at LGA airport and had no issues getting to hotel. Close to subway or within walking distance of thing we were looking to experience while in NY

title: Turn up
text: The staff here are amazing. They treated us like we were family 20 stars. Jason and Jesse were amazing. Great hotel, great service, great food and great coffee. Thank you for the hospitality and making us feel like we’re home.

title: Hidden Gem
text: West House has an excellent location that was close to many of the large banks and brokerage firms.  It also was very convenient to time square/broadway shows and central park.  The staff was very helpful, especially in getting cabs.  The property has a sister property less than a block away that has great cab traffic and they call a cab over from that property.  The breakfast bar was very nice with eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes, cheese, fruit, deli slices, and many wonderful pastries in a cozy room with various seating arrangements.  The area around is quiet for sleeping well at night.

title: Un très bon spot pour visiter New York
text:
Tres bon emplacement à deux pas de Broadway et du MoMA pour les amateurs de tableaux. 
Petit déjeuner inclus et très varié personnel très aimable 
Quoi de plus ?
Prix plus attractif sinon réservé sur le site de l hôtel que via les tour operators tels que booking

title: Cuidado e atenção ao cliente em todo momento.
text: Nos hospedamos no período do nosso casamento na cidade. A equipe do hotel simplesmente fantástica! Payge e Dana nos fizeram nos sentir em casa. Quarto gigante , 23andar p trabalhar mto agradável e acolhedor. Social hour e’ um convite para começar uma bela noite em Nyc. Localização? Excepcional!

title: Great Place To Stay
text: I chose this place via online and there were no regrets! It EXCEEDED my expectations. The staff is professional and amazing. They go out their way to provide great service. This is my go to hotel whenever I visit NY

title: Wonderful Time At the WestHouse
text: Took and trip to NYC with my daughter. Our experience at the WestHouse Hotel was Wonderful. Everyone was attentive and friendly. This hotel is ideally located. Near all the must-do-see in Manhattan. Thank You WestHouse Hotel!

title: Another wonderful stay at the WestHouse
text: I was at the WestHouse Jan 21-Jan 23 for a business trip. I have stayed here many times. It never ceases to amaze me the consistently excellent experience I have there. The entire staff is always courteous, friendly and professional. They are always trying to enhance your stay by making worthwhile suggestions. The WestHouse is a very reasonably priced hotel offering 1st class accommodations and service. I look forward to retuning this summer.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: The Westhouse is a very nice boutique hotel that makes you feel like you are home.  Excellent location, close to theaters, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, shopping and lots of great restaurants in the surrounding area.  Alicia Nunez made us feel special by checking in a couple of times during our stay.  Lobby is very comfortable and cozy. No need to look anywhere else!

title: Great Value
text: My friend and I stayed here for our girls getaway weekend. This hotel is located near Times Square (without the crowd), close to Central Park, and a stones throw away from the subway station. Bed, pillows, and sheets were very comfortable. They gave us bottled water when we check in - I know this isn't much but nowadays, every little thing counts. Breakfast is included and it isn't your regular continental breakfast. Also, they have drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) lite fare in the evening. Staff are nice and friendly. If you're looking for a hotel that provides great value - this is it. I'll definitely stay here again.

title: An Aladdins Den of Sophistication & Luxury
text:
An Aladdin’s Den of Sophistication, luxury & comfort in the City that never sleeps! 
However, you will get to sleep and very comfortably in this bespoke quality super comfortable hotel! 
My husband and I, enjoyed a 6 day trip to New York and stayed in the most delightful of boutiques hotel. Which I hope to one day re-visit very soon. 
Upon arriving we were greeted by the ever so friendly & welcoming Chris Ortiz, who saw us comfortably up to our room.
The room we stayed in was on the 22nd floor a King Deluxe room. Furnished with a most comfortable bed and quality bedding. It was a feat to wrestle myself from the slumbers that the quality bedding and very comfortable bed provided. The room was spacious, very clean and with quality mahogany furnishings. The bathroom is a Pandora’s box of truly great quality shampoo and conditioner provided by the hotel. The hair products sustainably sourced and blended into true quality, is a great gift of pleasure! The bathroom modern and exuding luxury and sophistication. Also, the two thick lush towel bathrobes were a great addition. I was pleasantly surprised to find my room had a GHD hairdryer which I took the pleasure in utilising. They also provided a premium body lotion too.
 Gloria, one of the House Keepers excelled in maintaining the clean and well made up “Wow!” factor that we got every time, we returned from a full day out. 
The resort fee which included breakfast, coffee and a selection of teas, plus soft drinks available throughout the day, and in the evening a hot meal, plus wines, beers and champagne.
Upon returning to the hotel, after a full day and evening out, I went to the Terrace room (This is  the room which the resort fee pays for - breakfast and an evening meal) It was quite late and the room was now closed. However, Jose a very helpful member of staff enquired, if I was ok and did I need anything?
I commented I would love a hot cup of tea. Jose went out of his way to get me a hot cup of tea and walked with me carrying some of the condiments. 
The staff we encountered were all very friendly and super helpful, a real credit to this hotel! Quimby Hightower provided exceptional service in ensuring our comfort and enjoyment! Rafael in the Terrace room exuded warmth and an interest in our day. He always had a ready smile!
My biggest quandary was my desire to enjoy the wonderful amenities, as opposed to wanting to do as much sight seeing, as possible!
The location for us was perfect. Set in the heart of Manhattan we could walk to all the places we wanted to visit, such as Broadway, Stardust Diner, Times Square, Bryant Park and so on. 
I cannot rate this hotel enough  … in the words of Simon Cowell it’s a “Yes!” From me!!!

title: Probably the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in while in New York City
text: Wonderful hotel with friendly staff that are looking to please. Every morning they serve a delicious breakfast and the same went for dinner to location was a perfect distance to fifth Avenue shopping and Central Park. This hotel has become my go to hotel from now on whenever I will be staying in New York City.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text:
It was a very pleasant experience to stay in this hotel. The most we liked is that they don't only offer a Breakfast Buffet, also they include dinner Buffet and an open bar.  The rooms are beautiful and very confortable. And they have excellent workers at the Lobby who are very considerante and willing to help you. Especially Chris Ortiz who was very kind and mindful with us. So, next time I am back in NYC I will stay in this same hotel for sure! Also they have excellent location close to all important areas you must see! 

Thank you Chris!

title: Very pleasant stay, superb location!
text: The location is superb, I loved the view from our rooms and the amenities of the hotel were more than enough, the only issue we faced was that the breakfast area was small for the number of guests. The hotel staff were very nice and accommodating, shout out to Chris Ortiz who was always helpful and friendly with everything we needed during our stay. Will definitely stay there again when I visit New York again!

title: West house hotel
text:
The hotel was incredible, the staff make you feel very comfortable and they were try to help you with every way possible.
And the doorman Chris Ortiz was the nicest man and he was helping everyone. With his actions he make us all feel very comfortable staying at this hotel

title: Super kind staff
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights, location is perfect, food is great, rooms are very nice. The only thing I would like to see improve is the response time of a few requests because there were time where I asked for cleaning and the took a while however they were very apologetic and corrected their mistake. 

The front desk staff and the bellman Chris Ortiz were especially amazing, would definitely recommend to stay there if you're visiting New York

title: A memborable stay - highly recommend Westhouse!
text: I traveled to New York with my teenage daughter in mid-December and stayed at the Westhouse in a double queen room for 7 nights and I cannot fault our stay.  The hotel is well positioned and is within walking distance to everything that mid-town Manhatten has to offer - Carnegie Hall, Central Park, Broadway, Columbus Circle, Times Square and if you don't want to walk there is a subway entrance about a minute's walk away from the hotel.   The hotel itself has everything that made our stay exceptional - friendly staff, great breakfast, comfortable bedding, access to a gym, and free light supper and drinks for all hotel guests which was a surprise bonus for when we didn't feel like going out for dinner.    Cannot wait to come back to New York and when we do we'll definitely be staying at Westhouse!

title: Poor Service and Quality
text: Hello, this hotel is not worth the price. Most of the staff are unfriendly and the quality and service of the hotel is far below the price.  They have no attention to detail, you will get better service at a Hampton Inn.  The breakfast room is too small and the service is terrible.  The front desk offers to solve a problem and then nothing happens.  I do not recommned this hotel.

title: Superb Service at The WestHouse
text: Great location and a fantastic team. A special mention to front of house Mo and the star performer was Chris Ortiz (Bell Boy). Chris’s customer care is world class and he was full of positive energy and a great ambassador for the WestHouse!

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Amazing Hotel, Friendly Staff, Location perfection & amenities like the happy hour cant be beat!  We will definitely be staying here again.  We were very happy with Westhouse from the Bellmen/Doormen to all other hotel staff.  Simply the best Trip my family has ever had and Westhouse made this vacation above & beyond!

title: Great choice for a holiday stay
text:
Forgot to mention in yesterdays review,Viktor and Rafael
Are outstanding staff members.Very kind and patient.I wrote yesterday that I loved the location close to everything in Midtown.The hot apple cider in the lobby,the afternoon snacks that turned out to be dinner with a different food theme each night and much more.

title: très bien situé, personnel sympathique
text:
Ce n'est pas un 5 étoiles ! mais plutôt 4, il y a des meubles un peu abîmés, robinets à changer, et la climatisation/chauffage c'est un scandale ! elle fait un bruit à ne pas pouvoir dormir et au prix de la chambre il faudrait vraiment la changer !

Pas de bar mais boissons sans alcool, vin, petites choses à manger, disponible toute la journée gratuitement toute la journée.

Le personnel est adorable, les lits sont confortables, grande salle de bain avec douche. La décoration du hall est très jolie. J'avais demandé une chambre avec vue mais j'ai eu une vue sur un mur dommage.

title: A New York Minute
text: My daughter and I came to NY to celebrate her birthday and get some Christmas cheer. Rockets, Mariah Carey, Highline, Top of the Rock, subways and 1000000 steps ! It covered it all.This is a wonderful hotel so close to things we wanted to do. It has a really good breakfast room which Wass included in our stay, also open from 6-8 pm for Happy Hour. Lots of great hot food and snacks and terrific staff. Our room was lovely and bright with a very comfortable King bed. Bathroom amenities also ver good in our shower. I would happily recommend this hotel.

title: Good stay
text: The staff were very helpful. Zero issues there. Vanessa from the front desk and the bellmen as well. But this is NOT a five star hotel. It’s clean and does the job. But not even close to five star. It’s a very basic hotel.

title: Excellent time at the Westhouse
text:
Really lovely hotel with fantastic staff - nothing too much trouble. The room was spacious and clean, with a good sized shower in the bathroom.
The breakfast was excellent - good and plentiful choice everyday, and the evening food was good.
The hotel is superbly situated

title: Well worth the money
text: The complimentary evening meal was excellent and the restaurant staff was very service minded. Roomcost was a bit high but with included meal it was well worth the money. The hotel has a perfect location with walking distance to everything in the middle of Manhattan.

title: Highly recommend the Westhouse Hotel in Manhattan. Great value, great location, great breakfast!
text:
Excellent location for tourists to Manhattan. Walking distance to Central Park. Within an 8 minute walk - or so- to Times Square but far enough away that you have peace and quiet from the hubbub of that a tourist magnet. 
Westhouse has nice clean updated rooms, an amazing breakfast and happy hour every evening which I guarantee is worth the up-charge. We booked our hotel through MagellanLuxuryHotels.com and not only saved money but got amazing perks for a small membership fee. The membership cost less than the perks were worth, but this varies for each hotel they book so make your own decision. 
No matter how you book the Westhouse  Hotel it is GREAT VALUE for Manhattan. Loved it!

title: Beyond Exceptional
text:
From the moment we walked in the front door, we felt like royalty- but with a familiar, friendly, open, engaging twist. The staff is inspiringly professional and takes service to a whole new level. At the same time, we felt like we were back in a familiar space, and always loved walking in the revolving door at the end of each day. Anything we needed, any recommendation we asked for and any questions we had were taken care of promptly- and with great results. The staff humored us by listening to our tales of what we’d seen in the city that day. More often than not we were thanking them for their input on the best use of our time given the weather (sunny but freezing and windy). We’d like to extend a special thank you to Olisha, who was the best concierge we’ve ever had the pleasure of meeting, and Chris Ortiz and a Christian, the bellhops who gave us most recommendations including Angelina’s Bakery (which you should visit.- get the burned cheesecake). The lobby of WeatHouse is welcoming, and the rooms are well appointed with comfy mattresses and linens. Upstairs, we enjoyed the hot tasty coffee, and great food in the dining area. 
Overall an amazing experience! We will be back.

title: Good hotel with great views.
text: Very comfortable and a warm welcome for my birthday weekend. Room was comfortable and well appointed but sadly did not have tea and coffee making in the room. Early morning refreshments were available from the breakfast room from 6.30 weekdays or 7 at weekends. It was only one floor down from our room. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice and the breakfast room was well appointed. Indulgent (Happy] Hour from 5-8 in the evening was excellent with lots of food and dessert choices with unlimited wine and beer. You could eat enough for a small evening meal here if you wanted. View from our room was fantastic but beware that taxis beeping and fire trucks screeching goes on into the small hours. We would definitely come back.

title: Amazing experience!
text: The experience at WestHouse hotel was great! Everyone from check-in until checkout was really nice. The breakfast and dinner they offer are great, and the hotel location is just incredible (it's so close to Central Park which I loved for my morning runs). ! I was excited about the trip, but the hotel exceeded our expectations. We are definitely coming back to stay more days at the hotel. I believe the only downside was that Brazil lost the World Cup game when we were checking in! hahaha!

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Room was very comfortable and spacious. The housekeeping and concierge staff and specifically the bellman Chris Ortiz was extremely helpful, welcoming, and responsive. Those extra touches are very appreciated!

title: Good - Improvement Requires to justify 5 star status
text:
Both my friend and I stayed in Westhouse at the beginning of December for a vacation in New York and loved the location of the hotel along with the rooms and amenities.

The staff at reception and at the door were fantastic and were there to help when required. The subway is literally a few steps next to the hotel with Central Park only a couple of blocks away. 

In terms of the why I feel improvement is required focusses on a couple of areas:

- Resort Fee

You pay $50+ a night for food and drinks along with gym facilities and wifi (which is pretty standard across many hotels now). As part of this there is food, wine, beer and Prosecco each night. 

The food is unfortunately not hot, not was it warm on many occasions, including breakfast which was cold on some mornings (scrambled egg, bacon and potatoes being the main options). I did highlight this to hotel management on day two, however there was no change in the temperature. 

- Rooms

With the hotel being older bear in mind that soundproofing does not seem to have been installed. We could hear all our neighbours, including what they were watching on tv to people  talking in the corridors. 

A rather minor inconvenience was the heating was also stuck on, which would automatically come on, even when turned off (and I did wonder why there was a fan in the room…)

- Facilities

There are only 2 lifts for the whole hotel that we could use, meaning a wait of up to 10 mins on some occasions to get to our room on the 20th floor. Other guests had told us they had waited for nearly 20 mins, just spending to bear in mind if you are on high room. 

Overall the hotel was nice, it was not worth the price tag I paid however, based on the service provision (with the exception of the reception and concierge team). 

I would be unlikely to return unless there was a promotion available.

title: Great Service
text: Second time staying at the West House and they never disappoint! Location is amazing and their staff is fantastic! We love the amenities on the 23rd floor. What made this trip fun was the excellent service we got at the front desk from Donna. We came in for my wife’s B day and she was so friendly and she made us feel special. Also Chris at the bellman station took care of us and allowed us to get our getaway started right away. Thank you both!!!

title: Our new NY favorite hotel
text: This is our first time staying at the WestHouse and it has already become our favorite from our many stays in the city.  The service from the moment our ride pulled up to the front door (thank you Chris Ortiz - to the front desk staff at check in who gave us several alternatives to rooms because we arrived 2 hours early - to the cleaning staff who nearly begged us to clean our room when it wasn’t necessary - to the excellent all included breakfast, happy hour and mini dinner - to shaking our hands to welcome us back when we returned from sightseeing - to Chris arranging a cab to the airport while we enjoyed a late lunch and more sightseeing before returning home.  The rooms while not overly large were well appointed and spotless !  All for a great value in the middle of the action in 55th only steps away from 7th Ave.  Oh, and before we left we ran into Herman Trophy winner Desmond Howard in their lounge !!!!

title: WestHouse Hotel
text: When we arrived at our Hotel. We were greeted by Chris Ortiz. Wow! He has a wonderful personality and was very accommodating. Chris always had a great attitude and was helpful about attractions in the city. We were very impressed with him and all the staff at West House! We also had an early flight out and Chris made sure our Taxi’s were waiting for us!! Now that is Customer Service at its Best!! Thank you so much Chris for making our trip pleasant. Till we see you next time!! The Mendoza’s

title: 6 day stay - Fantastic Attention to Detail
text:
