We arrived at the Westhouse hotel and initially had a few issues, that were raised with management.  After our discussion, were  overwhelmed by their concern and the speed at whcih they resolved everything.  Not only did they reseolve the issues, they did so,  immediatley and changed our room - so swiftly.     The personalised attention by the management teams was really first class and it resulted in us having one of the happiest hotel stays in |New York.

I would like to mention two people in particular who helped elevate our stay.  Carol,  head of the housekeeping was my initial contact.  After mentionaing to her in conversation, a few things that we were not happy with , she was genutinly concerned and explained that this was a fantastic hotel to work with. 
 She immediately rang her Manager and set the wheels in motion.  Within an hour everything was rectified.  We received a visit from the very professional Head of VIP Services, Pagye Luke who confirmed the room change and upgrade and ensured that everyone of our issues was rectified.  Pagye continued to check in with us during our stay to ensure that everything was good.   The team were exceptional, even finding me a pair of scissors at 1am in the morning as my dress zip was stuck!  Excellent experience and will certainly return.  
xcele

title: Girls Getaway
text: Westhouse Hotel is fabulous! We choose it for the prime location near Central Park and the theatre district. The trip to NYC was a girls weekend with our daughters and it was perfection! As soon as we walked into the hotel, our group was greeted with warm cider and chocolates by the Christmas tree. The entire staff was welcoming and went out of their way to answer questions and help us settle in. The breakfast and dinner buffets were a nice break for our group to gather at the hotel and relax. The staff is kind and attentive to the smallest details. A big shout out to Chris Ortiz who was waiting to welcome us every time we walked into the lobby and checking on any restaurants or activities when we had questions. Any future trips to NYC will definitely include a stay at the Westhouse Hotel---highly recommend!

title: Nice experience!
text: We had a great time at the Westhouse! Great location friendly, nice city views, attentive staff, and comfortable rooms. The breakfast and dinner buffets were a great perk…very convenient. The bathroom vent in one of our bathrooms didn’t seem to be working and I did notice some mold around the ceiling in the corners.  Other than that, no complaints.  I have already recommended this hotel to others. I would stay there again.

title: Staying here for every NYC trip!
text:
Walked in and greeted with big smiles which was great! Had a little issue with my room not being the right bed size but it was quickly fixed by the manager. Rooms are super spacious for NYC which is great and the location was perfect! The daily breakfast, snacks, and evening bites definitely makes the resort fee worth it!
I’d say the best part of our stay was the attention, personality and positivity of the bellmen. Every single one of them made coming into and leaving the hotel a joy. Christ Ortiz made sure we got warm cider when we got in, was super nice to my son, and even got us a better deal on a taxi to the airport. 

Whenever we do come back to NYC this is the only hotel we need to be staying in!

title: Great location and staff.
text: We had a great visit to NY and the hotel location is excellent. The staff was very helpful and we especially appreciated the attention and great personality of our bellman, Chris Ortiz. Breakfast and dinner buffet a nice touch.

title: Beautiful Rooms - Outstanding Service~
text: Stayed at the WestHouse a couple weekends ago. The Hotel is very nice - good sized rooms for NYC,  Clean - Comfortable, etc. The service though was exceptional. Working with Riley in Sales regularly, I knew to expect an extremely high level of customer service and they were right on it! Everyone from the minute we walked in the door was there for us with smiles! Chris Ortiz the Bellman - is a star!

title: A real pleasure
text: Have been to New York many times and The Westhouse Hotel is by far the best place I have stayed. The minute you walk in your treated like royalty. The rooms were immaculate. The beds and pillows so comfortable and the shower was amazing. Special thanks to Donna on reception, what a wonderful lady, so nice and friendly. Also to Chris who was so helpful and kind to us carrying our luggage in and out of the hotel a proper gent. We were there for one the busiest times of the year thanksgiving so hats off to this hotel and their staff, really enjoyed our stay. Will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful stay
text: The Westhouse was a wonderful choice for our weeklong family NYC visit.  The rooms were clean, well cared for and maintained.  However, the  food and staff put this stay in the five star category.  There was a full breakfast each day with a 3-4 hour window which included not only hot foods but fresh berries and an espresso machine.  There is also a nightly “happy hour” that was really enough for dinner including wine or beer.  My teens raved that the dinner at the hotel was some of the best food they had in NYC.  The staff was kind and helpful, displaying amazing customer service.  They assisted with booking airport travel and provided tips for the best parade viewing.  They even had hot cider to greet us after a day out exploring.  Overall highly recommended.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: This was my first visit to WestHouse Hotel New York.  I was greeted by Vanessa.  She was not only professional and courteous but so nice.  She made sure my stay was nothing shy of perfect.  And she did just that!!! The one bedroom suite is magnificent and so comfortable.  The residence fee that includes dinner light bites and wine, beer and champagne and the wide array of choices for breakfast was wonderful addition to my stay.  Vanessa even had Birthday balloons and desert delivered to my room while I was out.  I will definitely be back to stay at WestHouse Hotel NYC.  Thanks Vanessa!!!

title: Minimoon
text: Wonderful experience. Great location. Rooftop terrace was a nice escape. Staff were wonderful. Christ Ortiz in particular was super friendly, always greeted us with a smile,  and very helpful during our stay!

title: Solo visitor for New York marathon
text: Stayed here as part of the New York marathon in Nov 2022. Nice room, clean and a pretty decent size. No coffee/tea making facilities in the room but there was the ability to make a tea/coffee downstairs in the Terrace (where breakfast is served) all day.  As an international traveller, tea/coffee making facilities in the room are pretty much standard and expected.  Good location, easily walking distance to major attractions like Times Square, theatres, Carnigie Hall, Macy's, Empire State Building and Central Park.  I walked a lot on my own and felt as safe, even at night, as other cities I have visited or lived in around the world.  Hotel has two bins in the hotel room for rubbish and recycling which I liked.  Appreciated the early opening of dining for the breakfast pre-marathon.  Breakfast was sometimes crowded and difficult to find seats if you left it later, but as an early eater, there were no problems.  Food was good, and enough choices for me. Would stay again.

title: Best hotel ever!!!
text: After the fiasco of dealing with the Le Meridien Central Park and 5th Ave, the Westhouse was HEAVEN!! I am a Platinum Elite Lifetime Marriott member but will never use them again if I can help it. They cancelled our reservation 3 weeks before Thanksgiving and lied about honoring our booking price at an alternative hotel. So my friend booked Westhouse! Yay!!

title: Great stay in great location
text: Spent 5 nights here, loved great breakfast and couple evening light fares which were awesome. Located just couple blocks south of Central Park and half block from subway entrance. Room was great, staff really terrific. Wonderful place to stay.

title: Partner
text: There are very few good values in NYC but a stay at The Westhouse will demonstrate that you can experience a pleasant blend of hospitality, good nature, nice environment all for a price that’s affordable- thanks to the entire Westhouse team.

title: Wonderful reception staff.
text: My stay at the WestHouse hotel was great! Your staff was amazing. The women at the reception area, Donna and Pagye were friendly, warm, patient and knowledgeable. The way you are greeted on arrival determines the quality of the rest of your stay. These two women are definitely an asset to the hotel.

title: Annual Family Trip
text: Our family enjoys coming to New York regularly.  Our kids, who are 27, 19, and 14 particularly enjoy coming during Thanksgiving week.  Our favorite hotel is Westhouse.  We have stayed here on multiple occasions, with and without kids. The staff are very friendly and accommodating from check-in to check-out. We love that breakfast(and dinner if you desire)  is provided on site, with a very nice spread that fits anyone’s taste in such a tasteful and comfortable atmosphere.  The hot spiced apple cider in the lobby each day was PERFECT, and we grabbed a cup every time we passed through.  I would highly recommend Westhouse, as it is a terrific property for a great value, but I would also like to keep this little secret to myself!!!

title: First Rate Service & Great Location
text: My wife and I had a fabulous stay at this hotel. The food, cocktails, location, view, and service leave nothing to be desired. Moe and Vanessa welcomed us and made check in a pleasant experience, as they were very attentive. My wife and I would stay here again without hesitation, our room was clean and comfortable.

title: My new go to in NYC
text: This place is incredible! The views, the location, the rooms and the staff were all Top Notch. I think it’s my new favorite hotel! Special shouts to Vanessa, Donna and Hamza who made me feel like a VIP. Great happy hour and breakfast too! I will be back for sure!

title: Amazing
text: What can I say only the West House hotel is amazing. From the minute we walked in the atmosphere in the lobby and  the service was unbelievable. The staff were brilliant so attentive and the food was fabulous. We will definitely be back and will highly recommend. Location was so central.

title: Amazing stay & great location
text: We had a great stay! This was our second time staying- The hotel is clean, welcoming & in a great location. Breakfast was great every day and the happy hour service was amazing! We loved grabbing a drink / food before heading out for the night. Thanks for an awesome stay!!

title: Gem of a hotel in a great location!!
text: A gem in New York City. The location is great - easy to get anywhere. Fun to be near Central Park but so easy to get to Soho, Fifth Avenue, the museums.  The breakfast and afternoon appetizers are scrumptious and varied. It is lovely to have the 23rd floor concierge area available to sit and have some quiet relaxing time.  But the best part of the hotel are the staff.   I travel all over the world and you could not find a nicer, friendlier more helpful staff - every one of them.  The hotel has the amenities of a big hotel with the benefits of the personal attention and quiet of a boutique hotel.  Stay there!!!

title: CHECK YOUR FEES BEFORE YOU BOOK
text:
I just checked out of the hotel and was extremely disappointed to find an extra $99 per person for access to the terrace and gym.  This was not explained when I booked the hotel or when I checked in.  This was on top of the hotel charging $615/night (without taxes). 

In addition, the door to my room did not fully close there was a gap which I mentioned to the front desk because I felt unsafe, but nothing was done to correct the situation.

I am appalled at this experience.

title: Extremely welcoming and friendly staff
text: We were lucky to be able to visit friends staying at this hotel for our last night in the city. Even though we were not technically guests at the hotel, all of the staff were so accommodating and friendly and made us feel at home. In particular the bellman Chris Ortiz went above and beyond with every interaction, he not only helped us get a cheaper fare to the airport, but was so engaging and easy to talk to while we waiting in the lobby for our cab. Chris is the reason why we will be staying at this hotel our next trip to NYC, and we'll look forward to it then!

title: Birthday Stay
text:
Stayed for 4 nights at Westhouse this week. It was my boyfriend's birthday trip, and Vanessa at front desk gave us a wonderful birthday surprise when we returned to our room on that day. It was so kind of Vanessa and Westhouse to arrange for champagne, balloons and desserts for us. 

Armani the manager was super helpful for switching our room to one that was facing the outside, and just in time to celebrate the birthday! I really appreciate the warm hospitality at Westhouse. 

The breakfast and happy hour is a good addition, to grab a quick bite before heading for the day and snacking before dinner. 

The size of the room is standard NY size. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean and bright.

title: Consistently good, great team
text: WestHouse is a very consistent, clean, and perfectly located hotel, esp if you need to be in midtown. Very good people there on staff which frankly makes the place. You’ll hear a few names like Vanessa, Nick at the front desk; Chris and Winston on the door. All care. Well done.

title: Great location/superlative customer service
text: The WestHouse is so conveniently located near Central Park. Rooms and other amenities are very modern and clean. Their competitive edge though is their customer service and friendliness- you feel it as soon as you walk through the door. Well done Vanessa and team

title: Amazing customer service!
text:
Has the most helpful employees. Had a special request and received more than I expected. Bellman and front desk service were impeccable - ask for Vanessa! Manager followed up to confirm everything was in order.
Great location and very clean. Will certainly return

title: Great hotel, great location
text: Beautiful rooms, very comfortable beds.  Great food, happy hour drinks and snacks were awesome.  Fantastic location, close to Central Park, Times Square and Theatres. Very friendly staff - bellman Chris Gritz was super helpful.

title: Voyage du 24 au 31 octobre 2022
text:
Nous avons été très bien accueillis dans cet hôtel par Tarik qui parle très bien français.
La formule petit déjeuner et buffet du soir est très appréciable.
La chambre était spacieuse mais manquait de rangement pour défaire nos 3 valises.
Le personnel a été extrêmement attentionné le jour de l'anniversaire de mon fils, Tarik nous avait livrer ballons, gâteau et champagne.
Merci pour cet agréable séjour
L'hôtel est à 2 pas de central Park et idem de Times Square, très bien situé avec des bouches de métro tout proche. Ligne de métro E direct depuis l'aéroport JFK.

title: Love this place
text:
Fantastic friendly and knowledgable service staff. Great view down 7th Avenue to Times Square from our room.
Rooms well appointed and clean 
Close to everthing
Breakfast and  evening canapes are great

title: Terrible start but pretty good in the end
text:
This was a 5-night stay for my wife's birthday (who had never been to the USA before!)
I'd not been for nearly 30 years...
I had mentioned this on the booking and also emailed them directly a few days before confirming our room and arrival plus mentioning the birthday again and requesting tea making facilities in the room (they had stated in a reply to a previous review that this was on request only). I didn't get a reply.
We arrived late at night and check-in was fine (although no recognition of the birthday), they checked we were aware of the additional $49.99 per person per night residents fee (we were) and took our card details to cover this.
We got up to our room on the 19th floor and immediately realised we had been given the wrong room (this was a Standard King, we had booked a Deluxe King) so I went back down to tell them (and the requested tea making facilities were not there either).  The receptionist at first tried to argue that we had only booked a standard (even when I showed her my confirmation which clearly stated Deluxe!) then she blamed the booking company and said I'd have to call them!  However, when she realised this wasn't going to happen she said she's check with the manager (who was sitting at the desk on the higher level).  She agreed it was wrong but as they were fully booked that night I would have to stay there the night and come and see her again in the morning and she would move our room then.  She also said she would waive our first night’s residence fee.
The following morning she was nowhere to be seen to I explained the situation to the (new) receptionist who told us no rooms were free yet so to pack our bags, leave them in the room and we would be moved on our return from our day out.
When we got back at about 3.30pm I checked with (another new) receptionist who didn't seem to know anything about it but said she's give us a new room anyway - but when we got there it was exactly the same (wrong) room just a floor higher!!  So back down we went to explain that the whole reason for being moved was to get the Deluxe room we had booked (the difference being the Deluxe rooms are slightly bigger and have an outside street-view, not the inner courtyard view of the Standard rooms).  She then changed us again and this time we did actually get the correct Deluxe room (opposite the original one on the 19th floor with a nice view above 55th Street.
While down at reception I had enquired about the whereabouts of our luggage we had left in the old room and she said it would be sent up but nearly an hour later no sign so I called down and was told it will be there soon - it took another half an hour.  Still no tea making facilities of course but by now we were too tired to bother asking for this again!
So after this complete shambles of an arrival there began to be some positives.
The room itself was a decent size, had a very large, comfortable bed, a large TV with many channels, a fridge, two bottles of water, air-con and windows that opened a few inches.  It was also very nice and quiet and there was good WI-FI.
The bathroom only had a shower (no bath) but it was a good, large one and there were decent toiletries and plenty of towels. Both were clean and the room was well serviced every day.
There were no robe or slippers though which really is standard for a hotel claiming to be 5-star (we've stayed at a lot and in comparison this one is really a 4 star).
The residents fee included the WI-WI plus breakfast and the evening "hours of indulgence" with food and drink from 5-8pm.
The breakfast was very good with a decent selection of hot food (omelette or scrambled egg, sausages or bacon and sauteed potatoes), cold meats/cheeses/salmon, fresh fruits, yogurts, rolls, bagels, pastries and muffins plus waffles or pancakes and toast.  There were three types of fruit juice, cereals and a machine that would make tea or various types of coffee (a second machine was unfortunately not working).
The breakfast was served in the 23rd floor terrace which also had a small outside terrace area with nice views.  Although it was often quite busy we always managed to find a table.  Staff were very good with replenishing items and clearing plates away.
The evening offering (served in the same room) was also very good.  There was a "theme" each day (we had Mexican, Oriental, Italian and Mediterranean) and always featured a hot meat dish, a rice/pasta dish, a vegetable dish, salads and smaller appetiser type dishes with the theme.  It was mostly very tasty and was enough to be an actual dinner if you didn't want to go out/eat later.  Water/soft drinks were available in the fridge and there was a selection of white/red wines, prosecco or beer.  Once you'd been asked your choice the brilliant waiters brought it to you and then just came round topping you up which was great!  Some cakes/muffins also appeared later on.
The room was available to guests all day to help themselves to more water, soft drinks, tea or coffee so not having tea facilities in the room wasn't really an issue until later in the evening as they were not available after 8pm as the staff were cleaning up then.
On the last day we checked out and the door staff (all very helpful and friendly the whole stay) quickly asked if they could store our bags until out flight.
We were given the bill and i checked to see if the first nights residence fee had been taken off as promised but it made no sense,  I queried it and was told it had been removed for one of us on all five days instead (which was very good of them but not sure if this was just a miscommunication error!) but the one charge that remained had increased from $49,99 to $59.99 a night!  However, I felt that overall they had been fair even though I did wonder if they just made the numbers up!
So overall a mixed affair.  Terrible start - reception staff were trying their best to be helpful but do need to be better trained to allocate rooms correctly and actually read, take note and respond to customers requests on email.
But the room (when we finally got it) was great, the breakfast and evening food/drink were excellent (and worth the residence fee) and being quiet we slept very well.
Plus the location is also extremely good (15 mins walk to Times Square/10 mins to Central Park, subway entrance right outside the hotel and 2 blocks from subway to JFK airport).
Therefore, we would probably return here if in NY again.

title: Good place to stay
text: Very nice and comfortable and felt safe at all times. Centrally located to the tourist places we wanted to visit. We had an excellent time and transportation was convenient. Will definitely return on our next weekend visit or family gathering

title: Super holidays in NY
text: Great position, near The metro and in the center. Big spaces and very well organised. Hotel well cleaned. Good food for breakfast and apero time. All team is super kind, but Chris Ortiz did a great job at the entrance of the hotel for our luggages. Super service ! Funny and professional :)

title: Fantastic hospitality
text:
Everything was great. Fantastic beds and nice breakfast. 

Want to make an special review for all employees, wicha have been very kind with us. However I want to come forward to the bellman Chris Ortiz. Thanks for your hospitality and respect.

title: Short Trip 4 Th NY
text:
Top gelegen. Sehr freundliches Personal. Inkl gutes Frühstück. Kann ich wärmstens Empfehlen. Suite mit schlafsofa für 3 Personen Optimal. 
………………………………………………………………..was für ein Mist mit den 200 Zeichen, mache jetzt teotzdem Fertig für den netten Bellman

title: A lovely trip
text:
Our vacation was a great time made all the better by our stay at the Westhouse. The staff was the best feature as every member was so generous and helpful. Despite our check-in having some issues due to an issue from Priceline, we were treated very well by the front desk clerk and even offered a discount (the problem wasn’t even from their end). 
 
Those first few minutes exemplified the consistent kindness of their entire staff even to the last minute as the bellman, Chris Ortiz helped us with our luggage for our ride to the airport. I would highly recommend the Westhouse for its location, pricing, amenities, etc., but the comfort and treatment by their staff made me feel at home.

title: New York at its best‼️
text:
The staff is immensely amazing ‼️ Vanessa and Pagye made our stay magical.
They went over and beyond, especially as we were celebrating our birthdays. 
Serendipity ‼️
The food is superb. We were exactly in the heart of Manhattan and within distance to all the prime attractions. 
A must for a wonderful New York experience.

title: Comfortable Stay
text:
I recently stayed at the WestHouse for a quick business trip. The staff were incredibly friendly and went above and beyond to assist with some needed essentials and to help with early check in. The room was clean and well appointed, and the central location was convenient. The hotel also offers free dinner and breakfast on the terrace, which is a nice addition to the package. 

Guests should be aware that there is no room service available at this location. Because I was there on business, I was not able to take advantage of the dinner provided due to late meetings. Since there was no room service or a tea / coffee maker in the room, I had to figure out other arrangements for refreshments after my long day (which was fine). 

Overall, it was a great stay.

title: Westhouse Hotel
text: My stay at the Westhouse was very nice. The rooms are small, but that's expected in the city. The bed was so comfortable it was hard to get up in the morning! The staff were friendly, from check in to housekeeping. The daily breakfast is decent, what you would expect and the evening cocktail time was wonderful. The food served could easily be a full dinner and it was tasty. All of this is on the 23rd floor with a small outdoor terrace (as well as a full indoor space) that offers a great view. The staff were quick to clean things up and keep the food replenished. You can't beat the location. It is within easy walking distance of Broadway, Times Square, 5th Ave, Central Park, Rockefeller Center, the subway, and so much more -- there'e a Starbucks just steps away as well. The downsides -- other than breakfast and cocktail hour there is no food or drink to be found on the premises, none. There are stores nearby to pick up snacks, but it would be nice to have another option. Also, the $49.99 daily fee is a bit steep and adds up quickly, so take that into account when booking. My room had no view (other hotel rooms) which didn't bother me, but my friend's room had a great view. The bellhops can help you get a cab or order you a car for your departure. I would definitely stay here again.

title: THE SMALL THINGS DO MATTER
text: I have been coming to NY to celebrate my birthday for several years.  I have stayed at different locations but this was my most memorable stay.  After a long flight and jetlag I was greeted by Miss Alisha which gave me such a warm welcome.  This was my first time staying here and I was not familiar with the operation of the elevator, and she took her time to actually walk over there and showed me how to use the key to access my floor.  I am an elder and most people don't have much patience with me because I am not tech savvy.  She was very patient and even went up and beyond by taking me up to my floor.  Every time we crossed paths during my stay she always acknowledge me by name and asked if I needed anything.  To many this might seem simple but to me it meant the world. Thank you young lady for being so king and welcoming. I will be staying here again in the future.

title: A sanctuary in Midtown
text: The WestHouse reminds me of a very nice European hotel.  Very clean, staff is helpful.  Room is spacious for a Manhattan hotel.  Biggest pluses:  the windows actually open a few inches to let in air and the food and drinks provided in the Terrace (as a part of your stay) are a nice treat.  We would definitely stay here again when in NYC.

title: Westhouse Hotel
text: Close to everything in Manhattan. We walked to the theater district,  Central Park, and shopping. Our room was excellent and While we did have a drink at the bar we never got to the free food provided. The outside terrace was great for a glass of wine and going over our day before dinner and night life.

title: My experience
text: The West House hotel is an amazing environment to stay at, very relaxing due to the view ( we were on the 22nd floor) and it is very spacious, in case you decide to bring some friends or family with you. Employees were very respectful and greet you with such enthusiasm, Loved it.

title: Amazing
text:
This hotel is one of the best hotel I have ever been to so clean and smell good. the staff are amazing and respectful
I will definitely be back again with few friends soon thank you so much 

Makassiank

title: LOVEEEEE THIS HOTELL !!!
text: I am very taken with this hotel! I'd suggest this location to anyone who is traveling or even simply looking to unwind because of the hospitality and how spotless it was. This is the location to be !!

title: Highly recommend!
text: First of all, the customer service at this hotel was A+. There were changes that happened last minute on our part and they accommodated us without hesitation. The suite we stayed in was sparkling clean and spacious with amazing views of the city. Location was also perfect and the interior decor was entirely beautiful. Will definitely be back with my girls again!

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: I have been to many other 5 stars hotel but the staff here were amazing! I came with my parents and I booked a room for two instead of 3, they were so concern about me not enjoying my stay so they upgraded my room into a two queen beds :) I really appreciate their help. When I came in for breakfast and happy hours at the Evening Terrace, all of the staff there were super polite and nice. Foods were amazing! Great location, really close to the subway. Comfy bed and amazing views! Definitely recommend. Also, thanks to Vanessa and Jesey for assisting me with the room! I am coming back for sure!

title: Great location and staff but that's about it
text: If you're going to New York to see Times Square or see broadway shows, then you really can't beat the location of this hotel.  The desk and lobby staff are amazing.  That said, the room itself left a lot to be desired for a 'five star' hotel.  The door lock was not functioning correctly when I arrived to the room-- security/maintenance did help but ultimately did not 'fix' it, only helped me figure out how to get it to lock for the duration of my stay.  The shower did not drain correctly which left me standing in a puddle of water by the end of my shower.  The blinds had a sticker and a dead mosquito squished onto it and the mirrors were dirty/fingerprinted when I arrived.  All things considered, these are all pretty small things that didn't leave me feeling unsafe/unclean within the room-- the bed and sheets were clean and the free water bottles in the room were nice to have.  If you want something walkable to broadway shows this place is great, just don't expect true 'five star' amenities.

title: Amazing time in NY
text:
A NY Weekend getaway :

We booked the Westhouse hotel for the weekend  to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel was beyond our expectations. Vanessa at front desk went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. Jesey  was very informative about the places we could visit after the concert . The food and drinks were amazing. The staff at the Terrace  were very attentive . Terrace has great views . We have decided that from now on we will stay at Westhouse every time we visit NY 😊

Praveena & Delmar

title: Sad birthday visit
text:
I just checked into the Westhouse for a few days solo to celebrate a milestone birthday. It's my first visit to the Westhouse and I've stayed at many other properties in both Manhattan and Brooklyn. I thought this place would be something special for something special. I have to say that it hasn't gotten off to a great start. Despite mentioning the special occasion in an email confirmation to the hotel manager, there was literally no mention at check in, no note or anything in my room, etc. Absolutely nada. I've felt more appreciated and welcomed at much less "high end" properties. 
I really was hoping this plsce could become my home away from.home as i regularly come to NYC every few months. I guess the jury is still out but not the warm fuzzies.

title: Outstanding
text: 4 Nights, W-Su, couple in king room. This was our first trip to NYC, and this hotel blew us away. The staff here made all the difference - I expected gruff and grumpy, but EVERYONE on this staff was super welcoming and friendly, even the housekeeping staff. The doormen/bellmen were superstars and very helpful with everything (shout out to Jason). Many reviewers have griped about the "resident fee," but we thought it was well worth it for what they provided. We had breakfast and a great dinner every day at "The Terrace," including wine. If we are out for all of those meals, it would have been 2x what they charged, but the convenience of the whole thing would have been worth it even if the price was the same.

title: Perfect!!!!
text:
This hotel was excellent... stayed in many big, famous hotels in the past and received such an impersonal experience for more money. This hotel is right on 8th ave real close to Central Park, Broadway and time square. It is perfect... the rooms are lovely new york style decor and comfy beds. You get lovely daily maid service and breakfast/evening nibbles are just ideal if you don't want to eat out. The staff are brilliant... very warm, welcoming and can't do enough for you. As you check in Vanessa was very professional and lovely and our favourite doormen Hamzah & Jesey who will make sure you are okay and look after you in whatever way they can.

A hotel that knows what it's doing in new york... Will most definitely be back!!!!!

title: "Incredible Hotel in NYC "
text: Once you stay here once, you'll feel like you found home. From the moment you arrive the staff are so warm, welcoming and helpful greeting each guest with a big smile. The rooms have great decor, spotless with space to move around. The breakfast is so delicious and indulgence hour knocks it out of the park. It is truly a wonderful way to kick start a night out. The location is perfect and central to everything  including getting in and out of NYC. We have been enjoying this hotel so much this summer and can't wait for our next visit. A big thank you to Paige for making it so special. Linda D.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: I can't recommend this Hotel more highly, the staff are so friendly and helpful nothing was to much trouble, spotlessly clean & very comfortable.  Positioned perfectly for all places to walk to.  Wonderful memories of a fantastic holiday

title: Fabulous hotel in midtown, NYC
text: My wife and I have stayed in many top hotel in NY but Westhouse tops them all. The location is pretty much perfect and walking distance to all the key venues. Our one bed suite was very spacious and well appointed and the staff from the doormen to the receptionists to the staff at the Terrace and the maids were excellent. Special mentions to Tariq , Angela (maid) and the guys serving at the Terrace. The inclusion of a a very generous breakfast and dinner/drinks in the room rate was super value for money. We will be back!

title: A jewel in the New York Crown
text: I spent 3 wonderful nights with my wife and 2 daughters in the WestHouse Hotel. I can't compliment the staff and facilities enough. They were so courteous and helpful whenever we had a query. The buffet breakfast and dinner were top drawer every night. The location to Central Park and Time Square is perfect. Thank you all and keep up the good work! Colin and Family

title: Holly days
text: Gostei bastante do hotel, bem localizado, staff gentil e prestativo, bom pequeno almoço, toalhas sempre mudadas. O único senão, durante a limpeza da suite terem levado o robe pessoal da minha filha, o que foi reportado de imediato à recepção e à própria equipa de limpeza. Decorridos que foram três dias desde a comunicação, o robe não apareceu. Foi feito o reporte por escrito no dia do check out. Aguardarmos resolução da questão.

title: Long-weekend NY
text: Great location if you would like to visit tourist spots in Midtown Manhattan / Central Park (for example MoMa, MET, Broadway, etc.). Very friendly staff. Great breakfast and evening drinks/snacks included in the resident fee. Rooms are clean and have all amenities one would expect. We would recommend the hotel to everyone to NY especially “first timers” who would like to see the highlights.

title: Very nice
text: Very nice hotel with great furnishings, comfy beds, well appointed rooms and friendly and knowledgeable professional  staff. Breakfast was high quality and everything was spotless. Location was also top notch. Only minus was lack of storage in bathroom and no where to even put a cosmetic bag.

title: Boutique hotel, centrally located
text: This hotel surpassed our expectations. It's in a superb location right by central park and in a good safe neighbourhood which is actually surprisingly quiet considering it’s so central. The biggest plus point of this hotel is the 5-8 pm happy hour which essentially includes a great selection of food and alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages which is all included in the resort fee you pay on check-in. Breakfast is also included and this is a really nice spread. So essentially you get half board at a five star hotel for really awesome price which is a massive bonus. It's a small boutique hotel and I would highly recommend it. The beds are super comfortable and the rooms are clean and modern apartment style living. It’s good value for money.

title: Great service
text: Tareek checked me in at the front desk and he was just wonderful. I was a bit worried seeing how I never stayed at this hotel before but I was happily surprised with the service and the room I had at this hotel.

title: Terrible experience
text: Roaches, terrible maintenance, staff was rude. And promises made that were never completed. I spoke to people on the phone and in person but nothing was done and my concerns fell on deaf ears. I would not recommend this place at all.

title: Absolutely awful
text: Currently staying in This hotel and I have no idea how anyone can give it a good review. It is at best 3.5 stars. Long wait to register, no one brought our luggage (we went back and got it ourselves), breakfast is a very small selection and they have nothing if you arrive after later than at the beginning. Rooms are small with broken furniture. Cleaning services are very very noisy banging doors, shouting in the corridor non stop. No one picks up when you call reception. The only positives are location and a nice gym.

title: Wonderful Night in the City!
text: I couldn't have asked for a better hotel while I stayed in Manhattan. It was a little tricky to find, but upon entering, I was greeted with professional and friendly staff. Sokha answered all of my questions and went above and beyond when I needed assistance. Throughout the lobby and hallway was a pleasant scent that I can't identify. My room was very clean and modern. I had a view from my bedroom of Times Square! I was able to walk to Times Square from the hotel and explore. They have a bar that serves food and drinks in the evening, but I wasn't able to go. It also has a gym. The only thing missing is an indoor swimming pool, but that's ok. Each morning the hotel offers complimentary breakfast. Visitors can also sit and eat on the terrace if it isn't too crowded. They offered a variety of choices for breakfast and it was very perfect way to end my stay before check- out. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. I will definitely be returning to the West House hotel in the future.

title: Trying Too Hard
text:
The room was clean and spacious (deluxe king room), so that was a plus.  That being said, they brand themselves as luxury, and the hotel as a whole failed to live up to that.  The check-in area is quite small and was cramped with two families of four along with my wife and I.  The lobby area is called “the den,” but it is a waste of space that could have been used better and more efficiently.

When we checked in, only one person was working the desk (approx 4pm) which caused the uncomfortable jam in that area.  With 10 people and luggage, it was difficult to even move.  Another person finally showed up, but by then the area had cleared. 

Another layout oddity are the elevators.  With 25 floors, there are only 2 working elevators (even though other floors have 4 elevator bays).  It took over 5 minutes for an elevator to arrive at our floor.  What happened to the other 2 elevators bays in the lobby?  Are they unused behind a wall?  Very inefficient.

The hotel offers a happy hour type event in their terrace area.  Overall it was fine, but when more than 10-15 guests are in the small space, their happy hour is not worth the drinks and average food.  Yes, it is something the hotel offers, but if it wants to be a destination hotel, it needs to refine this.  We’ve been to many Marriott lounges that offer the same type of event, and it is much better.  The same can be said of the breakfast experience.  The staff in “the terrace” was attentive and friendly - another plus.

The most disappointing part of our stay was when we returned to the hotel at around 10:30 on Friday evening.  Not wanting a loud atmosphere, we decided to sit at the hotel bar and have a drink.  When we entered the hotel and walked toward the bar, a staff member physically moved in front of me to ask where we were going.  When we told her, she and a co-worker behind the check-in desk told us it was closed.  There was no signage or any other way for us to know, and the way in which they spoke and acted was very unprofessional.  If you have a hotel bar and it’s not open on a Friday night, it speaks to the poor layout and planning.  (Yes, we did ask the next morning if the bar is ever open, and the front desk worker replied “usually not.”).  

If the WestHouse wants to put itself in the luxury category, it needs to reevaluate how it gets there and if it is truly attainable.  Until that time, you are better off staying at the Sheraton down the street.  Because 2.5 wasn’t an option, we rated the WestHouse a 3 due to the high quality job the housekeeping and food service staff did during our stay.  If only the other employees lived up to that standard.

title: Hidden gem in NY
text:
Best hotel I’ve ever been in NY. The staff is very gentil, always helpful.
The resort fee is high but when you find all the benefits it has, you gladly pay for it. 
Great breakfast. Complimentary bottles of water every day not only in the room, but also at The Terrace, where you can go all day long to get a tea or a coffee or just relax watching a great view of Manhattan. From 5 to 7 pm happy hour is really happy! Great wines and great food, accompanied by a warm staff.
If I have to complain about something, it will be the towels. Small. Time to change them and buy towels according to the fantastic hotel!

title: A pleasure to stay at the WestHouse
text:
I stayed at the WestHouse twice in mid-July. The location is excellent and a great value.
It was my first time in New York since the start of the pandemic. It was a pleasure to see most of the same staff that was there on many earlier visits. 
The WestHouse has continued to maintain their excellent service and attention to detail in taking care of their guests. The friendliness of the entire staff is a joy. I always feel special. The breakfasts on the Terrace is excellent with a wide variety of items and a coffee machine that can be accessed all day. Their rooms are spacious and clean.
I look forward to returning to the WestHouse on my next stay in New York.

title: Home away from home
text:
I stayed 15 days at the hotel and everyone made me feel at home.
Since I arrived, they gave me a better room than I booked only to make me feel more comfortable.
Breakfast is fantastic and having the wine and snack 5 to 7 was something unexpected and gratifying.
Finding The Westhouse Hotel was as finding a gem in the middle of New York

title: Good hotel, excellent location
text: A very nice hotel, clean and relatively spacious rooms. It has a very nice roof terrace, albeit a small one, and a happy hour for three hours every day. Location is excellent for shows, restaurants, Central Park and easy distance to downtown by citybike or even walking. A very good experience.

title: Excellent hotel for business travellers
text: Nice hotel well located close to Central Park and a subway station to Soho (two of my preferred places). Service was excellent + they have a lounge that offers food/snacks and drinks throughout the day. If you chose a King Superior room you'll get a nice area to work (practically a small office). Would be good if they upgrade the wifi speed.

title: Great hotel
text: Great location and friendly helpful staff. Breakfast and happy hour with lots of food. Subway stop very close to the hotel. Good restaurant across the street. Easy walk to Times Square, Broadway, and Central Park

title: FUJAM DESTE HOTEL
text:
We stayed at the westhouse hotel from the 17th of July until the 22nd of July. A credit card was blocked at check in. 
We paid on the day of check out in dollars (CASH) for the 2 rooms, 100% of the bill. The front desk said That the reverseal of the pre-autorization maid in july 17th was AUTOMATIC. 

Today, 6 days later after the check-out and more Then  10 days after the CHECKIN a charge of EXTRA 1900 dollars from the westhouse is appearing on my credit card bill. WITHOUT ANY EXPLANATION. 

It is very dificult to acess Booking.com or the manager in order to receive cashback. 
I’m feeling deceived, stolen. 
DO NOT TRUST this hotel!!! You can see other customers complaining the SAME problem!
Now what?
WHO GONA PAY FOR THAT ????

title: Vacation
text: Hotel is very good. Staff is very friendly and well managed. View of the hotel is very amazing, Only five minutes away from central park by walking. Room are very cleaned. Bed and pillows are very soft and comfortable.I would love to sleep again on this this lovely soft bed.I believe i will be back.

title: BEST HOTEL TO STAY! WestHouse Hotel New York
text: It was one of the best experiences of my life in WestHouse Hotel NY. My family is very happy having stayed here. The environment of this hotel is neat and tidy. The staff of this hotel was very polite and respectable. If you want luxury and comfort in your visit then this hotel is for you, with reasonable price. I highly recommend this hotel

title: Good hotel for business travelers
text: Good comfortable hotel with complimentary wifi access which to me is lifeline while on travel. Comfortable accommodation, working desk in the room. I really appreciate  staff who were very helpful and considerate. Enjoyed the breakfast as well.

title: Not a 5 star hotel by any definition
text: Not a 5 star hotel. Rude at check-in. No minibar. No room service. Covid is not an excuse for poor services anymore. Lift your game. The rooms are clean and well appointed. Nice bathroom. But when you claim to be a 5 star hotel then be a 5 star hotel.

title: OUTSTANDING!!!
text: I want to THANK YOU for an outstanding stay at Westhouse.  Everyone at the hotel truly make it feel like home!  From the moment you go through the doors, each person greets you with genuine kindness.  The front desk team is amazing and expeditious.  The rooms are so clean and the housekeeping team are attentive and very accessible.  The breakfast is plentiful and the space is well maintained.  And Kizzie and Pagye are both wonderful leaders!  I look forward to future visits soon!!!  Thank you for an impeccable visit!!!

title: A fabulous stay !
text:
Thank you to everyone at The Westhouse. We had an enjoyable stay. The breakfast was delicious, the staff so friendly and the location was perfect! I have a lot of dietary restrictions, but there was always something for me (I lived on the bagels and lox). 

We felt VERY safe in the area. It was so easy to get to the subway- which was a bonus. 

We will forever stay here!

title: Enjoyed My Stay
text: I really enjoyed my stay at WestHouse. The staff was friendly, the rooms and hotel were clean, and it was easy to book my stay with the hotel online. 10/10 recommended stay during your time in New York!

title: Cozy hotel in bustling midtown
text: We stayed here for two nights while celebrating a friend's birthday, and all thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The lobby is gorgeous and very clean (which I state as particularly important during COVID), the rooms are comfortable and pretty, and the staff are very accommodating.  The rooms in particular are surprisingly large, considering that it's in midtown (most hotel rooms in NYC are pretty small).  We didn't sacrifice quality for a convenient location.  The hotel is centrally located near many popular NYC activities, so it's an easy walk from here to Times Square, Carnegie Hall, and subway lines.

title: Wonderful Place To Stay!!  Great Location!! Wonderful Breakfast!  Close to Starbucks!
text: Fast Check in!  Thank you to Nick and Moe who were both very help.  I believe Moe checked us in. Moe checked us in really quickly and asked if we need help with our luggage.  We were really close to the subway.  Close to Broadway and Times Square.  The staff were really great.  They always asked if we need any assistance.  I love that they have an espresso machine and tea available through out the day and evening for free. The room was nice and spacious.  There was even a safe in our room to store valuables.  The bathroom is really nice as well. The next time we visit NYC we will definitely stay at the Westhouse Hotel again. What I really love about the hotel was the security.  In order for the elevator to go to your desired floor.. You have to tap your keycard onto a scanner near the elevator buttons to allow the elevator door to close and take you to your desired floor.  I can not say anything negative about the hotel.  The hotel is definitely worth every penny we spent!  Housekeeping cleaned our room everyday!  What a plus!

title: Basics not provided
text:
Nice hotel and decent room sizes. No tea or coffee in the room! I’ve never experienced this before. 
I forgot a bag of purchases behind, but when I asked the hotel if it had been retained for me the answer was no.

title: Location Location
text: Hotel in an Excellent location.  Staff  was very accommodating and responsive to request. rooms and Hotel facilities were very clean .  Breakfast was very good and convenient.  Could not have asked for a better stay.   I will definitely stay here again.

title: Vacation
text: I first stayed at the Park Central in 2005. It was very good then,  but now it's so much better. They have exceeded my expectations. The entire staff was most accommodating. Vito at the front desk was the most helpful. As if that weren't enough,  the room was actually reasonably priced....as far as NYC hotels go anyway.

title: Excellent hotel - very friendly staff, particularly Jesey!
text: I visited NYC with my partner for our engagement and the Westhouse hotel was a perfect place to stay! Lovely hotel, very clean and very friendly staff. Jesey in particular went above and beyond to make our stay perfect.

title: Great stay!
text: Excellent service! Ana is the perfect host, very polite and made us feel like home. Many thanks to all the staff for their wonderful attitude. We stayed for 5 nights, the room was very confortable and clean.

title: Ottimo Hotel vicino a Central Park
text:
Hotel molto elegante e pulito vicino a Central Park. Servizio impeccabile.
Personale molto disponibile, in particolare Vito ed Elsa che sono stati molto gentili aiutandoci in un momento di difficoltà.
Lo consiglio vivamente per chi fosse interessato a visitare la grande mela partendo da una zona strategica.

title: Great place to stay
text: Rooms were comfortable and clean.  Every staff member was friendly and professional.  The hotel is in a great location with easy access to Central Park, Columbus Circle, Times Square and there are several restaurants, bars, and shopping within a short walking distance.  Overall, we all enjoyed the stay very much.

title: Great choice! Enjoyed our stay.
text: Initially, I was thinking of docking some stars because Westhouse charges a "Guest Fee," which is a hidden fee, which makes it more difficult to comparison shop hotels. However, many nice hotels in NY do this, and I can see how that makes it difficult NOT to do it. Anyway, I had a bad taste in my mouth, but this still looked like a good option for us, and I must say the hotel really won us over. The room was just big enough for our group of 3. I think rooms can tend to be very small in NY. The staff was super-friendly and helpful and the rooms were nice and very clean. The breakfast was good, though it did get kind of repetitive after a while (we stayed a week). I made much use of the cappuccino machine. The location was excellent. Everyone was very satisfied.

title: Wonderful family feel hotel
text: Fantastic stay, nothing was too much trouble the staff were all so friendly and we were made to feel part of a family. Nancy, who worked in the sister Park Central Hotel, was wonderful, she takes you to her heart and was so friendly and helpful with all our questions of NYC. The breakfast was delicious each day, the location was perfect, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Not a 5 stars hotel. Poor service. Room Oldish.
text:
Hotel's location is great. Breakfast is simply disgusting. Save money and go in front of the hotel at the dinner.  If you are OK with a 3 stars hote, WestHouse is good. If you expect more, just don't go. 
They should invest money in rooms & quality of services.

title: Conditioner in shampoo bottle
text: We stayed for one night while celebrating a birthday weekend for my daughter. I went to take a shower on the morning of our checkout day and put what I thought was shampoo (from a large bottle labeled “shampoo”) on my head and spread it all around. It felt greasy and didn’t lather. I then examined the bottle labeled “conditioner” and found that it contained the exact same substance as the bottle labeled “shampoo” — both a thick, white, creamy substance that clearly was conditioner. I asked my daughter to call down to the front desk and ask them to rush up a bottle of shampoo. They told us it would be 5-10 minutes. I stood in the shower while the water became cold and asked my daughter to go out in the hallway and see if she could flag down someone from housekeeping. She did, and she came back with a bottle of shampoo (this time containing actual shampoo). The remainder of my shower was completely cold. Not at all what I expect from a hotel that charged $500 a night. When I spoke to the front desk (and showed him the “shampoo” bottle that contained conditioner), the man apologized, took the $29 fee off the bill, and said that a manager would contact me. No one from the hotel has contacted me since we checked out. HUGE disappointment. I will not be recommending this hotel to anyone.

title: Home away from home
text:
What incredible hospitality! I stayed at the Westhouse for over 3 weeks, and this felt like my home away from home. I've stayed at several hotels in New York, and none compares to the warmth, professionalism, dedication provided by the staff - especially

Dana 
Tarik 
Vanessa 
Armani 

who went on of their way to make my stay special. The rooms are both spacious and clean, the breakfast a plentiful spread, and the overall hotel is maintained with attentiveness. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a beautiful hotel that wants to enjoy New York without any fuss or care - because the westhouse staff will look after you.

title: Okay stay but will not return
text:
Wanted to love this boutique hotel but just too many little things about the hotel that drag it down. First off service is friendly and no issues with the staff on site. 

1. Rooms are very small. Booked a Lux King and was still tiny, can’t imagine the size of a king room

2. Rooms showing wear on lamps, blinds and other areas like a three star hotel

3. Terrace area at breakfast is awesome as is the food. But outdoor seating is that nice wicker that should have thick cushions but they were never put out for the four days I was there. So you are sitting so low and it’s very uncomfortable. 

4.  Had booked 8 nights as family was going to join halfway through. So I called a week in advance and asked if I should upgrade to a suite. Was told no need as we will press sign you a lux king with a pull out couch. I offered to pay more and they said no need. Arrived and told that was not the case and not available. So left early and went to the newly renovated Westin Grand Central which is amazing and over $300 less per night with free breakfast as well. 

Bonus is I wasn’t charged the resort fee when checking out, thinking it’s because of the issues. 

Note: even if it doesn’t have a bar and restaurant. This property is connected to its sister property the Park Central with a door next to the elevators and its bar is excellent.

title: Terrible service
Excellent hotel !
text: This is one of the best hotel in town with excellent rates! I Absolutely love this hotel and have stayed a few times. What a Great location, with very clean rooms and friendly staff. No complaints here and highly recommend.

title: Great attention and service
text:
Great location and service 
Love the attention especially from Elizabeth and Vito. Would recommend to everyone
Bog rooms and bathroom
Amazing staff and lo bh
Starbucks around the corner 
Valet service 
Great and soacious rooom

title: Our second wonderful stay
text: We’ve stayed in several hotels in NYC over the years. For us this is the best. The central location close to Central Park, quiet rooms, unfailingly helpful and polite personnel and more combine to give an agreeable atmosphere. The breakfast buffet is excellent, with a wide selection. Spacious rooms and comfortable beds, desk in room.  Highly recommend.

title: Birthday trip
text:
we had a really nice time here, special thanks to Vanessa for the great organization of the cake. Thank you again for the upgrade to a very nice room.
The hotel is very centrally located and the subway is right in front of the door. The equipment has been chosen with a lot of love. The breakfast room with terrace on the 23rd floor is incredible.

title: Girls weekend
text: I loved this new boutique hotel. It was a nice walk to Central Park in a nice neighborhood. We went for a girls weekend and the decor was clean and crisp. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for anyone looking to be close to Times Square and the theatre site it but far enough away to have a feel of a cute neighborhood.  We can’t wait to go back!!

title: Love Westhouse Hotel
text: I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff and amenities are top notch!  I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a night out in the city.  The hotel exceeded my expectations and will definitely be staying there again. Excellent experience!

title: Great Location - Great Hotel
text: Located a block off Broadway and 2 blocks from Central Park, this was a great spot to base a week of shows, dining and shopping in NYC.  Our room was enormous, by NYC standards, with a balcony and a view.  The breakfast is good but it can be crowded at peak times but their staff are excellent at clearing tables and restocking the buffet.  Nice place to drop by during the day for a coffee or snack.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: My favorite place to stay anytime I am in NYC. One of the best hotels to stay at in the city and the bar is very swanky! Another great perk is that AAA members receive a discount when booking WestHouse Hotel New York.

title: Last minute NYC Trip
text: What an amazing boutique hotel located in a killer part of Manhattan. As someone who formerly lived in NYC, it's tough for me to find a hotel that can meet my high expectations for location, killer service, comfort, and modern design. The WestHouse achieves all of the above, and then some. I typically stay in hotels that are preferred by my company, however will definitely be looking to stay here the next time I'm in town. I am not easily impressed, and can say that they WestHouse achieved impressing me quite tremendously.

title: One of the absolute best hotels in NYC!
text: I highly recommend staying at the West House! The location is perfect, smack dab in the heart of midtown with some of NYC’s most sought after bars, theatre, restaurants and more just steps away! Not to mention being a hop skip and a jump from the subway. The lounge, bars, restaurants, and food are truly the peak of luxury and the rooms are comfortable and cozy. Combined a friendly, welcoming staff the West House is truly one of the best places to stay in all of NYC!

title: I LOVE THIS HOTEL
text: I haven't been back to the WestHouse for a minute, due to the crazy travel restrictions...  But, the stay was amazing again.  Once again, they have an incredibly talented staff.  They really take their time with each guest.  I love the amenities of the hotel as well.  I have stayed at many Marriott's, but Hi-Gate has really become an amazing competitor for the Marriott chain.  These NYC properties are AMAZING.  A subway steps away and it's located in my favorite part of Manhattan.  Friars Club and Carnegie Hall SO CLOSE!

title: WESTHOUSE IS THE BEST HOUSE!!!
text: I love this boutique hotel located on 55th St in the heart of Mid-Town.  What a great bang for the buck.  The hotel is amazing and so is the service.  The rooms are clean, and they offer a free breakfast on the 23rd or 24th floor.  I can't remember which floor because I'm getting old.  LOL.  But,

title: Home away from home
text: Westhouse is still my favorite place to stay in NYC--so convenient to everything--Times Sq., Central Park, Broadway, Lincoln Center, and directly across from Carnegie Hall.  This time I had a view of Times Sq. from my room!  So close, yet still far enough from the crowds. It's so easy to get anywhere in NYC from here.  And it's the little things....I forgot toothpaste of all things, but Westhouse has thought of everything and had a dental kit in the room!  I didn't even have to go downstairs.  The breakfast is delicious and they change it up just enough to have everything I need but still be a little different each time.  I love the lounge where I can get water or coffee whenever I need it. Most importantly, the room is well appointed and the beds and pillows are so comfortable.  So grateful for this gem of a hotel!

title: Serviço espetacular
text: A funcionária Kizzy, Deu-nos upgrade de quartos e atendeu prontamente todas nossas solicitações!! Melhor funcionária do hotel!!! certamente na volta a Nova York, nos hospedaremos aqui. Reitero que o café da manhã e delicioso e os quartos são amplos e reformados!!

title: Fantastic location, staff was really nice, the beds are fantastic!
text:
Went to see Broadway shows and this is where my friend from PA has stayed for ages, I stayed at the Westhouse once pre pandemic as well. 
I have to say, it was really nice to be back.  Small, boutique, easily accessible, friendly staff. Really great breakfast, very nice gym and workout area on the third floor. Cannot wait to come back in a 2023.

title: Not a 5 star hotel
text:
Our welcome by Vanessa was great.
Breakfasts despite previous reviews were lovely - service staff were attentive but their manner was abrupt sometimes. 
Our room was very spacious however the blinds were tatty on the edges, there were stains in the carpet and given it's advertised as 5 star, very few toiletries in the bathroom - bar of soap, shower gel, shampoo & conditioner only. 
We emailed the hotel 3 times and mentioned we were staying for my birthday but not once did we get a reply. 
I asked to borrow the hair straighteners (as advertised on their website) but they never arrived.
On one occasion we didn't get water in our room, instead found a packet in the hallway and helped ourselves. 
We used the terrace room one afternoon and found it in an unclean state. The coffee machine had been emptied and the grounds left in a pile on the side. There were used coffee cups left everywhere. 
All in all, if you accept that you're paying for the location and not much else, it's a great hotel. I think it's showing the signs of the pandemic and needs some investment and I wouldn't classify it as 5 star.

title: West House Hotel New York Review
text:
Second time staying at West House Hotel. Vanessa welcomed me upon arrival and checked me out. Sharing the same elevator as Parc Central, across the street from DREAM, Manhattan Club and Broadway around the corner, VIP lounge terrace perfect on a sunny day. It rained most of the weekend, I was pleased to find heaters warming me upon immediate entry to the lobby, private wnough for intimate seating yet an open layout should one choose to engage a neighbor by the bar, sophisticated yet modern mood. Scrambling for an impromptu Mother’s Day dinner reservation two hours prior, the concierge confirmed in 10 minutes an extraordinary place in our preferred cuisine choice walking distance. 

Initially booked two nights and received three rewards including a $15 Sephora gift card, two free wine bottles... I decided to extend one more night, the attentive staff took care of the spontaneous booking with ease and grace, so worth it. I only have eyes for West House Hotel New York! See you all soon :)

title: Great But Showing Its Age
text: Wonderful boutique hotel...great location...attentive staff...fabulous bed and shower. Our suite was large and very clean. However, the furniture is really showing its age. Same for the Terrace Breakfast room on 23rd floor. Carpet up there is pretty disgusting. They really should not have carpet where there's so much food. Breakfast is very European and constantly refreshed. Will definitely stay again.

title: Fantastico
text: Albergo ristrutturato da poco molto pulito con abbondante colazione mattutina. Servizio snack bar durante il giorno, non eccessivo ma comunque c’è. Personale giovane e cordiale. Disponibili alle richieste che abbiamo fatto e molto gentili. Grazie per averci ospitato avete reso nostra a casa fantastica.

title: Brilliant Customer Service
text: the front desk staff at the Westhouse in New York are amazing.  Fabulous customer service.  The team in their breakfast room are also incredible.  All are so friendly and accommodating and eager to help.  Rooms are fabulous - especially the rooms that look down toward Times Square.

title: Great service
text: Westhouse is convenient to my office in NYC and I enjoy staying there. It's in a great midtown location, clean and spacious. I especially appreciated the care and special treatment by Ruben and Vanessa and look forward to my next visit.

title: Excellent Service
text:
I just returned from a business trip to NY and had the opportunity to experienced the excellent service of the team at the Westhouse.
The hotel's location is excellent and the rooms are clean and spacious. Enjoyed breakfast at the Terrace every morning and staff there was nice and accommodating. 

I must say Kurdos to Alicia Nunez from the sales team for going above and beyond to provide first class service. 

Hope to come back soon.

title: Great Family Stay
text: We stayed with two daughters, 6 and 4 for three nights in April. The breakfast was great, and eating out on the Terrance was wonderful. We weren't charged the daily fees for my children which I was pleasantly surprised about. Staff were very friendly and you can't beat the location. Our view was disappointing but we got a good deal on the room. Overall would highly recommend based on the quality for the price!

title: New York New York
text: Great location, however cleaning staff and breakfast staff a disappointment, got a free upgrade as it was our honeymoon however windows dirty and room not very clean. Bed was very comfortable.  At Christ day cleaner was sitting on her phone on the floor int he hallway waiting for people to checkout constantly asking what time we will checkout. Hotel is on a 2 pipe system and extremely warm.

title: Convenient location
text: Had a nice 3 night stay at this hotel. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The location was conveniently located within walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. The one time we needed a cab, the staff was quick to service our needs. The check in process was painless. The breakfast was average and some of the food was cold, but that could have been a timing issue. Overall a good experience.

title: VERY BAD SERVICE! Far from being a 5 stars hotel!
text: When we arrived, the bed sheets haven't been changed and it was obvious. It was around 6 PM. When we called the front desk, they told us that there is no cleaning staff after 4 PM so they cannot help….. WHAT?????? So after discussion and explanation, at midnight they finally send us someone that has only few sheets and not an entire set… Very disappointing. The kids were exhausted. They were supposed to fix all that the day after but… nope…. When we came back at the end of the day, the bed was still not completely remake….. Oh one important thing that you should know. Satrting in April, there is no heating in the hotel. So if the night is cold, it is pretty cold in the room…. So without a full set of bed sheets, the nights are long…. All that to say that this hotel should not have the right to advertise as a 5 stars hotel. I travelled a lot and I gave them a big 2 stars for their mediocre service. Even the manager was not able to help! Very disappointing.

title: WestHouse Hotel New York Experience
text:
Staff very friendly and helpfull. Excellent location. Breackfast very very good. Clean. Comfortable room. The rooftop is great with a nice view, where you can relax for a while, with a nice coffe.
From breackfast You can bring to your room something to eat, even juice , water.

title: Great location for theatregoers or family visits
text: We stayed with our two young kids in a corner suite.  It was in great shape and quite roomy for NY.  The location is very convenient.  Just a few blocks from a great playground in central park and an easy walk to the Broadway shows.  Also convenient to most of the subway lines.  The hotel is relatively small and the kids felt quite comfortable there.  The hot breakfast made getting ready and getting on the go easy.

title: Great hotel
text: You will absolutely love this hotel, great location, clean, rooms are quiet, amenities are great. Tarek is amazing!!  Will definitely recommend. Would wish the lobby bar had more hours, wasn’t open at 9 on a Thursday. The staff really work to make a great experience

title: Stay away - not a luxury hotel
text:
As others have said it is not a 5 star hotel, not a luxury hotel and not a boutique hotel. It is a large hotel with bad service and mediocre rooms. 

The staff is unhelpful and argumentative, instead of finding  solutions they try to blame the low standards of the hotel on the client. It seems trivial, but there is no one to open the very heavy revolving door and help with luggage - not ok if you declare to be a 5* hotel. The rooms are dated and dirty, fingerprints on the mirrors and light switches, stains on the cushions, disgustingly dirty windows, we even found a dead fly on a table (it was there even after they "cleaned" the room on the second day). The "city view" is a joke - our windows looked at a wall and into other rooms. They still tried to say there's a partial view of 7th ave.. you see a corner of scaffolding if you stick your neck out. There is no amenities kit, just a soap bar and hand lotion. Nowhere to put your toothbrush. No kettle and coffe/tea in the room. None of this would be cause of complaint if this was a 3* hotel but for a 5* at over 400USD a night it's a flat out scam. Apparently it's listed on airbnb as well..as no luxury hotel ever would. I don't understand how anyone would find this ok - if you stay in a 5*  you'll know this place isn't. As others commented they even have compulsory extra charges for wifi and breakfast to raise your bill further. 

I can also confirm the underwhelming breakfast in an overcrowded room, with soggy pastries, stale bagels, rotting strawberries, and disposable cups (imagine the environmental cost), boxed fruit juice (not fresh) and a disgusting instant coffee machine...no cutleries or table cloths, you have to set your own table, the staff clears the tables by throwing disehs in a huge trolley. 

Nothing about  this is 5*.

title: Marketing Manager
text: Stayed here while passing through for work. Very pleasant experience. True to its “boutique” identity. Helpful, personable staff - excellent experience with the concierge who pointed me in the right direction for good food and interesting spots in the area. Clean and well-kept and found my room/amenities very nice.

title: Please Hire competent people.pay them well. The hotel workers are hidden all over the hotel 😂 but they don'tactuallywork
text: The hotel is extremely overpriced, not a single appealing amenity in the hotel. Seems like this hotel is about to die from Covid. On the other hand, the staff is extremely unprofessional, from the front desk to the manager very rude with tourists.(the breakfast is not great at all but the staff from the restaurant is very friendly and polite.)

title: Incredible Service & Location
text: Excellent. Location, Breakfast with A Excellent. A short walk to Central Park. Balcony views with breakfast. All day access to coffee and snacks. Quiet & Safe. Perfect for families, couples, solo travellers & business. Will 100% be returning.

title: Beautiful time in NYC
text:
We spend a splendid week at the West House. 
The staff was amazing and the room was so comfortable. The location is perfect very close to everything. I will give it 5 stars. 
Cannot wait to go back and stay there.

title: Traveler
text:
My return to WestHouse was just as lovely as my first visit! I love the atmosphere of this sophisticated property and especially appreciate the thoughtful staff. I look forward to my next stay at WestHouse. 

Jill Rooney Carr

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: Had a wonderful stay at the Westhouse Hotel. The staff were all friendly and attentive!  Nice rooms and fantastic breakfast. Great location, close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick’s Cathedral, etc.

title: Trying to be fair
text:
I booked two rooms in Nov for a March stay with family, directly through the hotel. The rooms needed to be adjoining and I was advised this was available for our dates. The rate was excellent and good value for location in New York. I stayed here a few years ago pre Covid with my husband and was impressed and decided to take family back as soon as we could travel again. The girl I booked with was extremely helpful and pleasant. 
The good points are that the rooms remain clean and of a good standard. Bathrooms were good and well maintained, towels were plentiful, beds comfortable, bed linen good quality and water replenished in the rooms. On this occasion neither room had a view. But not the end of the world. Breakfast was good quality and you get plenty for the rate charged. 
Some negatives though and I have taken some time to consider this and try to be fair. 
On check in I met Vanessa and although she started very pleasant when she informed me that there were no adjoining rooms and I questioned her stating that I had booked them and emailed the hotel twice to place a reminder, Vanessa’s facade changed. She became abrasive and abrupt. Telling me that she would have to downgrade one of the rooms to give me the adjoining ones. I accepted this because the adjoining was more important. Once this had been resolved she was all sweetness and light again. But it really struck me and my family members who stood beside me during the exchange. Also they take an amount on your card per room per day of 150 dollars. While this isn’t the biggest deal I wondered what for. There is no bar and no menu so room service would be extremely limited. Vanessa tried to put through the rooms on a number of transactions on my card causing it to be blocked by the bank. She again became quite abrupt stating I need to pay the remainder up front. To give an idea she ended up putting through 1200 gbp on one card and 1k on the other. When I checked out the final bill was 1500 and went through on one card and the remaining 1200 cleared from the other card a week later. This member of staff was impatient and rude but maybe I just got her in a very bad day.. I was struck that if you only had one card her haste and impatient actions could have ruined a holiday for a whole family. 
This was a fortieth birthday celebration it was noted on the booking and the guest relations failed to leave as much as a strawberry in the room to acknowledge it. There are few staff on at breakfast I counted three at most and they worked incredibly hard as the room was rammed every morning. They do a great  job but seem quite unsupported. The remainder of the  staff were lovely. But this has really annoyed me since I left and I did email feedback but it was not acknowledged. 
One other small point the terrace in the evening now serves only soft drinks tea and coffee. That is fine but it is cheap own brand soft drinks. Not quite good enough for a five star hotel. This area is poorly maintained in the evening and was a disgrace. There was no milk the first night and it was filthy the second one. I gave it a kiss the remainder of the stay. 
All in all I’m not sure I would go back. I booked it with the hotel taking previous advice. Not quite as good as it should have been. It is good value but it’s not 5 star unfortunately.

title: West House Stay
text: The West House is amazing! Great location and staff as well as all the amenities you’ll need and more. They had our room ready right on time and had such comfortable beds. The staff was so friendly and good at their jobs.

title: Best hotel in NYC!
text: I can’t say enough how perfect this hotel is. It’s close to everything, especially if you’re seeing a show, but still on a quiet block.  It’s directly across from Carnegie Hall, a few blocks from both Broadway/Times Sq and Lincoln Center.  The rooms are spacious by NYC standards and very well appointed. Comfortable beds and a lovely marble bathroom as well. There’s a perfect fitness center with everything you need and a delicious breakfast. The staff are all super friendly and helpful. This hotel honestly has it all—it’s the only place I want to stay when I come to NYC!!!

title: Hotel não confiável
text:
O hotel cobrou nossa estadia em duplicidade
Entramos em contato e nos informaram que seria feito o estorno de uma cobrança , porém já passado o prazo do estorno , a cobrança ainda é vigente 
ABSURDO ROUBO 

SERGIO MASSARO - hóspede de 9 a 16 de março /22

title: Best staff! and SUPER clean rooms!
text:
I arrived really late to the hotel, both Ruben and Vanessa welcomed me really nice, provided waters and asked if I needed anything else. During the 3 days I was there,  Ruben was so attentive, so sweet and kind towards me and my needs. Felt really genuine and caring. Felt so at home, to the point that I even extended my stay with them one more night. Ruben brought back the good hospitality  <3. The hotel its GREATLY located, super clean (I was in housekeeping so standards were high), good amenities and honestly the BEST staff. Bell mans, and engineering were also so sweet! 
thank you for an amazing stay!

atte: Antonella

title: New York week
