text: My friend and I recently stayed for a week at The Westhouse New York.The tone was set on our arrival by the friendly and helpful check in staff.During our stay there every single member of the Westhouse team displayed the highest standard of customer service.Not just in a professional way but in a natural friendly way that you do not get in many hotels.All of the fixtures and fittings,mainly Art Deco,were in very good order and the beds were very comfortable.The breakfast was very good and the drinks and use of the lounge during the day was very welcome.The position is very hard to beat ,two blocks down from Central Park and on the corner of Broadway.A lovely place.We will return.

title: Comfortable, clean and well located
text: We very much enjoyed our stay this past weekend at the WestHouse Hotel.  It is perfectly located for a short walk to Central Park or Times Square, with plenty of restaurants, shopping and museums also within close walking distance.  Our room was extremely clean and the bed was heavenly in its comfort.  The temperature was a bit warm for our tastes, but turning on the room fan helped.  The West House does charge a $30/day/per person fee, but included is a full breakfast buffet with hot and cold foods, everything fresh and tasty.  I also appreciated the oat milk with coffee, as I am lactose-intolerant.  Also, we could hear people in the hall but not once they were inside their rooms.  It was very quiet for sleeping.  Overall, we could not have been happier with our stay.

title: Outdated rooms and no view
text:
Rooms need to be updated. They do not look like the ones in photos. 
No view from the room, because it faces the brick wall. Room feels like a prison cell. No natural light. Dust on light fixtures. Poor customer service. Not a 5 star hotel at all.

title: 6 Stars
text:
Wow. This hotel is truly a five star experience. After one evening in a one star hotel that made me extremely uncomfortable I found this hotel. Let’s talk about what they did right…
First, the customer experience was amazing. Vanessa made my check in super smooth and made me feel right at home. Vanessa and Nick helped me check out, going above and beyond all of my needs. 
Second, the cleanliness was on point. No dust on any surface I could find throughout the room. Even the communal areas were impeccable. 
Third, the amenities. I didn’t get to go to the gym because I was on a rest day, but it has a 24 hour “fitness center” on the third floor for anyone who wants to work out at 3am. On the 23rd floor there is a terrace where you can get breakfast, do some “working from home” and enjoy a pretty cool view of the area. 
Finally, the details. You wouldn’t know it but things like hand soap, the remote to the tv, ample lighting and electrical outlets are things some hotels either forget to put in the room or just don’t have any available. Besides a dental kit (I only packed enough toothpaste Bites for 3 days, not my updated 5) they had everything I called down for. 
I cannot wait to come visit this hotel again! The only thing that would make it better would be a pool and on site wash-and-fold. Because people like me wear too many shirts in one day.

title: Fantastic!
text: My wife ordered a room at the Westhouse for my 50th celebration and the hotel did not disappoint. The room  was excellent - spacious, clean and tidy, and nicely furnitured and decorated.  I was surprised at how quite it was (on 21th floor). Wifi was installed in the room. My wife used the gym every day. Breakfast was great. The staff - especially Vanessa - was very helpful, polite and professional. The location couldn't be better - just south of Central Park and just north of Times Square. We couldn't have asked for a better stay away from home. Highly recommended!

title: Great experience
text: We stayed three nights in an executive suite.  The staff was nice and professional.  The room was clean and did not feel like a traditional institutional hotel room.  The breakfast was experience as also very good.  Good food and the staff replenished the food frequently.

title: Perfect for us!
text:
We had an amazing time here. I wanted something that was easy to walk everywhere to, a place that had breakfast (one less thing to try and find while you’re on a tight time table) and something that looked “boutique” and not generic. I found it all at WestHouse. 

We could walk to Times Square, Broadway shows, high end shopping, Central Park etc. The room was small (it’s NY after all) but very nicely decorated and had a great city views. Close to subway stations. 

The breakfast was great - eggs, meats, potatoes, yogurt parfaits, fruits, meat and cheese, bagels, oatmeal etc.  Coffee and tea. There’s a cute balcony that you can eat outside. 

There’s a lounge area downstairs but no food or drink due to Covid restrictions still. That part would’ve been so nice. The staff were fantastic! Welcoming and helpful all the time. They got me a fan in the night because I was so hot, they have subway maps and will get you taxis. 

This was a really fun place to stay for a NY version of a good value. It’s not a 5 star resort, but they deserve a high rating for being just perfect for me.

title: Budget Five Star - Every Possible Corner Cut
text:
Speaking to the staff about this hotel, they suggest that they re-opened too soon after COVID19 (union pressure) and that management have cut corners. 

That's in evidence in a variety of places: i) rooms - other than soap and a TV, there is nothing in the room. Not even a shower cap. No minibar. Nothing. If you're expecting comfort then go elsewhere. 

Whilst the rooms are clean, I can't say much more. ii) breakfasts - staff filling fruit directly from plastic punnets in front of you, jagged edges on sliced bagels - just smacks of laziness and a lack of attention to detail. 

Just a real shame as this hotel is, to give it its due, well located. But the real problem of this hotel is that they seem to have outsourced their customer service outside of the hotel - you call (e.g. for the aforementioned shower cap or as I did for an extra pillow) and either it takes an age (the shower cap...) or it never comes at all (the pillow....). 

Other occasions - you email or try to call the reservations line (I lost something in the hotel) and they don't even have the courtesy to reply to a number of emails. For a hotel where you pay this amount of money, it's a real disappointment. 

Many hotels in NYC care about their clientele - this one cares more about your money. Keep hold of your belongings, bring your own shower cap(!) and just expect a budget 5* and you'll be bang on. A disappointment.

title: Celebration 🎉 of my extended family
text: Jesey,Tarik,Vanessa,Moe,Tristan,Nick & Eric Palmer thank you all. My extended family had a beautiful stay at Westhouse. You made them feel very welcomed. The Westhouse is home away from home. See you soon.

title: Superou expectativas
text: Adoramos o hotel! Quarto ótimo, café da manhã super completo, no 23° andar. Oferecem um café/chá no final do dia também. Funcionários super atenciosos, inclusive a camareira! Localização excelente, perto de tudo!

title: Bad bad bad
text:
Location is good.
But rooms are really small for what you pay for.
Advised to be for a single person not two people.
Hotel is considered 5 stars i dont know how.
Rooms are not clean when we first checked in. Toilet flooring is really dirty. 
Body lotion, body wash, shampoo and conditioner is used. We are in covid still how come they give these stuff uncleaned not santized to other guests!
AC is too hot and noisy
Pillows are awful you cant sleep without getting neck pain i assure you.
When cleaners clean other rooms they are noisy, slamming doors and not respecting.
So many things i cant even explain because of the level of anger they kept me in.
And yes even if u ask for cleaning or u put sign for cleaning on doors they will not clean ur room.

title: A little gem
text:
This quaint gem located on 55th was this best find. A stones throw to Central Park and the shops on 5th Ave.
Many thanks to Ashley, Christian, Vanessa and Ruben for making our stay amazing! They are the true souls of the house!
We plan on returning!

title: Top notch stay
text:
This hotel is wonderful. It has a boutique feel but has all the amenities you would look for. The room was nice and spacious with comfortable bedding and very lovely decor. The bathroom was a bit small but clean and updated. The lobby is nice and inviting and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I love the added bonus of included breakfast (with hours that make sense). The gym is very nice and spacious. The only thing I wa surprised about was that no robes were included which is what I would expect at this level of a hotel. 
Still I would stay here again!

title: Broadway marathon
text: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel. It's a beautiful hotel with outstanding staff. I want to personally give a shout out to Vanessa who helped me switch rooms when I was having trouble with my initial booking. She went out of her way to make sure I was happy about everything. I had friends join me there and they were so impressed by the room and the whole vibe at the hotel. A+ for staff!

title: Excelente
text: Es un hotel que está perfectamente ubicado . Es muy cómodo para una familia de 4 . El servicio fue excelente . El desayuno básico pero suficiente para iniciar el día . Muy limpias las instalaciones . Es la segunda vez que me hospedo en este hotel . A dos cuadras de Central Park .

title: A must stay for comfort and quiet.
text:
This hotel was a hidden gem. Close enough to walk easily to Broadway yet far enough off the main track not to be bothered with loud traffic all night. 
The staff was warm and helpful with any of our questions or needs for reservations. 
The room was spacious enough for my friend and I to share a king size bed and bathroom. I loved the thinking and design that went into the shower. They put in a cut out hole so you could reach in without getting wet to turn on the water to let it warm up. 
The breakfast every morning was warm and in abundance. Hot scrambled eggs, potatoes, oatmeal were always refilled. Then an assortment of breads, fruit, meats and cheeses with plenty of yogurt to choose from. We always looked forward to the comfortable atmosphere to enjoy our breakfast and start our day. 
Now that I have stayed here, I will come back every time I visit NY.

title: We felt so welcome
text:
We felt so welcome and save in this period of covid. We loved our stay, the people who work here without exception are really the best. 
I think it was the first time in NYc we stayed in a place that we felt like we were at home. About the hotel the rooms are big for NY standard, and breakfast was included.

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
We stayed 5 days at this fantastic hotel during our honeymoon!!  Absolutely the best stay we’ve had in NYC!  It is a welcoming hotel, great for extended stays with an incredible breakfast spread and large rooms.  The property is well cared for by an outstanding housekeeping staff.  If in NYC for business, it is perfect!  The terrace has a small meeting room, spacious areas for private conversations and a a fabulous balcony with a view of the skyline.  Everything is near by, the park, Lincoln Center, the Cathedral, Broadway and Shopping!!!
Do stay there, we plan on going back!!!

title: Best Hotel for the Money
text: This hotel is in a great location and the hotel staff are unbeatable. We were treated like we were their only guests. They were so friendly and very helpful. The value of what you get with this hotel can’t be beat. The breakfast is delicious and has so many options. I would highly recommend staying here, you won’t regret it!

title: Great location and super helpful staff
text: This hotel is excellently located and very comfortable but I especially wanted to mention Ashley at reception/ concierge who made me feel so at home and really went out of her way to assist with all details big and small.  Thank you!!!!

title: Absolutely Wonderful
text: I generally stay the the W and this was our first time at the Westhouse. What a truly beautiful place situated in the best location. We walked everywhere with ease. The staff is beyond accommodating. The women at the check in even offered to personally get us our favorite bottle of wine for our room upon inquiry about their bar ( temp closed but not a huge issue bc The Rickey, right across the street is also amazing and a must try if you like fantastic cocktails and stellar service).  The Terrace is a lovely area on the 23rd floor offering a delicious and well thought out breakfast spread as well as beautiful surroundings which felt more like a European parlor than a hotel dining area. Complimentary water, espresso and high end snacks available there all day with gorgeous views of the city. The decor throughout the hotel is so tasteful with gorgeous lighting. Definitely will be a repeat customer and definitely rare to find a 5 star experience in the city at such reasonable rates.

title: A wonderful stay
text: We stayed here with my family for about a week and everything about our experience was just perfect. Everyone in the staff (Ashley, Thiago to mention a few) have been helpful, caring and attentionate. They just re-opened after a two-year closure due to the pandemic and they are doing an excellent job so I highly recommend this hotel to support the good work they are doing!

title: Awesome experienced!!
text: It was truly something special and amazing. I simply can't find the words to describe the feeling, the emotion, you need to experience this at least once to be able to understand the excitement, the inner peace which fill you up in the darkness, silence, in the mysterious underworld of the Mayan civilisation. It's like a meditation, everything what bothers you is left outside, you forget about your problems, about distractions. Complete freedom for your mind. Ashley was truly a blessing. God bless her

title: Love this place
text: Kourtney was amazing outstanding staff members my First time flying and first time to New York and she treated me like a king completely made me feel comfortable and welcomed. She gave me impecable service. West House Needs staff like her! Thank you Kourtney for making my stay pleasant and enjoyable.

title: Spectacular Visit
text: This was my 2nd visit to WestHouse and I already can't wait to return!  The hotel is very tastefully appointed, great sleep on those pillows, the breakfast in the Terrace delicious and the staff very pleasant & helpful.  The location is perfect, walking distance to Central Park, Times Square, Stephen Colbert (!!!), shopping and great restaurants!

title: Amazing
text: Upgraded to a suite just because she could and wanted to accommodate my inquiry to a room with a bigger tv, amazing suite instead right next to the terrace that of course serves breakfast, my favorite

title: Not 5 star but close
text:
After spending 3 nights at the Westhouse I feel i was so close to being able to give it a 5 star review but just a few things let it down .
One of the main reasons for booking here was the reviews I had read on here and the rating it got on SLH for location, service and the breakfast in the lounge. 
Location was fantastic and within walking distance to many great attractions. Service was good in general but one member of staff stood out amongst the rest , Ashley on reception was outstanding and she is a credit to the hotel and was so helpful in so many ways .
Sadly I felt the breakfast was a let down and not what I had hoped it would be , food was dry and tasteless and would recommend going elsewhere.
We had booked an executive suite which was spacious and comfortable but the bathroom was a little small considering the size of the suite. The rooms are starting to look a bit tired and in need of a bit of a makeover.
All in all I would recommend the Westhouse and I would hope to return on my next visit to NY if only for Ashley’s 6 star service

title: Highly recommend WestHouse NYC
text:
I would highly recommend WestHouse NYC. We’ve stayed at many hotels in NYC, and this was by far our favorite. All rooms are on high floors. Our room had a view of Carnegie Hall. The Terrace has hot breakfast, as well as fresh fruit and yogurt parfaits, each morning. The espresso machine and drinks (La croix, water, tea) are available while the terrace is open. There is also a lovely outdoor terrace available to guests with a table and chairs to relax.
The staff was so helpful and accommodating. They respond quickly by text.
The room overall was very nice. It would definitely help if there were more lamps, as the room was very dark after sun down. 
Hotel is a great location in Central Park south area, easily accessible to several subway lines, can walk to Central Park and to Broadway shows. 
We definitely plan to stay here again!

title: 5 Star....Really
text: First, I canceled a reservation at Embassy Suites Manhattan to stay here. I was excited to stay at a 5 star rated hotel. When we arrived check in went smoothly. We learned at that time that they were just reopening and some amenities would not be available. Once we got to the room we immediately noticed how basic it was. I gave up a two room suite for this. The view was another disappointment, open the curtains and saw four back of buildings. Vanessa, the front desk clerk, went above and beyond and switched us to a room with a street view. The bed was comfortable and breakfast was good, but for the price I didn't feel like I got what I paid for.

title: Keep away!
text: This Hotel is horrible. The stuff is unfriendly and incompetent. No service, no bar, empty minibar, no late check out. Beside the awful breakfast there is no chance to get anything in this Hotel - no snacks, no drinks, no room service - that‘s an expensive bed & breakfast, not a Hotel

title: Fantastic stay
text: Just returned from 2 nights in NYC, this hotel is a gem! The staff are responsive, kind, and made our stay so comfortable. Breakfast was great while traveling with my two daughters, and make sure you take in the view from the terrace! Our room was cleaned to perfection in a time when so many other hotels are getting bad reviews for being neglected, the entirety of the property was immaculate! Room size was larger than expected and the location was perfect!

title: Really impressed!
text:
This was my mother's second stay at WestHouse and my first. My overall experience was fabulous and I can see why my mother was so keen to stay again. All of the staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and gracious and the moody, intimate ambiance belies its bustling midtown location. 

I personally feel that the breakfast buffet and access to complimentary water, coffee and soft drinks throughout the day more than make up for the residence fee. (I'm looking at all the hotels that have the audacity to charge exorbitant rates and then still want you to cough up $10 for the bottle of water "thoughtfully" left in your room).

The 12PM checkout time is an absolute luxury that allowed us to leave at a leisurely pace and not feel like we were being rushed out. On top of that, the entire hotel smells lovely, it's conveniently located, and you can get great tacos across the street.

And for those who are complaining about the bar being closed, etc. — this is the world we live in right now. I'd rather the hotel take precautions and cut back on unnecessary services than have all the bells and whistles.

WestHouse is now at the top of my list for whenever I'm in the city overnight.

title: Incredible stay at a top-notch hotel
text: My experience with the West House was nothing short of phenomenal.  Things I wasn't expecting:  1) the West House oozes luxury and class.  I was only there for a few days, but it made me wish I had several black-tie events to attend.  The staff really made me feel like I was a VIP checking in.  2)  Just how close the hotel is to everything.  I mean, I liked its location, but actually being there is a different story.  You are STEPS away from central park and midtown, not to mention the subway feet outside the front entrance.  Amazing!   and 3) (My favorite)  the included top floor breakfast!  Wow, was this an impressive spread.  Hot buffet, and even an upscale coffee machine that makes lattes and more.   That really put a bow on my trip!   I could not have been more pleased with this hotel.  I will be staying again.

title: Whirlwind NYC trip.
text: What a beautiful hotel.  Staff goes above and beyond.  Perfect location.  Absolute gem. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise. Clean and covid protocol in place.  Masks required in common areas. Security conscious.

title: WESTHOUSE IS A MUST STAY
text: It’s a 10/10 for me - Staff is so friendly and helpful, I could chat with them all day if I wasn’t constantly running around. Location is prime, rooms are great, breakfast buffet!!!  You won’t regret it. Do it, stay here!  Thanks all for a great stay!  Shoutout @Ashley!

title: WestHouse is BACK and is awesome!
text:
The Westhouse is fabulous!  We had the best time returning to NYC after so long…. They have an incredible lounge on the 23rd floor with drinks & breakfast.  The rooms are clean!  The gym is 24 hours.  The staff is so nice too.

We’ve stayed here before the pandemic, but I believe it is improved now.

title: Bad service. Small rooms (even for NYC). Terrible service. Not 5 star.
text: the hotel is ok, if you call it a 3-4 star hotel....but the service is definetly not 5 star. bar was closed, terrace closed....bad service....but oh well, its supposed to be 5 star boutique hotel in mid town manhattan, for $230 I guess we got what we paid for.

title: Guest
text: The staff at Westhouse was amazing we just loved our house keeper Mary Paul !!! And front desk attendants Tarik and Ashley were the best…. We will be back ! Hopefully happy hour will be reinstated when we return

title: Amazing staff and beautiful hotel!
text: We just stayed at Westhouse this weekend for my husband’s birthday and it was amazing! The rooms and hotel itself are beautiful and the location is fantastic. The best part of all is the staff! First, Vanessa was simply a star helping me with my reservation—she was gracious, generous, kind and a total professional. During my stay she went the extra mile placing wine in the room and getting ice for me and with a big smile on her face. Then, Mo and Nick at the front desk were so fantastic helping with my room, an early check-in (thank you Nick!) and making sure everything was perfect (thank you Mo!). Ryan in guest serves answered my phone requests smoothly and kindly, Dennis in Housekeeping was so sweet and hospitable and every bellman/doorman we encountered was friendly and helpful. You all truly are wonderful and I hope you know the effect you had on making this getaway amazing. We are excited to return to Westhouse! S&E.

title: Sophisticated, beautiful hotel, centrally located
text: This smaller NYC hotel is a hidden gem. It's within walking distance to most of NYC's famous attractions like Central Park, Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, and more. The interior and rooms are sophisticated and well appointed; it feels upscale and classy without being pretentious. The staff is fantastic- they were so friendly, so helpful, I actually felt sad leaving them. And the breakfasts, which are included in your stay, were delicious. The lounge is on the 23rd floor. It's lovely inside with a fantastic outdoor deck. The breakfast included a large buffet with many options. It feels like we found a hidden gem in the city- the hotel is very fairly priced and the room was definitely larger than the NYC average. We will absolutely visit this hotel again!

title: Private and peaceful.  Also good for family getaway.
text:
First time staying at Westhouse, had a suite and connecting room for my 3 children. 
Staff was friendly, hotel felt private like I was walking into my own apartment building.  
Lobby is very nice and breakfast upstairs  in the morning is perfect way to start the day.  
The kids forgot their tooth brushes and I forgot the toothpaste.  Hotel hooked it up and fixed the problem.
Will definitely go back.  Location was great.  I had an event at the Javits and close to Central park. 

Thank you all!

title: Gracious and convenient
text:
My wife and I stayed at WestHouse because of the proximity to several locations we were interested in. We could see Carnegie Hall from our room. Every employee that we came in contact with was engaging and helpful, from Ashley at the front desk to Thomas who switched out our room safe! 
The breakfast served at The Terrace always provided plenty of options, though the quality did vary.
We stayed the first week of opening after the pandemic driven closure. There were a few bumps, but all issues were resolved. We were very pleased with the hotel and the friendliness of staff.

title: WESTHOUSE IS BACK
text: I am so happy that my favorite hotel in NYC is BACK!  I spent a night in NYC last Sunday and the WESTHOUSE (which has recently reopened) is back and better than ever!  Rooms were spacious and clean.  A breakfast buffet!  And, the friendliest staff EVER!

title: Still Nice, Be Patient
text: I’ve stayed here before, but in a suite pre-COVID. This was a smallish (not for NY) room, but it was nice. Bed was very comfortable, storage adequate for 2. The residents fee, which normally adds a lot to your bill here, is now just 29.95 per night because they have suspended their evening happy hours. This is a very good deal considering it still includes the breakfast buffet every morning. An even better deal for me since they waived two nights of it because of a two hour wait to check in. Do keep in mind that the hotel was closed for 18 months and they are still working out kinks. All in all, I got good value for a nice experience in midtown.

title: Keine Rückerstattung, nur leere Versprechungen und Lügen!
text:
Wir wären im Mai 2020 im Westhouse Hotel gewesen, ganze 5 Tage, was einiges kostet!
Aufgrund der Pandemie konnten wir unseren Aufenthalt nicht antreten. Wir hatten über Secret Escapes gebucht. 
Das Hotel bzw. der General Manager behaupteten stur und steif, Secret Escapes habe noch nicht bezahlt, sonst würden sie den Betrag sofort rückerstatten, wie sie das gerade bei allen gecancelten Buchungen machen würden.. (wenn ich die Bewertungen lese, stimmte das wohl auch nicht). 
Der Mailverkehr ging über Monate, ein ewiges hin und her, für nichts und nur belogen worden!
Lange Rede kurzer Sinn, Secret Escapes hat mir dann die Zahlungsbestätigung (!!!) zukommen lassen, welche ich ans Westhouse Hotel weitergeleitete habe, seitdem werden meine E-Mails ignoriert!
Das die Kosten nicht rückerstattet werden ist schlimm genug, noch mehr hat mich aber schockiert, dass man die Verantwortung dafür abschieben möchte und dreist lügt! Absolutes NO GO! 
Da wir weit entfernt von normalen Reisebedingungen sind, Finger weg von diesem Hotel!

title: Hotel is good, staff is AMAZING
text:
The hotel is good. Rooms are nice and clean. The location is great - it’s only a short walk to the Central Park and times square, so if you’re planning to explore the city on foot, this is definitely a good choice. Some rooms need minor renovation - new layer of fresh paint or new blinds would definitely have a positive impact on the overall look.

The staff here is amazing! First of all, everybody here is nice, pleasant, and are good at what they do. I wanted to specifically mention the lady at the counter who left a very good impression, and, most importantly, manger Elizabeth, who is went above and beyond to ensure that our stay here is pleasant and quickly resolved the issue we had (we were booking through different company, so definitely not this hotel’s fault). I would say that work Elizabeth did for us left the biggest impact on our stay here - knowing that people like her are working here, I will definitely stay here again and recommend this place to friends 

I’m attaching the night view from my room - you can see the Times Square

title: What a RIP OFF
text: We booked, and paid upfront for a stay at Westhouse in December last year and were really looking forward to it. Unfortunately, due to the pandemic we were unable to go. We cancelled very early and requested a refund which we were promised. Despite numerous attempts Westhouse have not refunded the money and now are ignoring our emails. DO NOT BOOK ROOMS HERE UNLESS YOU LIKE THROWING YOUR MONEY AWAY!

title: Close to everything.
text: My first stay at Westhouse in Feb/20 (just before the pandemic) was excellent. Staff is nice and helpful specially the concierge. Very comfortable room, good breakfast and no complaints of any kind. Walking distance from broadway and a metro station just around the corner to go anywhere in Manhattan.

title: ZERO Customer Service
text:
I have been trying to contact the hotel since June re a refund I am due for a visit which can't take please, no one is answering my many emails and the phone line just rings out HOWEVER the phone line to take new bookings is open but no one can help me with refund except logging an email with customer service who no one returns my calls.

I was due to visit the hotel on 22.11.20 due to covid our flight was cancelled so have been asking for a refund since June. I have had no communication to tell me the hotel is even closed. 

The lack of service has been horrendous - AVOID

title: Beware the small print of NYC crooks
text:
Just a warning. I was ripped-off for over $300 for services including (quote) "the use of the fridge", not that there was anything in the fridge - this is the cost of keeping it cold...

The hotel was OK, but they scam you with a pre-authorisation on your credit card for damage etc (which is reasonable) but then once you've left, a couple of weeks later you get a bill for stuff you've never used - or wanted - & in my case #voyageprivé (travel agent) didn't accept responsibility for. 

Ignore the photos of the terrace too - it's going to be closed for 5 years & is unusable.

They might as well have had 'Milo' from Times Square as the doorman, demanding $20 just to open the door. 

READ THE SMALLPRINT & ideally book elsewhere.

title: bell'esperienza
text: per me consigliatissimo, sia per la posizione davvero strategica a newyork, a pochi passi da times square,  poi anche un bel hotel  classico, per come ti immagini gli hotel di new york.   Ottimo da ritornarci sicuramente

title: Amazing
text: Very late writing a review as a couple of days after returning the pandemic took hold. There was nothing that could have been improved at the Westhouse. Breakfast was superb, rooms more spacious than we expected and the staff were superb. The daily happy hour was outstanding - alcoholic drinks free-flowing and lovely food. I wish all WH staff the very best and hope tourism returns to NYC as soon as possible.

title: RESIDENT FEE !!!
text:
Attention  cet hotel pratique le RESIDENT FEE c’est à dire après avoir payer votre hôtel avec formule Ex : 7 jours avec petit déjeuné pour un total de 2000€ vous devrez encore payer une soi-disant garantie bancaire à la réception le jour de votre arrivée qui est de 49$ par personne et par jours ce qui est scandaleux !! mais hormis tout ça hotel pas 5* mais plutôt 4* les chambres sont pas très grandes il y faisait très froid nous avions un bébé avec nous pas de chauffages nous avons dû trouver un système D pour bloquer le froid entrant un maximum, hôtel vivement à déconseiller il y en a de beaucoup mieux comme le Sheraton qui est a peine à 150m.

Please note this practical hotel the RESIDENT FEE ie after having paid your hotel with formula Ex: 7 days with breakfast for a total of 2000 € you will still have to pay a so-called bank guarantee at the reception on the day of your arrival  which is $ 49 per person per day which is outrageous !!  but apart from all this hotel not 5 * but rather 4 * the rooms are not very large it was very cold we had a baby with us no heaters we had to find a D system to block the incoming cold as much as possible, hotel strongly to  do not recommend there are much better ones like the Sheraton which is barely 150m away

title: It was my birthday celebration.
text: I enjoyed a free night from Hotels.com after ten bookings.  This boutique hotel is very charming and does offer a most pleasant experience.  I enjoyed a sedate champagne supper talking with a nice Los Angeles lady followed by a contrastingly vigorous workout in the fitness room that looks over the street just around the corner from Carnegie Hall.  Very comfortable bed.  Watched Mike Myers and remembered "Wayne's World" (so wacky)!  Breakfast was positively sumptuous.  I just paid $64 facility fee and enjoyed liberal amounts of quality wine and tasty foods.  This was just before the "shut down" and prices were on discount.  Manhattan is a paradise of fine hotels.  I hope this over-hyped nonesense that has been pushing excessive fears of virus infection comes to a swift end and hotels get back to normal before businesses are even more severely damaged.  Most of it seems politically driven!  The pandemic is the panic because Dems can't win the White House!

title: Ummm...
text: In the heart of Manhattan, within a 10-minute walk to Times Square and Central Park, downtown attractions are within walking distance. There is a subway station nearby. Food is average. Every member of staff we is polite, helpful and courteous, however do beware of the high resort fee. It’s so not worth it!

title: Great location, great hotel... watch out for extra charges
text:
Anyone that's booked a hotel in new York knows this can be a tricky place to find decent accommodation in without paying a small fortune/ ending up in a noisy part of town/ staying in a disappointing hotel.  Our booking here then was a delight.  This is a great hotel.  Modern and bright,  it's in a great location but far enough of the street to let you get a good night's sleep.  Our rooms were immaculate with a super comfy bed.  We asked for a quiet room when booking and it was blissfully quiet.  Staff are charming too. Nothing to fault here then... 
Well there is one tiny thing that should be taken on board.  The hotel charges $49 per person per night as a supplementary charge.  This isn't city tax. Rather it's a charge for breakfast and use of the club room on the 23rd floor open in the morning for buffet breakfast and from 5 till 8 at night.  In the evenings they have hot food and a selection of cheeses/ breads etc plus beer prosecco and wine,  unlimited soft drinks and so on.  

To be honest we wouldn't have wanted this if it hadn't been included in the price when we booked as we eat out in the evenings.  And it's per person per night so for four of you,  it soon adds up.  And lots of people seemed unaware of the charge when they arrived so do check what you're left to pay.  That's not to say it's not value for money.  The foods fine and if drinks your thing,  it's unlimited.  But worth checking for sure

Apart from that we were delighted to have found this place and had a great time.  Highly recommend.

title: Fabulous stay
text:
This hotel is amazing, the team especially Ashley in reception and Angela in housekeeping made our trip special, they made us feel welcome and we’re really friendly. 
The location is great as is the Terrace lounge serving breakfast and early evening drinks. 
A fabulous and memorable trip!

title: Amazing
text:
Stayed at the Westhouse for 6 nights in Feb 

Great location 
Subway on door step 
Big rooms with natural light 
Windows that open 
Big bathrooms 
Comfy beds
Breakfast was plentiful with a good variety
Happy hour is a must beer, wine, presecco with a light supper served if you chose 

The best part of our stay was the staff and management team always on hand working hard to make our stay the great experience it was 

We will be returning in July

title: Highly recommend!!!
text: I would definitely recommend the Westhouse to anybody traveling to NYC!!  The location is perfect.  Close to everything but still quiet enough for a great night's sleep.  The food at the Terrace was delicious, the rooms were clean and very comfortable!  The staff was fabulous and the overall atmosphere was so welcoming.  I'm ready for my trip back...and I will definitely stay at the Westhouse.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: Really Nice rooms with great comfortable furniture, and incredible service . . . staff was some of the most helpful I've ever seen!!  The hotel location is shockingly close to Time Square and Central Park.  It's a perfect place for luxury close to the bustle of Time Square.  We are definitely coming back.

title: Great stay
text: We stayed at the WestHouse for one night on business. Check-in and check-out were seamless. The room was a good size for NY with a super comfortable bed. Hotel had everything you need and the 23rd lounge was a great place with delicious breakfast and evening wine reception. I will definitely be back in the future.

title: Hits and misses
text: My wife and I were there for the weekend.  There were some really good features as well as some problems.  First, the good features.  We were able to check in early which was very helpful to us as we had tickets for a matinee show on Broadway on the same day.  You can walk to the theater district from this hotel as it is very conveniently located.  The complimentary breakfast was very good.  The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable.  Now the problems.  First, we were met by a reprpesentative from Diamond Resorts who kept insisting that we attend an Owners' Update meeting.  That is code for a sales pitch to upsell on your time share. We refused, and then she brought out her manager to pressue us to attend.  This became borderline harassment and we just had to leave.  Also, the promised welcome basket never materialized.  Second, the room was tight and there wasn't much space.  There was no horizontal space in the bathroom.  No shelves or counter for personal items, such as a shaving kit.  There were no luggage racks to hold your suitcase.  Third, it was noisy.  Our room was right next to the housekeeping area and every time that door was opened and closed, our room  door rattled.  It sounded like someone was constantly knocking on our front door.  Also, there was someone screaming in the hallway, which is behavior one might normally find at a cheap chain motel.  Fourth, the shower door leaked.   There was a puddle of water in our bathroom every time the shower was used.

title: Not up to a 5-star rating
text:
Breakfast and evening buffet are included in the price, but given the amount of the Resident fee, it's the least they can do!

But above all: now is not the right time to stay in this hotel, it is surrounded by scaffolding and we were woken up early every morning because of construction works...

Otherwise the hotel is not a worthy 5-star hotel : 
- some objects were missing from the room when we arrived, despite our request no one came back to us + no tea or kettle in the room
- average cleanliness, mediocre cleaning service 
- small bedroom and bathroom despite the announced standing of the room
- very low luminosity in the room (for instance if you open the dressing closet you can’t see anything)
- breakfast is nice but always the same

title: Amazing hotel
text: I stayed for 6 nights with my family in February and we absolutely loved the hotel and felt safe and at home.  Our room was spacious with lot of natural light and the beds were so comfortable and the only negative I have is that the rooms could be cleaned to a higher standard and could do with more attention to detail (fix anything that is broken and leave enough towels and toilet paper). The location is perfect and practically next door to 57th street subway and a few streets away from Times square and surrounded by bars and restaurants. The terrace on floor 23 is fantastic for both breakfast and for drinks and a light dinner or snacks from 5pm-7pm every evening. We will definitely stay again and thank you for a lovely stay.

title: Zu Teuer
text:
Das Hotel ist schön und an guter Lage nahe Central Park / Columbus Circle, es ist aber komplett überteuert. Leider ist bei der Buchung nicht klar geworden, dass die sogenannte Residents Fee pro Person und nicht pro Zimmer fällig wird. So bezahlt man zusätzlich zum eigentlichen Preis nochmals 40%! des Preises zusätzlich. Damit hat man dann das Recht auf ein täglich ungeniessbares Frühstücksbuffet sowie die "Daily Hours of indulgence" Happy hour mit billigem Fusel und erneut ungeniessbarem Essen. Auch wird einem erklärt, dass die Benutzung des kleinen Fitness-Raumes sowie des WiFi's! mit der Fee gratis seien. Diese Definition von gratis ist definitiv schwierig nachzuvollziehen wenn sie pro Tag 100$ kostet.

Von diesem Hotel kann man nur abraten.

title: Weekend with Mom
text: Once a year I bring Mom Irene to NYC. She is in her mid-80's and requires a comfortable room. I try to get her close to all her favorite spots St. Patrick's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center and Central Park. This way she does not have to walk too far. The Westhouse is in the perfect location for all of these attractions. I called prior to booking and spoke with Juan Vargas the manager on duty. I could not have spoken to a nicer person. Everything I needed in a room he made certain I had it. Even a coffee maker (they also have a lovely place for breakfast on the 23rd floor) When we arrived the front desk folks were fabulous. They couldn't do enough for us. The housekeeping staff were kind and friendly. The room was beautiful, it was like our own apartment .The views were spectacular. When my mom took her afternoon nap I had a 5 minute walk to Nordstrom's. I am embarrassed to say I went there everyday (they have a bar in the shoe department no joke).  I book directly with the hotels. I find the rates are just the same or better than using the Hotwire or Kayak. When we were leaving the bellman were quick to call us a cab they also couldn't do enough. Unfortunately, we didn't get to use the outdoor patio because it is wintertime. I hope to go back with my husband in the summer. I would stay here again.

title: Fantastic hotel in a central location
text: Westhouse offers large rooms and wonderfully spaced bathrooms, a fantastic staff and a lovely area for complementary breakfast, tea and afternoon cocktails.  We have stayed several times and only last visit regret trying someplace new.  I’m back to Westhouse.

title: Small feels with big 5 star service
text: We spent a night at westhouse and loved it! The service was great especially the front desk and lobby staff. We especially enjoyed our room, a modern clean design with cozy feel. The 23rd floor hospitality room was a great addition and well worth it. If you enjoy high quality service with attention to detail, don't hesitate to book this hotel... you won't be disappointed!

title: Tarik
text:
Aimabilité, bon accueil, souriant et prêt à nous aider. 👍👌
Tarik a été très gentil, serviable, magnifique. 
On a été contentes d'avoir une personne qui parle français. Merci
Hôtel bien situé, dommage pour les échafaudages, ça gâche tout.

title: Superbe
text: Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits dans cette hôtel .A notre arrivé nous avons eu la chance de tomber sur Tarek à l accueil d une très grande gentillesse et parlant français il fut très utile pour notre séjour et nous l en remercions énormément le reste du personnel est à son image aussi gentillesse tout est fait ici pour que vous vous sentiez bien. Les chambres sont propre grande manque juste un peu d éclairage . La situation de l hôtel est extra métro à 10 m Time square central parc top on thé rock accessible facilement à pieds . Petit déjeuner copieux et à volonté , le soir petit encas copieux et de bonne qualité . Se sera sans au ciné hésitation mon prochain hôtel pour notre prochain séjour à NY .

title: Mr. David
text:
Amazing staff and hotel
I have stayed here many times and it gets better and better. A special thanks to Sena, Michalyn, Q, and all the other bartenders who go out of there way to always make me feel at home. The hotel manager Eric truly cares about his guests. The service is definitely 5 stars. The rooms are always taken car of with pride. The hotel is in the perfect location. I travel all over the world and this hotel is my favorite. Oh and did I mention that the rates are always fair. Weather business or pleasure you will love it.

title: Amazingly good!
text:
We had one 2q room and one executive suite (4 adults, two kids).  They were
hugely big-- they  were a  good size for any hotel and immense by New York
standards, and very comfortable and quiet (22 floor).  
The breakfast was a lavish spread and the food in the late afternoon could easily substitute for dinner if you didn't have time for going to a restaurant.
If you want to be close to subway (the N and Q express go right to Canel St), theaters, and MOMA  and reasonable cab fares to the Met and Natural History Museums, this location is perfect. 
In sum, we cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

title: Fremragende !!
text: Fremragende hotel med yderst smilende og servicemindede medarbejdere. Dejlig morgenmad. Lækker snacks/tapas i loungen om eftermiddagen som en del af hotellets residents fee. Det er alle pengene værd. Rummelige værelser. Bedste hotel vi har været på i New York og skal vi tilbage igen bliver det helt sikkert Westhouse.

title: Gracious and attentive hotel staff
text: This hotel is staffed by caring and attentive professionals. It is beautifully situated so that you can make the most of your time in the city. The rooms are comfortable, the hotel is quiet and the amenities are appreciated. Marcelo, in The Den Bar, makes everyone feel comfortable as he creates the perfect drink to end your day.

title: An extraordinary NYC stay...personally or professionally!
text:
So happy to have found this hotel. I have just completed a nine night stay while in NYC working on a theater project. Having lived in NY for many years and traveled extensively, I am always appreciative of great service. This hotel offers such. It was my 
first time staying here and I was impressed with the care to detail throughout the hotel; ultra-comfortable rooms, clean gym and the Terrace where an array of food and beverages are offered twice daily. Most of all, The WestHouse's staff is top notch! Allie and Alex were exemplary in their professionalism; conscientious and detailed on all fronts. A FIVE-star team. I would highly recommend The WestHouse for a professional  or personal getaway in NYC.

title: Amazing hotel!
text:
My wife and I spent valentines weekend at this hotel and it was perfect!  It’s a hidden secret in a city full of overpriced small uncomfortable rooms.  The WestHouse is literally the exact opposite.  It’s like spending a night in a beautiful apartment in nyc will tons of room and beautiful decor.  The amenities for a boutique are a step above the rest.   From Petr the GM, to Allie the manager the senior staff is amazing.   My only comment would be the front desk to smile a bit more and be a little more friendly.   

I highly recommend this hotel and that is coming from someone who usually stays at only 5 start hotels!

title: Boyfriend’s Surprise Visit To NYC For His 38th Birthday!!!!
text:
WestHouse Hotel is not only beautiful on the inside, but the staff is just as amazing. Ashley & Courtney at the front desk went above and beyond in making sure our experience and stay was nothing short of perfect! My boyfriend and I absolutely loved our room, the lounge, and the terrace! We were walking distance to time square and every other tourist attraction you’d love to see! I stumbled upon the WestHouse by google, and I honestly couldn’t be any happier. We had an amazing stay! We will definitely be back, to see the amazing staff, who is more like family now, the beautiful views, and the perfect experience! Thank you so much, Ashley & Courtney! You both are amazing!! 
Love,
Danielle & Gerad

title: Great Experience
text: Stayed at the WestHouse over the weekend and had incredible stay. The cordial staff and amenities offered really enhanced the experience. Will definitely be staying there again without a doubt next time I return to NYC.

title: Please avoid this hotel if you can!  Very poor service, room DISGUSTING. Pics included.
text:
My husband and I were very excited to go to NYC for a Valentine's weekend getaway.  We specifically booked a king room and called ahead to let them know we'd be arriving around 9pm Friday so to hold our room. We arrive, and get in the long line in front of the front desk.  There seems to be a few issues as none of the people in front of us seemed happy or satisfied as they left the front desk. When it is our turn, we are told that "we have been upgraded to a double queen".  First off, the double queen is a cheaper nightly rate than the room we booked, so that is the opposite of an upgrade.  They wanted to downgrade us, still charge us the king rate, and pretend they were doing us a favor and "upgrading us". We point that out, and say we specifically booked a king room which is what we want.  What I resent the most is being treated like I'm an idiot.  Downgrading us to a double queen and calling it an upgrade is treating their customers like we are dumb.  An actual upgrade would have been to a suite, which any other hotel I've stayed in would have done had they made the mistake of giving away reserved rooms.  Eventually the front desk admits they ran out of king rooms and we ask to speak to a manager.  The woman at the front desk then proceeds to call the night manager Alex and complain about us on the phone right in front of us so we can hear! The night manager came out and offered to waive the nightly resort fee, which did not help at all since we still did not have to accomadations we actually booked. After he left, the woman at the front desk, said "he's not even a real manager anyways".  What kind of people are they hiring at this hotel that the front desk person, the face of the hotel, is saying this to people?? She was rude, unprofessional, and not a person you should have interacting with guests. 
Once we got to the room, oh boy, it was gross. It was covered in a layer of dust, as if it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned in years. The blankets were stained, (pic is of a burn mark on the blanket) the lampshades ripped, and the nightstand had dried white gross goo that had dripped down the side (it was grosser than the pic shows).  If the room had ever been thoroughly cleaned, that wouldn't have been there.  It was clear the bathroom vanity had not been wiped down or cleaned before we checked in the room. (all the water spots, toothpaste/other dried stains in the pictures).  And the faucets hadn't been cleaned in so long that parts were no longer silver, parts had actually tarnished to a dull black from lack of cleaning. If the room had ever been thoroughly cleaned, that wouldn't have been there.  I am attaching pictures, but believe me, these don't even do justice to how disgusting this room was.  Please avoid this hotel if you can!

title: Great hotel great location
text: Stayed for one night for business. Fantastic gem of a hotel. Great rooms. Modern decor. Staff is fantastic. Located near Central Park, Broadway, and Times Square.  Has a concierge lounge that all guests can use. Stocked all day with sodas and coffee and they serve breakfast and a dinner buffet at night. Would highly recommend.

title: Valentine’s Day weekend
text: I had the most comfortable stay possible. I will definitely return to NY and stay at Westhouse Hotel. The location is great. The hotel is walking distance from Time Square and other major attractions. The subway entrance  is right outside the hotel for quick transportation. (Ashely) from front desk gave me so much info and was very helpful with my stay. Ashley made a horrible day into a wonderful day for me. Another staff member I appreciate is housekeeper (Alice) who cleaned my room very well and made sure my stay at Westhouse met my expectations. The entire staff is friendly and amazing but these two ladies are the reason I will be returning and staying at WestHouse when I return to NY.

title: I WAS TREATED LIKE A KING
text:
My stay at WestHouse was absolutely amazing! My girlfriend and i were celebrating Valentines Day, and the staff could not be anymore helpful to make our brief trip to New York special. 

We were instantly greeted by Kourtney and Vanessa at the front desk and they were the best! Very quick and friendly check in. When we got the to room, we were in awe. There was a personalized hand written note from management on our table welcoming us to WestHouse with a bottle of champagne as well to celebrate our special night. Unexpected but awesome!

The breakfast and dinner in the terrace was absolutely superb. The food and beverage staff there was very helpful as well. Shout out to managers Dena Sotiru and Victor Riso, who’s courtesy and kindness was on full display in the terrace. 

Overall, this hotel literally MADE our Valentines Day in NY a night we soon won’t forget. I can not wait to come back to NYC in the summer, mostly because of this hotel!

title: Westhouse NY - Great Service, Food and feel
text: Stayed at the Westhouse this weekend for my boyfriends birthday and everything was impeccable. To start, we were greeted at the door, our room was spacious and homey, and the food was amazing. The morning complimentary breakfast had an array of choices for all pallets. Overall 5 stars and we will definitely be back! Thank you Westhouse for a nights stay that felt like a home away from home 👌🏻

title: The perfect spot for a busy work trip!
text: My business partner and I stayed at the WestHouse while in NY for a buying trip. It was just what we needed - super comfy beds after walking all day, a great shower (with this fab little hole in the shower door - so no need to get sprayed in cold water when putting the shower on!), a great desk for working and a lovely, intimate bar area to relax in after a busy day. Not to mention complimentary early evening snacks! Would highly recommend! We usually stay in a different part of Manhattan, so this location also gave us the opportunity to explore a new area. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Safe Haven!
text:
Wow! Wow! Wow! 
What an outstanding experience I had visiting the WestHouse. It was a last minute booking and after some difficulties getting there we were met with warm welcomes and accommodations that totally elevated the entire experience in New York! 

The service was dynamite! From Ashley our front desk clerk- to the managers- to the housekeeping! Ugh! They made me want to go back just to go back! 

 Even the Diamond Resort folks made us feel valued and totally appreciated! (Kevin was so handsome and his dimpled smiled change the dynamic of a tough day) 
The manager was just as awesome as he always offered up great compliments and meshed well with the hotel staff! Never overbearing! Just the right touch to make anyone want to get themselves involved in the timeshare business! 

The rooms were wonderful and the housekeeping was ON it! 

I even tagged them in a post on my personal Facebook page and their social media manager matched the service that was given! 

The part that got my friend and I hooked was the 5-7 dinner! I wish it would last until 8pm but regardless- it was definitely the touch that sets them apart! I spent most of my time jumping back and forth from the lobby to the 23rd floor living room-(as I called it) 

They had everything I needed! Aunt Flow visited early- BAM! Personal hygiene right on time! 
Gave myself a paper cut! Bam! First aid kit available! 
Raining outside! Oh yes! A WestHouse branded umbrella ready for me! 

And their water game is TOUGH! We never ran out of water! Lol 

I totally enjoyed my stay and absolutely appreciated the experience! A heaven sent and my official Manhattan Safe Haven!!! ❤️❤️❤️💪🏾💪🏾

A Job well done Westhouse!  We felt right at home! ❤️❤️🥰

title: Great little hotel!
text: I loved the location of the hotel, it was perfect for the conference we were attending but out of the way so we could escape.  The rooms were great, as were the bath products provided.  The Terrace coffee bar had a wonderful breakfast and cocktail time, the food was far above regular hotel food and great coffee 24/7 from the machine was such a perk!  What really stood out though was the staff - Marcello in the downstairs bar was especially amazing, but really everyone we came in contact with was so friendly and helpful.  I will absolutely stay here again next time I am in NYC!

title: Disappointing
text: I’ve stayed here several times in the past few years and have noticed a marked decline in the hotel. The rooms are stuffy and have no ventilation, open windows were no help. The room itself was in need of cleaning and updating. There were coffee drops staining the walls, the sink was cracked and the furniture worn. The staff were not attentive. The only positive is the hotel location. I will find another hotel for my next visit to NYC and suggest others do the same.

title: Great hotel!!
text: This was my second time staying at the hotel and I couldn't have felt more welcome by the wonderful staff.  It is an amazing thing to get a free breakfast and afternoon treats (with wine and proseco).  But beyond that from the front desk welcome, to the lovely room this is where I will stay whenever I go back to NYC!

title: Business
text:
Amazing time! Excellent service from the staff and a special thanks for Alex overnight manager:-) Our stay was perfect! We were at the WestHouse Hotel for fashion week.
We will return for sure next year
Natalie

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I was at the Westhouse NY hotel for a week in January 2020 and I can only say great things about this great hotel and the amazing staff. I want to mention the staff at the Terrace, where I had breakfast and a light dinner and wine every night. In particular Kirk the manager who was so attentive and made me and everyone else feel welcome and well taken care. I don't remember the names of all the other server and staff but all of them always smiling and working hard to make all the guests feel at home. We will be back!

title: 5 Star Hospitality
text: This very well-located hotel is small, comfortable and well-attended to if not exceptionally luxurious. Where they truly excel is in hospitality. Their “free☺️“ morning/ evening food and beverage offerings in the large communal dining/lounge area were quite good and surprisingly bountiful. Outside of food service hours, this area provides a wide diversity of beverages (including my fave, decaf cappuccino) all day. Staff was unfailingly helpful and warm. After my days on the wintery NYC streets I looked forward to the comforts of this sweet, temporary home.

title: Fabulous theater hotel!
text:
Shout out to Ashley in reception for the perfect room for our recent stay!  We love to come to NYC at a least once a year for theater and this jewel of a hotel is perfect for us.  Centrally located, we can easily walk to and from the theater.  And the subway is literally just steps away for exploring elsewhere.  
The rooms and bathrooms are always clean and well-maintained.  Ashley found me the perfect, quiet room for a light sleeper.  
This is our go-to hotel for NYC.

title: Don’t pass this place up!
text: A true gem! Stayed in a lot of different hotels in NYC for business travel over the years. This place is now TOP of the list as far as luxury feel at an affordable price. Well appointed details and decor, clean rooms and a great atmosphere in the lobby lounge and terrace levels. Breakfast in the Terrace was incredible. Quiet and serene but located in a great spot in Mid town. Best of both worlds.. Will definitely be back!!

title: All the extras!
text: Our stay was excellent. It was made even better by Kirk from Food and Beverage Department and Alex Claudio one of the Overnight Managers. They were extremely friendly and very helpful in the breakfast towards my family and I. Receptionists are the desks were very helpful as well. When I eventually come back to city I will definitely be coming back. Thank you Kirk, Alex, and the rest of WestHouse!

title: Favorite Hotel in NY
text: I travel to NY monthly for business and this is my favorite hotel in the city.  It all starts when you get there and Ashley greets you, by name, if she has met you.  She is a great first impression of the hotel as her service is impeccable.  She will make you feel comfortable as you get settled in.  The hotel itself and rooms are very nice.  The 23rd floor has a great work/relaxation space with free coffee/soda's/water.  The also serve a great breakfast and happy hour daily.  Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to NYC.

title: Luxury Hotel
text:
I work for a Luxury company and expect best in class service and this hotel
had it all.  When first checking in the staff was warm and welcoming; room was much bigger then expected and very clean.  The breakfast location on the 23rd was cool, cozy and top of class.  And at night great spot for a few drinks and then you can wander down to the bar lounge area to continue your evening.  It was perfectly located in mid town and steps to everything you need.  Definitely going back anytime I am required to stay in NYC...

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
text: Been staying here for years pretty regularly amongst other NYC hotels that I stay in because I have meetings in different parts of the city.  Big Shout Out to Ashley, who has always greeted us by name every time we come in!  She's always friendly and warm and it's great to have someone familiar greet you each time.  It's a great hotel and very near the subways.  The 23rd floor Terrace Room has great breakfast and Happy Hour, plus a great cappuccino machine so you can work in comfort.  It gets pricey after May or so, so sometimes have to stay elsewhere, but as soon as peak season is over (New Years), we are back!

title: Great place to stay in New York
text: We had a great room on the 21st floor with a view of Times Square a safe and quiet distance away. The hotel was recommended by Magellan Hotels, a referral service, and the value was terrific. If you book through Magellan the breakfast and 2 hour Happy Hour with all you can eat snacks and all you can drink and it is all included in the room rate. Can't beat it!

title: Great Visit!
text:
“I had an unbelievable stay at WestHouse! The $50 resorts fee was completely worth it, with the breakfast completely standing out! The rooms are very clean, and it’s an AMAZING location right by Central Park. Was here for a show at Carnegie Hall, it was just across the street. The wife and kids enjoyed being so close to everything!

The staff is what makes this hotel stand out, especially Alex Claudio the Overnight Manager and Dena from banquets. Both of them really went above and beyond in trying to make our stay wonderful. I would definitely recommend!

title: Little Big Town at Carnegie Hall
text:
This place had a great location. Yes, it does have scaffolding around for restoration but you are out and about and not in your room.  The breakfast is phenomenal and the indulgence hour where you can get wine / beer and they serve food enough for a dinner

All staff were pleasant. Vanessa at the front desk made this mom and daughter outing to see Little Big Town at Carnegie Hall a full enjoyable experience

Thank you Vanessa

title: Best Visit Ever
text: Hotel was everything I had hoped for from a visit to the big city!  Courteous and helpful staff, complementary goodies at the room door and any requests or issues were addressed promptly.  We had no complaints!  Enjoy your stay as we did.

title: Thank you Alicia
text:
Alicia took great care of me. There was an issue in my room that couldn't be easily resolved. She jumped into action and got me switched out to a new room asap. She was a total professional. 
I stay in this hotel every time I come to NY. Great place.

title: Hotel incrível e bem localizado.
text: Tivemos a Felicidade de ter escolhido o WestHouse para nossa primeira visita a NY. Além de muito bem localizado, o que proporcionou fazer quase tudo a pé, os funcionários são extremantes gentis e solícitos. Café da manhã com quantidade de opções na medida e qualidade excelente dos que é servido, além disso o hotel oferece tantas outras coisas que fiquei triste em não ter tido tempo de aproveitar, como um happy hour com drinks e petiscos que acontece todo dia no final da tarde. Super recomendo!

title: A Great Place To Be
text: This place was fantastic! The location was so close to Central Park and near Times Square- without being right in the thick of tourists. Very elegant without seeming pretentious!. I was hesitant reading other TripAdvisor reviews, but was shocked how friendly all the staff was. I knew about the fee in advance because it was on my confirmation and when I called the hotel for more details they answered my questions so it didn't bother us at all. We took advantage of the various food/beverage offerings and felt this was such a nice aspect especially considering where else can you go in New York and literally have a meal and unlimited drinks- this was EVERY NIGHT. We will definitely go again. It really feels like I did a staycation getaway in the middle of the city- kudos to the staff-every single person I came in contact with were top notch!

title: Has potential
text:
The WestHouse is a pretty hotel in a great location that has a lot of potential, but is not yet awesome. If you get a good price (WATCH THE FEES!) it is definitely worth trying,

The lobby is attractive and inviting.  The front desk folks were polite and friendly.  However, the doormen more or less ignored people.  Never underestimate the power of greeting guests with a genuine smile when they enter and exit!

The positives:
* room was decent size for NYC
* breakfast on 23rd floor was very nice; well-stocked and inviting
* gym (shared with Park Central Hotel) was good with ample treadmills and 2 Peloton bikes
* noon check-out was a nice surprise (vs. standard 11am in most places)
* free bottled water in room is a nice touch
* great loaction near subway(N/R/Q/W)

Negatives:
* when I tried to book through Amex travel, the hotel snuck in a $100+ per night resort fee which makes their room rate misleading - be careful!
* towels are small - at a luxury hotel, I expect my shower towel to cover my bottom when it is draped over my shoulders...I'm 5'2" it's not that big a distance!  These were smaller than the towels at my gym at home...a silly thing for the WestHouse to have skimped on
* toilet clogged and while it did eventually get resolved I was unable to have it fixed during the window I requested
* my key never worked to get back into the hotel's elevator bank from the shared gym, so each day I had to go to the lobby of the hotel next door and cut across - was not the end of the world, but certainly inconvenient
* loud near elevator

All in all, i would try this hotel again if the rate was reasonable, but it would not be my first choice in NYC.

title: Es hermoso y la vista espectacular. Servicio el mejor.
text: Este lugar fue fantástico!  La ubicación estaba muy cerca de Central Park y cerca de Times Square, sin estar en medio de los turistas.  Muy elegante sin parecer pretencioso !.  Tenía mis dudas al leer otras críticas de TripAdvisor, pero me sorprendió lo amable que era todo el personal.  Conocía la tarifa por adelantado porque estaba en mi confirmación y cuando llamé al hotel para obtener más detalles, respondieron mis preguntas para que no nos molestara en absoluto.  Aprovechamos las diversas ofertas de alimentos / bebidas y sentimos que este era un aspecto tan agradable, especialmente teniendo en cuenta a dónde más puedes ir en Nueva York y literalmente tener una comida y bebidas ilimitadas, esto fue CADA NOCHE.  Definitivamente volveremos a ir.  Realmente parece que hice una escapada de vacaciones en el medio de la ciudad, felicitaciones al personal, ¡cada persona con la que contacté fue de primera categoría!

title: Ubicación perfecta.
text:
Habitación muy cómoda. Ducha excelente.
profesionalidad y amabilidad del concierge.
Y ubicación excelente a 3 minutos caminando de Central Park.
El desayuno es muy normal y no hay nada que destacar sobre el.

title: GREAT FOOD THE REST NEEDS WORK
text:
I HAVE STAED IN 4 AND 5 STAR HOTELS ALL OVE THE CITY BUT ONLY REVIEW IF THEY ARE PERFECT  OR NEED WORK.  THIS PROPERTY IS BOTH 

I have stayed here many times in the last five years.  The food has improved dramatically.  The best part about this hotel is the 23rd floor lounge. The lounge is super comfy and warm and the breakfast and evening spread of complimentary food is fantastic.  They obviously have someone new in F & B who has made remarkable changes.  If you don't go out to many restaurants in New York, this is the place to stay based on food alone.The servers in the lounge work tediously and fast to make sure that the food not only taste incredible, but looks gorgeous always, and is alway hot and fresh.
  
Housekeeping doesn't seem to have any management.  There are no standards, noR consistency, just a total lack of training and poor supervision.  The list of complaints is too long, but here are a few:

-I was told on one stay that only suites have robes, when I stayed in a suite the next visit there was no robe. but the following visit in a standard room there was a robe.  What is the standard?

-I was told I had to call each night for turndown  if I wanted it the duration of my stay.  I did and never received it.  I did however have a pile of chocolates deposited on my nightstand, seemingly done with contempt. I was told by the housekeeper that I was not on the VIP list so she couldn't turn my room down.  No standard

-Never EVER the same amount of towels and washcloths.  Upon checkin once,  there was one wash cloth. 

-They put body lotion in the shower in place of conditioner. That was awful to get out of my hair. Is there a supervisor who double checks rooms?  

-The room is never straightened up.  They only make the bed and clean the sink. 

-Front Office manager offered me compensation, which I said was not commensurate with my dissatisfaction, and he said " I always start with 50% off ."  I was depersonalized.  I was just his "usual complaining customer who got the usual compensation."  There was so much more he could have done, even to drop a short apology note. Remember I have stayed here frequently.

-I have stayed in 3 suites.  The last two times it turned out to be the same room, very very dark. NO BATHTUB even in a suite.

-No rooms have an extra blanket in the closet.  I always have to call for one.

-For the amount of times I have stayed here I was disappointed that they charged me an upgrade fee for a  suite.  First the front desk agent  said $100 a night and he couldn't do any better, then he dropped it to $90 a night.  Do the front desk agents get a percentage of rewards for charging for upgrade? Is there a standard?

-Front desk employees are not empowered to do what it takes to satisfy the guest.   They have to consult with a manager before making any adjustments.

-No doorman outside to open door and welcome guests ever.

-Bellman just drops bags.  No introduction to room.

-I received a card in my key packet for Chrome-cast on my television.  I was transferred three times when I called to find out how to use it.  The last transfer was to a voicemail.  Nobody knows how to use it.  Lack of training.

Front Office manager seen hanging out at front desk with agents.  Does he not have work to do?  Or why doesn't he come around by door and greet guests?

Oh MY!!!  Wish I could go in and train these people.

I continue to stay here because food is great deal, room decor is beautiful, hotel is very well maintained,(continues to show no wear and tear), the location is perfect for me, and I get a good rate through Magellan. But it is not a five star property as Small Luxury Hotels of the world boasts that it is. 

The good news is that they have a new General Manager with an extensive background  in impressive hotels.  The improvement made to the lounge food is significant.  I hope he can do the same with Housekeeping and the Front Office.

title: Not a good experience
text:
I’ve stayed here a few times over the years and had mixed experiences.  This time was quite problematic.  It started with arriving after 10 pm and having to wait 40 minutes for my room to be ready.  The next morning I found there was no hair dryer in the room and it took two calls and 30 minutes to get one.  Room quality here varies considerably (no SLH upgrade was given; they may have been full) and this time I got one with wholly inadequate lighting in the hall and bedroom - it was difficult to read or even see the contents of my luggage.  After an email and a request at the front desk to have someone check the bulbs were not acted on, I was able to get an additional small table lamp delivered my second night, but note that two of three bulbs in the hall light remained burned out throughout my 3-night stay.  Even during the day, the room was too dark, in part because of the dirty window and the scaffolding that is STILL up (for at least 7-8 months now).

On the plus side, I thought the breakfast selection and quality was good (although I am not a fan of paying for it through the mandatory additional fee - if it.’s mandatory, it should be part of the listed room rate), and most of the staff was friendly and tried to be helpful.  The decor is pleasant, tho somewhat marred by the presence of cleaning supply and linens carts left in the halls 24/7 - apparently when they remodeled they forgot to include housekeeping closets.

title: Awesome boutique property great location!
text: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel which is part of Small Luxury Hotels (love all of their properties and great benefits for members) - the location is perfect and super central but on a quiet block without tons of foot traffic in front which I love. There is a subway station right by the entrance which is also very convenient. Their staff is extremely friendly and helpful/knowledgeable and special thanks to Ashley and Kourtney at the front desk who were always smiling and making sure I was taken care of! They also will text you when you check in to check if you need anything (thank you Erika and Mandenise) - LOVE that special touch! Also I did not get the names of the bell staff but the two gentlemen I encountered during my stay were also fantastic. *Room tip- the suite with a king bed is huge for nyc and definitely worth the upgrade. Also make sure to take advantage of the lounge on the 23rd floor which has an espresso machine, bottled water, and yummy bites and really nice breakfast spread! All areas were really clean and you can tell they take care of the property - will be returning!!

title: Super
text: Bel hôtel calme à proximité de tout. Le petit salon est très sympa. Le personnel a été génial. Merci à Kathy, Vanessa, Ben et mention spéciale pour Tareek alias " l'homme de la situation " qui a été au petit soin du début à la fin du séjour. Concernant les chambres,je dirais juste un manque de luminosité dans les chambres.

title: The Best Customer Service in New York
text:
I am a business traveler and frequent NYC .  I travel enough to understand what it takes to run an efficient customer focused hotel which is why I am posting my first ever tripadvisor review.   
Recently I drove into NYC from Boston and needed to valet my car.  Road construction had my turn onto 55th blocked which meant I couldn't access the hotel from my direction on 7th.  When I contacted The Westhouse, Jason McGrath an Asst. Director picked up and took control of the situation.  By control I mean he put me on hold and ran out into the street  to speak to the NYC traffic cop to find out my options and then he  directed me how to get across 7th and to the hotel.  There was another little snag but in the end it all worked out.  Once in the room I found a nice gift of wine and chocolate and a hand written card from Jason apologizing for the trouble - which was obviously not the Westhouse's fault.   I usually stay at the Westhouse for its location and its incredible amenities but now because of this amazing customer focus and gesture I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. 
Thank you Jason an staff!

title: Worst “5 star”
text:
Check in was terrible. 2 people ahead in line with 2 employees ~40 min. Elevator was stuck door open coming back from dinner. Front desk employee extremely rude told me “obviously you need a key card to get it to work.” Alas, elevator door still stuck with employee of the month walking away with no other help posited. So “obviously” I was going to write a review after that. Room was sweltering at night. Room was small - got a double queen while booking a single queen apparently no way to change rooms- hotel too full. Good thing I could see other unoccupied rooms from my window where the only view is other rooms. 

I paid something around $150 in fees upon check in and check out despite booking a prepaid rate in advance. Only hotel I’ve ever seen charge a resort fee per person. Didn’t drink anything at the bar and breakfast was vastly underwhelming and plain bad. 

Overall, biggest joke of a 5 star hotel and not worthy of a 4 star rating. 2 star hotel industry in New York better watch out because west house is gunning for the top spot at inflated rates. What a joke

title: Hyvä sijainti
text: Siisti, puhtaalle tuoksuva hotelli. Sviitit tilavia. Ruoka ja juoma tarjonta ei mielestäni 5 * tasoa, loudge:ssa niukka tarjonta. Vaatimaton tuloaula. Kolme tähteä tälle hotellille, ei mitään vikaa, muuta kuin hinnakas palveluun nähden :-)

title: Ubicación estratégica para hacer turismo
text: Excelente atención, asesoría turística y calidad humana. Rafael es quien hace la diferencia, su amabilidad y vocación de servicio nos hicieron sentir como en casa. Viajé con mi esposa. La ubicación es inmejorable, aunque era una temporada de mucho movimiento era fácil para movilizarse.

title: Buckeyefan1323
text: Really enjoyed my experience at WestHouse. I was visiting for few days for my friends birthday, I was very impressed! Great location to some nice bars and restaurants. Rooms were spacious for New York, even though it’s still not as big as I’d like. The breakfast and dinner was superb, and the staff there was really friendly, especially the  manager Alex. Would definitely recommend, especially for the price. To be honest, I can’t think of anything negative. Thanks for a great stay!

title: Amazing weekend stay!
text: What a phenomenal hotel nestled into a perfect location in NYC.  When we arrived they automatically upgraded us from a suite to an executive suite.  The president of Estonia had just stayed in this room. The room had a direct view of Time Square and the ball. Our room was fabulous.  They have an amazing happy hour with good food and wine/cocktails on the 23rd Floor.  Breakfast is one of the better that I have ever had at a hotel.  I really loved our stay.  Thank you WestHouse for making it so fantastic.

title: Prezzi troppo alti e bassa qualità
text:
Prezzi eccessivi per la qualità dei servizi offerti da questo mediocre hotel.
Assolutamente non paragonabile a un vero 5 stelle.
