Dalle finestre entrava l'aria gelida e il riscaldamento non bastava a riscaldare l'intera camera.
Pochissima varietà nel buffet della colazione e la stanza dove la si consuma è piccolissima...ogni mattino si doveva attendere che qualcuno liberasse il tavolino per poter sedersi.
Il minifrigo della camera era addirittura vuoto, non c'era nulla dentro, nè stuzzichini nè bevande...sarà stata una dimenticanza? Mah!
Tra tasse e costo generale, non posso consigliarlo a nessuno.

title: Fantastic staff special thanks to Rafael and Victor outstanding friendliness and made us very welcome
text:
Booked with voyage prive 6 months ago all fees and taxes included , the breakfast was fantastic also the drinks and nibbles at night before going out for diner was lovely it did get busy but when Rafael and Victor were working there was no problems .

There was only 1 disappointment  the pictures of the hotel and the room are a bit different they do make it look a lot more modern. The terrace was covered in scaffolding and so was the room window we did ask to be moved to a bigger room without the scaffolding but there was none available

I’m assuming this is temporary and I would definitely stay in the west house if I was returning to new Nyc , staff really nice .

title: Nice hotel and location. Level 23 food and drink service is poor.
text:
The Food and Beverage Experience really let the hotel down. Having paid $49 per person for our 5 night stay, we were extremely dissappointed to not be able to get into breakfast on two mornings due to a lack of available seats. We were also unable to get into the evening happy hour on three occasions, again due to a lack of seating.

A number of hotel guests seem to just sit in their seats for as long as possible and eat as much and drink as much as they can in that time. Really, in order to ensure all hotel guests get a chance to experience the food and drink, the hotel should issue dining tickets meaning that one ticket can be used to to get breakfast/evening food and this must be presented when going to get the food. This will stop people abusing the buffet and wasting a lot of food. It will also free up seating so more guests can get in. People seem to use it as a communal area and sit on laptops and don't eat anything.

Due to unavailability we had to eat outside the hotel which added a further expense to our holiday. This was extremely dissappointing as we paid $490 residence fees and only got a chance to experience level 23 on three days. Feel like we lost a lot of money due to this.

title: attention rip off
text:
I booked for 3000 Dollar but the hotel add a special Hoteltax inclunding beverage 56,5 Dollar per person per night so in the end the accomodation was 3800 Dollar, room was ok, bed
 was ok, brakfast was good, beverage in the evening was to full if you come after 18.00 it was difficult to get a place to sit, barthroom was dirthy.... we stayed for 25.12.19- 1.1.20
Persomal was kind and friendly

title: Stay at Westhouse
text: Good location bad value for Money comparing to other hotels in the area which are 5*Star and include facilties. No dining facilities or room service available. Room was a deluxe but was quite small and traffic was very loud due to the location

title: Review on Westhouse Hotel
text: I can only recommend staying in this hotel. The room was amazing, really comfortable bed, well furnished room and a good variety of food during breakfast. The staff especially Tarik was really polite and friendly. He is really professional and is going to help with everything. I only stayed two nights but this was probably the first time that I fully liked a hotel and it’s totally worth staying here. Side information: Choose the room with the Times Square view!!

title: Spend your money elsewhere.
text:
First off, I am basing this review on the fact that this property is advertised all over as a "5-star property; quintessential luxury", so keep that in mind as I write this.

To disclaim, the booking agent had nothing to do with this other than showing me the property in a list.  I had full cognition and chose a property that wasn't discounted with their specials, etc.  

This is all on me.

I had no issues with the check-in process, and I have no issues with the staff whatsoever.  So, as far as the rest is about to unfold, the actual people I interacted with were nothing but pleasant.

The room I booked was a luxury king with the typical amenities at around 550 USD per night.  Upon arrival to the room, I had to rush to the climate control and correct the temperature as the ambient range was around 85F.  I quickly kicked on the unit and started unpacking for the week I planned to stay.

I left shortly after to grab dinner in the city and begin my vacation.  I was out of the room for around 6 hours.  When I returned, thinking my early-addressing of the climate would resolve the stagnant hell it was before, I was pretty far from the reality.  The room remained around 84-85F, even having the system unit circulating air in the 300 square-foot unit for several hours.

Naturally, I phone the concierge around 12am local time and ask what was up with the air in the room.  They were quick to reply that they kick the entire system off for the season.  Makes sense, but let's remember, 5-star facility.  Their solution was to have us open a window.  A window, by the way, that faced a brick atrium with scaffolding and maintenance ropes dangling about.  Not the best view for a 5-star facility.  

To sum up, the solution wasn't helping in the least.  There was no outside circulation of air due to the closed-off atrium that barely saw sunlight, much less a puff of air.  The remainder of the stay maintained around an 80F average, with the single window wide open 24 hours a day in a city that was around 45F outside.  

Moving on, housekeeping.  I'm not one to demand a room be turned over every morning.  It's a personal preference to not have staff knocking on my door in the early morning, as I like to sleep in.  So, I wait a few days then crank over the sign.  I had to hunt down a housekeeper when I left in the morning to make sure they knew I was out and could turn the room.

I was out for the entire day, forgetting about the room entirely, until I made my return.  When I arrived back, the room was...turned, in a sense, but in a more hilarious, half-assed way one would expect a child to do while trying to make the best mark for a parent's approval.  The bed was partially made, the pillows and accent blankets for the bed were mashed into a ball and stuffed into the chair next to the bedside.  50% of the pillows had the covers removed entirely.  Not sure what happened there.

The bathroom was hastily wiped down, and dirty towels discarded and replaced.  Haphazardly-folded and tossed under the sink. The bathroom tissue was not restocked and the shampoos and soaps were not replaced.  Not even sure the shower was looked at.

I know whoever reading this is wondering where the actual issues are, but again, refer to the opening statements.  "5-star", "luxury", "550 USD per night".  These highlights of a place makes one think there is more to it than one I expected. 

To compare a bit, I left this facility and continued my trip at The Plaza hotel, which is actually a luxury facility and it showed in every regard to what I was paying for the room.  We had a butler!  Come on, WestHouse.

I don't want remuneration, or an apology from them, I just want people to understand where their money goes at this establishment.

I recommend to anyone reading this, stay elsewhere.  If you're spending the cash, there are way better places that will spend it right.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel centrally located near Central Park.
text: Recommended by an acquaintance, the Westhouse hotel is a gem. The location is excellent - so easy to walk to Times Square, Central Park, Lincoln Centre, Carnegie Hall, the MOMA, Rockefeller Centre, Nordstrom, etc... and there is a subway stop just outside the front door! Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the closet was large enough to accommodate most of our clothes, pretty good for a NY hotel. My only complaint is insufficient counter space in the bathroom - where am I supposed to put all of my toiletries? The resort fee provides daily breakfast and happy hour drinks and snacks - more than enough to provide sustenance for most of the day. The bar is great too. But what most impressed me is the staff - they were friendly, gracious, and helpful. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Un bel emplacement
text: Un hôtel vraiment bien situé (proche de Times Square et de Central Park), une déco très sympa mais des chambres et salles de bain petites pour un voyage en famille. Le service n’est pas toujours à la hauteur de cette catégorie d’hôtel, le petit dej et l’encas proposé en soirée sont très classiques et pas forcément d’une grande qualité.

title: Would book again if there was a discount.
text: Great location for an average stay in New York. Walking distance to everything. Would not recommend if you will be staying for any kind of special occasion. We didn't get to go but they do offer complimentary breakfast and happy hour every day.

title: Great time at West House Hotel
text: My family and I stayed at this hotel several times and every time we come back we are blown away how amazingly this hotel is run. The staff is so friendly and professional. We love the continental breakfast every morning. Thank you The WestHouse hotel for making our vacation extra special.

title: New Years stay
text: Absolutely amazing hotel!! It is the  Perfect place to stay when visiting New York to be centralized for shopping and visiting time square.  Juan and Ashley are absolutely amazing!! They are always helpful and  very pleasant.

title: Great Hotel
text:
I stay in WestHause Hotel many times and recommended to all my friends they all come back ..Nice Hotel very cleen room ,
Fast service always help with choices of restaurants, Broadway show...
Front desk associate are very knowledgeable...
Close to everywhere...
Great shopping around...
You’re jus in the middle of the city!!!!!!
Thank you!!!🙏
Can’t wait to be back!!!

title: Great Stay
text: Had a great stay again...as always. The hotel has very clean rooms offers great service, very competitive pricing and is at a great convenient location. Many great restaurants and Broadway nearby.... Highly recommended!

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
As always, we enjoyed our stay at the West House. This was our 5th trip this year in NYC and whenever we visit the city, we always stay at this great hotel. The rooms are spacious for NY, clean and has everything we needed. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. We always love the breakfast! Make sure to check it out before you start your day. The location was outstanding!!! 

We are planning to visit New York in 2020 and for sure we will stay at this hotel again! Thank you WestHouse!

title: 2nd stay still as good as 1st
text:
We stayed here in Dec 18 and as we enjoyed it so much we returned again this Christmas 19-23rd
Again as last year could not find a fault and im sure we will be returning for another pre Christmas stay in 2020

title: Location Location Location--- A Top Notch Place to Stay!
text:
WestHouse Hotel is a unique property well situated near the following; Central Park, Time Square, Theatre District, and notable restaurants. There is a feeling about this place upon entering, a great vibe. The hotel was vibrant.  Below outlines my contacts during my first stay. 
Mr. Tarick Boukhari welcomed me at the check-in.  He was friendly, professional, and eager to help. Later I met Vanessa/ front desk who was as complimentary, a winning team.
The room/ensuite was ample, clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable with wrinkle-free sheets. The attendants come twice a day. Breakfast and the hotel's Happy Hour seemed similar to the ones I've been to at the Ritz Carlton, Fairmont, and Four Seasons properties with a wide variety of delicious food and drink. The buffets were constantly monitored for fullness and had a very attentive wait staff. This was a pleasant surprise! 
Shawn Harris, the Chef Concierge, is very knowledgeable. He'll help you with directions and reservations for a variety of outings. Shawn is professional and genuinely interested in making the most of your stay in the "Big Apple."
Allie De Gaetano/Front Office Manager, I met while visiting the concierge desk welcoming me.
I enjoyed my stay at this property selected by my travel service for its’ proximity mentioned above. I and saw "Frozen," and walked to and through Central Park." 
*Note, I used Magellan Luxury Hotel Services for my reservations, (866) 784-6726, ext. 6127, Chrystal. Please share Deb sent you.

title: For pleasure-son’s wedding and Xmas visit.
text:
This my third time staying at this hotel since October of this year. 
The staff is extraordinarily polite, and very service oriented. They will work hard to meet your every request. 
The rooms are immaculate, the bed linen very nice. 
Found the complementary breakfast and happy hour to be both very pleasant. 
I do think Westhouse is a little treasure in Manhattan’s congested hotel skyline. 
I truly recommend  anyone to stay here.

title: Great hotel!
text: Great location near midtown NYC - by all the holiday attractions!! Friendly and helpful staff- smoooth check in and check out! Answered all my questions. Clean and spacious room- will definitely be back next year !

title: AMAZING Hotel!
text: Westhouse was the best hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC. Every single staff member was extremely accommodating and friendly. Their location is absolutely perfect and central to everything in the city. I will never stay anywhere else in NYC!!!

title: Lovely hotel- great service, great location
text: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite.  It was roomy, comfortable, and clean.  The breakfast was delicious.  The hotel itself is a little gem in the city, not boutique, but not a massive hotel, either.  Sweet lobby, and really great service.  The manager Juan Vargas went above and beyond to provide excellent service.  He took care of us like we were guests at his own home.  Highly recommend.  Would return.

title: Westhouse 2019
text: Excellent service. Fantastic location. We have stayed multiple times and so have our friends. We will only stay at the westhouse - it is unparalleled. The staff is amazing. The hotel is beautiful. Thank you

title: Vacaciones en NY
text: Hotel excelentemente ubicado, a 5 min de Tines Square. Habitaciones amplias y limpias. Desayunamos en el hotel y es correcto aunque el comedor es pequeño en época vacacional. El personal correcto aunque no demasiado servicial.

title: Definitely not 5 star - don’t let photos fool you
text: I booked to stay in the WestHouse for a 4 night stay with my mum for Christmas (20-24th December). I booked through lastminute.com and by the looks of things on there it was a stunning, luxurious 5 star hotel. I was so excited to treat my mum to this luxury experience. It was NOTHING like the photos. We arrived in the taxi and thought we had arrived to a wrong location. The entire building was covered from bottom to top in scaffolding and you couldn’t even read the WestHouse sign. The lobby was small and one thing about this hotel is that there is such poor lighting! The lobby was quiet and dark with no sense of Christmassy feel or ambience. No doorman or friendly service from anyone on front desk. They seem bored and are just doing the bare minimum. I was very disappointed with the severe lack of Christmas decorations as that was one of the reasons I booked the hotel! On the website and on their Instagram, they talk about all things festive and how they have “decked the halls” however their idea of this is a 4 foot tree in the lobby and a couple of plain wreaths on the window behind the curtains. Very disappointed after I was so looking forward to staying here. The first thing the lady said on check in was “can I have your ID and credit card” and then proceeded to demand $500 dollars for a “resident fee”! I had paid everything upfront before arrival so this was a complete shock to us. I didn’t see this advertised anywhere during booking and thankfully the receptionist waived the fee but this was not a great start. We were also asked to pay $250 for incidentals (which we would get back at check out but are still yet to receive). We then went up to our room and it was barely 3 star at the most. The room was small and again really dark. Everything was old and chipped and all the fixtures were wonky. There is no room service, mini bar, robe or slippers and our “city view” that we were promised was a literal brick wall! So disappointing. USB plugs and lamps don’t work either. It was however clean so can’t complain on that front. Breakfast was good with a good selection of fruit, continental and “hot” food (which was not hot as there is no kitchen on site and the food is transported from a nearby hotel!). Also not enough seating for all the residents or room to move around and serve your food. No decorations in this part of the hotel either. This is not a 5 star hotel and I would not stay here again. The only good thing was the choice of fruit at breakfast.

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS - please read to the end.
text:
I stayed here in September with my Mum after booking via a 3rd party website (Voyage Privé.)
I paid for the room in advance, checked in no problem and had a nice stay.

Now, 3 months down the line my credit card has been charged £900+ by the hotel for no apparent reason - no receipt, no email and no authorisation from myself. 

I emailed the hotel 6 times over a period of 3 days and it was only when I threatened them with a bad review that they replied. The reply I got was “Voyage Privé haven’t paid us so contact them.” 

How appalling! No care or explanation given. No attempts to rectify the situation. All the responsibility put onto me - despite me keeping up my end of the contract and paying in full prior to arrival. 

I have since been in contact with Voyage Privé who have sent receipts of payment. This is still in dispute but the way in which the hotel has managed it has been nothing less than distrusting. 

***if you have already booked to stay here, please use a credit card for payment and on arrival - then you have some security if this happens to you.***

title: Great hotel with high level of survice
text: The perfect place to stay in NYC center if you want to be close to everything and sleep well. The happy hour "apero" is what you need after shopping. I strongly recommend this hotel and will book it next time I come back to NYC.

title: Great Find
text: Great CLEAN room and very comfy. Location is perfect in midtown. Couple blocks from park and Times Square. Subway was literally 20 steps out the front door. Would stay here again for sure. People might complaint about rooms being to small - welcome to NYC LOL.

title: great location and comfortable hotel
text:
Lovely hotel with very helpful staff. Very good breakfast and really enjoyed the indulgence hour in the evening which provides a light dinner and unlimited drinks - can get busy though!
Perfect location to explore NYC and would definitely recommend staying.

title: 5 star Managment
text: I stay here often for business as it is centrally located and the breakfast and happy hour are amazing.   It’s more like a full dinner and great quality food!   This time there was a little hiccup at check in as it’s the holiday season and it was overwhelmingly busy.   Juan and Allie took such great care of me that anything that went wrong was instantly right.  They remembered me throughout my stay and made me feel as if it was my home.   I highly recommend this property and it’s amazing Managament team :)

title: A little Oasis in busy Manhattan
text: The Hotel is a little older but everything was in a good condition. Service was very good. The Club with food and the free drinks is just wonderful. The Hotel is really a quiet oasis in that loud city

title: Terrible
text:
It’s totally ridiculous that you can’t pay with a card or charge to your room a bar service. It’s their day and i had a drink session with a client who is staying here and we could not put anything on the room!
So silly.

title: Great place and location
text: You can always count on a great location, great service from everyone with the only situation that AC units do not properly work. They are doing some renovations on the lobby and bar and we couldn't use facilities. Bar on connecting hotel, it was closed also, so we were not able to stay on property and had to leave to a different one to continue our meeting and dinner.

title: Amazing service
text: It was a amazing time out there. Great service and quick response time when needed help. Staff is very friendly and Extremely helpful. So glad I was able to enjoy my time there with my family. Keep up the good work everyone!

title: Superb Hotel and Staff
text: Can’t fault this hotel or the staff. We stayed three nights there while visiting NYC. Very central which  we found very handy. We’d pop back during the day just to have warm up, regroup and have a coffee. The staff were extremely accommodating. Breakfast was very good, coffee, tea and soft drinks served all day FOC. There was also food, wine and beer served in the evening which was also FOC. We’re not massive eaters but we ate there all the time and avoided the crazy prices charged in the NYC eateries. Being so central was also so very handy. Three blocks to Central Park, just up from Times Square, easy walk to and Penn Station with your suit case. There’s also a tube station right outside the from door although we just walked everywhere or took the bus to go farther away. Really can’t fault this hotel and I would rate it as one of the best I’ve ever stayed in and having travelled extensively that’s a big statement.

title: Amazing hotel in a great location
text:
This is my 3rd visit to NYC and this is by far the best hotel that we have stayed in. The decor and furniture is very chic.  The rooms are of a good size and the bed is super comfy.  It's also in a great location.  The staff are friendly and incredibly helpful.  

The breakfast is worthwhile with lots of choice and really great coffee.  The indulgence hours (5-7pm) include a hot dish, cooked vegetables, cheeses/meats etc and wine, beer and champagne.  It was a great way to unwind for an hour or so before heading out.  You can also easily make a meal out of it, particularly if you are heading to a show and struggling on time.

Overall, this is a super boutique hotel and we will definitely be staying again.

title: Amazing experience, incredible hotel!
text:
I stayed here for business last week - had tons of midtown meetings and appointments so the location was perfect. 

The lobby is so nice, not overwhelming when you come in but so welcoming.  I love the vibe.  The staff jumped to my assistance, offered me water, walked me through my reservation and other room types available.

I got right into my room and WOW it was so so cool.  I love the design.  The bed was so comfortable and the space was surprising large for a  king room.  I worked in there all morning and then took some calls in the lobby area which had so much space to work.   

I even ordered in take out while in the lobby and the front desk agents took care of me from start to finish. 

I will stay here again and again.  It was perfect for hair appts, nails, bars, and some clothing shops, etc. too!!

great job management team!

title: Incredible Hotel! Incredible Service!
text:
I stayed here recently and OH MY GOD I'M IN LOVE! It feels so chic and "NYC" when you walk in, the front desk team was amazing! The entire experience from start to finish was awesome!

Great check in process, super accommodating kind lovely front desk team, the seating area in the lobby was so warm and inviting and the music was fantastic!

I stayed in an awesome room, king bed, so nice!! GREAT shower, GREAT bed, GREAT design, and GREAT artwork, I loved it all!!

The room was SO SO SO clean and the housekeeping staff were the kindest!  They went out of their way to say hello!! Everyone was so nice, customer service was amazing!

I loved the whole experience - I will be back every time I can be!!

title: Xmas in the city
text: Clean, well appointed room in a great location. Conveniently located within a short walk of Rockefeller Center and Fifth Avenue shopping. Great ambiance, friendly, helpful staff! Will return for sure!

title: lousy hotel
text: While I wanted to love this hotel I can't say many good things. I will not return. Reservation canceled on me after checking in. Put in tiny room. Lousy mattresses. Guest service manager not helpful. Not a five star hotel at all. I would rate them as 3 star

title: Beautiful hotel
text:
Merci à toutes l’équipe pour l’accueil, plus précisément à Tarek qui a été de très bon conseil et d’une aide précieuse.
Il a su répondre présent à toutes nos demandes grâce à son français, anglais et arabe 
Merci pour tout magnifique séjour

title: Exceptional hotel and customer service
text: Beautiful hotel! Perfect location! Exceptional customer service! Close to everything you need. Clean room and beautiful decor. Food was delicious and the check in/check out hours are perfect for traveling.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
What can we say,  my husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and it was fabulous from beginning to end. The gentleman at reception Tarik was very helpful and pleasant and always made you feel welcome as you came and went from the hotel.  The room was lovely and clean and cleaned with fresh towels etc everyday. Breakfast in the morning was great had a very good choice to set you up for the day.  But what really made this hotel was all the staff, every single member of staff we spoke to was so lovely and always made time to speak to you in particular we would like to mention Rafael our barman, what a guy,,, we have travelled many many places and he has stood out to be one of the best and nicest people we have came across while staying at hotels.  The ‘happy hour’ from 5pm to 7pm for us was fantastic, it gave us a chance to put our feet up and have a few drinks and recharge our batteries before heading out in the city each evening. We cannot fault this hotel in any way and it’s location was fabulous. We met so lovely people while on our travels.
We are currently looking at booking to stay again next year and bring our two boys. (Can you recommend what type of room we would need for 2 adults, 12 year old and 16 year old).
Ann and Thomas

title: Seriously disappointing and a rip off
text: I normally stay at the Waldorf which was unfortunately closed. Got a special “no cancellation” deal of $1400 for two nights in a Deluxe King room. Arrived early and asked for early check-in - none available. When We eventually got to the Deluxe King room it was TINY and had no view at all (different to what was sold). Looked down into a brick hole with no sunlight. No minibar. A tiny bathroom with a passage with three doors opening onto one another. On Saturday we returned at 1140pm only to find the room had not been cleaned at all - bed not made, no fresh towels. We had no choice but to go out again across the street and only had a fresh room at 1am. No apology. Left on Sunday morning feeing ripped off, only to arrive home and see another almost $300 charge for levies etc. Rather stay with a big name proper 5 star. This was a crappy and disappointing experience on what was supposed to be a WOW trip. Oh and the “automated” texts of I am xxx and wanted to check how things are - only lip service. The USB plugs don’t work in the room - we reported this and was told someone would be right up. Must be the same people who were supposed to clean the room as we are still waiting!

title: Unhappy Guest
text:
s for help and no one helped. Felt like Motel 6. Not sure why you would allow this. I would like to comeback to your hotel in the future and resolve this bad experience. Being Corp America and my travel would in the long run benefit your establishment. As you know people talk and share bad experiences more than sharing good comments. Being in customer servixe myself I could not imagine such behavior! My training consist of Walt Disney, The Ritz Hotel, and Nordstrom’s who all has proven without happy customers our company’s will not grow. I hope to hear from you and change my perception of your establishment. Thank you for your time, Happy Holidays
Jerry Snyder

title: Never again
text: Disappointing on all fronts. Woefully understaffed & way too expensive for the limited service. I tried twice to go to the bar to get a drink & was never able to bc either no one was there or such a long wait. Ridiculous

title: Love this Hotel!
text: The WestHouse Hotel is a great place to stay when visiting New York City. The staff are friendly and efficient. The accommodations are comfortable and clean. The breakfast is a very nice way to start the day and the evening food service is plenty to consider a meal.

title: Feels like home away from home
text:
There is a sense of personal treatment here from arrival and during the entire stay. 
The morning and evening food and beverage offerings and service in the Terrace is excellent. The breakfast has an excellent variety and the evening selections provide an excellent light dinner. 
Subway access is outside the front door. Walking distance to Times Square/theatres and MOMA.
Close to Central Park.
The staff including senior staff will help out when unexpected situations arise as much as they can.

title: Gala
text: I stayed here to attend a Gala nearby.  Very nice hotel.  My room was a little warm, but my friends that also had rooms did not have that problem.  It was centrally located and within walking distance to my attractions.  Great breakfast in the morning!

title: Long weekend
text:
A really well located boutique hotel, it's in walking distance from Time square, 5th Avenue, Central park, Rockefeller center and Columbus Circle to name a few(saved us loads of money on cabs and also time)  We were able to cover all of the above in one day on foot.
It was close enough to the attraction so you were in the thick of it all, but far enough for it not to be too busy/crowded.
The breakfast at the hotel is the largest but it's surrounded by loads of delis and coffee shops so plenty of cheap eats a few mins away.  The Hotel also offered afternoon drinks which was a nice way to meet other visitors.
Was a breath of fresh air and nicer then the larger hotels, would be suitable for couples and families with young children.

title: Gem in the heart of Manhattan
text: Small boutique hotel with so much charm and character. WestHouse is perfectly located to allow one to walk to all the major sights or use transit to hit all of Manhattan.  The breakfast buffet and early evening food fare with drinks was an unexpected treat, especially after a day of walking around town.

title: Exceptional stay
text:
This is my second stay at the WestHouse NY and as usual flawless and exceptional ! The room was spotless and what makes this property different than other hotels is the staff! From the minute you enter they welcome you not as a guest but as you are coming back home.
The breakfast buffet is very good and the evening complementary drinks and food just great.
I will definitely come back and recommended the WestHouse to anyone staying in NY!

title: Bra läge
text: Perfekt läge, trevlig personal. Rum med stadsutsikt, nja.. såg mest byggnadsställningar som ingen informerat oss om. Saknades en del saker på rummet, badrockar tex.( var med på rumsbeskrivningen). Trots detta, kan jag varmt rekommendera hotellet. Extra plus till frukost/lounge personalen.

title: Fantastic Hospitality!
text: This was an incredible hotel! Besides the great space and amenities, the staff was among the most hospitality-minded I've encountered in New York. After becoming ill, the staff rallied to help me, bringing me crackers and gatorade and checking in on me from time to time. They went above and beyond to make my stay wonderful, despite being sick! Bravo team!

title: AWESOME HOTEL!!!
text:
I stayed for Business last night and then loved the hotel so much I decided to work in the lobby all day today and it was so great! The staff was so lovely and hospitable - it was calm peaceful and beautiful inside the lobby area. There were many conveniences like outlets and tables and places to spread out and get a lot of work done. 

The room was gorgeous!  the bed was so comfortable I had trouble getting out of it! 

The shower design was so cool the water pressure was perfect and a little thing to some but a big thing to me - I really liked the shampoo and conditioner and a blow dryer was very powerful and good! Room was SPOTLESS. Stylish design! 

The staff from start to finish was so lovely the hotel is beautiful clean and impeccable shape I highly recommend staying here on any trip to New York City! 

Very intimate boutique feeling great music in the lobby and super nice staff!

title: Personnel make the difference
text: During our stay there was kindness on all occasions but especially from our experience with housekeeping.  Bebe Ishamel was especially caring and kind in being sure that our needs were met.  It was not a job to her; but an opportunity to serve.  We appreciate that so very much.  The only problem was the extreme perfume smell in the front desk area.  I had to not breathe as much as possible in walking through due to an allergy to perfume in general but this was way beyond a pleasant scent.  Overpowering!

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price, Huge Room
text: My wife and I stayed at the WestHouse for 6 wonderful nights. It’s very reasonably priced for a hotel of this caliber. The room was excellent. Very spacious (huge), great bed, very clean. The bathroom was also very large and nicely done. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a few drinks at the bar and both bartenders were fun. The bar itself is very cool. There’s a “resident fee” of $49 (plus annoying NYC taxes) per person per day. For that you get bottled water in the room and a nice breakfast and an afternoon Happy Hour with nice wines and light food. The only issue was that the USB ports didn’t work. We called the Front Desk, but, as it was a weekend??, they couldn’t get it fixed. I sent an email to Petr Jurecka, the hotel manager, and he responded promptly, even on Sunday night. The next morning, bright and early, Petr personally took care of the issue. He’s a great guy. I highly recommend the WestHouse Hotel and we will be back next time we’re in NYC. Thanks Petr!

title: Not a five star
text:
The breakfast at this hotel is a joke for anybody who is vegan or has gluten-free restrictions. The staff in the breakfast area is discourteous and seemed mostly uninterested in their jobs. The room was cramped, no sufficient closet space. 
On a positive note, the room was clean, housekeeping and front desk seemed nice.

title: I would go back.  That's saying somethig!
text: Arrived ahead of my two traveling companions, one of whom was a very hip lady, who just happened to be celebrating her 90th birthday.  Arrived to a hotel covered in scaffolding.  I panicked, as my companions are very particular women.  Ashley at the front desk made sure we had rooms with unobstructed views and upgraded our birthday girl to a junior suite.  There is a elaborate spread for breakfast, with multiple American and European choices, as well an an equally fabulous early evening wine spread.  Honestly, enough food to have light "dinner" before WALKING to the theater.  The lobby bar is cozy and one night had a small jazz group.  Not too loud either!  Only negatives, was the "hipster hotel" lighting that made the public areas kinda dark.  The hotel gym was under construction, so I had to go outside to a complimentary local gym. Most unsettling of all was the "air freshener, scented candle" aroma.  My room was overwhelmed by it, and it was evident in our other rooms, as were the hallways.  Scents always make me think "what are they hiding?"  Or is it some "hipster hotel" amenity?  Take it from me WestHouse...ITS NOT NECESSARY  Ethan, the manager, had my room detoxified.  It was better, but still pretty cloying.  Overall, we were very well taken  care.  Shout outs to Ashely, David, Vanessa and Ethan.

title: My go-to hotel for New York
text: I've stayed in many hotel's in New York and they all cost a lot of money for what they are. I like the Westhouse as the rooms are spacious (rare for NY), they are well appointed, it has good facilities including the bar, and the service is great. They charge you a residents fee which includes city tax and other items, but this includes not only a fantastic breakfast, but also the ability to go into the dining room at any time and use the coffee facilities and take the drinks in the fridges. The best bit for me as a business traveller is that they'll hold your luggage on check out at the end of the day, and there is a changing facility for use so that you can get out of your suit and into something more comfortable to travel home in.

title: Hotel parfaitement situé ,permettant énormément de déplacements à pied ce qui est agréable .     éableéable .
text:
nous avions une trés belle suite ,extrémement confortable, avec vue magnifique .
La direction est à l'écoute ,et parfaitement attentive .
L'hotel posséde une terrasse qui fait suite à la salle du petit déjeuner ,qui doit surement etre trés agréable à la belle saison .

title: amazing suite and great people of westhouseq
text:
we had a 1 night stay at the westhouse hotel and loved the room we were given, 2004. the front desk staff....marcelo in the lobby bar went above and beyond to chat and make sure we were taken care of with drinks and appy's.
great staff...an essential part of a good hotel!
the hotel itself was under scaffolding, but this didn't bother us as we could still see time square perfectly.

title: Boa poção e excelente localização.
text: Já me hospedei em 04 oportunidades diferentes, mas sempre com algum tipo de sumiço no apartamento e assim deixamos de insistir. O hotel, proposta e localização são show! Sugiro não deixar nada para ser entregue no apartamento. Tem uma sobre taxa mas vale a pena.

title: Great Hotel & Awesome Staff
text: I would like to thanks: Juan Vargas for being so kind with all my family!!! Also Tarik and Carmen!!! We all have a great time; thanks to all of you!!! We appreciate it very much!!! We all love this hotel and the staff!!! See you; in our next trip to NYC!!! Thanks a lot!!! Morales & Sanchez Family!!!🥰

title: Très bon séjour
text:
Hôtel très bien placé (entre central Park et times square). Service et prestation de grande qualité. Personnel à l'écoute et bienveillant.
La chambre était belle et confortable. Malheureusement, un échafaudage est placé pour le moment sur l'immeuble ce qui gachait la vue mais sinon elle est très belle. 
Très bonne expérience

title: Great location, Great Hotel
text: Would stay again. Rooms were very comfortable, quiet and clean. Staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Hotel was really well located - close to the subway stations but easy to get around to many places on foot. Would recommend a stay at the WestHouse!

title: WestHouse Hotel NYC
text: Always a wonderful stay. Wonderful staff clean rooms and excellent amenities such as breakfast tea and evening hors d’oeuvres. Close to shopping and subway for easy access. Personally I find this to be one of the best places to stay in New York.

title: Good NYC hotel and good location
text: The hotel is conveniently located in Midtown --and has a nice bar area. We really enjoyed the 23 floor food and beverages. We will stay here again. The negatives were: Lots of outside noise--NYC is loud at night. Walls are a bit thin--so easy to hear neighbor's if they are noisy. We did have a HVAC problem in one of the 4 rooms---which was resolved the following day. Staff is friendly.

title: Home Away From Home
text: WestHouse is a beautiful property with stylish rooms and perfect views of midtown Manhattan. But what stands out is the exceptional service and hospitality. Juan is outstanding and we appreciate so much the amenities he provided for our stay! Nick and Mo made our check-in seamless. Jesey is so lovely, we love Jesey! We enjoyed our conversations with him, what a great guy! We look forward to another staycation soon!

title: Tremendous find in NYC
text:
This was by far the best hotel experience in NYC for sometime. Very welcoming and perfect location.
The ambiance of the breakfast room and bar area were very conducive to relaxing and socializing. Will definitely have no hesitation in recommending. The staff from front desk to room services were outstanding.

title: Great hotel
text: Only thing I could fault were pillows and too much scent in communal areas. Other than that, hotel was awesome, the location was excellent and the service was very good. I would definitely stay here again

title: Not great. Not terrible.
text: I had high hopes for the Westhouse. I was travelling for work and brought my family with me. Got a suite. Room was extremely dark. Finishes were clearly aging. Nasty construction on all the balconies so the blinds have to be closed 8am-5pm. Staff not super professional. Ugly cleaning trollies line the hallways all the time. The one thing we did appreciate was the breakfast and snacks available for $50pp per night. Better options in nyc.

title: Excellent experience at Westhouse
text: I was happy with every aspect of my stay at Westhouse.  The staff was friendly and attentive.  The breakfast was outstanding.  The room was large and spotless.  The location of the hotel was perfect for my purposes.  I'm looking forward to another visit, soon.

title: Good Recommendation by our DialAFlight organiser Harvey
text: Great location between Central Park and Times Square and very close to a subway station. Rooms smallish but fine with good facilities. Front desk staff and concierge (especially Tom) very helpful. Breakfast very good and happy hour (2 hours) great - but both paid for in a fairly high compulsory charge but we felt this was reasonable value for money. My only gripe was up to 4 housekeeping trolleys stored in the corridors of our floor. This did not look good for a quality hotel

title: Slept like a baby
text:
Stayed in room 2511 and loved it! 
From the moment I walked in, to checking out, the entire process was flawless. 
Staff were super friendly, even the cleaning ladies had a smile on their faces. 
The room was very nice and cozy. 
In room air con was sooo quiet, I slept like a baby.  
The Terrace had an amazing happy hour selection, and the breakfast had a good variety. Definitely worth the $50. 

I have already recommended this hotel to my over seas friends, specifically this room. Do yourself a favor and stay here. You will not regret it.

title: Autumn in NYC
text: wonderful staff.  very solicitous and caring.  nice people staying there that we met.  great views from the room of Broadway and Carnegie Hall. They are responsive to all requests and continually check to make sure our experience is the best.

title: Our House Away From Home
text: WestHouse lived up to its reputation: from the beautiful marble floors and convenient location to the hours of indulgence and friendly staff...my daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed a long, relaxing Veteran's Day weekend together. We look forward to next time!

title: Wonderful time at WestHouse!
text: WestHouse is a beautifully appointed charming hotel!  The staff is helpful and friendly.  I greatly enjoyed the amenities such as morning and early evening meals and cocktails, complimentary bottled water in the room and the comfortable den off the lobby.  I have stayed at WestHouse twice now and will do so again next time I visit NYC.

title: S U P E R B
text:
Unprecedented hospitality, service, location and breakfast spread. We couldn’t have asked for anything more. Ashley, at the front desk, made our trip such a memorable experience. 
Many thanks, Olivia & Dave.

title: Great start to our new York trip
text:
My wife and I just checked in.  Juan and Vanessa were very pleasant and helpful. Our room in clean and comfortable.  There are plenty of pillows and towels.
Looking forward to the amazing breakfast tomorrow

title: Wonderful Stay
text: The WestHouse Hotel could not be in a more perfect location! Just a few blocks away from Central Park - Times Square and the Theater District. Plus, the service we received from staff was excellent. We are pleased with our choice and would stay again!

title: Short Getaway
text: Excellent breakfasts and dinners. Hotel service was a bit slow (had to call twice for bags to be brought to room), room amenities weren't prepared (had to call for robes, no hair straighteners available as advertised). Excellent location (safe area, close to two subway stations, close to Carnegie Hall).

title: The best
text: One of the most welcoming hotel stay I have ever had in New York. From when I first arrived and throughout my stay I did not have one single area of concern. I Will only be using this hotel going forward on my future trips to New York.

title: Average Hotel Not Luxury Experience
text: The hotel has a great location near Central Park and convenient for shopping and dining. There is no restaurant and a bar with minimal hours. While there is a 'complementary breakfast', you will pay $49 per person, per night as a residence fee with no other amenities.  Rooms were small and the hotel seemed understaffed.

title: End of cruise stay over extension
text:
Arrived in New York after a Regent Seven Seas Cruise from Amsterdam, via Orkneys, Faeroes, Iceland, Greenland, NovaScotia, Boston, Martha’s Vineyard. Chose the WestHouse of almost 1500 in the general area without any prior knowledge. The area seemed good, close to Central Park, close to TimeSquare, and other usual tourist sites.
We had a large room on 25th floor which we were able to go straight into at 9:30 am having just disembarked the cruise ship that morning, - a welcome surprise, which was added to when we were invited to enjoy a coffee and complimentary breakfast (not that it was needed!). Having settled in the room we returned to the lobby to make enquiries about the area as we had plans for visits to sites and restaurants and was given great advice by the resident concierge who provided us with a map, arranged tickets, sorted a 3 day bus pass, and river sightseeing trip. He was great. The lobby area also had a lounge bar area- more later. The 23rd floor had a club area which served as the breakfast area, and also the place for a very nice complimentary early supper with drinks. The breakfasts were good, a self service selection with hot options, cold options fruit & cereals and yet, probably brought in, as I was not aware of any adjacent kitchen area. We spent most days and evenings out doing the usual sightseeing and visits to theatre land, and restaurants etc, returning to the hotel mid to late evening and the lounge bar which on one night had a live music trio with some easy to listen background numbers. The bar staff were excellent speaking both English and Spanish. 

For a first visit to USA this was a very good introduction and I would recommend this as a mid range hospitable hotel with excellent service in a very competitive area of New York

title: 50 in New York
text:
Perfect location and family style hotel for holiday with family.
In case of renovation works in progress the hotel doesn't advise guests in advance, so better to check personally before arrive.
Top free hour cocktail in the evening complimentary.
Best experience in new York

title: Business Trip
text: The hotel has an excellent location. Check in desk is small but was seen to fairly promptly. The room was fairly comfortable - although the air con didnt work, but they did provide me with an additional fan which worked great. There is a gym in the hotel but did not get time to use it,  The main negative is the breakfast room - for the size of the hotel it is very busy so at times you have to queue before getting a table (if you are lucky) or eating breakfast on your lap on a sofa.

title: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Stay
text: I've stayed several times at the WestHouse and have always enjoyed its location, its friendly and gracious staff, and Old World feel. (This is accentuated by the fact that most of the clientele, at least on my visits, are from overseas and from Europe in particular.) This time I stayed in a one bedroom suite which brought me the best of both worlds-- the size of an American room and the amenities of the European side. The breakfast is very good and welcome, the facilities are constantly upgraded, and there is nothing not to like (unless, perhaps, you are arriving with and keeping a car, in which case things will be more complicated). Vanessa at the front desk was especially helpful on this visit and all of the staff are helpful without being intrusive. A terrific hotel and a good value as well.

title: Loved the Terrace
text: The Terrace is lounge at the WestHouse Hotel where you have breakfast (simply outstanding; scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, meats, cheeses, yogurt parfait, fresh juices, coffees, teas, bagels, pastries) and drinks and appetizers.  Both offerings incredible tasty and plentiful.  A great value!

title: Mrs
text:
Very nice hotel with comfy beds, helpful staff and a delicious breakfast and afternoon food and drinks between 17-19.
I would give this hotel a better review BUT 
- the very cosy breakfastroom is too small
- the music in the breakfastroom is too loud. I love music but it is the start of the day not an After Work. 
- the cleaningstaff did knock but asked to come to start cleaning before 9 am - Every Day

title: Awesome Spot, great staff!
text: Stayed here several times, always found the venue and staff great! Notable was Marcelo during the daily happy hours and attending the bar in the late nights. Will return again for sure and recommend to others.

title: Great sttay
text: went with family and friends for the weekend and had a great stay!  The staff was very friendly, room was comfortable and location great  Loved the breakfast and afternoon cocktails and snacks.  We will continue to stay at the Westhouse

title: "Hours of Indulgence"
text: The staff and service at the WestHouse Hotel were excellent. The "Hours of Indulgence" happy hour was enjoyable and The Terrace a great place to relax after a busy day. Breakfast in the Terrace offered a good variety to choose from and the staff there kept the food fresh and topped up. It seemed that all the staff, the front desk, housekeeping and valets, were happy in their job which made the experience that much more pleasant.

title: NYC Adventure
text: Location is great, close to the subway and to various site seeing locations. I do not think this should be classified as a 5 star hotel, room was dirty when we arrived and not cleaned well on subsequent days.

title: Great hotel, with excellent service and location
text:
I stayed 5 nights here last week and it was a lovely stay. The hotel has great location and service. I would like to thank Allie from the reception, who was very kind and did her best to help me, when I had a special request. 
Also the lounge in the afternoon and the breakfast were an added value

title: Hotel in need of updating
text:
With a crack in the bathroom sink and the grout corroded in the shower drain, the bathroom needed attention. The AC needed repair. Construction outside each morning...drilling and hammering. The first night some type of insect bit both of us, but that did get resolved. 

Upon check in, we were informed of a $125 per night damages surcharge, which would be refunded upon departure. Upon questioning, we were told that fee would be waived and just a flat $250  would be charged. Further questions with not clear explanation given. That said, at checkout there was no surcharge for damages on the bill, leaving us perplexed.

title: Terrible, the most horrible beds, mattress very soft
text:
I expected much more from a hotel like this. We got two rooms, the beds were terrible, the rooms very nosy, before 6am a lot of noise from upstairs 
The breakfast very poor, the dinning room very small, you have yo wait for a table. 
The gym was out of service, they sent you to one outside the hotel.
Even the daily fee of $53 USD could be fair for NY, is not worth without gym and a poor breakfast.

title: Welcomed back
text: You are doing a fantastic job. Keep up the good work.. We had a fantastic time. We are looking forward to coming again and spending time at your hotel. The staff was great and took care of us right down to the bell boy.

title: Great boutique hotel in great location
text:
Hotel was fantastic! Room was clean, staff very friendly & helpful. Location was great. Near Central Park, subway lines, Broadway shows, a whole foods grocery store, Nordstrom…
What’s the complementary breakfast & lite dinners were great! Even the wine, beer, soda & bottled water were complimentary all day long!

title: A place to come back to in NYC
text: This hotel is very well located, has good sized rooms, locks, fridge.Provides excellent breackfast and dinner for an extra fee which is totally worth it if you compare to nyc prices,  but their nicer asset it certainly their staff: well trainned, courteous and sweet.

title: View of scaffolding
text:
This review is based on what we wished we’d known before booking. The position of the Hotel, comfort of room ( apart from air con) and the majority of staff were all good.

Do not pay for a room with a view. The hotel facade is currently under renovation and all you will see out of your window will be scaffolding encased in netting. Luckily we were made aware of this through Trip Advisor reviews prior to our stay, otherwise we would have been sorely disappointed on entering our room. No notification from the Hotel concerning these building works.

The ‘residents fee’ is a huge add on, over $50 per night per adult, this added over $500 to our already substantial bill for 5 nights. The breakfast is a fair selection of hot and cold foods, but be aware the Hotel has no kitchen of its own, so ‘ hot dishes’ are transported in, therefore they are never hot, only warm at best. The evening ‘hot’ dishes were limited and whilst there we only ever saw pasta. Free wine, beer and soft drinks between 5-7, but small cakes, which would be perfect to have with a cup of tea around 5, do not appear until 6pm, which was disappointing as that is just when we arrived back from a long day sightseeing. If you intend to have this food as your evening meal and not eat out, then the residency fee would probably be more palatable. 

The dinning room becomes extremely crowded, we struggled to find a table at breakfast a couple of times.

Air conditioning seems to be hit and miss, we definitely found it hard to keep the room cool, and this is when it was only around 15c outside.

title: Venessa is Amazing
text: Second time staying at the hotel because its in a really good location and reasonably priced.  In fact I came back the second time because the front desk lady Venessa is so pleasant and helpful, one of the best check in experiences by far.  The only thing the hotel needs to get the extra star is Room service and for the house cleaning staff not to be so loud.  Overall a very good experience.

title: Trendy Hotel In Midtown
text: Very nice boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan. Upscale attractive rooms and excellent service. Complimentary breakfast and heavy appetizers in evening are nice touches. The facade was covered with scaffolding and so some interior rooms were a bit dark. Great hotel overall.

title: Not a 5 star hotel
text: This hotel is definitely not 5 star. No food, no room service, no gym ( closed), had to sleep on the floor, no heat ( space heater provided). Far better to under promise and over perform instead of what this hotel does- over promise and under perform. I feel taken advantage of

title: Excellent stay!
text:
The hotel has a very high-end vibe, with a very chic lobby that has a bar. Stayed in room 2511. Room was very clean and the AC in the room was super quiet and worked like a charm. The amenities including breakfast spread, along with happy hour was amazing! 
The location was next to the subway station which made commuting a breeze. Central Park was also walking distance which was great. Staff were very professional and I would gladly stay here again.

title: Good location, friendly staff,
text:
Good location in Manhattan, very helpful and friendly staff, comfortable beds, very clean, the Happy Hour and breakfast are great. I didn't know about the additional fee per person prior to staying. This was a surprise. 
Room was smaller than expected and bring a fan. Air conditioning is turned off and system blows heat. You will sweat all night. We stayed this past weekend, 62 outside broiling hot in the room. Opening the window helped. When I complained, they did offer to put a fan in my room. Overall, for the cost it could have been better but not bad.

title: Great Location, Needs Updating
text:
We booked this hotel on a strong recommendation. This was a trip for our sixteen year old daughter to adventure with us :). 

First of all, the lobby and customer service upon checking in was superb. The woman at the desk was very friendly and chatty. We loved that after a long traveling day. The concierge was very helpful with our questions on navigating the subway too!

The room was what was a bit disappointing. When we walked in we were so excited to see the view....
It was a view of scaffolding with obvious construction, and repairs happening, etc.  Such a bummer. We decided to overlook it and move on.  The rooms don’t have coffee makers, or other options of drinks. There were 2 complementary water bottles. The bathroom, although mostly clean, had things that looked dingy. The door (or anywhere in the bathroom) had no hook to hang towels or clothes on; it looked like it had been taken off? There were stains on the wallpaper and and other places. 

The Terrace was great and so nice when it was open. With all the activities we had planned we rarely made it back to the hotel before it closed at 9pm. So, that meant we either had to go to a restaurant to get a drink or buy one at the bar. It’s a bummer when you pay $50/day/person for the use of The Terrace. I think it would be very nice if it was open 24/7 to access the drinks and snacks that are included in that price!

**Note: the ONE day we had to actually sleep in, we were all woken up suddenly by banging, etc RIGHT outside our window by the construction workers :-((**

title: Best Service EVER!
text: We stayed at Westhouse for our wedding weekend. The hotel is beautiful and very clean. But the best part is the staff!! We told Juan why we were here and he upgraded our room and seemed to genuinely care that everything was to our liking. Can't recommend the hotel enough!

title: Long weekend at West House Hotel
text: The hotel was a pleasant surprise in busy midtown Manhattan. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The hotel was quiet and clean. The morning breakfast and evening snacks and drinks were excellent. The room was well decorated and clean with very efficient maid service. The only minor negative was the lack of space in the bathroom for storage of personal items. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect birthday weekend away in NYC
text: My husband and I stayed here for a night out in NYC for his birthday. We were so happy with our hotel choice. Tarik, the front desk agent was very helpful and super friendly at check in. We were also really surprised at how huge our room was. It was really nice and had beautiful modern decor. Our favorite part was that the hotel has a happy hour from 5-7pm on the 23rd floor with free hors d'oeuvres, beer and wine. It was a great location and was within walking distance to our show. Would highly recommend!

title: Wonderful Experience Hip but not too hip!
text: Fantastic Hotel in a great location. We don't care for those "super trendy" hotels that tend to be cold.  The Westhouse is trendy and hip but with a very warm vibe! I loved everything about this hotel!  We travel to NYC 2-3 times a year and we always stay at a different hotel for various reasons, however we have finally found our hotel!  The lobby, halls and room were all great!  I have never seen a bed made (with gorgeous linens) so beautifully!  The staff especially Alyssa at the front desk were all courteous, helpful, knowledgeable and overall the highest quality of staff in any hotel in NYC in my opinion!  Peter the GM was around constantly and called many guest by name, myself included! Wonderful experience! Cannot say enough good things about this lovely hotel!

title: Birthday trip
text: Great stay at this lovely hotel.  The hotel is very nice, old style with lots of dark wood etc.  Room was fine, again lots of dark wood fittings, very comfy bed, rather noisy air con and the bathroom, although beautifully fitted was very small - really one person at a time but the shower had plenty of hot water so not really a problem.  The breakfasts were really nice with both hot food and lots of cheeses, cold meats and delicious bowls of fresh fruit.  You could help yourself to bottles of water, coke etc. from the fridge as well as bottled water in the room each day.  The free bar in the evening 5-7 p.m. was excellent and also offered a selection of hot and cold dishes which was a surprise.  We did not find it difficult to find seating etc. apart from one evening/breakfast when a party of about 15 people had arrived for an overnight stay and we left at the start of the Columbus Day weekend when it was noticeably busy.  It was nice to be able to come back during the day and go up to the Terrace and get a cup of coffee or soft drink. The location is excellent, easy walk to Times Square, Broadway and Central Park for starters.  If we were to stay again in New YOrk we would definitely stay here again.

title: BEST HOTEL BEST LOCATION AMAZING STAFF AND SERVICE
text:
I travel to NYC at least 5 times a year on business.  I always stay at either a Ritz Carlton or a boutique hotel.  Amazing lounge on the 23rd floor.  Live jazz, a staff that gets it.  I have found a gem! 

There is a great lounge on the 23rd floor that includes breakfast and happy hour from 5-7 with great food, wine and beer.  Internet is fast.  The rooms are amazing.  It feels like a boutique, but the service is superior to most small hotels.  It may be a little bit more than a Marriott or Hilton, but it's worth every penny.  

There is a subway station on 55th that is literally 20 feet from the entrance.  It takes you to the financial district in 10 minutes.  Right to the World Trade Center. 

The Wednesday night jazz band was great.  I wound up not leaving the hotel on Wednesday and the lounge was a great time.  

This is my new place.

title: Luxury in Manhattan!
text: Wonderful stay in the middle of Manhattan. We arrived quite late. The check inn was quick and friendly. Upon our arrival there was happy hour for hotel guests at top floor cozy restaurant, what was like a hidden gem.  The rooms where very spacious, clean and nice. Although I like to stay in different places this hotel had something special what pulls you back! Thank you for amazing stay!

title: NYC Gem
text:
Having lived and worked in NYC - the westhouse Hotel is a hidden gem. gorgeous, spacious rooms, with stunning interior. Complimentary breakfast and evening drinks/light fare is the perfect touch to a NYC stay.
The service is ALWAYS impeccable - and a THANK YOU TO Vanessa - who always has service with a smile, expedites check in, and is incredibly accommodating.
For me - Westhouse is the best house and home away from home.
Location - perfect, ambiance perfect..  great staff, location, and ambiance...oh ps - jazz wednesday nights at the bar (3 piece set)... thank me later...xoxo

title: Great Hotel and Location
text:
My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights recently , we arrived and we were greeted by the friendly staff , first impression of the rooms was decent standard ..for NY the bed was amazingly comfortable, bathroom was typically small but ok to deal with , my only concern which I hope the hotel take on board was the lighting was very dark it needed an extra lamp of some sort as my wife found it difficult when doing her work etc , WiFi’s etc was spot on 

We had complimentary breakfast and happy hours (2)  in the evening which was a nice touch again just a note not much choice for non meat eaters (my wife ) but overall a lovely  experience  as when your out all day a nice drink alway goes down well . 

They had some work in the Hotel changing carpets and other stuff , generally not a problem until on our floor it became dusty and also we were woken up at 3am one night with the noise . The Hotel where very sincere and gave us a late checkout .

One note that  was a little concern  was when we asked the concierge , about suggesting a local nice Italian  or casual restaurant for a late lunch . He sent us all the way to 9 th Avenue such a distance, when we found 2 places directly opposite within 50yards away and then once we got our bearings there where many others so close to the Hotel , maybe because he was not from the area , but they need to know the local offerings . Customers like us depend on this knowledge . 

I cannot fault this Hotel otherwise ...... will definitely visit again . The Hotel was very stylish especially the seating area behind reception . All the staff from I have to say very nice and helpful .

title: Amazing Experience
text:
My wife and I booked this hotel to celebrate our 10 year anniversary in NYC. From the moment we walked into the hotel everything was impressive. The location was great, the corner of 55th and 7th so right in the middle of everything. The breakfast and Indulgence Hour were a very impressive surprise as well. 

The staff was professional and helpful, there was a member of housekeeping on the 23rd floor named Stefan who went out of his way to help us. We had some questions about the indulgence hour and a few other amenities in the building, though he was obviously in the middle of doing his normal duties, he took the time to answer all our questions and point us in the right direction. I wish you could expect that level of service everywhere you go! He made an already good afternoon great. 

I highly suggest staying here! We will again!

title: Good hotel
text:
Best hotel in Manhattan I love the room and 
Thanks for the best  in New York
 (ashley❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️)
She gave me upgrade my room  to deluxe room and included breakfast and open bar 
Ashley❤️ashley🙏🏼ashley💙

title: Like Going Home
text: Beautiful place to stay just close enough to the theatre district and Central Park to make it very walkable.  Wonderful staff who are welcoming and helpful. Complimentary food and beverages are great and very generous.  Super comfortable beds.

title: The Best Hotel with a Fabulous Location
text: Best hotel in NYC.  We loved everything about this hotel!  The rooms are a nice size and were always very clean.  The hotel is in a great location to get around the city it is steps away from the subway station.  The entire staff is extremely friendly and very helpful.  They were always going out of there way to help us with whatever our family needed. Everyone on the 23rd floor is always so helpful with whatever our needs are.  Ethan, Juan,  Nick, Vanessa, Ashley, Mo, Jason, Shawn, Winston, Hamza, Allie,

title: Amazing management, personalized service, extremely friendly staff, great rooms!
text:
This is my second ever review on TripAdvisor, but I had to post this because we just had such a great experience with the management at both Park Central (my first review), which is a neighboring sibling hotel to WestHouse, and WestHouse.

My fiancé and I just returned from a week long trip to Manhattan, where we began our stay at the Park Central Hotel. We arrived around midnight on a weeknight and took the last King room available. 

After our first night in our room, we decided that while we enjoyed the hotel, we didn't like our specific room for many reasons. We approached the managers the next day to discuss what our options were. Darren helped us out and gave us options within Park Central and over at WestHouse. He very patiently and politely walked us through each option, showed us a potential room we could move over to, and took the lead on handling the entire transition to the WestHouse the following day. I had booked through a third party, so there were a few extra steps involved, but with Darren's attentive help, things were handling very smoothly and seamlessly! He even offered us some great perks to help offset the annoyance of needing to re-pack/check-out and check-in to the new room. 

My fiancé and I were both thoroughly impressed with Darren's attitude and his management skills. We're both engineers by trade and try to do our best at our job every single day. When I see someone in the service industry doing the same, I am very impressed. I know that it can be a high stress, high anxiety job, so to see someone go above and beyond is a breath of fresh air. We had a great and time during the rest of our stay in NYC and walked away with a very memorable experience, thanks to Darren.

I also wanted to add that WestHouse in general was a great experience, even beyond only the management. All of the staff we encountered were extremely friendly and I felt as though we were receiving personalized service during every minute of our stay. The Happy Hour that is included with the facilities/resort fee was delightful, but what made it even more-so was the head waiter/head of staff that worked there every night of our stay (this past week). I also have to add that the rooms and halls were very clean, the beds extremely comfortable, and the noise levels that traveled from the hallways within the rooms very minimal. Thank you WestHouse for such a great experience!

title: Good place to stay
text: It is a very well located hotel if you are interested in 5th Ave, Times Square and Central Park, it is near almost everything. The room we got was a bit small, almost no space to walk between the beds and the TV, the beds were absolutely amazingly comfortable. The bathroom on the small side as well, nicely furnished and very modern, there were no windows in the bathroom and no extractor which was a bit uncomfortable. It offers complimentary breakfast which was really really delicious and with many options to choose from. It offers a Happy Hour as well from 5 to 7pm which offers drinks and food, but not only snack, I mean real food, you could eat there and not have dinner you could have for example a plate of different cheeses, then a hot pasta and a delicious salad. We could see the hotel from the outside because it is covered since it is being remodeled I presume. The service was good, only one day the cleaning lady left some thing undone in our room, it looked that she got called whiled making our room and the forgot to come back because the towels were on the TV, the beds were missing a sheet and a plate of food was left on a desk.... Overall nice hotel, will stay again if the price is right.

title: Perfect Weekend Break in New York
text: We spent 3 nights over a weekend in The WestHouse in September.  Flew into Newark, caught the train to Penn Station and then a cab to the hotel.  On arrival the property doesn't look very impressive at the moment as there is scaffolding covering the front facade, so I can't comment on its kerb appeal.  The reception area is relatively small, and a little dark for my taste but the staff were very welcoming and check-in processed quickly, with all hotel information provided.  We stayed on the 19th floor, which was well away from the street noise.  We did get a little noise from the elevators, and the air conditioning unit was audible but neither of these detracted from our experience.  The room was spacious by NYC standards, and the bathroom well appointed with good quality toiletries, and both were spotless.  There is a fridge in the room, and housekeeping provide complimentary bottled water every day.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  Housekeeping keep their trolleys in the corridors, obviously to maximize guest accommodations, which seems a little odd, but we didn't find it a problem.  The hotel is located between 7th Avenue and Broadway, less than 10 minutes walk in either direction to Central Park or Times Square, and very close to subway stops, so ideally located for a weekend break in the city.  The unique selling point of this hotel is the inclusive breakfast and 5-7pm "indulgence" on the 23rd floor.  An excellent breakfast with hot and cold buffet in the morning, and an equally excellent hot and cold buffet with complimentary wine and beers in the evening.  We had events to attend 2 evenings we were in the city and didn't really have time to go to a restaurant ahead of them after sightseeing during the day, and felt it would be too late to eat afterwards.  Problem solved by the hotel indulgence.  We really didn't feel the need to go out to dinner!  The lounge does become very busy both at breakfast and in the evening, but the staff are very helpful at making sure nobody waits long for a table and that buffet items are replenished quickly and often - and one pointed out to me that they have plans to expand the lounge in the near future.  Is this hotel perfect?  No - there is no room service available, there are no tea/coffee making facilities in-room, and the hotel bar on the ground floor is very expensive, however it does deserve an excellent review due to its location, the quality of the accommodation, the inclusive food and drink on offer, and its welcoming and helpful staff.

title: Really nice hotel
text:
Just got back and staid in this hotel for 4 nights! I loved the location in between time square and Central Park! The staff were really friendly and the breakfast was fresh! 

The only thing I was disappointed with was the mirror had marks all over it and the bedroom side light didn’t work or the spare plugs. 

I probably wouldn’t stay again. I also think when booking the hotel it should say the price for breakfast because I didn’t see the price was compulsory when staying at the hotel. Usually it’s optional. 

But the stay overall was pleasant :)

title: Really is a home from home
text: Booked this hotel via Secret Escapes for my first visit to New York last month and stayed 5 nights, my friends joining me for the last 3 nights to stay there too. We all loved the hotel! After the heat outside, the calm and cool air conditioned interior of the hotel was a sanctuary and my standard room was clean, comfortable and the mattress super comfortable. And my friends’ suite was very spacious and had fabulous views. The breakfasts were great and included hot dishes as well as fresh fruit, yoghourt, granola, pastries and very good coffee, plus free bottles of water to take with you for the day. The included suppers between 5-7pm were a godsend given the poor exchange rate of the pound to the dollar and just what we needed after a full day’s sightseeing, The location of the hotel is excellent: right near Central Park, Broadway, Carnegie Hall and a subway station. The staff, from the doorman Winston, to Ashley on reception who so kindly upgraded a room when my friend was ill, to Shaun who booked our tickets to Top of the Rock online, to the staff in the dining room and the cleaners -  did everything to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. I hope to return when next in New York!

title: Not what I expected
text: This hotel was so recommended by so many colleagues I finally tried it. What a disappointment... the staff as reviewed by many is not nice. The rooms,  ehhhh... mine was dark with a view to a “courtyard “ which is just another building.  Very poor lighting and a tiny bathroom, extremely uncomfortable. Going back to my other hotel! Breakfast is nice however...

title: Third time staying here and it was great again!
text: I’ve stayed here a few times and each stay never disappoints! They staff is super friendly and always so accommodating. We have two kids and find the additional resort fee daily is so worth it! The breakfast items offered are fantastic and they even have fresh berries. Most hotels offer the typical apples and bananas but this was new and great for our kids. Complimentary reception at night offers a great selection of wine which is perfect after a long day out with the kids! Rooms are always clean and good size. We love the location since our kids love to venture to Central Park. I definitely recommend this hotel!!

title: Would have been a great boutique hotel experience if I hadn’t been charged TWICE
text:
This is a lovely and well situated boutique hotel just south of Central Park and a few blocks from the lights of Times Square. I was there on a business trip and the front desk and the porters made us feel very welcome. 

Unfortunately the hotel billed us twice - once when I made the online booking and again when I checked out. Mistakes happen so I called to tell them. The staff who took my calls and emails were unhelpful and haven’t managed to resolve the issue 3 weeks on. I would have happily recommended this place to my friends, now I think it’s better they look elsewhere. 

What a shame.

title: Great Hotel and Great Team!
text: Currently writing this while here at the hotel. Planning another trip back to this amazing place. Second time coming back to this hotel. I have to say a very big thanks to the team here! It all started with Moe, he took care of us from the beginning. Must also mention Allie and Juan, they both went above and beyond to make sure all was great. Raphael and Marcelo thank you both. Tarik my fellow football(soccer) fan, thanks for chatting about the sport!

title: Misses the mark
text: On check-in, the young male spoke so softly as he rifled quickly through the offerings and terms, one could only conclude that he was bored to do so or that it was with attitude of pre-addressing complaints - one of which I'm sure is the $45 additional fee per guest above one per room. That extra cost covers "delightful offerings" between 5 PM and 7 PM and breakfast. And you can be sure that most people want to make sure that $45 is well-spent. So "snacks and drinks" becomes dinner for most, families and couples flood the afternoon room making it a full dinner (pasta, salad, bread, water, beer, soft drinks). And at 6:30 AM on a quiet Sunday morning in the city, I asked the receptionist if there were any room or space in the hotel where the music wasn't blaring. The answer was no. Rooms were fine, if a little tired, with a tiny bathroom with barely enough counter space to place a toothbrush.

title: We had a lovely time here - great location and lovely room.
text: We enjoyed our stay at the West House hotel. The room was large for NY and beds comfortable. The staff here are lovely and nothing was too much trouble. We enjoyed the breakfast and the drinks and food early in the evening. A special thank you to the very nice manager, Alexandra, who helped us make arrangements for our room.

title: Très bon hôtel
text:
