Parfait emplacement pour visiter la ville .
Accueil charmant et rapide, nous avons eu notre chambre dès notre arrivée vers 12h00.
Nous avons beaucoup apprécié le petit-déjeuner ainsi que l’happy jour de 17h00.
La chambre est très confortable, tout le personnel est d’une gentillesse exemplaire .
Le seul petit regret est de ne pas avoir pu profiter de la terrasse qui était en travaux...

title: Lipstick on a pig... severe disappointment
text: I’m not usually one to bother with leaving reviews, but this place is such a scam... the room is old and dirty, and it’s a suite! Not as pictured, NO mini bar or snack items in the room, the fitness center is run down and dirty towels everywhere, there was a dirty used cleaning towel waiting in the foyer of my room when I got here, the sink doesn’t drain, the scaffolding outside has workmen basically sitting outside of my window... the list goes on!! Dust everywhere, stains on the furniture... just really run down. So so far from a five star... I’ve been in 2 and 3 stars that were cleaner than this. I intend to switch hotels immediately!

title: Stay away
text:
Stay away, these guys add really big hidden costs after you've prepaid a room on entry and say it's in terms and conditions. They doubled the price. They say it's for dinner. But I didn't want dinner!
And it's in construction, there are builders outside our window, really not pleasant.  Go to a normal hotel.

title: Pas terrible!
text:
Nous sommes partis cet été au westhouse hôtel, 5 nuits... et nous avions hâte de  re partir! 
Hôtel « 5 étoiles »... j’ai vu mieux!! Chambre pas propre ( j’ai demandé à refaire le ménage, dès notre arrivée), obligation de prendre petit déjeuner et collation à 17h en plus du prix de la nuit. J’insiste sur « obligation », car si je ne payais pas, nous devions quitter  l’hôtel!! Avec 3 enfants, 6 h de décalage et 5 valises ... j’ai dû payer, pour pouvoir avoir ma chambre ( que j’avais déjà payer via hôtels.com !! )Tout ça pour une nourriture  bien moyenne et répétitive. Ascenseur en panne, alarme a incendie en plein milieu de la nuit( ça peut arriver... un petit mot d’excuse pour avoir réveillé tout l’hôtel... sûrement pas). Personnel antipathique, mis à part les jeunes hommes postés devant l’hôtel. 
Bref, je ne le conseille absolument pas... rapport qualité prix médiocre. 
Heureusement l’emplacement était bien!

title: Servizio fantastico
text:
Ospitalità e pulizia sopra la media per Manhattan. Stanza pulita e più grande di altri hotel della stessa categoria. Colazione all’ultimo piano con vista notevole, peccato per l’impalcatura...ma le ristrutturazioni non sono eterne, tornerò sicuramente!
Personale cordiale e collaborativo!

title: Awesome hotel
text: I’m a bit late in writing this review which I s— but it’s better to be late than to not write one.  This was my second time staying at the Westhouse and I couldn’t be happier.  The rooms are clean and spacious and the staff is fantastic!  A special call-out to Tarik at the reception desk who really looked out for me and my husband!  Thanks Tarik for your hospitality.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed in New York numerous times a year this is the first time we tried WestHouse,  the staff were polite and professional.  Room and view was amazing.  Will definitely stay here again.  Thanks to all the staff for just making it a wonderful experience.

title: Trés bon établissement
text: A very nice hotel with a good level of services. Personel are kind and available. The hotel is well located, surrounded by ground transportations allowing you to reach each part of the town very easily.

title: Amazing including the most spectacular customer service in New York.
text: Aside from a convenient location, super staff the hotel is perhaps one of the most wonderful and warming I have ever stayed in. We experienced a small problem with our room on our first night but Petr (Hotel Manager) was quick to respond with a more than satisfying compensation, room relocation and scrumptious chocolates and cupcakes delivered to our room every night. Every guest and especially children are entertained through their Terrace Restaurant which serves a delicious breakfast and drinks, accessible to all until 8. If I have to describe it one word, it would be; Exceptional.

title: TOP-NOTCH QUALITY!
text: My review is long overdue, but...You're entire stay at WestHouse hotel will be nothing less than exceptional! Last September was my first time in NYC and staying at this hotel made my first time experience better than I anticipated. Not only was it a gorgeous hotel, but the staff was very exceptional! The manager of this hotel did a great job hiring their staff because the service was the highest of quality. However, one of the staff members really exceeded my expectations and her name was Ashley Clarkson. From the moment we walked in she made sure that our stay was of top-notch quality. My next trip to NYC will definitely include WestHouse hotel!

title: Bel hôtel, emplacement idéal.
text:
L’hôtel est idéalement situé entre Time Square et l’entrée de Central Park. La chambre était de bonne taille, assez de place pour le rangement, salle de bains un peu petite. Les meubles et la décoration un peu vieillissante. Les prestations comme le petit déjeuner ou les happy hours en fin de journée sont appréciés. Le personnel est agréable et serviable. 
Les chambres sont à un prix raisonnable mais ça devient moins intéressant lorsqu’il faut payer 50% de plus pour les taxes de séjour!!

title: A perdu de son éclat
text:
Ayant déjà fréquenté cet hôtel j’ai noté une baisse de qualité de l’hôtel, malgré la taxe inaliénable d’environ 60€/pers et par jour toujours présente, plus de tea time et le champagne a été remplacé par du prosecco; pour ce qui est des plats proposés attendez-vous à faire le plein de féculents. Les produits d’hygiène ne sont plus remplacés tous les jours alors économisez.
Néanmoins l’hôtel et ses chambres restent beau, son emplacement plus que parfait et son personnel courtois.
Je remarque juste que « Le diable est dans les détails»

title: Vacanza
text:
Vacanza favolosa che è stata piacevolmente agevolata dall’accoglienza del personale dell’hotel.
Molto attenti stanza sempre pulita e bottigliette acqua e asciugamani nuovi ogni giorno.
Favolosa colazione e buona merenda pomeridiana ☺️

title: Great hotel!
text: Wonderful and very friendly staff. The rooms are a good size and very clean. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Can’t beat the location, close to everything and the subway.  They offer a great hot breakfast and the happy hour so wonderful.

title: Amazing Staff and Hotel!!!!!
text: The WestHouse is  such an amazing hotel and the staff is the best!  The hotel is in such a convenient location for me  to visit family while in NYC.  Everyone is just so friendly they are always there to help with anything we need to make our stay wonderful.  The 23rd floor staff are so friendly always helping with the food and drinks.  (I can't remember there names on the 23rd fl. )    I would like to comment on how wonderful a couple of people were especially great on this trip. Juan, Ethan, Allie, Moe, Nick, Vanessa, Peter, Shawn, Winston, Hamza .  I will definitely be returning to this wonderful hotel!

title: No merece la pena
text:
Para empezar nos exigen pagar un extra diario de 50 dólares donde incluyen desayuno, ¡que ya teníamos pagado¡. Al decir que no lo queríamos nos dicen que no hay opción, que es obligatorio.
Por cierto el desayuno es de los peores que he visto, solo desayunamos un día, el resto lo hicimos fuera a pesar de haberlo pagado.
Mucho ruido en las habitaciones, pocos ascensores, solo se salva la cama que era buena.
La ubicación buena,

title: WOW - A Must Stay
text: We went for my daughters 17th birthday and this hotel did not disappoint, they even had cupcakes in the room for her birthday.  I simply cannot say enough about the amazing staff!  Everyone was so nice and friendly and funny.  The hotel itself was stunning, clean and welcoming.  The light fare in the evening, delicious the breakfast in the morning, again delicious and a great way to start the day.  This is now my go to NYC hotel, hands down.  The location is perfect close to everything, the hotel was quiet not noisy like many other hotels in the city.  I truly cannot say one bad thing about this hotel, and highly recommend it for any and every visit to the city.  Thank You WestHouse!!

title: Excellent hotel
text:
This hotel is in an excellent location just south of Central Park and within easy walking distance to Times Square, 5th Avenue, etc. There is a subway stop just at the end of the road and so it is very easy to access the rest of the city.

The hotel offers drinks and food from 5pm and 7pm. While we were there this consisted of wine, beer, champagne, fresh pasta, cheeses, hams, bread and salads. It was very welcome to arrive to after a long flight when we were all hungry but didn't feel like going out! During the day the lounge offers hot drinks and soft drinks that are included in the room rate. These could be taken back to your room if you wanted.

Breakfast is also included in the room rate and this was lovely with a good choice.

They have interconnecting rooms which is useful when travelling with children. However the rooms are quite compact, although this is what we would expect in a large city and wasn't a problem for us.

I would definitely recommend this hotel

title: Love it
text: We are still staying at this hotel. We just love our room - spacious in this big apple! Service at this hotel is excellent. I would like to say special thanks to the lady who cleans our room- Sharon Forbes. She is a delight to speak with, makes our room spotless every day and she is so friendly, professional and we are so glad to have met her. She is very helpful especially since we are travelling with two small children, no request is too big for her, always there with a big smile. Thanks Sharon.

title: Westhouse is THE BEST HOUSE!
text:
My wife & I have stayed at this hotel about 6 times in past three years for long weekends or weekly stays. This stay in July we were celebrating our 12th wedding anniversary. We love the proximity to the theater district as we see at least one show each stay. This hotel truly has that "boutique" feel. The staff once again did a wonderful job with our room accommodations upgrading us to a king corner room with a terrace. Plenty of light. Unfortunately due to all the construction on the facade of the building, the terrace was inaccessible. Would have been a cool experience to have breakfast on our own terrace. The room was very comfortable & clean overall. We also were disappointed in not having access to the 23rd floor terrace as that too was under construction. This terrace is one of our major considerations when booking this hotel as the views are amazing & it just enhances our breakfast & evening fare experiences. Being a beautiful weekend in July really made us feel that much more let down. I really wished that the hotel would have had some sort of disclosure. 

Now, for what they get right consistently & have enhanced over the past 5 years is the breakfast & evening reception. The breakfast choices are plentiful with scrambled eggs, chicken sausage( not my favorite), bacon & plenty of pastries, bagels with spreads & fruit & yogurt. The service has also been enhanced with more attendants working during this time cleaning tables assisting with any requests. They do a great job maintaining it clean & full of food. This same consistency is extended to the evening fare between 5-7pm as that too has expanded with more hot food such as fettuccine alfredo, mixed veggies one night & seafood paella,  cauliflower in brown butter & a very nice beet salad as sides the next. Also lots of charcuterie. Cheeses were very good but the prosciutto was my favorite. Plenty of very good belgium & domestic beer & quality red & white wines. Again worth the value if you are able to take advantage of it.

Oh, they also offer soda, bottled water & different coffees throughout the day so u pop in & out of the 23rd floor lounge throughout the day to help yourself.

All in all for this time of year, with the deal we were able to get on the Westhouse website thru my email offer it once again a great experience. 

Hopefully the construction will be completed soon because ultimately that was the only real glitch in the hotel. It was so substantial that it definitely diminished our enjoyment.

title: Siamo tornati ma sempre peggio
text: Siamo tornati con una offerta di vojage privè. Il westhouse  è un hotel molto centrale in Manhattan a 5 minuti a piedi dal Central Park e con una comoda fermata della metropolitana proprio nell'angolo. È un hotel a cinque stelle anche se paga la non ampiezza dei luoghi comuni. Per esempio la hall è molto piccola così come la sala colazione. eravamo già stati in questo hotel e questa volta purtroppo abbiamo dovuto subire la chiusura del terrazzo causa la ristrutturazione dell'hotel. Ad ogni modo il terrazzo gode di una vista molto bella. Abbiamo avuto questa volta una stanza ancora più piccola con un bagno davvero angusto dove non c'era il posto neanche per appendere gli asciugamani. I servizi dell'hotel comunque sono adeguati ad un buon standard newyorkese.  gli ascensori sono un po' lenti e obbligano a delle lunghe attese. Anche la colazione è essenziale con pochissima scelta nel dolce o salato o frutta.  comunque soddisfacente sia nel salato che frutta.. Una nota positiva il pre dinner dalle 5 alle 7 pm dov'è possibile bere vini, champagne accompagnandoli con delle pietanze calde  e fredde. È un buon pre cena o se volete anche una cena leggera. Anche se un po'ripetitivo. Discreta la scelta dei vini invece varia.

title: Great location and comfortable rooms
text: Overall really good hotel, but some issues related to service that i think are just because it's a smaller property. Waited a really long time one night for pull out couch/bed to be made up, and generally had longer than expected waits for things like extra towels. Hotel bar also closed down reasonably early and lacked selection. But we enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back.

title: Love this hotel and will stay again
text:
I had such a wonderful experience at this hotel when I visited for a long weekend in late July with my three teen/preteen daughters.  The hotel is in an amazing location that is convenient to major attractions, restaurants and subway.  It's easily accessible and feels safe for families. There are plenty of places to get souvenirs, a cup of coffee, a quick bite nearby.

The hotel itself is quiet and feels luxurious!  My kids thought it was beautiful and smelled wonderful.  The staff was also exceptionally friendly. We shared a two queen room and it was great for us. The beds were really comfortable!

Best of all, the breakfast buffet and happy hour offered by this hotel are amazing. Such a treat and great value - and so practical for a family with children. The happy hour included veggies and cheese and pasta. Coke/sprite was available at all times. Breakfast had plenty of options.

Such a great experience and a wonderful trip.

title: Nice........but
text:
Perfect location, clean and staff we encountered were all very helpful and friendly.
Our room was on the 24th floor and was everything we were expecting, nothing special but nice, we were informed that there would be scaffolding and work going on to the exterior of the hotel, although not want we wanted, this was not a problem.
Our room was cleaned every day to a good standard, but the air con could not be set very low and with the weather being very hot the week we were there, this seemed very pointless, the included breakfast was nice but after a couple of days got very repetitive, however did not really get the benefit of the free drinks at night due to the selection of beer on offer, the first night they offered Budweiser, but every night after that there was only 2 types of IPA on offer which had a very acquired taste and not to my liking, when asking if there was any Bud, to be told, sorry but no.
However my biggest gripe was the Resident Fee,I knew about this before, so it was not a surprise at checkout, I was not expecting was a tax on the resident fee of $8.70 and another city tax of $5.76 per night making the fee $112.46 per night not $98 I was expecting, however the hotel did deduct a night of charges, after I pointed out that I did not check in till after 7pm on our arrival.
All in all, had a nice stay but would not stay at the Westhouse again if returning to New York, mainly due to the, what I feel was the excessive resident fee, for what I received in return.

title: Hidden charged
text:
The hotel was nice enough. Under renovation so our terrace was trashed, but I can deal with that. 

However they add $56 per person as a resort fee. For this you get a happy hour and snacks, which we didn’t ask for or use. As these charges were not disclosed until after we booked, it completely changed the economics of our stay. I feel that this kind of charge is a sneaky way to bait and switch and I would not stay here again

title: Hidden Gem
text:
My time at this hotel was fantastic!  The service was great.  We arrived before check in time.  They took our bags, offered us a key to the terrace where we could get sodas, water or coffee, complimentary.  We did this and began our adventures.  When we arrived back at the hotel it was around 6.  The front desk told us they had light bites in the terrace along with complimentary wine, beer, champagne and the aforementioned items.  The lightbites weren't so light.  There was meat and cheese board, stuffed shells, broccoli rabe and a salad along with bread.  All complimentary.  The only thing missing was sweets.  
In the morning there was a full complimentary breakfast.  All items were fantastic and hours were reasonable 6-10:30 or 11.  You also had access to the terrace and room throughout the day closing at 8 p.m.
Wednesday night there was a jazz band in the bar area.  
Room was nicely appointed as well, although the beds could use an upgrade.

Overall, thoroughly enjoyed.  All the nice touches were there!

title: Worst 5 star hotel in New York or anywhere for that matter
text: I could not agree more with recent reviewer RGSOUNDF whose review (Definitely not a 5-star, not sure if it is a 4") echoes my own experience. Having stayed in a few wonderful 5-star hotels, I have some basis for comparison. But on the merits (or lack thereof) of Westhouse alone, had I not had prior exposure to a REAL 5-star, I would still say that this was the worst hotel experience I have ever had in New York City where I go 3 times a year. I checked in late and like RGSOUNDF the AC thermostat in my room could not be adjusted. The room, like the weather, was hot and humid. I went to the desk and asked for someone to repair the AC thermostat. I waited in the bar, by now it was almost midnight, and was told the technician was in the room. He was not. I went back to the desk and the extremely rude young woman at reception practically yelled at me before moving me to an "upgraded" room, or so she said, which did have a functioning AC. But this was no 5-star room. It was dark. It looked into a dark shaft that was surrounded by high walls on all sides so NO view and no direct light. The room was a nothingburger. The bathroom was spacious but there is no shower curtain so the marble floors are like an ice rink when you step out of the shower. Beware of slipping! The towel rack came off in my hand. The Terrace was also a vast disappointment. Like the rude reception clerk there were rude waiters in the breakfast room. The Terrace itself is covered in scaffolding so it cannot be used. So there was no view or light on one side and on the other the same dark shaft I saw from my room. The offerings were comparable to a breakfast buffet at a 3-star chain hotel. The "cocktail" hour was also a disappointment. There was a pasta dish and some cheese and free wine but this was not a noteworthy spread. Waiters still as rude as at breakfast. I want to go back to the reception desk experience because I have never been spoken to in that tone or in that way by a hotel employee. She came on at 11 pm on July 24th so the hotel can check on who this employee is. She needs some serious retraining. The Westhouse website describes the hotel in these terms "incomparable design and elegant style", "finest luxury bedrooms in NY", "captivating views of the city", unrivaled among luxury hotels in NY", "natural light floods interior space", "most exclusive roof deck terrace in NYC", and so on. All lies. The corker on the website is this one, and although this is not an Onion article but it is worthy of satire "chic art deco design is enhanced with a signature scent by ambient specialist 12.29." You cannot make this stuff up. Finally they wanted to charge me $49 for the breakfast and cocktail hour of the day I arrived. I arrived at 11pm so I was supposed to pay for amenities that I could not have enjoyed without time travel. The rude receptionist "waived" this fee - so very gracious of her. Do not stay here.

title: Definitely not a 5-star hotel, not sure it is a 4
text:
In the absence of the clear standardized system of NYC hotel classification, a 5-star rating is by and large is a meaningless designation. Newspapers, magazines, AAA, Google reviews, TripAdvisor reviews, etc, all rate hotels in the ways they deem fit. As a result, Hôtel Plaza Athénée NYC is 5 stars, The Surrey Hotel (Relais & Châteaux) is 5 stars, Mr. C Seaport (Leading Hotels of the World) is 5 stars, and so is Peninsula, The Pierre, etc. And then you have Westhouse...
With batteries of housekeeping carts (noted by other reviewers) lined up, one after another, in the hallways, with outdated HVAC systems, loud and noisy, with AC thermostat that can't be adjusted (from 72 degrees, pre-set by the hotel, we set it up to 80, and upon coming back to our room 6 hours later, discovered that the room was freezing cold, our thermostat setting won't change the effectual temperature). And then, there is no turndown service, in a "5-star" hotel. And then, there are no electrical outlets next to bed; in the day and age of smartphones, the need to charge your devices on the desk is a major inconvenience. And then, the entire facade of the hotel (including one of the windows, in our corner room) is barred by scaffolding. Sure, renovations happen, but an honest practice in the industry mandates that a hotel makes an appropriate mention, a disclosure-type. Nothing, in the case of WestHouse.
And then, there was a clump of hair, apparently left from the previous guests, on the floor, by the bathroom. 
The room itself, its design, upkeep, the view, the furnishings, were quite average. The bathroom was arguably the tiniest among dozens and dozens of Manhattan hotels we have stayed at. 
But then, there was a free breakfast. Not so much free, considering the so-called "residency fee" of 90-plus dollars which entitles a guest to a free breakfast, use of the hotel's fitness center, etc. The breakfast was as mediocre as it can only get; it is a breakfast buffet (scrambled eggs, blackened bacon, chicken sausage, hard-boiled eggs, breakfast potatoes, bagels and danishes), which is very often the case even with the "real" 5-star hotels, but WestHouse takes it a step down; you are supposed to make your own coffee, from a coffee machine at that (yes, you heard that right, not a coffee maker but a machine you see in hospital or school cafeterias). The breakfast self-service area is very narrow and cramped, resulting in unpleasant crowding. The name of the breakfast facility, "The Terrace" is as misleading as the 5-star rating, for there is nothing there of the terrace, except the top floor location. 
The room mini-bar is nonexistent either. 
Another major inconvenience: no overhead lighting; 2 bedside lamps and 2 desk lamps is all you get. 
Several elevators, even though sufficient in number, can't handle the guests volume adequately; there was a wait every time we used them. 
A nice touch was a text we received right after checking in, from the hotel staff, asking if we needed anything. We texted right back saying one of our magnetic keys wouldn't work. Everlasting silence followed. 
The well-known dictum "you get what you pay for" wouldn't be the case, for our corner room ran us over $480. This is the price for a premium room in Dominick SoHo or Beakman, a different universe from WestHouse, so the monetary gain or budget-friendly aspect are nonexistent either. 
Every discerning traveller or those who have plans to stay in an upscale property in Manhattan, shall better look elsewhere to avoid disappointment.

title: Unbelievable unfair pricing system, but good location
text:
We chose WestHouse because of its good location and nice descriptions. The price seemed to be fair, too, especially as we received a nice discount cupon. We didn't check the fine print, so the actual final rate we had to pay was about 30% higher than advertised. This hotel has a special pricing system: on top of basic hotel services (e.g., bed, linens, bathroom, cleaning, desk services) it charges extra (besides the "rate) for other services, either you use them or not... So breakfast is obvious, but charging for a gym (even if you don't use it)? for concierge services (even if you don't use them)? We have to thank them for not charging for NYC view, or do they charge for it?
In summary, our frustration is great, so we couldn't appreciate other aspects of this hotel. We'll never return nor will we recommend it!

title: Great find
text:
Staff, service and accommodations all wonderful 
Staff at the front desk....Ashley Clarkson and Kourtney went above and beyond the make us feel welcome.  We were greeted with a smile and wave every time we walked into the lobby.
Looking forward to our next visit!,

title: WestHouse is A+
text: WestHouse service & amenities are perfect for NY stay near Carnegie, Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, etc. The staff was amazing, accommodating, & put to the test during the 7/13/19 power blackout in Manhattan (lasted several hours) on a pretty warm summer night. WestHouse management made everything right with us. We would stay here again & recommend to anyone. Complimentary water/soda/coffee all day. Continental breakfast & dinner can save money on food, too. Right next to 55th & 7th Subway.

title: Beautiful, great service and location
text: Stayed at Westhouse with my teen daughter for a 1-night NYC getaway. Fantastic location just south of Central Park, which we walked through to visit The Met. Nick at the front desk was very friendly, polite and professional. Baggage storage and valet excellent as well (although there was a mixup with getting our car back but it didn’t ruin the stay for us). The Terrace for breakfast and dinner was great. The hosts were working hard, pouring wine for guests and keeping the food well-stocked. Much finer experience than other places we’ve stayed because it was actually enough for dinner: vegetable ravioli, roasted cauliflower, tomato/mozzarella salad, charcuterie board and rolls, plus beer and wine. Seating was plentiful and very nice atmosphere. Breakfast was just as good: eggs, sausage, bacon, homefries, cereals, and plenty of pastries, from croissants to bagels. Room very comfortable, from bedding to a/c control to bathroom. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others. We were very lucky to use points from Southwest for our stay; only thing not covered was $50 resort fee for me (no charge for kids) and valet. Amazed to stay someplace so nice on points.

title: Before and After a Wedding Weekend
text:
My wife and I formerly lived on the UES for many years before moving to Florida.  And our son was getting married in the NY area so we chose WestHouse Hotel as our base of operation.  The bell and front desk staffs were always very welcoming during our comings and goings. The suites we stayed in were spacious and well decorated.  During our June stay, the friendly bellman heard us discussing NJ and talked to us about his choice to live there.  When we returned after the weekend we were welcomed warmly back.  

Although it is located in northern midtown it is so simple to get to UES via Q (Second Avenue subway) and only a few blocks walk to Central Park where I used to run regularly (and the community still does), to say nothing of all the sites and park locales.  During the first part of our trip we saw the Cher Show in the nearby theater district, on Pride weekend - it was close by and fabulous! During the second part of the trip we had opportunity to see more sites downtown and in Tribeca, also very simple subway access without Tax or Uber hustle required.

The breakfast and evening light bite amenity are appropriate to the need in visiting New York: Many choices for hours in the morning and a few choices plus wine in the evening to either be your meal or tide you over til your next meal.  Both times we stayed in suites which in one case had a sleeper sofa and the other a private desk alcove.  It was a great way to begin and end a memorable weekend

title: Beautiful Hotel/Friendly Staff
text: While we were there, the hotel was doing some construction which was a bit annoying but otherwise, we very much enjoyed our stay. Their breakfasts and happy hours on the 23rd floor were lovely (and great people watching). And in particular, the bartender at the first floor bar -- Raphael -- was amazing. Friendly, accommodating, great drinks. Even if you aren't staying at the hotel, I would check out the bar (Wednesday nights are free jazz night).

title: Great Hotel in NYC!!!
text: My girlfriends and I spent 5 days at the WestHouse hotel for our all girls’ getaway trip. What a lovely place!!! Everyone was so friendly and helpful especially Petr, the General Manager. He was always very helpful to us. It was our first trip to NYC and the whole staff made it very easy for us to enjoy our time in the city. The hotel was very clean. We enjoyed the free delicious buffet breakfast. It was always nice to come back to our clean rooms after a busy shopping day and evening dinner parties. We love it!!! Thank you so much! We are planning to come back again and will stay at the WestHouse.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: This was our 3rd visit to the WestHouse Hotel and each time we stay it feels just like our home. You will not go wrong with this hotel. A completely awesome staff, perfect location, amazing rooms and the 23rd floor Terrace lounge with great food and evening wine & cheese reception is an absolute bonus. We’d highly recommend the WestHouse to anyone visiting NYC

title: Best WestHouse hotel!
text:
When we arrived after traveling 19 hours we finally arrived at the westhouse hotel and was greeting with a large smile by the woman on reception who asked how we were and how our travel was. (It’s the little things)

Hotel room- lovely and perfect size!
Staff- lovely and very helpful
5-7pm all inclusive drinks- keep them flowing.
Food- lovely
Location- honestly it was just perfect. 5 minutes from Central Park, Fifth Avenue Times Square and Broadway. The hotel is also located right next to a subway so handy to get to and from places.

The only issue (which wasn’t he hotels fault... more the company I booked through) was the hotel/service tax. If it makes you feel better (the readers) you get your money’s worth with the all inclusive drinks, food and amazing service! 

Can’t wait to stay here again!

title: Perfect Oasis in NYC
text: After a long flight and a dreadful ride to the city from JFK arriving at the hotel at Midnight, there was Kathy to greet me.  She was warm and welcoming.  The hotel charges a hotel fee for the breakfast and "indulgences" in the evening.  This minor cost is nothing compared with what you get in return.  The full breakfast with everything you can think of especially the mini NY Bagels is delicious.  In the evening its even better.  The location is right where you want to be, the MTA is right out the door at 57&7th ave.  The metro card is easy to purchase and much cheaper than a cab (they have gotten very expensive) The team at the hotel do everything to make your trip enjoyable.  The concierge also was a god sent..

title: Amazing team and great stay!
text: Fabulous hotel in a great area, you have plenty of options down and across the street. Central to Time Square and a few blocks from Central Park. Plenty of stores to visit while walking down the street. Good room, late check out. The service from the staff was excellent. I'll make sure to stay here again next time I'm in the area.

title: Great service and exceptional care for the guests
text: NYC is known for great service, but Westhouse team really take it to the next level.  Highly conscientious staff that took care of my stay from the minute I checked and to the minute when I was helped with my bags into the car.  I was even asked if I wanted water for my trip back.

title: Belated gratitude!
text: The amazing thing about WestHouse is that every visit feels like a true coming home. We really appreciate the care we are given each time. The service is palpable from the cleaning staff to the highest level of management. We wanted to specifically recognize Sharon, who cleaned our room with love and attention and was attentive to all details.  As always, we recognize Tarik Boukhari for his endless hard work and his personal attention - he is a priceless employee with a radiant smile. We appreciate Ashley for helping us check-in in a timely fashion.

title: Another lovely time at Westhouse
text:
A somewhat last minute work trip brought me back to NYC for a few days and back to my favorite place I went! I really do just love this hotel. Ashley at the front desk is a darling. So, so welcoming. She always remembers me! And Christian too. Always just super helpful with getting up all of my work stuff. 

The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are so clean which I love. Housekeeping definitely does a great job - I come back to a fresh clean room - and I’m kind of a tornado when I leave for my meetings. 

Also, their complimentary wine reception at night..for that reason alone this is literally my favorite place ha ha! Absolutely the best hotel in NY. Thanks again for a wonderful trip Westhouse!

title: Extremely well run
text: My family stayed in a suite at this wonderful hotel next to Carnegie Hall and near Central Park. Juan the manager quickly took care of a minor matter when we checked in. Ashley was very engaging and helpful throughout our four day stay. Then there was William the bartender originally from Cali,Columbia.He had my wife and adult son in tears with laughter with his stories. The WestHouse was spotless. The breakfast and afternoon "snack" were very good. Our rooms were rather large for New York.They were certainly comfortable. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Best of New York
text: Una de las mejores experiencia en New York fue visitar west house hotel, el servicio la amabilidad y la experiencia que viví con todo el equipo en particular William y Melida F&B Manager, excelente servicio y sin duda será uno de mis lugares favoritos para visitar

title: Always a good place to stay
text: I stay at the Westhouse for work frequently and it is a great location, always clean and the staff is pleasant. Rooms near the elevator can be loud at night but otherwise it's a great spot. Very close to Times Square, Carnegie Hall and lots of restaurants.

title: Great hotel with very friendly stuff
text: This is my 7th stay at this hotel and I am always amazed by the kind, helpful very friendly stuff that works there. I love the continental breakfast every morning with so many choices. Love the location.

title: Awesome experience, helpful staff!
text: This is a great location and the staff goes beyond and above. Special shout out to Ashley and Ben, the extras make this the best deal in NYC! Included in your stay is a full breakfast and heavy appetizers from 5-7pm.

title: Love this boutique hotel!
text:
Loved the staff, extremely friendly and helpful. Juan, the hotel manager, had great suggestions for our trip.  Other staff members, Moe ,Ashley, and Kathy were so nice to deal with.The concierges floor was the best idea yet!  The complimentary breakfast had a fabulous selection of all types of hot and cold items for a yummy, filling meal plus delicious coffee.
The cocktail hours also had a large assortment of food...even great cooked veggies for vegans!  I would definitely stay there again.

title: 숨겨진 추가 비용이 어마어마한 곳입니다.
text:
뉴욕의 많은 호텔들이 resort fee 혹은 residence fee형식으로 1박기준 20-30불 정도 부과하는것이 보통입니다. 이 호텔은, 숙박일과 사람수까지 같이 곱해서 추과 부과 합니다. 3인이 머물렀는데요, 1인 50불씩 매일 $150이 추가됐어요. 4박한 이후 (처음 결제한 숙박비 이외에) $600이라는 돈을 추가로 내고 와야 했습니다. 

저 600불을 내고 우리가 누렸던건, 말라빠진 빵조가리 몇개와 감자 베이컨이 볶아져있는 (매일 같은 구성의) 아침 식사와, 오후의 와인몇잔이 전부 입니다. 
600불이면, 3인이 장조지 미슐랭 디너를 하고도 남는 돈입니다.
너무나 황당했고, 정말 최악의 호텔 경험이었습니다. 

서비스를 원하지도 않는 고객들까지 무조건 (그것도 사람수대로) 추가로 비용을 부과하고,  
그 가격과는 전혀 맞지않은 질의 아침과 오후와인을 제공하는 ..
정말 도둑당한 기분이었습니다. 

뉴욕 지난10년간 8번정도 방문했고, 20곳이 넘는 뉴욕내 호텔들을 다녔지만
저에게는 너무나 기분나쁜 최악의 호텔이었습니다. 

아는사람이 간다고 하면 정말로 뜯어말릴 그런곳입니다. 절대 비추 합니다.

title: excellent accueil, excellentes prestations !
text: Très bien accueillis par Tarik (parlant français) averti par Magali (française), toute l'équipe aux petits soins. Belles chambres lit très confortable (juste une fois un petit oubli de pantoufles et de coton, oubli vite réparé). Le plus : le forfait petit-déjeuner - dîner happy ours - fitness - bouteilles d'eau - coffre etc. Station de métro à deux pas.

title: Awesome hotel, But.....
text: The room that I had was a Luxury King, on the 19th floor. It was much nicer than I had attended. Wonderful view. My only issue during my duration of the trip is that the walls are paper thin. You can hear EVERYTHING! There was a family next to me with screaming kids up all night, and on the other side I could hear thing that were a bit R RATED. I know the hotel can only do so much, and are unable to reconstruct the walls for my liking, but never had this problem in any other 5 star hotel. It was like they were in my room. I’m not a complaining person, so I never took my option to call the lobby to see if they could do anything. That’s why I’m keeping my 5 star rating, cause I know they would’ve, but I didn’t take the opportunity. The staff was beyond professional too. Beyond that, the decor was stunning in the room and everywhere around the hotel. The breakfast is nice too.

title: Great Staff and Service
text:
Stayed here 4 nights post cruise and it was great from check in to check out. We arrived early, having notified the hotel in advance. To find one of our rooms was ready. We then dropped all our luggage in the one room until they notified us when the other room was ready.

The staff were helpful and pleasant. We jammed the safe and within 10 minutes of reporting it someone had come up to open it for us. 

We were expecting continental style breakfast so was surprised to find Scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon available. As well as cereal/toast etc.
Coffee machine and soda were available throughout the day free of charge. Also, was surprised to find happy hour included a light meal & wine/beer all included in the resort tax. we were expecting snacks, but this was more than that.

Having been advised that the resort tax was higher at this hotel we certainly felt that it was worth it for the extras we had.

We chose the hotel for its proximity to Central Park. The subway was steps away from the front door for easy access to Battery Park & other sites. Just make sure you don't get on the express.

On our last day the hotel arranged a taxi for us to the airport and stored our luggage until we left.

Not sure but we never had a turndown service in the evening, not sure if we should have or not. But this didn't bother us.

My DH celebrated his birthday here and the hotel left a bottle of wine and chocolates in the room for him. Which was a special added touch for his special day.

Can't comment on the Gym as we didn't use it.

Overall we had a fantastic stay and if we returned to New York would stay here again.

title: 5 Star Service
text:
This top class, luxuries hotel situated in the heart of Manhattan is the perfect spot whether travelling for work or pleasure. All staff are friendly professional and take an active interest in the hotel experience of each guest, which made my stay at the West House memorable. 

It is easy to see how a hotel can be of such a high calibre when you meet the managing director, Mr Don Fraser, whose attention to detail and inviting personality sets the bar high for any hotel wishing to even compete. He went beyond the call of duty to ensure my stay at the West House exceeded expectations. 

All of this and I haven't even mentioned the exquisite rooms, great hotel amenities, perfect location to times, square, central park, Columbus circle and subway stations. 

If you are considering choosing the daily access to the lounge level, trust me, you will not look back or regret it. 

All in all, I will be staying here the next time I am in the city.

title: Comfy in Many ways
text: from first greeting by Vanessa at desk, Ben's help as concierge and the wait staff in bar and 23rd fl. dining everyone to housekeepers was cordial, initiated greeting and follow though graciously with assistance when needed.  The location was ideal for seeing shows, museums, getting subway and walking to central park.   Petr, GM was personable, relaxed and informative.  All the best to add to our comfort and experience.  Did I mention quiet?:, no street noise, spacious room well appointed for our needs.

title: My favorite hotel in NY
text: I love the Westhouse hotel!  I rarely return to a hotel more than once and am very picky but I just returned  there for a second time.  Quiet room and great  free breakfast (cappuccino machine!!!) and they provide a light dinner at happy hour every night which is quite good and is perfect if you are seeing a show.   The staff is amazing - friendly, helpful, and devoted to making sure you are happy.

title: Excellent hotel, great location
text: We stayed at the WestHouse for 3 nights in June - we would stay there again. Great location near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, 57th St subway.  Rooms well set up, good desk are, hotel rooms on higher floors so quiet for NYC. Front desk and concierge staff very helpful. Good buffet breakfast and cocktail hour food and drinks.

title: Luxury
text:
We got this hotel through Hotwire. It has an upscale feel. Comfortable beds and linens. Hot shower. Refrigerator in rooms. Complimentary Happy hour and continental breakfast included. 
I was pumping breast milk and they stored it in a freezer for me overnight. 
Very accommodating staff. 
It is completely under exterior construction right now, so views outside the rooms were hindered.

title: NOT FIVE STAR!
text:
We would expect a five star hotel to not have maids carts stationed permanently in the corridors as its unsightly and a risk in emergencies. The making up of the room was a bit random; sometimes we had enough towels, sometimes not and definitely not enough toiletries for two people! Stains on the carpet, and on the mirror, no stationery and no room information or room service and it took half an hour for ice to be delivered to our room. No duvet cover just sheets either side of the duvet, which became especially irritating. No vegetarian choices for dinner on occasions in the 'happy hour' service. No slippers or gowns as you would expect as standard in a five star hotel and especially as one of the "Small Luxury Hotels of the World" - worn and a bit tatty in general.
However, the hotel is positioned conveniently close to a Subway station and within walking distance of Times Square and Central Park and the beds were comfy!
The 'Bell Boys' were especially nice as were the waiters, although the maids we encountered were standoffish and rude. Unfortunately scaffolding was up at the front of the hotel during our stay which we were not informed about when we booked and it ruined any view we might have had.
There is a great bar just across the street and a half decent deli as well.
This hotel was basically clean and comfy enough for a short stay just not worthy of the money we paid or 5 stars!

title: Gem in Midtown
text: This place is gorgeous and the staff is so lovely. My room is beautiful and my window looks right over Carnegie Hall which I absolutely love. The bathroom is stunning, and I love that you get a light breakfast in the morning and a light dinner between five and seven. What a gem in the middle of mid town! Close to everything. Fantastic service. The entire staff is so courteous and lovely. They upgraded my room which was very nice, and I was given a drink ticket. It’s the little extra touches like this that make me happy. Customer service is not dead. The decor is chic and classy. The whole place has a European vibe and reminds me of Paris or Rome. I love it! It’s going to be my go to place now when I come to New York.

title: Not the luxury I expected
text:
We made a reservation at the Westhouse because my sister has stayed there and said it is a bit more private than it's sister hotel and worth the extra money. We did not feel our stay lived up to that. 

The GOOD: 
It was very quiet, and everyone with whom we dealt was pleasant. To assure reduced city noise, we requested a "courtyard" view which we knew would be an air shaft, but it was a very large and nice air shaft, and on the 25th floor, just 1 floor below the sky. We didn't hear other guests when they were in their rooms. Our room was tastefully furnished and the drawers of the dresser were very clean. 

The BAD: 
Our king size bed was actually on a queen frame (no box spring) so it was rather uncomfortable. I was pretty amazed when I noticed this in the morning after sleeping on it. That explains all the bedding coming untucked from the sides overnight...
The bathroom was really tiny. 5'x5' with a 2'x2.5' alcove for the sink. As the door opened into the bathroom, you had to either open the door fully while pressing back against the toilet or scrunch into the alcove with the sink to get the door by you. 
The LED lights in the bathroom flickered (except the one over the sink). The flickering gave both my wife and me headaches.
There was no full-length mirror in the room. The one mirror that could have worked had a little unusable shelf-like projection at the bottom, which blocked the view of my ankles and feet. 
There were no bathrobes in the room. Although I realize this is somewhat of an extravagance, the hotel had been promoted as "luxury" so we expected that. 
Probably not the hotel's fault but we expected a higher class of people than the inebriated (sounding) people talking loudly and for quite a while beginning at 2;30 AM right outside our door.
Finally: valet parking--they should warn guests it will be approximately 25 minutes to retrieve their car, so the guests can plan appropriately.

And one complaint against many NYC hotels - they tout "free" breakfast and cocktail hours but charge a mandatory $49/person/day to cover that. Please just add that to the room fee to accurately list the room price.

title: Nice breakfast and early dinner
text:
I liked the option to have early dinner at the hotel, but very early! Rooms are nice but
Bathroom are very small. During the night I have listened some noise and I have waked up with the air conditioning turned off. I guess it is normal for the hotel but it was very warm for me. I have chosen this hotel because of my office distance.

title: Great hotel and location
text: Stayed for 6 nights in May and spent so much time sightseeing and did not spend much time in the room but the complimentary breakfast and evening appetizers and drinks were great before going out. All of the staff we talked to were very helpful and pleasant including the staff that looked after the evening appetizers. The food was always replaced promptly when needed. Housekeeping was also excellent. Lighting in the room could have been a bit brighter but had lots of light from the outside (had an exterior facing room with nice view of surrounding buildings).

title: Great location but Service and room needs work
text:
I stayed here for 5 nights with my husband, it was our first trip to the big Apple.
Ok! We arrived at check in and had no help with our bags, even tho I did request it! After a while my husband jus said it’s ok we’ll handle it! 
Got to the room and I must say this hotel is NO 5 star I’m not even sure I’d give it a 4 star as it’s so tired and we found dust everywhere not jus that the mirrors were stained. Lighting was quite dim, for us ladies who do make up. We had so many issues as one evening there was no Shower gel replacement and no shower floor towel, also no face towel replaced. 
I did complain about it at the desk but was told to come back and see a manager, why should I see the manager? He should find us and speak to us or leave a note in our room. Not very professional at all as I’ve stayed in so many 5 star hotels and not had this treatment. 
We drank at the Den cocktail bar and service was great the first night! But the next day it was really bad, the same bar tender was sooo miserable it put us off our drink. 
Jus don’t go to the Den as so many amazing bars who appreciate your custom. One of our faves was Living room in Time square.

The only positives I have about this place is that the breakfast was good quality and the cocktail hour was good! But don’t forget we all
Pay for that anyway so it’s not complimentary as they tell you before you book. All in all we had a great time! But don’t be fooled, book somewhere else.

title: The Perfect Hotel for you...
text:
This hotel has it all, beauty, chic, location, amazing service and beautiful rooms with amazing extras. Me and my wife just enjoyed our second stay at this hotel. We first visited from the UK when we were engaged in 2017, our stay that time was perfect. Our second time was as husband and wife and the hotel was just as good as before, if not more appreciated.

If you are visiting NY as a tourist or a business trip the hotel is ideally situated, there is an Underground station about 15 seconds from the hotel and Central Park is a 3 minute walk and Times Square a 6 minute walk. The staff work exceptionally hard to make your stay enjoyable, and the decor and smell of the hotel is amazing. 

The ‘hours of indulgence’ from 1700 - 1900 is essentially a happy hour, where you have access to unlimited alcohol and soft drinks as well as amazing food which is easily an evening meal if you choose it to be. This is all included within the price.

The breakfast has a great selection and is also included in the price and really sets you up for your day of business or exploring. The hotel has a great gym and many of the rooms offer a fantastic view of Manhattan.

New York is a magical city, with an energy I have seldom experienced anywhere else, the Westhouse Hotel is the cherry on the top, it’s a genuine 5 star hotel with class and chic and the hotel goes above and beyond to make your trip perfect. 

You need to stay here, you won’t be disappointed.

title: WE JUST LOVE THIS HOTEL!
text: Our family just loves everything about the WestHouse, from the location to the room decor and how they keep the hotel so beautifully clean! The employees are by far the best I have met at a hotel from how friendly they are to helping you find the best  way on the subway routes. I would like to mention some people that stand out with going above and beyond with helping my family.  Juan, Vanessa, Ashley, Nick, Tarek, Jason, Kathy, Moe, Ethan, Anthony, Tom, Rafael, Hamza and Raymonde!  THE BEST STAFF!  We are definitely coming back to stay again soon.

title: Top Lage für dieses Stadthotel mitten in Manhatten
text:
Hotellage: Ideal, fußläufig Midtown, Time Square, Broadway, 5th Avenue, alle Hauptattraktionen einfach zu Fuß erreichbar. 

Direkt an der U-Bahn Station, mit allen wichtigen Verbindungen, raus zum Hotel und links noch 20 Meter - Linie nach Downtown uns Brooklyn, damit ist alles erreichbar. 

Hotelerscheinung im 50iger Jahre Stil, freundlicher Empfang und auch sehr bemüht samt Concierge. 
Das Hotel ist sehr dunkel eingerichtet und in die Jahre gekommen.  Wirkt trotzdem sehr gepflegt, sauber, angenehmer Duft und hat Stil. 

Hotel hat alle Annehmlichkeiten wie Frühstück, tagsüber alkoholfreie Getränke aus dem Kühlschrank zur Selbstbedienung, Kaffeemaschine und von 17.00 Uhr bis 19.00 Uhr ist Happy Hour und es gibt im 23. Stock in "The Terrace" Wein, Bier, Sekt und Snacks, die einem Abendessen gleich kommen - 2 Warmgerichte plus Käse, Wurst, Salat, Brot. 

Das "amerikanische" Frühstück, mehr als ausreichend…. 2 Kaffeevollautomaten (guter Cappuccino), Kaffee im Behälter, diverse Teesorten, Orangen-, Grapefruitsaft und Zitronenwasser im Spender, diverse Warmgerichte wie Rührei, gebratener Speck, Würstchen, Tortilla, frische Wurst, verschiedene Bagels, Toast, Marmelade, Butter, frischer Obstsalat, Quark und Brotaufstriche, süße Teilchen, Croissants, usw. Wer nichts findet, hat wohl zu hohe Ansprüche an ein amerikanische Frühstück. Bananen, Äpfel, Müsli-Riegel stehen auch zur Verfügung und können mitgenommen werden. 

"The Terrace" im 23. Stock ist eine angenehme Lokalität und sehr nett und hübsch im 50iger Jahren Stil eingerichtet. Der Balkon nach draußen war leider eine Baustelle und zu dieser Zeit nicht begehbar. 

Zimmer sind ausreichend, aber leider sehr dunkel, wenig Licht, Ausblick in den Hinterhof auch nicht toll. Das Zimmer ist trotz der höchsten Temperatur eingestellt noch frisch und kühl. Generell ist das Hotel sehr gekühlt, was aber in NY wohl völlig normal ist. Durch das dunkle Ambiente und fehlendes Tageslicht hält man sich darin nicht wirklich gerne auf. 

Auch das Bad ist relativ klein, aber ausreichend, ohne Abluft, Dusche ohne Handbrause. Duschgel, Shampoo usw. vorhanden, Fön ist auch sehr gut. Wasser ist auf jeden Fall heiß und man kann sich dann zumindest gemütlich duschen, ohne dass das Bad unter Wasser steht. Auch der Service war o.k. täglich frische Handtücher und die Badutensilien wurden aufgefüllt. Täglich waren auch im Zimmer 2 Wasserflaschen gratis zur Verfügung. 
Die Hotelzimmer sind sehr hellhörig und man hört jede Stimme vom Flur, da die Türen einen großen Spalt aufweisen. 

Trotz allem wiegt der Service, die inkludierten Getränke, die Happy Hour und die absolute Bestlage alles auf und kann somit als Top Hotel empfohlen werden.

title: Excellence Everywhere
text: First stay at the WestHouse. Won't be the last. It started with Kathy at the front desk (who couldn't have done more to make my stay comfortable) and set the bar for the whole time. Great culture across the board, including housekeeping and Raphael at the bar. And of course the room was really lovely! Congrats!

title: WestHouse Hotel
text:
Stayed there for for a quick get away and it was amazing. The dark theme of the lobby is breathtaking. Did I mention complimentary daily breakfast and dinner with champagne and wine?

The only thing I didn't like about the hotel is the entrance’s proximity to the street.

title: Nuestra segunda vez en este hotel; todo excelente.
text: La estadía en el hotel acompaña lo magnífico de New York. Confort, limpieza y atención excelente. Muy buena ubicación. Desayuno abundante y servicios impecables. Para destacar, a Rafael por su profesionalismo y calidez.

title: Great straff & great company
text:
Great hotel and fantastic staff. Overall a very nice experience and a good concept. Good services, nice beds and clean rooms.
Special thanks to fantastic bartender Rafael and his great Mumm champagne.

title: Beautiful Rooms and great service
text:
This is my second visit to Westhouse Hotel in New York for business. The staff has been accommodating and friendly. Tarik at the front desk specifically made a previous circumstance during my stay even better the next visit and even remembered the inconvenience despite it happening months prior.

The rooms are clean, comfortable and modern. I look forward to continuing my business and personal travels here.

title: Birthday Weekend Trip
text:
Westhouse is a 1920’s style boutique hotel with a fantastic location!  The rooms were small but well appointed and very comfortable.  Walk to Central Park, a Broadway play and Times Square.  Steps from the subway too!

The best part was the attentive staff.  Vanessa at the front desk was sweet and helpful.  Raphael at the bar made you feel like he had known you forever!  Make sure to ask him for an Italian Margarita... the best!!!

The evening happy hour was much more than expected.  You could actually make it dinner.  The breakfast was also very good.

The only con... for such an upscale hotel I hated seeing the housekeeping carts/vacuums being stored in the hallways all night. (They did cover them since there was nowhere to put them.)

A definite recommendation!!!

title: One night stay - wonderful
text:
Last night in NYC before going back to France. Wonderful experience : juste a one night stay and yet a great expérience.
Thanks to Mo, Tarek (at front desk) and Ben (concierge). We will return with pleasure.

title: 5 estrelas
text:
O hotel está muito bem localizado, o quarto muito confortável, funcionários muito simpáticos e eficazes. Fiquei em um quarto sem vista para a rua e era muito silencioso. 
A única coisa que eu não gostei foi o chuveiro. Mas me hospedaria aqui de novo sem dúvida! 

Special thanks to the lovely employees Vanessa (reception) and Rafael (bar).

title: Friendly staff and great location
text: When you have staff at a hotel that remembers you post check-in that shows another level of service and understanding of its customers. Tarik in particular was lovely and very welcoming, all other staff I interacted with were also great. The hotel offers extras such as breakfast and early evening canapés/drinks also adds to the experience, thus I have made the WestHouse my go to when I travel to NY. The hotel ticks a lot of boxes from a travellers perspective,

title: Our new favorite Manhattan hotel
text: We were treated very well especially by Tarik at the front desk and Juan, the manager. They assisted us in getting the lovely room we wanted. We loved the close proximity to Central Park and the theaters. Having delicious breakfasts and light dinners there saved us lots of money and time because we went to the theater each night and didn't want to eat heavy beforehand. Can't wait to return there again.

title: Fantastic hotel for a quick theater weekend trip!!
text: This place was perfect for me traveling solo. They graciously accommodated me with an early check in- and my room was a perfect corner city view. The lighting was great because of the windows; and in the evening, the lights in the room were bright where there were mirrors. The bed and pillows I found super comfortable. The room will probably need updating soon. There's some signs of wear and tear now-but I liked the decor and it was a huge space where I could do morning stretches and sort thru my luggage. I consider this more of a 4-4.5 star hotel. It would be even nicer if they provided robes and had room service. I read other reviews referencing the daily $49 resort fees-so this wasn't a surprise to me when I was billed at the end of the stay. It was actually perfect for me because as a solo traveler, I was able to grab breakfast from the buffet at the Terrace dining room and it was a wonderful assortment. The crowd was definitely mixed with families, couples, and adult groups. I worked from the hotel room-where the free wifi worked without any problems. All water bottles were complimentary.  Then there was happy hour 5-7pm with wine, beer, champagne and food, cheeses/meats, dessert- the whole spread felt more like dinner. It was fabulous having the happy hour and easy for me to get back to my room to get ready for my shows. I didn't get a chance to check out The Den bar near the lobby. The hotel location was superb within 1-4 blocks of the theater shows I was attending. I felt completely safe. Central Park was a short walk-and I rode the subway to get to the Met Museum. I ended up finding a great health food store a block away to grab a supplement I needed. Hotel staff were super kind in all their dealings with me. I would definitely stay here again!! It was perfect for my needs.

title: Perfect dog-friendly hotel
text: I and my "special guest" (as WestHouse refers to dogs) were welcomed with a dog bed and bowls already in our suite upon our arrival for a six night stay. The hotel has excellent proximity to Central Park for off-leash runs before 9 a.m.

title: Great Hotel
text: A great hotel in a good location with great service. Mo (front desk) was extremely helpful and dealt with all of our requests with a smile. And we loved our room - very spacious, nicely furnished and private. We’ll be back.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: My daughter and I spent a few nights in NY at the WestHouse.  We’re very selective; and both agreed we loved the WestHouse !  We had a one Bedroom suite; so plenty of room. Bath was fine, small but not by NY standards.  Decor lovely. Very clean. Staff was super nice, efficient and helpful!   Loved the breakfast and cocktails and hors d'oeuvre 5p-7p each evening! Highly recommend the WestHouse !!!

title: Awesome Stay!!!
text: Had an outstanding stay at the Westhouse Hotel New York. Phenomenal staff (thank you Stephen for your welcoming personality), roomy rooms, incredible location, terrific amenities, fantastic breakfast (and soda)...I am running out of superlatives. Simply awesome!!! Gary

title: Great
text:
Wonderful stay 
Reception is great and efficient (special mention Tarek, Nick, Ethan. they will do everything they can to make you happy)
Concierges are great (Shawn and Ben give great advice and are very efficient) 
Breakfast is amazing 
Bonus : indulgence time !

title: Still special
text:
This boutique hotel continues its consistent high level of service and accommodations while maintaining its personal touch by making each individual feel welcome. 
There is no pretense. Only a desire to please. 
So well located- easy walking to theatres and great shopping— subway right outside front door

title: Great, centrally located but a little pricey
text:
Stayed with my wife for a week and thoroughly enjoyed it. Very helpful staff, nice clean and comfortable rooms and a great „happy two hours“ with free beer, wine and champagne as well as hot food from 5-7pm on 23 floor.
Worth considering though is that New York is a noisy city. We orignally had an inner courtyard room where there was a constant hum from some air con generators below and asked to be moved. Turned out the front facing room we moved to was even nosier (Lots of road works). Staff were exceptionally helpful in moving us and waived 2 days residents tax. 

What I found a little disappointing was that there is no place to have a drink during the day (bar in lobby opens at 7pm if I remember rightly) and although not the worst failing, I can‘t understand why some hotels don‘t have toilet brushes?! All in all would book again.

title: Ashley at the front desk is amazing!!!
text: The staff at this hotel is wonderful, Ashley at the front desk helped us out so much and even got us into our room earlier than check in time.  This is the only hotel we will stay in on our next trip back to NYC!!

title: Tarik is the Man and Westhouse is the Place
text: I got to the front desk, very tired after a long day of work and in need of a bath and a nap, only to find out that the company who booked my stay made a mistake. At many hotels this would have resulted in a long frustrating run around in the lobby. Luckily for me, Tarik was at the desk. He worked the phones to his people and to my people and within ten minutes I was relaxing in a very nice, very quiet room. Thank you Tarik.

title: TARIK IS AMAZING!!
text: What started out as a exhausting day of airport delays and cancellation ended with an amazing beautiful night!! I travel two weeks a month to NYC and will now move my trips to WestHouse!! The room upgrade and glass of wine was so thoughtful and greatly appreciated. Beautiful room, and amazing Front desk!! Thank you Tarik! See you next time !

title: Quick visit
text: Great location and customer service. Upgrade easy. Full buffet breakfast and happy hour on the 23rd floor  a welcome service.  I asked for a late checkout and it was accommodated readily by duty manager . Juan, Harik and Vanessa were great.

title: West House is a Great Hotel
text:
We really enjoyed our March, 2019 visit to NYC and our stay at The West House.  First of all the price was right!  Our room, however, was very small and we asked for an upgrade.  We got one for a bit of a price raise, but the room was a suite and absolutely fabulous.  Living room, couch, tv, dining room table--very roomy.  View of 7th Avenue looking down to Times Square.  They did have scaffolding around the building and you could not go out to the deck, but that was minor.

Front desk service was fabulous.  Starting with arranging for a room change.  The front desk person Ashley was amazing, highly professional, and did everything with a very big smile.  So were Aleksandra and Moe.  

The concierge service was outstanding! Ben and Shawn made many arrangements for restaurants and visitor sites.  The best restaurants that we would not have know about were River Park and Milos (a very short walk from the hotel.)  Milos was the best Greek restaurant we every ate at!  Every time we went out we got advise on whether to take a taxi or the subway.  If we walked, we got excellent directions.  They made us feel so comfortable and nothing was too much to take time to speak to us and advise.

The hotel is close to everything!  The subway is about 15 steps away and they encouraged us to take it, even though I was hesitant.  We used it and loved it.  We felt like real New Yorkers!  We easily walked back to the hotel from the Theater District and even farther away areas like the Lower Eastside.  So many great restaurants close by.  Great neighborhood in Midtown--clean and safe.

The complimentary daily breakfast was a real plus and delicious.  Lattes and cappuccinos were available!  Never attended the complimentary afternoon appetizer and drink event but heard it was lovely.

The beds were super comfortable with wonderfully soft sheets.

Maid service was excellent.

It is not the fanciest  or updated of hotels, but very clean, fabulous service and so centrally located.

title: Wonderful location and great staff!
text:
WestHouse is a gem! It is a marvelous boutique hotel in a wonderful location with walking distance to many places such as Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Time Square and Broadway Shows which saved us so much time traveling.

Thanks to the WestHouse staff for trying your best to accommodate us from late arrival to late check-out! Even though the suite we originally booked was not available because the previous guests decided to extend their stay due to emergency, Alexandra from the front desk called us and made arrangement for us. Our flight was cancelled because EWR had some air traffic control issues, so we were en route to JFK and ended up arriving 9 hours later than planned. We are so glad that WestHouse still held our rooms for us. On the day we needed to check-out, we had a concert at Carnegie Hall until 2:30pm. The manager in charge generously granted us late check-out, so we could have a place to change out of the concert attire. Thank you so much! You made our trip so much easier! This is the 2nd time that we stayed at WestHouse and we are sure to be back! Thanks again for everything!

title: Un seul mot : idyllique !
text:
Que dire ?

Nous en avions regardé des hôtels sur New York  !
Et il y en a tellement ! On s’y perd !

Nous connaissions déjà un hôtel près de Central Park, plus tape-à-l’œil, trop grand à mon goût, car nous voulions en réalité quelque chose de plus authentique, de plus intimiste ... et raffiné malgré tout. 
Après une longue recherche étudiée, nous nous sommes donc arrêtés sur le WestHouse hôtel… 

Nous avons TOUT aimé  !

Les chambres, le petit déjeuner, l’apéritif dînatoire du soir…
Mais il ne faut surtout pas oublier le professionnalisme de l’équipe !
Nous remercions tout particulièrement Tarik pour son français impeccable, Ethan le manager et sa disponibilité, Marcelo et son sourire incroyable, Victor et sa gentillesse de tous les matins, ainsi que Vanessa pour un accueil chaleureux alors que nous arrivions de l’aéroport fatigués !

A noter ! Nous avons demandé (malgré un hôtel plein) le possible changement de notre chambre car nous préférions au final être sur la 55th. 
Tout le monde s’est mis en quatre pour répondre à notre demande et nous avons été pleinement satisfaits par notre changement !

Pour conclure, au WestHouse hôtel tout est soigné et travaillé : la décoration, la cuisine, le choix des vins, les attentions, la prévenance du personnel (sans oublier les bagagistes !), et même la musique, chic et discrète ...

Incontestablement, lorsque nous reviendrons à New York ce sera forcément au WestHouse hôtel que nous séjournerons ! 
Un grand merci !!! Cécile.

title: Great place to stay
text: We loved the stay. The location is very convenient and close to Central Park. The hotel itself is very nice. Tarik at the front desk was very helpful and took the time to help us during our stay. The breakfast was also great.

title: Nice hotel, super nice staff
text: We stayed here from 4/15-4/18. Nice stay, super friendly staff, very comfortable and very well located. The residents fee charged covers breakfast, fitness center and “hours of indulgence “ with wine and light dinner from 5-7pm. We enjoyed our stay!

title: Lyxigt med bra läge.
text: Stort men stilfullt och mysigt hotell med toppenläge. Tunnelbana och shopping utanför dörren men ändå lugnt. Trevlig buffé med mat och dryck, även vin och champagne på eftermiddagarna. Bra frukost med amerikanska mått mätt. Trevlig personal. Många klagar på debiteringen men vi hade inga problem med det. Trevlig bar/lounge vid receptionen.

title: Perfect hotel for family break
text: We had a three night stay for a family of 5 so booked 2 adjacent rooms. I’ve got to say that this was exactly what we were looking for. It’s a high quality, relaxed hotel with five star quality but non of the stuffiness that you might expect. It feels like a boutique hotel and we felt welcomed and relaxed from beginning to end. The breakfast is a really pleasant buffet so we were able to wander up and have our breakfast and then send the kids as and when they were ready. Finally, the location is perfect too. Any family that’s weighing up the pros and cons between an Airbnb and a hotel should simply book here, and let the hotel staff look after you.

title: Bra läge
text:
Bästa med detta hotell är läget, nära till det mesta och ändå lugnt på nätterna.
Tyvärr så är standard, städning och frukost inte i närheten av ett "normalt" femstjärnigt hotell, det är bara priset som ligger på femstjärnenivå.
Pass upp så att ni inte blir feldebiterade, de ville lägga på oss skatter för både det ena och andra tills jag påtalade att det inte stämde med min bokning.

title: 7 nights
text: I could not pick a better hotel for my solo business trip to NYC. Great breakfast every morning. Absolutely unexpectedly nice happy hour/food every later afternoon. Vanessa and Starlin were great on the front desk. Trenton ran the bell desk like a conceirhe. So friendly and professional. Great representatives of a hotel whose entire staff really cares. Tiny issue with temp of rooms. Thermostat seemed to be more for show as room was pretty warm no matter how it was adjusted. Otherwise great room, great services. Loved it.

title: Perfect Hotel for Family of 4 near Central Park
text: My family of 4 with 2 young children found this to be well appointed, excellent breakfast and happy hour included as part of Resort cost and nicely located, blocks away from Central Park. Highly recommend

title: Not a 5 star hotel
text:
We love NY and this was our 5th time visiting the big apple. We’ve stayed at different hotels previously but this time we stayed at the WestHouse hotel close to Times Square for five nights. 
The website tells you that it’s a 5 star hotel but I wouldn’t agree.
The lobby is nice, staff friendly and service minded but that you can find at any hotel no matter the stars.

We had a nice room, a queen size bed, and some kind of view since they were remodeling the outside of the building and had a construction platform covering the building and windows.

We had the breakfast buffet and it was ok, coffee was good and they had well made scrambled eggs and bacon. I would have loved if they had some selection of cheese, ham and vegetables. They only had fruit salad for some days during our visit.

The cleaning was average for being a 5 star hotel. The forgot towels and water one day and I also found long black hair beside my toothbrush one day (I’m blond) Not so nice...
Cleaning could definitely have been better.

The last night we had dinner at a nearby restaurant and decided to have our coffee in the bar at our 5 star hotel... turned out they couldn’t serve coffee at the hotel at 9 pm.

We had a great time in the best city but that was not because of the hotel and it was definitely not worth the price.

title: Superb service
text: It was such a pleasure staying here thanks to the customer service and hospitality I experienced while staying at this centrally located hotel for business. My first positive impression was that when I requested a quiet room, the woman who checked me in truly then did give me a very quiet room. She knew the pro’s and con’s of each unit and described them to me so that I could decide whether to wait for my perfect, silent room. The concierge was very responsive and resourceful in booking an appointment for me. The property is clean and organized. The proximity to Central Park is phenomenal. I will stay here again for business or pleasure.

title: Spectacular Stay
text: My wife and I stayed at the WestHouse. We travel frequently and highlyrecommend this hotel.  Our room was clean, and the staff were both helpful and super friendly. Special shout out to Ethan and Ashley at the front desk who greeted us with genuine enthusiasm and followed up mid stay to make sure we were happy.  We had originally booked a luxury King room, but Ethan was happy to offer upgrade us to a suite. The Terrace on Floor 23 is a great place to grab a quick bite, coffee or drink and is included in the cost of your room. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect stay
text: Great hotel in a wonderful location, two blocks south of Central Park. Very comfortable rooms, clean and well appointed. Excellent service by staff. Residents enjoy breakfast and a light dinner each day which was perfect for our stay.  Highly recommended.

title: Surprise upgrade to a suite
text:
Beautiful accommodations, attentive staff and great breakfasts included on the 23rd floor. 
The front desk manager was very welcoming and helpful.  Later, the concierge made a great recommendation for dinner at "Robert" on Columbus Circle and completed the reservation for us. The staff made us feel very comfortable.  Very convenient location. 
We would stay there again!

title: Fantastic service - very pleasant facility
text:
The WestHouse is a very nice hotel: the room was well-appointed and seemed newly-remodeled.  All the public spaces were clean and pleasant.  The Terrace lounge/dining area was a pleasant place to enjoy tasty breakfasts and a free espresso during the day.  The location is also excellent, adjacent to the 57th Street subway stop off 7th Avenue. All spaces were meticulously clean.

What really stood out, however, was how pleasant and helpful literally every staff member was.  The breakfast buffet was well-stocked by people who seemed genuinely committed to creating a pleasant experience for everyone.  The front desk, concierge, and housekeeping staff members provided warm greetings at every turn. 

Can't wait to go back.

title: A smile and a laugh after a long, tiring day
text: Upon entering the WestHouse, after a long and tiring fitness-dance Conference, I was greeting with a joke & a smile from Tarik, the front receptionist on duty. We laughed & danced a little Salsa with Raphael from the restaurant bar, and Tarik so kindly granted me my wish with a gorgeous room on the 24th floor. Thank you Tarik. So far, a lovely experience,& I know I will sleep better, knowing how kind, fun, diverse, yet professional and a gentleman Tarik, and Raphael were. I can’t wait for the gratuitous breakfast tomorrow morning!!

title: Great hotel, excellent service
text: Very nice hotel, spacious and excellent staff.  We visit NY often. Great hotel with kids also. Good area for quick walk to Central Park, broadway and Times Square.  Anthony Sturiale, food and beverage manager, went above and beyond making our children feel welcome.  Would definitely stay again our next visit to New York.

title: Excellent service and accommodation
text:
I booked a 5 day trip to New York for my partner for his 30th Birthday as a surprise . It had been booked in July 2018 for March 2019. Upon booking at the hotel I had paid for a Times Square King view room to ensure that all aspects of this trip was 5*. 

When we arrived at the hotel it was pretty late and upon check in the manager came to talk to us. Unfortunately the room we had booked wasn’t available. However by way of compensation the manager wiped our residence fee and also moved us to a suite.

From start to finish the experience in the hotel was absolutely 5*. In fact we stayed in a different room on the first night until the suite was ready. Even if we’d have stayed there the entire time the room was beautiful and reflected the 5* nature of the hotel.

The location of the hotel couldn’t be better, two streets below Central Park and 3 blocks from Times Square you are in a very central location, just enough to be in the hustle and bustle but not too close to be overwhelmed by all the tourists.

The staff at the hotel are incredible polite and amenable. 

We intend to visit New York again soon and we will definitely be staying here again.

title: Expedia VIP Experience
text: My Expedia gold status awarded us complimentary Resident status at Westhouse, which includes 2 drinks at the bar and complimentary lounge access on the 23rd floor. This had daily breakfast and dinner buffets, although modest (2 hot dishes and cheese and wine, plus espresso machines) were enough to keep us going during some of our 6 nights. The City View rooms can be just a little noisy from the sirens, but this is NYC and the view is worth it. Everyone was very helpful, accommodating (brought a heater to our room), and pleasant (our maid Angela was great). This is a great place for longer stays, feels very safe, and we love the area for subway access, Columbus Circle shopping, Central Park and food in Hell’s Kitchen. #petfriendly this is also our best experience so far in NYC staying with our Chihuahua (in the last 5 or 6 hotels).

title: Bait and Switch
text: I booked a room at the Westhouse, which is attached to the much lower quality Park Central Hotel.
