When I arrived, surprise surprise....... there was a problem because they had overbooked the Westhouse and did not have a room for me so they charged me the full cost of the Westhouse room and then stuck me in a closet sized, low quality room in the adjacent hotel.  They would not reduce the price and I in no way got what I paid for.  Beware of sham hotel owners who pull a bait and switch like this one.

title: Amazing hotel - we loved it
text: We just spent 6 days at the WestHouse hotel. What a lovely place! Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean. We enjoyed the free delicious buffet breakfast and free happy hour. The bartender Rafael was very nice and we enjoyed his great customer service.  All the staff seem to enjoy their jobs. There are many restaurants and shops within walking distance. Times Square is just minutes away. We will stay again at WestHouse on our next trip to New York.

title: Perfect accommodations in NYC
text: The hotel was fabulous! The staff was friendly and helpful. The suite was very spacious and clean. We enjoyed the breakfast and cocktail hour! Delicious food! Location was spectacular! We will definitely stay here again on our next visit to NYC!

title: Comfy beds, great staff!
text: The hotel is well appointed, and other than room doors that bang shut which will disturb light sleepers, this was a great midtown pick.  Melida in F & B and Rafael during wine hour were good humored and attentive, even with more difficult guests. The breakfast choices were beyond the average continental, and even towards the end of service hours there was plenty to eat. Front desk staff were welcoming and charming- Aric/Eric(sp?) especially.

title: A gorgeous hotel with better service this year than ever before!
text: What a lovely, warm, cozy, elegant retreat from the chaos of Times Square!  I've stayed here multiple times, always having a clean room and comfortable bed and gorgeous rooms. But this time the service was even a step above.  Kind, polite and warm staff from the front desk to the waiters to the bartender, Marcello, who deserves special mention. What's more fun in this world than taking a child to stay at this wonderful hotel and seeing a few shows? Enjoy.

title: Beautiful rooms
text: This hotel is stunning and right in central location. You can walk right into Times Square, Broadway, even central park. On arrival we received a bottle of champagne and had complimentary GHD hairdryer and straighteners. Was a lovely touch. The room was very spacious and very clean. The staff were helpful. You could help yourself to drinks from the restaurant area such as coke, lemonade or water. Makes up for paying such high city tax upon departure, which you dont get told about.

title: Routine travel to NYC
text: A true luxury property with every amenity imaginable and a staff that delivers sincere concern for guest comfort. Since moving out of our CPS apartment and trying CP area hotels, we have finally found a home. For those traveling on business, you can have extraordinary productivity by holding your meetings on the concierge floor and if traveling for pleasure, Westhouse is the ideal spot for couples or families.   Incredibly impressive!

title: Mini Spring Break trip
text:
Great Hotel!  Clean and friendly. Rooms that we stayed in were nice and clean ..small but to be expected in New york and a little dark but overall nice! The breakfast and Happy Hour were great! Lots of choices and everything was great!
Great Location also!  would stay here again!

title: Lipstick on a pig
text: The Westchase is a "four-star" hotel in a two-star building with three star service.  Issue: Really poor climate control in the rooms.  Like other old buildings in NYC you either get heat or a/c.  In good hotels, they have made updates or figured out how to give you a choice in your room.  In this hotel:  no choice.  If you are in one of the hot rooms, like we were, even with the heat turned off you might just bake.  In addition, the rooms are on the 19 floor and up and there are only two elevators, which can make for a wait.  Hence the two-star building.  The rooms were nicely appointed with good soaps, etc, and the lobby and breakfast room were nice (with above average food and service in the breakfast room).  Hence the the ability to call it a "four-star" hotel.  The front desk and cleaning crew were about as helpful as you get at a run of the mill big brand place.  Hence the three star service.

title: Excellent  location
text: My husband and I had very pleasurable stay at the Westhouse, it’s always a wonderful experience, we loved how close it was to everything, we love to walk to Central Park and broadway. Excellent customer service, we want to say thanks especially to the food and beverages manager (Melida )she’s amazing she make us feel welcomed, We will definitely staying again, “Highly recommend”

title: Wonderful Gem of a Hotel
text: The WestHouse is a fabulous Hotel! Everything from the rooms being kept so clean and tidy to the up to date deco. The staff is just amazing!!!  Everybody that works at the WestHouse is great.  I just want point  and exceptional bunch of people that made our stay  extra special  Juan, Ethan,  Ashley, Jason, Vanessa, Tarek, NIck, Petr, and Kathy   We have stayed at the WestHouse many times and are most definitely coming back again.  Everyone at this hotel is so friendly and extremely nice.  We just love this Hotel!!!

title: Great Customer Service
text: I organized a group stay at the WestHouse. Working with the reservations team (specifically Suzanna and Su) was an absolute breeze. They responded quickly to all of my many requests, changes, and additions in the most professional and kind manner. Everyone in the group enjoyed their stay, and they loved how close it was to everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a prime NYC location that's both elegant and cost effective. Also--there were no "hidden" fees, so I have no idea what these other reviews are referring to--all pricing information is available if you read thoroughly. We will definitely be working with WestHouse in the future.

title: A perfect location in the heart of NYC!
text:
I have booked flights and 3 nights at WestHouse Hotel via Opodo, all fees included and ALL payments were done in advance, double room with breakfast. I certainly accept local city-taxes but at the check-in counter they asked friendly but strict for another 53,35 $ per person and night for a mantatory resident-fee. So another 320 bucks for 3 night´s. After a serious discussion I could negotiate and cutt off 50%, still had 160 bucks to pay extra, which is simply not correct and made my arrival not that good. After all I got an upgrade from queen to king. Besides  that the hotel was really great and it is a strong suggestion. Next to times-square, metro, bars, restaurants, central garden, etc., it is just a perfect coice and the service is really good. 
After check-out I wanted to call myself a cab to the airport but the door-man asked what I need and than he was extremely pushing and just called a cab for us. Instead of usually 70-90 bucks for the tranfer to Newark (took just 45 minutes at 3 p.m.) we paid 115, probable 20 bucks for the door-man included :) All together it´s a nice, clean and great located place just be careful with extras and fees than it works out perfectly! The staff was nice as well, big thanks! Yes, next time I book at the WestHouse Hotel directly all inclusive ;-) without discussion and than it´s a  5 star rating.

title: WestHouse hotel
text:
Happy hour between 5-7 great , could be 5-8 like some other hotels who offer this . Overall , room nice cosy and clean .
Little bit of noise from latecomers chattering and  slamming doors in the early hours of the morning but on a weekend I suppose to be expected... 
Breakfast could be a little better - the eggs were not good and there was no fresh fruit until the last day. 
Staff very nice , especially Raphael,

title: Hidden Fees & Headaches
text:
Where to begin? I came to the Westhouse hotel in celebration for my 21st birthday. My boyfriend at the time used to live in New York and we knew it'd be the perfect place to be for this pivotal moment. We had visited New York before and stayed in the Jane hotel. I was Curious as to why it *felt* we had decided to stay in a much nicer hotel this go round (to my surprise he later during this trip proposed.) And as a congratulatory gift from his mother she rented us this hotel room.

On arrival I used my card for a (refundable) $500 downpayment for incidentals. After a seemingly decent trip I returned and was never refunded the downpayment knowing full well we left the room in immaculate shape. When calling to see why I had never received a refund I was sent to department after department and wasted 30 minutes on the phone. I did this about 5 times. At this point it was nearing Christmas and not only did I not receive a refund I couldn't even get anyone on the phone to understand why I was being charged.

About a month later I finally am able to get Juan Vargas the general manager of the hotel on the phone (after badgering a seemingly innocent concierge.) And I am told that this was NOT my downpayment, but the residence fee. He goes on to tell me it is made visible on the booking website, and after explaining that I am not the one who booked this room and that it was a gift and that I was never made aware of such fee that I was only told I would be charged for incidentals, he went on to tell me there was nothing he could do. 

Fast forward to months later and hours upon hours spent on the phone with my bank. I look back on this stay (what should've been a magical time in my life) as nothing but a nightmare.

In addition the luxury items they boast about online are A LIE! Upon arrival there toiletries were nothing more than your standard inexpensive shampoo and conditioner, and the "luxurious" brand named heat appliances for your hair are LITERALLY CONAIR!! My straightener is better at home.

Also the residence fee for this "Continental breakfast and cocktail hour" is food straight out of a bag, and dried out, luke warm chafers full of average at best dishes. Oh! And don't forget the cheap champagne. So if you want to be spending $100 bucks night for halfway decent food when you can go ANYWHERE else in NY for better quality, AND you intend on being there to take full advantage every night than go right ahead, but I can say from experience you WILL be disappointed.

Lastly there is no restaurant and the bar is almost never open, the rooms are TINY and we faced a concrete wall. There are plenty of better hotels in regard to service, location, and size. 

In conclusion. if you want to spend a good amount of money for hidden fees, and a headache than this is the spot for you!

title: Perfect Location
text: This place is just shy of getting 5 stars. The resort fees are $49 per person per night. It's NICE that you actually get something for this here. The breakfast is a nice way to start the day. The wine and light snacks from 5-7 is a nice touch. The bottled water in the room was appreciated. All of the workers were kind. the location is GREAT! Walk to Broadway shows Times Square and Central Park. The rooms were nicely decorated. Overall VERY clean. The trash can and wall had some spilled coffee on it (Room 2414) in the bathroom and the bathroom sink stopper does not work, All no biggie at the end of the day. BUT, the reason only 4 stars. We had two rooms and both were SO HOT. Neither rooms slept well. Open windows did not help. When we complained we were told the AC had not been switched over yet but they were working on it. We stayed 3 nights, and never got AC. We also asked for fans and none were ever delivered. When we checked out, they did take off some of the resort fees. So, they did make up for it, but really, a hotel of that size should be able to accommodate the changing of the seasons. But we do recommend this place and WILL stay here again.

title: The trip of a lifetime!
text: Just got back from my first trip to NYC with my daughters and stepmom!  This hotel is wonderful, clean, high level of customer service and food for breakfast and afternoon appetizers is wonderful!   Would stay here again, just a couple of blocks from Times Square and Central Park, a great location in NYC!

title: WestHouse Hotel
text: The west house hotel is by far the nicest place to stay in New York City. The location puts you in a great spot close to transit in a safe area near times Square near Rockefeller but not too close where it’s too busy.  Not only do they have countless amenities but the staff is amazing and always accommodating. The hotel is ashetically pleasing and is always clean. I have stayed here 3 different times and have been in both suites and king size deluxe rooms and they were all always clean and gorgeous and provided great city views. They offer a free breakfast and free dinner service which is always amazing quality food. They also have free drinks including soda champagne wine etc. throughout the whole day on the 23rd floor.  The staff is always willing to help you with recommendations,directions, and anything you need throughout the city. I have never had a bad experience with any staff member during the many times I’ve stayed. I have been going here since 2015 and it has always been consistent and amazing. It is never too busy where you feel overwhelmed and is always gorgeous and a happy place to be. If you were looking for an amazing hotel in New York City look no further you have found it.

title: un excellent choix
text:
Bien situé cet hôtel confortable à de nombreux atouts.
De belles chambres à la literie parfaite .
Un personnel affable et compétent .
De bons petits déjeuners inclus dans le prix .
Un bar sympathique .
De bons restaurants aux alentours et à 3mn de Central Park .
Bref de quoi passer un agréable séjour à Manhattan .

title: Lifetime Trip.
text: Travelled with my husband, daughter & granddaughter. Excellent hotel with a fantastic greeting from the staff on duty. Our rooms were ready on arrival & were perfectly clean on the 20th floor. No complaints about either rooms. Take your travel kettle if you are used to a cuppa on waking up. Room has USB connections which is ideal as you don’t need too many continental plugs. Hairdryer etc is all good. Beds are incredibly comfy with lovely crisp cotton linen. We had a street view which was lovely to see all the skyscrapers. If traffic noise bothers you such as sirens & horns going off in the night then pack earplugs or make sure you have a room on the inside (not so attractive). Great breakfast but limited in choice if you’re a fussy eater. Its America! Its cooked very well & you can eat as much as you want. Scrambled eggs & bagels were very tasty. Really good choice of beverages throughout the day. Paid residency with evening complimentary food & drinks (happy 2 hours) was amazing. Only one choice of meal plus cheeses, grapes & bread. Over the 4 nights we had very tasty meals with wine. Congratulations to the chef. In my opinion very nutritious & healthy meals. Finally all the staff are so friendly, helpful & up for a chat. Wonderful hotel & well done to Ethan (Director) you run a well oiled ship. Hope a Yorkshire Hotel can look after you when you come to visit

title: Quite a few good things going for it
text: Location is fantastic. So is breakfast which is included. The rooms are quite nice but a bit tired, but would probably recommend this as a good stay in the city, near the park, shopping and restaurants, with pleasant staff and a boutiquey feel to it. Sadly my room had no views at all and my neighbors kept slamming their doors which made the whole room vibrate!

title: It's a perfect hotel for both business and pleasure :)
text: Everything was absolutely perfect.....and the "Hours of indulgence" from 17:00 to 19:00 with nice food and good drinks was an extra "value for money". The room was nice, tidy and clean, and we could open the windows....with no noise from the outside :)

title: Wonderful mid-town boutique hotel with FANTASTIC amenities
text:
NYC is expensive. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks, a bottle of water, a cocktail - you will pay more for these things in NYC than just about anywhere else in the world. Therefore, when a hotel offers a big breakfast (eggs, meats, potatoes, pastries, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, the works!) every morning, and a happy hour spread each night that includes gourmet salads, hot pasta dishes, cheeses, beer, wine, and champagne, and all of that is included (along with free wifi, access to a full gym, bottled water in your room, etc.) for a $49 per person/per night fee (on top of the regular room rate) it is more than worth it. 

This hotel is steps from Broadway and Times Square. It's cute and quiet, with a cozy decor and spacious rooms. The lobby is small and intimate, with a nice-looking bar off of it. The rooms are larger than most in NYC, with nice bath amenities and bottled water. Very clean and nicely appointed. 

The real show-stopper is the aforementioned food - up on the 23rd floor Terrace. It's almost a shame because the food is so good here, you really could skip dinner but there are so many good places to eat in NYC, that you don't want to fully partake. My plan for next time is to have a 10 pm dinner reservation and enjoy a pre-dinner here at 5. 

There are so many hotel options in NYC but I keep coming back to the WestHouse because it is a great value without feeling like a "value" hotel in the least. If you want to be in Midtown, this is where you need to be.

title: Loved every aspect.. 5⭐
text:
Room: Beautiful, well structured and comfortable. The room was spot on with a very comfy huge bed, big TV with lots of channels for the chill time, complimentary bottled water both in room and accessible all day (great for me as I drink a lot of it). Bathroom was very nice with a great shower, plenty of sockets and USB charging points. 

Staff: All staff (and I mean all) from the front desk to the cleaners were all friendly and helpful and greeted you with a smile. Helpful information and tips about the city too.

Location: To me it was great, right next to Central Park, 10-15min walk (because of all the lights) down to Times Square and walkable to loads of other spots. Subway just outside takes you straight to downtown. 

Complimentary extras: Wow! Just wow! Never have I experienced it in a hotel. Let's start with the breakfast, which was a fabulous spread of Bacon, eggs, sausages, frittata, pancakes, range of pastries and yoghurts and bagels with spreads alongside. All types of coffee and tea included too. Safe to say I filled up in the mornings! 
Tea, coffee, soft drinks, water all available all day free. 
Then 5-7pm they have complimentary wine (good range) and beer, alongside a cheese and meat spread and a hot dish each night (we saw a pasta and paella the nights we ate in). All was very tasty and meant we didn't pay anything eating out some nights which was a great saver.

My experience at this hotel was brilliant, loved it all and will definitely be coming back next time in NY.

title: Fabulous hotel in New York.
text:
Hotel had wonderful breakfast and happy hour each day. It is in close proximity to Time Square and Central Park. Right next to subway to head to Brooklyn  
Great stay and we will definitely return next trip to NYC.

title: Amazing stay at the Westhouse
text: About to check out but 1st had to have about this hotel. We've stayed at many NYC hotels but have to say this is one of the best. Room was spacious, quiet (on 24th flr), bed comfortable, nicely updated bathroom. Incredible happy hour with food & wine/beer and great breakfast too all on the 23rd floor with outside patio if weather permits. Friendly staff too. I don't want to leave!! We will be back for sure.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Enjoyed our stay so much.  Amazing service at front desk.  Thank you Tarik and Hanza.  I will continue to stay here in the future.  This is a hidden treasure in NYC.  I will recommend to friends and family.

title:
WARNING YOU GET CHARGED 98 dollars residents /resort fee per day on check in !!!   
Read on bellow
text:
A few days before we left uk we received a email informing us of an additional charge of 49$ per person per night .
So an additional 98$ per night.

This is pure greed.
We already had WiFi and breakfast in with the price we paid for hotel and tax.

We’re told this covers free WiFi breakfast drinks 5-7 pm and light snacks with your drinks .

So if I’d already got breakfast and WiFi ,
I did not want to be tied to eating there each Euro even being at the hotel until much later.

This is a con and one of only a select few hotels that are fleecing you for money .
After looking around you can get a great deal with no residents fee from lots of the big chains.

The hotel is tiered , carpets stained and bathrooms not great .
Light fixtures need a good polish  and a decent light to put your make up on would help .

Breakfast was fine .
Bed was comfortable.

We argued the toss regards the  exstra cost and got it halved .
This charge can be waved at managers say so , it’s not required by law and is down to each individual hotel .
Every single person I saw at reception was arguing about this hidden charge .
I didn’t even pay this for Vegas . 
I paid 35 dollars for the mgm grand but got about 6 pools and drinks day and night .

So sad to say , shop around to avoid this cost .
This hotel is not central so can’t command the huge inflation in price .

They need to pack it in, admit what their doing and charge abit more for a room after they’ve sorted hotel out .

Sorry due to this , I won’t use this hotel ever again .

title: A very special perk!!!
text:
There are a million choices for hotels in NYC, and like many traveling there, it is a total guess on where to stay.  This hotel is well-located walking distance everywhere you would want to visit, the rooms are well staged and all that you would expect.  However what you will be surprised by is the FREE (inclusive) Breakfast and dinners offered on the Terrace floor.  So to be clear, not some "run of the mill" breakfast bar, but a full on very well thought out and presented breakfast and dinner.  Drinks included wine, beers champaign along with all the teas and coffee you would wish.
We were there to bring two granddaughters and their mom to see the sights, great time.  Even catching a luncheon at a deli, is a 100 bucks plus. So 4 days time a bunch of meals is a small fortune.
I promise that the meals served buffet styled will more than meet your expectations and you will save a ton!
Have a great visit and enjoy

title: Marcello Martinez; Bar tender
text: I have never written a review of a bar tender. In Tampa Florida, I am regarded as a local expert by Google reviews. I feel compelled ti6 write about Marcello Martinez (the Bar Tender) in the WestHouse Hotel in NY, NY on 201 W 55th St. Marcello is a true consultant and somehow (after he focused on what I was saying) he made the perfect recommendation for a drink I've never had. Wow, not only was the drink perfect for my mood but he is personable and humble...a very genuinely likable guy with a true passion for providing you with the best experience. I thank God for people like Marcello. He will exceed your expectAtions.

title: Nice surprise
text: I have to say I was pleasantly surprised with the WestHouse Hotel, the staff is fantastic, prices adequate, Wine&Cheese daily set up in the Terrace Lounge is amazing and the views from the Terrace and really neat. I can only recommend the WestHouse, you won’t be disappointed.

title: Amazing!!
text:
Great location.  The room was extremely comfortable.  I was treated so well by everyone.  The staff always went out of their way to make me feel welcomed.  You really feel you are getting your money’s worth!
Amazing bar!!   Great conversations with Rafa and perfectly made drinks!!  Look no further,  this place is a gem!!

title: The Westwood Hotel New York
text:
This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. The staff is efficient, extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast and happy hour are included. The breakfast offers a great variety of choices as does the food during the evening hours. I was in NY to see plays and had no time to go out to dinner before. What a pleasant surprise to find healthy food as part of the package.
The hotel clean, comfortable and in an
excellent location as I like to visit MOMA
when I’m NY. 
Bathroom and closet space a little small but for me everything else far outways that.

title: Always Great
text: My family and I have stayed here several times over the years. The staff is always wonderful. Breakfast is great too, and my daughter loves it when they have the late night cookies available. I do think some of the rooms need some care, but overall, this is a great hotel. There is easy access to the subway and you can walk to Broadway.

title: Wonderful Staff
text: From the front desk to the complementary breakfast and refreshments everyone you meet along the way is helpful and cheery. The rooms were clean and the accomidations make it easy to be away from home.

title: Daughters 15th Birthday
text: Amazing hotel! Room was clean and had a great view. They have a complementary breakfast and happy hour. Ivan at the happy hour was very friendly and attentive. Will be back. This hotel is smaller but is central to almost everything.

title: Fantastic Find!!!
text: I stayed here two weeks ago for a business trip.  Let me begin by saying that I have stayed at several hotels throughout the city so I had already prioritized what was important to me on this stay.  I chose the Westhouse due to reviews on their customer service, bed comfort, and high speed internet in the room.  I arrived around 7:45pm on a Sunday evening for check-in and from the moment I walked in the service was outstanding!  The hosts at the first desk were so accommodating and helpful.  Getting me settled and meeting my needs was a priority for them.  I booked directly through the hotel website which had offered a room upgrade and I was able to get a king size room.  When they rebooked my room, I was put in an accessible room which I did not want.  One of the front desk host took me around and showed me a few different rooms so I could choose a new room.  I took room 2301 which has a great view of the Empire State Buildong and happens to be down the hall from the Terrace where breakfast and happy hour are served.  If you are on business and want to make everything quick and easy, this is the room for you. Things that I noticed but are not deal breakers for me are no extra counter space in the bathroom, cabinet in the closet makes it tight for anything that hangs long and the housekeeping department is hit or miss with towels.  However, with all that being said, the breakfast And the happy hour are nice amd a nice way to compensate for the resort fee (don’t be surprised by this as you pay it at any of the NYC hotels). There was a jazz band in the downstairs bar one evening and it was great to sit there and have a glass of wine and finish some computer work.  There is a Starbucks on the next block and a subway station as well.  You are a quick walk to Columbus Circle and Central Park if you want to go for a evening walk.  My overall rating is based on the amazing service I received and will definitely be staying again and booking through their website.

title: Great views and place
text:
The service was great, we were attended by a waiter called Ivan and he was really kind.
The food was good too, maybe they can extend the menu because there are just a few dishes. 
Also, the fact that the waiter speaked spanish was nice for us.

title: Excellent Choice!
text: We found the WestHouse by accident and we were so very pleased!  From the Valet, Reception, Housekeeping and Staff in the Terrace, there was never anything but smiles and helpful service. The decor of the hotel is old school beautiful and clever. The rooms were perfect.  The Terrace is like a Living Room with food and drink. Light snacks and drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning are included in your resort fee and VERY well worth the price. Our morning manager, Ilan Illatarco, was a morning burst of sunshine and took care of us like we were family!  If you can, stay here!

title: We love staying at WestHouse!
text: This is a property we have stayed at several times now, and it's always a wonderful experience. The rooms are lovely, and there is a lovely happy hour offered every evening as well as a delicious breakfast come morning. The staff is exceptionally nice and goes out of its way to make sure you have a great stay! On top of all this, the hotel is well situated, an easy walk to Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Central Park, Times Square, etc. Our friends stay here now too. Highly recommend!

title: 5 Stars.. I dont think so!
text:
Having stayed at the Westhouse before we decided to return for a third time.  Unforturnately sometime between our first and third stay something has happend to the standard of service from this small boutique hotel.

We checked in at 1am and Kathy who greeted us at checkin was the first and last friendly face we saw.   Our premium king room was clean and comfortable.  However, the layout of the room on this occassion was ridicoulus, the bathroom was the size of a matchbox. We have stayed at many hotels in the USA and this was by far the smallest bathroom we had ever encountered, very impactical.  Housekeeping was very average the only day the room was fully serviced was the day we checked in,  which was very dissappointing.  From the second day onwards we were continually short towels, no drinking classes, toiletries, i.e. shower, body wash not replenished. The final straw for this hotel was when we requested two glasses and ice to be sent to the room at 10.59pm after returning back from an evening out.....nothing, however a knock on the door at 7.51am the following day we were presented with 2 toothbrushes??? which they said were ordered at 10.59 the night before, seriously they need to get there act together!  
I also think a 'Small Luxury Hotel'  should not be leaving their room service carts in the passage way all day and night, it really is not a good look. There was no personality, no warmth or feeling of being welcomed at this hotel.  With so many other amazing hotels in Manhattan, it is definately time for a change.

title: Wondeful Experience!
text: I absolutely loved the WestHouse hotel and I plan on staying here again! Rooms are spacious, beautiful, clean, modern. Everything from lobby, hallways and even the stairwell was spotless They offer a happy hour from 5-7 with free wine, drinks, and amazing selection of food, enough for a full dinner!. Breakfast, also included was incredible, large selection of eggs, coffee, expresso...etc, freshly made yogurt parfaits, and much more. Staff was wonderful.

title: Cherry on top of a perfect trip
text:
Conveniently located between Times Square and Central Park, Westhouse has it all; spacious and comfortable rooms, super friendly and accommodating staff and views to die for from the Terrace on the 23rd floor.

Anthony, in particular (who I can only assume was the restaurant manager) really made us feel welcome with his friendly demeanor and helpful insight into the best places to eat outside of the hotel. When we asked for a picture of the terrace view he didn’t hesitate to personally escort us outside and give us a mini tour of the surrounding area.

Being from the UK and having not visited The US for quite some time, we were alarmed to learn of the Residence Fees which are often considered ‘hidden fees’ at a lot of other hotels in NYC. The Westhouse hotel however fully disclose these fees on their website so we knew exactly what we were getting into. $47 (excluding city tax etc) per person, per night seemed quite steep at first however this allowed us to have breakfast at the hotel every morning (which was always absolutely delicious and really set us up for the long days) and take part in the hours of indulgence between 5-7 were they serve alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks together with a light evening meal for those opting not to venue out for dinner. At the end of our stay we were completely satisfied that we’d both experienced the best service The Westhouse had to offer and it really was the cherry on top of the cake of a unforgettable trip. 5 stars, would totally recommend!

title: Outstanding Hotel
text:
I have recently returned from New York having stayed in the Westhouse hotel and would recommend it to anyone going to NYC. The rooms were modern, stylish, spacious and the hotel staff really made you feel welcome. The hotel itself is ideally placed with a 5 min walk to Times Square and 2 min walk to Central Park.

Genuinely made mine and my girlfriends trip and would certainly return. 5 star !!!

title: Jewel in the Middle of Midtown Manhattan
text:
As a former NYC resident and frequent visitor to NYC for work, I have stayed in so many hotels and no matter, Midtown is always a good idea..location, location, location. This boutique hotel is perfectly located smack in midtown, in super close proximity to Times Square, Central Park and Columbus Circle and several major subway lines. 

The hotel itself smells yummy, has nicely sized rooms (for NYC that is), a wonderful staff helmed by the GM Juan who was truly fantastic over the phone prior to my check in. All hotels in NYC carry some "resort fee" now, so it's best to get a hotel where you get something for that fee (aka obligatory tax). And The WestHouse delivers. You get a full hot breakfast daily and a happy hour with hot bites, beer, champagne and wine daily from 5-7. 

The room rates were reasonable as well, an all around win. I will definitely return time and again. Thanks for a great stay.

title: Perfect as always
text: This was our sixth stay at the Westhouse and this stay was as perfect as the last five.  Anthony who heads up food and beverage was so fantastic and accommodating, our suite was beautiful with more room than I've ever had in any other Hotel in New York city and the location and price can't be beat. Ask about the resident fee before booking and then try calling Magellan to book your hotel because they usually have the best rates and the residence fee is included. Highly recommend this place!

title: Great Value and a Gem in New York
text:
The WestHouse is a gem in New York.  The location is great and the service and hospitality is consistently exceptional.  
I have been to the WestHouse several times and I am always greeted warmly when I arrive by the entire staff.  I truly feel it is a home away from home.
The rooms are spacious and clean.  The food and service in the dining lounge are wonderful.  The lounge is a comfortable place to read and rest during the day.  There is always coffee, tea and water available.
I go to the WestHouse twice a year.  I am looking forward to my next trip this summer.

title: Perfect gataway
text: I chose this hotel quite quickly from the large variety of hotels in NY. We liked the location and loved the way rooms looked in the website. Sometimes you can be disappointed when you finally get there but our visit was totally opposite. From the very first moment we were warmly welcomed and room was as cozy as we wished. Everybody were super friendly and I had a wonderful long weekend with my daughter. Would definitely visit again.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text: My wife and I have stayed at adjoining hotels (Manhattan Club & Park Central) part of the same building, but this one is far superior. The location is excellent,  with various subway stops at that corner which is kitty-corner from Carnegie Hall. The staff/service was at all time friendly and helpful.  The rooms, like most NYC rooms were a bit tight, but was clean and comfortable.  The TV stations available were sufficient for most.  Daily papers were available.  The 'full' breakfasts, the afternoon access to the lounge and coffee/cold drinks, the evening snacks and drinks (inc. wine) saved us time and money if we had to go out...there is a Starbucks and other cafes just downstairs.  I should add that although there is a safe and small fridge in our room, the lighting was really not sufficient,  there should be shear drapes to allow daylight in but offer privacy, and, there was no clock radio in our room.  I realize that one can request a standing lamp for nighttime reading.   That said, we would stay there again, anytime.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text:
Great staff, well appointed rooms, fantastic location!
Breakfast and Happy Hour were both terrific with great selection of food and drink.
Entire staff was amazing....Front Desk remebered our names everytime they saw us. The Bellmen were always available and eager to assist. The Staff on the Terrace were efficient and friendly... even Housekeeping was super friendly... and fast. 
The bar was not yet open one late afternoon and the worker preparing for open walked us over to the "main hotel" where their main bar was open... and thriving!
Our 2 Queen bedded room was exactly as pictured on the website and we had an amazing city view.
Would definitely stay here again.

title: Old World Charm
text: The dark wood lobby was beautiful and staff were very accommodating.  Our room was Manhattan-small but sufficient w/comfortable amenities.  Our view from the 34th floor was dreamy.  We definitely recommend this Midtown 5-star hotel.

title: Loved Staying at Westhouse!!
text: The hotel staff were very accommodating across the board. Vanessa at the front desk checked us in efficiently. Marcel is the bomb bartender and makes a Cadillac margherita. Great breakfast and evening fare on the Terrace, clean and quiet place to stay. Highly recommend.

title: Best Visit to NYC
text: Just back from a trip to NYC and I think it was one of the best visits ever. The experience was elevated due to the wonderful stay at WestHouse. This boutique property is a complete gem with elegant and spacious rooms, gracious gathering spaces, lovely amenities and a welcoming spirit like no other property I've previously visited. The staff is welcoming and very service-oriented and I noticed how the other guests were very warm and grateful for such a nice hotel experience!  The final bonus was WestHouse's location -- it was steps from the subway and made it a perfect spot for navigating the city -- whether we needed to get up to the Upper East Side, Upper West Side, down to Battery Park or simply walking down to Times Square.

title: 2 Day Girls’ trip
text: My friend and I left our husbands at home and found this on line. This facility is a jewel.  Vanessa greeted us at the registration desk and made our accommodations WONDER! She was extremely pleasant and professional. Then we ventured up to the Terrace and Morcelle  MARTINIS treated us like queens. The Terrace had the absolute best drinks and lite fare....it was perfect. Marcelle made our drinks at the lobby bar and the terrace.  The hotel is attractive and very clean. The rooms are very nice and attractive. Linen is nice and clean and the beds are very comfortable.  I  would give it and its staff 10 stars!!! I plan to stay there again and again. It’s a fabulous. And don’t Forget the gym...it’s quite adequate. Again, I commend the staff of the WESTHOUSE HOTEL. They’re wonderful!

title: Wedding Block Hotel
text:
Our daughter was married in NYC and we chose the Westhouse for our wedding hotel. The hotel is a boutique hotel located close to Central Park, Times Square, 6the Avenue, and adjacent to the subway system with 4 stops within a block for all of our out of town guests to easily experience and access NYC.  The lobby was quaint and inviting and the staff (Christian, Juan, Tristan, Winston, Jesey, Hamza and Courtney) were exceptionally welcoming, accommodating, and extremely helpful for all of our guests.  The rooms are very comfy, cozy and newly remodeled with some rooms having great views of Times Square.  The beds were awesome too.  

The 23rd floor (The Terrace) offers a hearty breakfast and evening happy hour with heavy appetizers for the residence fee.  If you didn't want to go out for dinner, the appetizers definitely can be a meal.  It was a great place for all of our guests to meet and mingle around wedding festivities along with meeting other NYC travelers. Anthony, Jason, Melida and their staff were very attentive to our guests.  The wine and beer were flowing. The hotel manager, Petr, was at the Happy Hour a couple of the days to welcome guests and to make sure everyone was enjoying the experience.

My hat's off to Su for orchestrating the great experience for all our guests.  She organized the reservations, welcome bag distribution, room assignments, and checked with me during our stay to make sure all our guests were enjoying their experience.  Brian was also instrumental in making it all happen.  

Will definitely stay here again because of ALL the welcoming and accommodating staff, the comfy rooms, and great location.

title: Great Staff for a Great Hotel
text:
The staff is extremely professional and friendly.  The hotel is superb and very relaxing.

The amenities are superb, the rooms are well appointed.  Highly recommended for family, business and couples.  

Great location!

title: A mixed bag
text:
This is a solid choice for a centrally located hotel, but a property that overall seemed 4 star, not 5. 

Our first, and a lasting impression was of the two lobby staff not bothering to come outside and help us get our bags out of the car, despite seeing us struggling through the windows. Looking at previous reviews this seems to be the norm.

Fortunately the front desk staff were far more friendly and helpful. 

Our room was large for NYC standards and all the fixtures and fittings seemed fresh and well maintained. The bed and bedding was extremely comfortable and the bathroom amenities were high quality. It's worth noting however that there is no minibar, no room service and no turndown. 

The breakfast buffet was good but not of a 5* standard and it starts to feel repetitive after a few days. The lounge staff were very friendly but they seemed overworked and tables took a while to be cleared at busy times. 

We later had an issue with housekeeping who refused to collect laundry from the room because it was after 4pm and they had nowhere to store the clothing. Not something that should be an issue at a large, luxury hotel.

Admittedly WestHouse is better value than a lot of high end properties in the city but you'll be sacrificing a number of perks and the sort of proactive, can-do service you'd expect.

title: Sister’s get away
text: I love the place, clean and nice, elegant and sophisticated, well located, visiting NY for the first time, the WestHouse Is the perfect place to be, close to the subway and all attractions, the staff is amazing from the guy who always helped us with the revolving door (a bit heavy for us😜) to the friendly people at the terrace. Melida and Rafael went the extra mile when at 9pm we asked for tea, they did EVERYTHING possible to provide us with cups, sugar and hot water!! You guys rock!!! The WestHouse hotel made our whole experience amazing!!!

title: Excellence in the Big Apple!
text: Amazing service and exceptional value. The staff never stopped exceeding our expectations. Friendly. Great attitudes. Excellent food and drink. At every turn they went above and beyond. Cannot wait to return again and again!

title: New Year visit
text:
Very disappointing stay with this hotel.
Positives are the location and the staff were all very polite.
Negatives are the breakfast room is extremley small and the breakfast very average and evening indulgence cramp and we decided on the first night not to bother, the residents fee of 47 bucks each was therefore expensive and frankly a rip off especially when you pay two taxes on it.
The real problem though with the stay was our room, we had a one bedroom suite which although clean had the pokiest bathroom and as we were on the 22nd floor we were awoken by moving furniture every morning between 5.30 and 6.00, not good enough, when i complained they knocked off two days residents fee, laughable.

title: BaeCation
text: Check in was so wonderful, Vannesa was so proffedinal and cutious ! She made our check in a bliss. We will be returning for my birthday In June and looking forward to enjoying time at the Hotel. Loved the amenities and the TERRACE - Happy hour and the wonderful breakfast. Really great hotel stay overall

title: WestHouse is our new home way from home!
text: We’ve visited the city 6 times so far and stayed in different hotels from The Village all the way up to WestHouse. WestHouse is our new home away from home and by far, the BEST hotel we’ve stayed in! 5 stars for sure! Clean, comfortable, and the ALL of the staff we encountered were extremely professional, accommodating, and made sure we had everything we needed for the most enjoyable 5 day stay in NYC!  The Residence fee per person MORe than paid for itself. Even at the busiest time of year, The holiday season, New Years Eve, the staff in the breakfast/dinner room were attentive and quick on their feet to make sure all guests had Every thing they needed and a seat to accommodate their party, with no waiting! We were impressed by everything  and this will forever be our only place to stay when we visit nyc.  The location is close/ walking distance to some of the most popular tourist spots, and the subway is right at the corner! Thanks WestHouse! I almost didn’t want to write a review as to keep this place a secret!! But, They are too great not to share!

title: Hotel der Spitzenklasse mit Leistungen die kaum einer bietet in New York
text: Im Westhouse muss man sich einfach wohlfühlen. Vom ersten Augenblick an fühlt man sich wie zu Hause. Netter Empfang, super Service, aufmerksamer Doorman, kompetenter Conciergeservice, alles perfekt. Die normalen Ziimmer sind nicht die größten, aber es fehlte an nichts. Schönes Bad, gemütliche Einrichtung, Zimmer war mit allem ausgestattet was man benötigt. Ab 17.00 Uhr wurden im "The Terrace" Getränke zu einem Essen angeboten, so dass man eigentlich kein Abendessen mehr benötigte. In dieser Lounge fühlte man sich wie im Wohnzimmer, mit super Ausblick auf die Skyline, und es war jeden Tag ein gemütliches Beisammensein der Hotelgäste. Diese Leistung ist inklusive, ich weiss nicht ob es ein vergleichbares Hotel gibt wo das angeboten wird. Das Westhouse ist nicht das günstigste Hotel, aber wenn man die Leistungen vom Frühstücksbuffet, welches hervorragend ist im Verleich zu normalem amerikanischen Frühstück, bis zur Happy Hour mit Essen und Getränken betrachtet, rechnet sich das auf jeden Fall.  Wenn  New York, dann Westhouse!

title: Great Hotel, Location and Staff
text:
Stayed 5 Nights over New Year (2018-19) in a Times Square view suite.  The hotel is beautifully decorated, maintained and serviced by its staff.

Room was well appointed, spacious and very comfortable.  Room servicing staff take great pride an it shows in how well the public areas and rooms are presented. The bed was super comfy, two large tv's to choose from and lots of wardrobe storage space (as well as a number of cupboard and drawers in need be).

Breakfast was simple but plentiful and tasty; as was the food presented in the evening along with a small selection of drinks (Wine, Beer, sparkling fizz).  Coffee, tea, water and soft drinks plentiful and available all day.

All the staff are so helpful, friendly and nicely laid back (makes a change) - very boutique and luxury but felt very much at home.

Located near the subway, 5 minutes walk from Central Park, Times Square or 5th Avenue on foot.

title: Great hotel, great hospitality
text: We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights (new year 2019)  During all of these days, every interaction between us and the staff, left us with the feeling that we were the most important guests at the hotel (and I am sure that the hotel was fully booked). The breakfast was fine, and the dinner which is called “the happy hour” -  between 5pm to 7am) served great food, plus a wine bar that was always full. It was great and full of openhandedness. The location was the best for us, few blocks from The Times Square from one side and to the Columbus Square from another. The hotel was very clean and as I told, the services were excellent.

title: A little Gem!
text: We are 2 days in to our visit... We was upgraded...from the sister hotel. Not sure why but feel very lucky... This is a little Gem in the heart of everything..very comfortable, lovely staff. Would very much recommend!!

title: Séjour
text: Bonsoir j ai effectué un séjour en couple  à New York dans un hôtel Westhouse bien situé pour faire des visites et des magasins cet hôtel correspondait à nos critères et à nos attentes de plus le personnel est accueillant chaleureux et souriant un grand merci à deux personnes Mr Mohcine et Mr Tarek qui nous ont permis de passer de très  bonnes vacances je conseillai vivement cet hôtel

title: A relaxing oasis amid the hustle bustle of NYC.
text: I cannot say enough about the professional and helpful staff at this hotel. A special shout out to Moe at the front desk, who took one look at our luggage and Xmas presents and found a larger more comfortable room for us. The complimentary meals were surprisingly fresh and healthy. The ambiance is very laid back. Yes, there was a fiasco on the day we woke up and discovered the entire hotel did not have running water, but it was handled by the manager and staff with grace and professionalism and we were compensated for it. We would definitely return for another stay.

title: ATTENTION AUX « RESIDENT FEES »
text:
Le positif :

- Bel hôtel, très bien situé (en plein cœur de Manhattan)
- Chambre avec vue incroyable

Le négatif :

- Faites très attention si vous pensez avoir déjà payé en totalité votre chambre avec petit déjeuner, c’est faux ! Cet hôtel utilise la pratique honteuse des « resident fees » (aussi appelés « Resort fees ») : Même si vous avez déjà réservé et payé votre chambre sur internet, une fois sur place, on vous demandera votre carte bancaire pour payer une taxe surprise de 53$ par jour et par personne !
On vous dira que c’est pour avoir le droit à tout un tas de « privilèges » qui en réalité ne sont que les services classique et logiques pour un hôtel 5* (qui au passage n’en est pas un du tout, à la limite un 4* et encore...) Pour ce prix là, vous aurez droit à :

- A un « savory breakfast », oui, même si vous avez déjà payé « chambre avec petit déjeuner », pour eux il n’est pas inclus au prix de la chambre. Et il n’a rien de « savory », il est tout juste passable. J’en ai fait des 5*, et je peux vous dire que celui là ne les vaut pas. En plus la salle pour petit déjeuner est microscopique alors que l’hôtel est énorme, bonne chance pour avoir une place assise... C’est vraiment 5* d’attendre debout dans la salle en espérant que quelqu’un parte...

- Accès au « Indulgent Hours » entre 5pm et 7pm : vous avez accès à un buffet pour faire un repas léger (toujours dans la même salle microscopique alors si vous voulez avoir une chance d’avoir de la place, allez-y tôt et si, pour vous, dîner à 17h c’est un peu tôt, tant pis !) Au menu, tous les jours la même chose : en froid, charcuterie, dés de fromage, salade, en chaud, des pâtes, du chou-fleur (vraiment 5* tout ca...), en boisson, du vin (rouge, blanc, champagne) et des softs, ou plutôt 2 softs : coca et sprite (la plupart du temps même pas frais)

- d’autres privilèges « so amazing » comme envoyer des fax, passer un appel ou encore avoir accès à la salle de fitness...

Pour conclure, je ne retournerai jamais dans cet hôtel, ni dans aucun autre hôtel qui pratique les resort fees (vous pouvez trouver la liste de ces hôtels facilement sur Google). Il y a plein d’autres hôtels qui ne le pratiquent pas, alors ne faites pas comme moi, choisissez bien !

A bon entendeurs,

title: 10+ great stays here!
text: Westhouse is our first choice in New York -- great location near, but not in the middle of, the Theater District, and also an easy walk north into Central Park.  Multiple subway lines  are just a very short walk away.  Excellent breakfast as always, and the evening happy hour has been delightfully upgraded over the past couple of years.  Front desk is very happy to assist, and a good concierge for restaurants and entertainment.  As always, room was very clean and well maintained.  We usually get to NY at least a couple times a year, and we'll be back!

title: Amazing stay
text: Stayed at WestHouse Hotel for 4 nights. I had such a great stay, the hotel was quiet despite being in Midtown and the staff was so helpful. The room and facilities were great, I will definitely stay here next time I'm in New York.

title: Great hotel
text: We stayed at the hotel for almost 2 weeks.  Great spot. Very clean and neat(note cleaner cranky with us several times as a result of us wanting to use room at 4.45 despite being out from 10.15). Very friendly staff.  Breakfast and drinks great. Would stay again

title: Buen hotel precio/ubicación
text: Estuve 10 días en NYC y escogí este hotel por su cercanía a Times Square. Un hotel que cumple con todo lo que promete. Habitaciones cómodas, limpias e insonorizadas. La atención del personal también estuvo ok. El único pero, fue que el desayuno es todos los días lo mismo: huevos revueltos, salchicas, bacon, bollería + bebestibles. Muy pocas opciones de alimentos saludables. Lo mismo la cena, muy repetitivo todo. Por otro lado, la atención de Rafael y de joven Chileno (no recuerdo su nombre) fue muy buena, muy simpáticos y serviciales.

title: Truly best experience for an unfortunate situation
text:
Stayed over night past Friday on . We needed a last minute room for my elderly mother, who just came from hospital need a room beacause we could not get my mother home in her  condition after her procedure . went to the west house and glad I did. As we walked by the entrance my mother noticed how welcoming and beautiful it was. We met with Courtney who was so lovely and acomidating. She was so compassionate to my situation and went above and beyond for my mother and I. I will always remember the wonderful customer service. The hotel was gorgeous and very immaculate breakfast was delicious.. cannot wait to go back best hotel I have ever stayed at and I have been 
At  many  the staff was wonderful as well !!

title: Quasi perfetto!
text:
Natale a New York, inutile dire che la scelta e posizione dell’hotel a NYC è cruciale  perché il traffico intenso e la marea di persone che visitano la città, specialmente Manhattan, rendono i taxi lentissimi e la metropolitana molto affollata, quindi potersi muoversi a piedi è fondamentale.

Parto proprio da qui, la posizione:

5 minuti a piedi da Central Park
10 minuti dal MOMA
10 minuti da Bryant Park
15 minuti da Grand Central 
15 minuti dal Rock Feller Center
15 minuti da Macy’s 
20 minuti da Greenwich 
25 da SoHo

Praticamente perfetta!

Qualità/Prezzo di questo hotel sono molto difficili da trovare, sono molto buone, anche se non mi spingerei a definirlo un vero 5 stelle, lo definirei un buon 4 stelle e forse per questo le tariffe sono abbordabili.

Lo staff è eccezionale, sempre pronti ad aiutare mettono a disposizione un sorriso 24 ore al giorno.
La reception dell’hotel è calda e accogliente, elegante e dato il periodo del mio soggiorno addobbata con un bellissimo albero di Natale.
Dietro la reception un raffinatissimo salottino e un’elegante area bar.

Le stanze sono abbastanza grandi (considerando la media di NYC), il letto comodo con diversi cuscini a disposizione, il bagno piccolo ma con una bella doccia.
Il sistema di riscaldamento un po’ rumoroso, da spegnere durante la notte.

L’hotel mette a disposizione un “aperitivo” che ha un costo extra di 47 dollari al giorno, questo viene servito al 23mo piano, offre bevande alcoliche e analcoliche, una pasta che varia ogni giorno, del formaggio e poco altro.
L’idea è buona e considerando che “l’aperitivo” si svolge dalle 5 alle 7, potrebbe diventare un’alternativa alla cena senza dover uscire nuovamente.

I 47 dollari a persona potrebbero essere accettabili se la qualità del cibo e delle bevande offerte fosse molto diverse, la qualità purtroppo non rispecchia ne la spesa sostenuta ne la presunta categoria dell’hotel (ricordiamo che parliamo di un 5 stelle), servizio quindi bocciato.

E bocciata la pulizia della stanza e soprattutto del bagno, assolutamente deludente.

Quasi perfetto quindi ma vista la natura dei difetti, sono certo possano migliorare.

In generale mi sento di consigliarlo.

title: Perfect stay
text:
Came here to stay in January 2018 on our first visit to NYC from the UK. 
Such a wonderful room with a view of Times Square. Quiet and clean whilst also being very luxurious. Staff all so helpful and the location is perfect. The only downside is we hoped to come back January 2019 but the prices were very high so we have had to book into park central next door!

title: Exquisite boutique hotel in the heart of NY
text:
This hotel is the best kept secret in the heart of NYC.  I have been staying there many times over the years and each time it is an enjoyable stay.  It is elegant, very well maintained, clean, with good size rooms and with luxurious toiletries (more recently they have been carrying La Perla!).  But what is most important, while most other hotels in NYC charge daily “resort fee” on top of their rates and provide nothing for this fee, which is a terrible and deceiving practice, Westhouse does charge this fee too, but is the only one I know which provides daily breakfast and dinner (with wine and Champaign included), as well as tea and coffee at their cozy terrace lounge throughout the day.  
I had a problem once with room service and complained to the management, and my complaint was dealt with promptly and in most gracious manner by Ethan Fishbane (Director of Front Office).  Very much look forward to staying there again and again in the years to come!

title: Good location, well- apointed hotel
text:
This was a good hotel for sightseeing New York.  The rooms are clean and everything works.  Hairdryer, iron and USB points in the room, free wi-fi.  No tea/coffee making machine in room. We had breakfast included in the room price, a reasonable buffet -style breakfast is offered and there is the use of 2 very good coffee machines.  There is no option of special dishes being prepared.  
There is a residence charge on top of the room rate, which we only learned about on checking in, this could seriously eat into some budgets.  This charge allows you to partake of a selection of savoury dishes and drinks, including alcoholic ones between 17.00 and 19.00 (no sweet stuff).  There is a terrace attached to this dining area which is probably pleasant during warmer times of the year.
There is a good gym/fitness room on the 3rd floor, which is shared with an adjacent hotel; ensure you get in the correct lift to get back to your floor or you'll end up in the other hotel! 
It was impossible to regulate the temperature, even on switching off the heating the temperature still stayed at 22C, not my choice for a good sleeping temperature.

title: Clean Hotel. A lot of deceiving charges. Take your money elsewhere!
text:
I stayed at the WestHouse during a weekday. The rooms are well sized, and the luxury room I selected had a view of the city. The employees were very friendly and accommodating. They also offered unlimited bottled water, coke, sprite and Diet Coke in glass bottles. Keep in mind that this is offered till 8 pm. They also have a happy hour from 5 pm to 7 pm. The breakfast was pretty good, but the room was crowded and I ended up standing for the most part. I haven't stood up and ate/drank since I was bar/club hopping in my younger years. The staff was good, but most of the guests are from Australia, Russia, UK, and other parts of Europe. An Australian guest said something racially insensitive to his kids about Asians and South Americans while I was there, but that isn't a ding on the hotel, but on his disgusting self. Overall, the breakfast was not ideal when you consider the crowd. I would have been better off at a Residence Inn or a Hampton, but I wanted to experience this 5 star hotel, and glad I did. If I was on another business trip, I would stay here again. If I was on my own dime, probably not for the $54 "resident fee".

A week later, I received another charge on my credit card for $158.69. After calling the hotel's billing department and leaving them multiple voicemails, I finally received an email back telling me that they have reversed the charge. No apology or reason as to why the error was made. I had booked via Orbitz. While I was checking out at the hotel, another resident was agitated as the hotel had billed him roughly $1,600 after he had already paid via Expedia. This being the case, I would suggest checking your credit card bill after you pay via a 3rd party website. Most of the residents at this hotel are from Europe and Australia, and I am thinking this hotel takes the opportunity to "confuse" them with these sneaky additional charges. I will never be staying at this hotel again, and will ensure that my Corporation doesnt book anyone at this hotel again. There are much better hotels in NYC for the money spent.

title: Great place Great location Great staff
text:
Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Upon arrival we were upgraded which was a great start following long journey from JFK.
The rooms were spacious with large comfy beds and lovely hot powerful showers.
Breakfast was great and set us up for the day and the evening hours of indulgence were perfect for a relaxing glass or 2 of champagne following a hectic day.
All staff were superb throughout our stay and made us feel most welcome.
Will certainly be staying here again for our next trip to New York.

title: Wonderful stay, accommodating staff.
text:
Stayed here with my mum for her birthday treat. Immediately impressed by the decor and vibe and was wowed once again with our room, with an internal courtyard view which, although wasn’t of the city didn’t matter. The fact this hotel gives back to the customers for the residents fee (in the form of free food and beverages) is brilliant! 
Special thanks to Ethan down at the front desk for being extra accommodating when our travel plans unexpectedly changed: giving us an extra night in our room without having to pay the extra nights residents fee on top of the room rate. 
Would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to coming again in the future!

title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel
text:
Just back from 4 great days in New York with family and friends 
The Westhouse is the perfect base to explore Nee York 
The rooms are just the right size , and the beds , most comfy we have ever had in a Hotel
The 5-7 indulgence in the comfortable terrace lounge was perfect after a long day walking around New York , the food and snacks were always lovely along with a welcome glass of wine , champagne or beer , whatever you wanted was provided
The guys and girls at reception were fantastic
Thanks so much to Ashly,Winston,Moe,Nick and Christian for all your help and genuine warmth
Happy Xmas to you all and see you next year!!
Ashly and Winston hope you got your Parkas shipped from the UK in time for the holidays!

title: Fabulous staff, lovely hotel, great location
text: From our first impressions on arrival with the super reception team (Ashley, Christian) to the uber-helpful concierge crew storing our luggage before we headed back to JFK, nothing was too much trouble for the WestHouse team. A brilliantly located hotel - minutes walk from Central Park, Time Square, Fifth Avenue, etc. - yet with some fabulous quietly located bedrooms, this is a real find. Yes, the rooms are "efficiently" sized and the bathrooms frankly "small", but a great walk-in shower, wonderfully comfortable beds and spotless housekeeping. And the mandatory "resort fee" is pretty good value for money compared to most other hotels - the "happy (2-) hours" each evening has good food and drinks and a great atmosphere. Thank you WestHouse team - you renewed our faith in New York hotel hospitality! - we'll be back!

title: Warm and Welcoming Staff
text: We stayed for 4 nights and were treated like we were family. From the staff at the front desk, to the concierge, to the staff in the Terrace lounge - everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful.  The room was not extraordinary, but comfortable. The location is excellent - central to all activities.

title: WestHouse and Optimum Water
text: Our company has strated to utilize the WestHouse for all of our business travel to NYC. The manager, Petr Jureka and his team have been amazing and we will continue to utilize in 2019. The location is perfect , the rooms are above average in size and the service is excellant.

title: Hidden Gem in the City
text:
From walking in the lobby, damp and cold from the seasonal monsoon, I was greeted warmly by Ashley. She accommodated my needs, inquired about any additional concerns I might have about my stay, and sent me on my way with a confident feeling about the team that runs WestHouse.
I was rushed to get out the door, so my request for Champagne flutes and ice were not delivered before I left, but they were waiting for me upon my return to the room.
At checkout, they were gracious enough to gather my bags and hold on to them as I finished my holiday jaunt through the city. Ethan and Venessa were very thorough, and kept the perfessional and personal touches going. 
I am not an easy guest/customer, but I will be back.

title: Disappointing
text: We stayed for three nights in a terrace suite. The room was a very odd design having to go through the sitting room to get to the bathroom. Our “terrace” (narrow balcony) was split in half, both halves being shared with other rooms so people could look in our windows (and we could look in theirs). The adjustable bed was broken on one side and the promised “glass fronted rain shower” was a white shower curtain and neither were the bathroom products as advertised. The rooms were very dark and had little lighting and there was no full length mirror in the room. On the plus side the food and drink you get for the residents fee is plentiful with good variety and the location was great.

title: NYC Gem
text: I’ve been to New York City several times for business and this was one of the best experiences to date. Location is everything in a city the size of New York and most anything one can think of is within arms reach of the Hotel. Based on the suggestions of a very dapper gentleman (Quimby, I believe) I was not only able to get some holiday shopping done at Bloomingdales, but even had time to squeeze in a Broadway show before returning home. Also, this one of the only places I’ve stayed in New York City that actually has a quiet yet comfortable area to catch up on work emails between all the sightseeing. You won’t regret staying here !

title: Amazing !
text: I recently spent several days at WestHouse with my family and it was one of the most relaxing experiences. A gentlemen by the name of Quimby made sure that our experience was comfortable yet exciting. His suggestions for activities and entertainment in New York City were great and his attention to detail was impeccable. The staff is under great leadership and it shows -  It was great !

title: Ok stay - hotel lacked personal touch
text:
My husband and I stayed at the WestHouse for our trip to NYC for four nights over Thanksgiving. This is a tough one because the hotel didn’t really do anything wrong. But they didn’t really do anything well, either. Overall we felt the hotel was significantly lacking in any personal touch. We both landed on that it “lacked soul” which is not anything I have ever found myself saying before. We found New Yorkers to be incredibly friendly and warm, but not this hotel! We usually leave a stay, especially one for 5 days, knowing the names of people who work there. We couldn’t tell you one name. 

Good: 
1) location - centrally located and easy to get cab
2) housekeeping
3) bathroom decor

Bad: 
1) the bogus “resident” fee that we didn’t use at all. It’s just a way for the room rate to look lower than their competitors. I find it deceptive. 
2) untrustworthy and/or unknowledgeable concierge
3) cold reception at checkin
4) had to wait an hour for bellman to assist with bags at checkout despite numerous calls. 

Too many great places to stay in this fabulous city to stay in one that completely lacked a personal touch.

title: Central location, good for some
text:
This is half of a big old hotel in central Manhattan . Unusually for USA it includes very generous breakfast and evening drinks but charged through a compulsory daily resort fee.  If you are going to have time for breakfast and evening drinks and snacks, this us good value. If you have other commitments, it is not! Not all booking sites make this clear. 
The room was fine, lovely quality bed linen , clean and quiet.

title: Unforgettable Service!!
text: Outstanding location, fantastic design and unbeatable level of service. Upon check-in we were greeted by Christian the front office manager who instantly impressed us with his hospitality by delivering us a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. It truly was an unforgettable start to our trip to NYC! Thank you, Christian! See you soon!

title: excellent value
text: Staff great, room excellent, location perfect and daily charge really good value. The location in between central park and times square is handy but also away from the noise. I paid for the daily charge (about $40 day) and enjoyed daily buffet breakfast, cocktail hour, open bar, early dinner, etc.

title: Cozy, Top Notch Service
text:
Enjoyed our 2 night stay at the WestHouse Hotel nyc. Comfortable Beds, Clean rooms, and Customer Service the top of the line in all departments! The food and Beverage manager was very welcoming to the guests!
Delicious Breakfast everyday and drinks in the afternoon. Great location! Highly recommend!

title: ASHLEY
text: The hotel is an excellent choice if you are staying in Manhattan. When we got there, ASHLEY helped us in the front desk, SHE REALLY SOLVED OUR DOUBTS, ASHLEY we would like to thank you for your help.. each hotel should have a person as ASHLEY.

title: Pleasure
text:
My partner, Mark, and I spend several weeks a year in the City. We now ALWAYS stay at the WestHouse. The staff is amazing! Especially Ashley at the front desk, Christian and Petr the managers, Riley at the concierge desk, and the guys who take care of the  lounge on the 23rd floor!

 These guys rock and make the stay that much more awesome!

title: Excellent boutique hotel, well situated with amazing staff
text:
This is a very small (170 room) well run hotel. The staff immediately get to know you and are superbly helpful and knowledgeable.

It is sympathetically decorated in an Art Deco thyme, clean and in good order.

It's very well located and most things you are going to want to see are within walking distance.

Now if you haven't stayed in NYC before your are gonna get a shock, depending where you are from you will probably get stiffed with daily resident tax of about $50 per person, it's not down to the hotel it is a government thing; but what the hotel do to off set this is to lay on a spread each evening between 5-7pm, there is food and drink free gratis and it's a great way meet fellow residents and hear about their day etc.

We're going back to NYC in the spring and will be definitely staying at the West House.

Highly recommend.

title: Amazing staff and service
text:
This hotel is everything you would expect from a 5-star - clean, elegant, and good amenities. But what truly sets this hotel apart is the staff and the excellent service they provide. When we checked in we met Vanessa and Tariq who welcomed us personally with big smiles and addressed every question we had. This set the tone for the rest of our stay. During the light dinner indulgence, we met the warm Melinda who manages the Terrace staff during breakfast and dinner. It’s truly delicious and the staff is so warm. 

Because of this personalized service, we canceled other reservations at a different hotel and decided that the next time we come to NYC, we must stay at WestHouse. We turned to Tariq to help us make the reservation, and he did everything in his power and beyond to find us a room. We recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting New York - walk right up to the front desk and look for the man in a suit with a radiant smile - that’s Tariq and he will do his best to help make your stay enjoyable.

title: It was ok!
text:
It was ok, would I stay here again? Probably not. It’s advertised as a 5 star boutique hotel. The package we booked included taxes and charges, however we then had to pay the additional resort charges plus tax (just over $500) the evening we arrived, we waited a little while to check in with no help with our luggage. 
We entered our room to a note that the terrace would be closed the following day and that the hours of indulgence would be in the den. I helped myself to a tea and asked the guy behind the bar for a decaf coffee for my husband, was told no only regular coffee, I then asked for a lemonade was told only Coke or Diet Coke (my husband can’t have caffeine) so I asked for an orange juice which I could see in the fridge. Guy closed the fridge and said only Coke or Diet Coke. My husband ended up with a bottle of water. Not really sure what was indulgent about this. We called in for breakfast on out last day and struggled to get a seat. Such a shame I was expecting so much more. On a positive note the view of time square was fantastic and the hotel is situated in a great location, unfortunately you pay extra for this and are then stuck with the tiniest wardrobe and bathroom. Room 1908. The best was really comfortable, the room was cleaned daily but it needs a deep clean as the unit is filthy.

title: Terrible Stay
text:
Westhouse is not worth the money.

First, they charge a ridiculous $50/nt fee PER PERSON for "amenities" that include an awful breakfast and awful drinks. I would rather save the $50, grab a bagel for breakfast, and have drinks at a much nicer place then their so-called overcrowded ounge. Also, they have no kitchen here so the breakfast is really mediocre with MICROWAVED eggs and really bad pastries that tasted stale.

That being said, you can get the resort fee waived if you book through Amex or another travel advisor. That may sound good but Westhouse actually RAISES the published rates to these partners to offset the cost savings on the resort fee, pricing amex, and other advisors right in line with prices listed on Agoda and other sites. 

The room we had was terrible. The view was of a brick wall! The room did not receive any natural light and felt like a small prison cell. When we asked to move, they said no rooms were available for our time. 

That brings me to the next point, customer service. Service here is not polished at all - no-one opens the door, no-one greets you by name, and the staff just isn't trained to a 5 star level. This is a shame.

For the price, its not worth the money. When you factor in the resort fee, its better to spend the money at other 5 star options in the same area.

title: Great service!
text: We had a great visit at the Westhouse hotel. The location is fantastic and the rooms are really nice but the service is the best. I had forgotten my hat and gloves and Vanessa at the front desk was so helpful, giving me several options for getting replacements. I’ll definitely be back!

title: Excellent !!
text:
Hôtel cher mais d'une excellente qualité surtout à NYC.
Très bien placé, entre Central Park et Times Square
Personnel avenant et très à l'écoute
Nous avons eu l'agréable surprise d'être surclassés avec vue sur Times Square et d'appendre qu'il y a les "indulgent hours"; buffet plus vin et champagne !
Merci à Vanessa, Tirek, Marcelo, Rafael et tous les autres....
Nous y retournerons.

title: Would have loved to give this hotel 5 stars
text: I would have given this hotel 5 stars all across the board. The reason I did not is because our room had a shower issue- in which the shower leaked water throughout the entire bathroom floor. This is a major hazard, which almost resulted in my husband falling and hitting his head. We complained to the front desk (The initial young lady was very concerned and helpful), however; the issue was never resolved. A staff member did come in to caulk around the shower, but the water leakage continued... for 3 days! When checking out around 5 am, we told a lady at the from desk who appeared to not care one bit about our concern.  To repeat myself (and especially for a 5 star hotel), this is a major lawsuit/ hazard just waiting to happen. I hope the hotel is proactive and fixes this immediately to prevent harm or an unnecessary accident to hotel guest. Other than that, the hotel and happy hour was amazing. All other hotel staff was absolutely exceptional. Our room was a bit dusty, but beautiful none the less.

title: Exceptional
text:
WestHouse is a boutique, cute hotel that includes some more high-end offerings made to make your stay wonderful. They offer complimentary breakfast with a large variety of food, complimentary Happy Hour from 5-7p with endless wine, and a (free) coffee lounge open 24/7. This is why there is a $50/person service charge each day you stay, but it ends up paying for itself.
The staff very nice and overall a very pleasant hotel in heart of the greatest city on earth!

title: Great hotel
text: I normally don’t leave reviews, but felt this place deserved it. Stayed here with my wife for a mini vaca for our anniversary and it was an excellent choice for our stay. The location is perfect and had everything I was looking for... service, cleanliness and good sized room. pricey but worth it.

title: So not 5 star!!
text: Literally do not understand how this is considered a 5 star hotel!! On arrival I was not even greeted and neither men welcoming at the door offered to help with my luggage. I was put in a far smaller room than I paid for the first night. The second day they moved me and the room was nice. Only twice did I call downstairs to ask for something to be brought to my room. The first after 40 minutes I had to go down myself to fetch it and the second it took over an hour and three phone calls for them to bring it up to my room. My return flight is only 9pm so I asked if any rooms are free to use one for an hour late afternoon to shower or if the fitness area has a shower which it does not (which is very odd for a 5 star hotel!) and they said I can use a room for an hour for a full nights fee. Needless to say I definitely will not be returning to this hotel!

title: Home Away from Home - Another Amazing Experience
text: While we always enjoy traveling to NY, we have had the pleasure of discovering our new home away from home place to stay - Westhouse Hotel is truly a wonderful hotel.  Location is superb.  It is close to many galleries, Central Park, a short walk to Times Sq. close by to 5th, the Theater District and of course tons of great restaurants.
