It is also a great location to get to and from by subway and taxi.  The hotel itself is really lovely - the rooms, the common areas and the roof lounge are all terrific.  Most important though are the Hotel Team - from the moment you arrive they make your stay perfect!.  The Hotel Manage Petr has an amazing Team that go the extra mile to make every persons stay personal and special.  This was not our first visit and will not be our last.  Can't say enough about our new home away from home.

title: Amazing hotel for our anniversary!
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our Anniversary, and the Westhouse hotel didn’t disappoint. The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated and modern, and the rooms are very nice. They even gave us a very nice bottle of champagne for our anniversary which made it extra special! The residents fee was well worth it, as they provided a free light fare dinner which was delicious (wine and cheese, meats - prosciutto etc), fettuccine Alfredo, and some other items), as well as breakfast. My only issue is that I am very sensitive to fragrances and they give me headaches, and the hotel pumps a very heavy scent / fragrance throughout the hotel which was a little much for me and gave me a headache. Other than that the stay was amazing!

title: Another great stay
text: Had another great visit at the Westhouse! The staff was courteous & helpful- hotel is beautiful & clean!!  Location helps with the ease of getting around the city.Looking forward to my next visit! Thanks again Westhouse for a great experience.

title: I just love it here
text: I really do love this hotel. I recently stayed here myself (again) but I also recommended it to friends who were visiting the city for the first time this past month and they had the best time. The staff here is just incredible. The hotel is beautiful, great location, just one of my favorite hotel experiences in NYC - and I’ve stayed in quite a few.  Highly highly recommend this lovely place.

title: Wonderful small upscale hotel in a great location only a few blocks from Central Park and Fifth Avenue shopping
text: Stayed for business one night at the end of November 2018.  The staff were extraordinarily friendly and attentive and the rooms clean and well appointed.  The complementary breakfast and drinks/appetizers each day, both delicious and nicely presented, are a nice touch and very convenient.  Will definitely return with family soon.

title: A great New York Hotel
text:
Being on the road over a 100 nights a year, it takes a lot to wow me in the hotel category. However, I would definitely make a point of booking a stay at the WestHouse. Great Hotel. Great Location. Great Staff. 
An A-Plus experience for me.

title: Vær ops hvis du bestiller over tripadviser!
text:
Hotellet ytet super service. Rommet var stort, likeså badet, renslig og orden overalt. Hyggelig frokostservering med bra utvalg. Beliggenheten var perfekt, utsikt til Times Square fra rommet. Anbefales!

Vi bestilte hotellrommet tidlig, og beløpet ble umiddelbart belastet kontoen. Ved innsjekk ble vi informert om at vi i tillegg skulle betale 108$ pr natt, noe som inkluderte bl.a middag. Det var vi ikke informert om via Tripadviser, noe jeg kunne vise til. Hotelldirektøren unnlot å belaste oss for dette ekstra tillegget. Det var positivt. Vi hadde på forhånd bestilt middag i andre restauranter.

title: Amazing Thanksgiving Stay
text: We had such an amazing time while we stayed over the Thanksgiving holiday, due mostly to the fact that the staff was so helpful and fun! Melida was outgoing and friendly and providing top notch service.  Victor was adorable and apologetic when he had to do his job, which required him to pass in front of the TV every so often.  The food was spectacular and was such a treat to have a Thanksgiving dinner away from home. Hands down the best bartender was Rafael.  He made a great drink and you felt like you were at home in your own living room.  He is also a talented artist and gave us one of his sketches to make the trip even more memorable.  If you are traveling to New York, this is a must stay.  The resort fee is nominal compared to what you get, including a wonderful wine and beer selection!

title: Highly recommend!
text: We stayed here this past summer and was really impressed, so decide to stay on a last minute trip to the city. Great spacious rooms and the staff is always so friendly. There is an extra charge for breakfast and a reception at night, but well worth the money. If you’re visiting for a few days to see the sites it’s in a perfect location!

title: Super
text:
Super et superbe hôtel. Très bien situé. Le personnel est très gentil avec une mention spéciale pour Sean qui m a toujours très bien et gentiment informée. 
La chambre au 24 e étage, ( avec terrasse) est super, et bien insonorisée. 
Petit déjeuner copieux mais manque de fruits. A part les bananes..... et la nouvelle machine à café est géniale !! 
J y reviendrai.

title: Perfect location, friendly staff
text:
We visited New York and did the tourist thing based out of this hotel. There are many good reasons to stay at the West house. Here are a few: 
Location to Central Park, Carnegie Hall, 5th Avenue, Times Square, and the subway. 
Great hot breakfast 
Satisfying evening reception 
Helpful concierge 
Friendly staff
You couldn’t ask for a more convenient location. I’ve included a photo from the terrace on the 23rd floor. The rooms were quiet, well appointed and had a good mattress. We will stay here again on our next visit.

title: Excellent Hotel & Location
text: We like staying in hotels that offer breakfast and a light supper/happy hour. The WestHouse met all of our expectations. We are very active during the day and prefer a light supper in-house before going out to other events. We had a one bedroom suite that looked down the street to the old Ed Sullivan theater, now home of Stephen Colbert. It was so convenient to the subway and major streets in the area. We would definitely stay here again.

title: New York da un bellissimo punto di vista
text:
Hotel stupendo in centro Manhattan, comodissimo per poter girare agevolmente la città. Personale molto cordiale e sempre disponibile per qualsiasi esigenza del cliente. Pulizia della camera ottima.
La terrazza al 23 esimo piano offre una vista mozzafiato della città, soprattutto verso le ore serali.
Simone

title: I found my new New York Hotel
text: The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The room was a vey good size and the bathroom was great. My bed was firm and the pillows were fantastic.!  My thanks to Moe, Winston, Nick and Tristan. Let me not forget Ashley Chris and Shawn. Everyone was instrumental in seeing that I had enough to eatt at breakfast, a cold glass of Prossicco  after 5, and my hair appointements along with UBER called at the right time.  I will be back

title: Another great stay
text: My husband and I stayed at the Westhouse again for date night and it never disappoints!! The staff is always so courteous and friendly, our room was emaculate and the ambiance is perfect for a romantic getaway in nyc. It’s also in the best location close to our favorite spot Nobu 57 and especially Central Park which I love this time of year. We absolutely love staying at this hotel and will be back again soon!

title: Great service...but rooms need a once over
text:
I stayed at Westhouse for two nights. The first thing that impressed me was the service. I was greeted warmly at the front desk, allowed to check in early and was given an upgrade. A pleasant surpise!

However when i got to my room, the first thing i saw was a broken dresser door right under the tv. It's as if housekeeping hadnt checked the room in a while. The sink faucet was a bit grimey and not all the lamps had working bulbs.

But the room overall was large, clean and comfortable...especially the bed.

Westhouse also has free breakfast on their terrace level. The selection was decent and what I ate was tasty.

In short i recommend this hotel...it is just short of 5 stars!

title: Genuinely friendly staff with spacious modern rooms
text: This hotel is, in a word, perfect. Midtown location, big/modern/tasteful/clean rooms, relatively quiet at night, fair prices, free happy hour, free breakfast and some of the nicest staff in the world (how do they find them in NYC?).

title: 위치가 정말 좋습니다
text: 타임스퀘어가 걸어서 10분 거리입니다. 주변으로 관광지도 굉장히 가깝고 아침도 나쁘지 않습니다. 한국어를 하시는 직원분도 계시니 만약 영어가 안되시더라도 도움을 주실겁니다.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Me and my wife stayed here on our mini-moon and we truly had an amazing time. They need to re-do the virtual tour on the website because the room was much bigger than what was advertised. Only issue is the day I checked out, I called front desk twice to send someone to help me with my bags and no one came. I ended up bringing those bags down by myself. It was a little frustrating but besides that staying at this hotel was truly an awesome experience.

title: AMAZING STAY!!!
text: Nothing compares to the welcoming atmosphere of the WestHouse hotel. From the minute we got there we received exceptional service. Vanessa and Hamza made our stay very pleasant. They are two amazing people who made us feel right at home! The rooms, the location, the staff... everything was excellent. This has become my go-to New York hotel! Your new friends, Nella and Tony (Hamza’s brother from another mother) ;)

title: Best Hote in NYC
text:
Overall, I was very satisfied with my 4 night stay here. As soon as I walked in, Nick was very happy to assist our group at check in. I was really pleased with the hotels central location, 24-hour gym, lounge areas, and the hotel that is perfectly scented.

When we arrived to the room, we are also blown away how clean the room was. The beds and pillows were very fluffy...The bathroom is very modern as well.

Reviews below are that of those that do not read fine print. The website clearly stats a resort fee, which is REALLY worth it. 

The breakfast layout consisted of eggs, chicken sausage, applewood smoked bacon, potatoes, various type of bread, pastries, doughnuts, and cereal. This truely out-beats any other bootleg continental breakfast. 
Also, imported tea, coffee, freshly squuezed orange juice and grapefruit, water, soda (in glass bottles), The list goes on and on. 

For dinner, there is generally a main course and a few sides. What I enjoyed about this was the beer, wine, and Champagne.

Another highlight is the terrece that I made sure to visit as much as I could. 

The staff... ALL staff from housekeeping to wait staff were just genuinely nice people, not one ahole nor douce in sight. 

If I am able to afford to come back here again, I would not blink twice.

title: Always a pleasure here!
text: My husband and I have stayed here a few times on a weekend escape and it’s always been an enjoyable stay with a clean and spacious room and the staff goes above and beyond to make sure you have a pleasurable stay!  We LOVE staying here!

title: Another fantastic stay!!
text: This is my second stay at this hotel for a business trip and it yet again exceeded my expectations! They took such good care of me as a repeat guest and gave me an unbelievable room with a great view of Times Square. Staff is always accommodating and the complimentary reception and breakfast is great! I can’t recommend this hotel enough!!!

title: Excellent
text: Excellent boutique hotel with top notch amenities!! From the staff,Ashley, Nick and Ethan to the views, and terrace!!  What can I say I was so impressed!! Milanya and I had and amazing stay with Having Time Square visible from our room and everything in Walking distant it was an excellent choice!!

title: So good we came again!
text:
I visited for business 2 years ago and found myself returning with a child in 2018. Both visits were spectacular. The rooms are comfortable, the food/drinks in the mornings and evenings include a wide variety, and the location couldn’t be better. Beyond this, the staff is very friendly and accommodating. 

I hope to come again!

title: Fantastic weekend stay
text:
We are 4 girlfriends from out of state, who just spent a four day weekend in New York City celebrating friends and a birthday. From upon making the reservation, with responding to all my questions, and enticing us with the amenities this hotel has to offer, through check in and checkout, the Westhouse hotel staff are superb, making this the most enjoyable visit. The location s excellent - 2 blocks from Central Park, and close to Times Square and subway station. The gourmet breakfast that is included, as well as the “Indulgence hours” in the evening, of light fare dinner and beverages, was outstanding!  But truly, it is the staff that make this stay a fantastic experience. Everyone was so pleasant and helpful. Many thanks to the Food and Beverage Managers, Jason and Melida, who oversaw the services and ensured we received anything we needed. They were even there with a surprise birthday presentation for us, along with Juan Vargas, Guest Service Manager. Sean, the concierge, was informative and helpful in making arrangements for the various sites. 
We would highly recommend this hotel experience and without question, will return there!

title: Una semana en NY en familis
text:
Hotel céntrico 
Muy amables
Serviciales
Desayuno buenísimo 
Por la tarde de 17-19 organizan Merienda aun mejor que el desayuno con embutidos, quesos riquísimos, “paella”, pollo asados, cada día un plato fuerte distinto,vinos americanos blancos y /o tintos, refrescaos para los niños, cava, podíamos repetir hasta la saciedad y todo gratis, cosa rara en NY, Hotel muy recomendable 
Hacíamos merienda-cena
Repetimos seguro

title: Ottima posizione e squisita gentilezza. Torneremo
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato al Westhouse per 4 notti con le nostre gemelle di 10 anni e ci siamo trovati molto bene. La posizione è perfetta, centralissima, a pochi passi da Time Square e da Central Park così come alla fermata della metro. Ci è stata assegnata una bella ed elegante suite d’angolo al 22esimo piano, con spettacolare vista sui grattacieli e su Times Square. Letto grande e comodissimo.
La colazione al 23esimo piano è molto varia, comprensiva di piatti dolci, salati, yogurt e frutta. L’ambiente è accogliente e raccolto, in alcune zone sembra di stare più in un salotto, con poltrone e divanetti, che in una sala colazione. Se il tempo lo permette, ha anche una gradevole terrazza per mangiare fuori.
Personale molto cortese e disponibile, sia alle pulizie sia al ricevimento. Anche i due ragazzi addetti al Concierge ci hanno sempre aiutato con prontezza, tanto nelle nostre richieste di indicazioni e chiarimenti quanto in quelle di prenotazioni di ristoranti e di alternative soddisfacenti quando il locale da noi prescelto non aveva posto. Un particolare ringraziamento va all’hotel manager, Petr Jureka, per la squisita gentilezza dimostrata.
Non esiteremo a tornare al nostro prossimo viaggio a New York. Da consigliare decisamente.

title: Excellent in every way
text: Quiet hotel in the midst of New York. Good clean and well appointed rooms. Complimentary breakfast and evening snacks with drinks. Staff very pleasant and friendly. Centrally located. Highly recommended

title: Good would stay again, some flaws awful bed linens
text:
Would stay again. Great breakfast, staff 

PROS;
Friendly, helpful staff
Attractive decor 
Nice lobby - even smells good
Breakfast included and a very good quality 
Pretty quiet (asked for quiet room - no
View but facing in was quiet, just what I asked for 
Glass shower nice 
Location good 

CONS:
OMG- comforter was as thin as a sheet!!! Literally thought I only had sheets as covers. The worst. Even a blanket would have been an improvement. Really affected my sleep. 

No counter space in bathroom. Only a tiny glass shelf which was installed with a slope so things rolled off. Had to hang my toiletries bag on a door knob and things kept falling out. Annoying as hell. No place to set down a brush while blow drying. And the thing is, they could’ve  had room for a small vanity with counter. Felt like they just chintzed out and remodeled on the cheap. 

Weird hole in shower. Should have had a better way for you to reach out for your towel, which had to be hung on a rack right next to the toilet. Rack should have been on part of door that opened. Not grabbed through hole by toilet. 

Room 1929- mirror over desk needs to be replaced. Looked like it had once had graffiti sprayed on it. Weird and noticeable. Also, nightstand had scratches on it. Things should be maintained better. One of the switches on the bedside lamps  was missing a piece. Still worked but just added to the “we don’t maintain things well” feeling. 
The choice they picked for faucets has a finish that doesn’t wear well. Looked worn. 
Just not well though out when planned bathroom. 
Climate control didn’t seem to do what you wanted it to. Room kind of stayed same temp no matter what. It was nice though because warm 
When climate control turned on, a very musty/moldy  smell was emitted.

title: Inmejorable ubicación.  Un 4 estrellas muy agradable.
text: Un 4 estrellas muy agradable.  Desayuno abundante y correcto y lo más importante, aperitivos de 17 a 19 horas.  Staff muy servicial. Muy práctico para trabajo. Si puedes pagar la habitación con vistas a Times Square es mucho más agradable. Puedes pedir que te abran la cama por la noche y cambien las toallas.

title: Amazing stay
text: Couldn’t recommend The Westhouse more, we felt so welcomed as soon as we stepped through the door. Any requirements were met at a high standard and we even got upgraded for our anniversary with complimentary champagne which was lovely. The staff went above and beyond the high standards that we read on tripadvisor before booking and we would definitely recommend everyone to stay here. If we were to come back to NYC we wouldn’t think about staying anywhere else. Thank you for the best stay!

title: Elegant and low key boutique pied a terre.
text:
The Westhouse continues to deliver on its promise. 
The location is exceptional-- walking distance to theaters,museums,central park, shopping, etc. Subway station is outside the front doors.
On arrival, we are made to feel at home and welcome. The rooms are perfectly laid out and the Terrace on the 23rd floor is a relaxing and elegant lounge where the breakfasts and afternoon happy hour /light pre- theater dinners are served.
But what really sets it apart is the service. The front desk personnel ( Ashley sets the tone) are warm and helpful. The lobby staff is also friendly.Jason and Anthony manage the Terrace and are ready to assist with any requests. Raphael is a constant in the Terrace in the evenings and in the lounge after hours -always with a smile . 
what is very unusual is that the management team interacts with the guests during the day and evening  and want to make sure that all is well.

Super stay.

title: Estafa
text:
Un hotel muy lejos de la categoría de 5 estrellas que se supone que tiene. 

El desayuno y el aperitivo están bien, pero de calidad no acorde a la categoría. 

La reposicion de amenities brilló por su ausencia, en dos dias consecutivos, tuvimos que solicitar la reposición del gel de baño, pues con los botes vacíos, no se repusieron. 

Tuvimos según el hotel un mal entendido en la reserva de unas entradas para un espectáculo a través del hotel. Tal mal entendido no sucedió, pues el importe cobrado se duplicó, principalmente porque las entrada en la ubicación asignada no cuestan ni la mitad de lo cobrado. Pero mi principal malestar es por el trato recibido en recepción, el chico de reserva de las entrada y principalmente el director del hotel, que actúo a la defensiva sobre una documentación escrita a mano a posteriori. En ningún momento  nos negamos a abonar la Estafa recibida, pero por su parte no se molestaron en comprobar que en la venta de entrada habíamos sido estafados.

title: The Royal Treatment
text: We were given the suggestion to stay here by several friends, and after staying there, understood why they recommended it.  From the service, as you walk in, to the comfortable rooms, the complimentary breakfasts and happy hour wine and "more than" appetizers, it exceeded our expectations.  There were six of us and all of us agreed that it was more than we expected, and would highly recommend to anyone wanting to be in the middle of the action, within walking distances, this is the place to stay. The concierge was always so helpful in explaining different places/locations we were wanting to see, along with great suggestions for how to get around town, and great eating places. We were blocks from so many places that were on our list to see.  Being centrally located of all the sites that were on our list, we could Uber to many of them without exobrant fees.  Can't wait till our next visit to New York City at a stay in the Westhouse Hotel again!!!

title: Loved Our Stay
text: First time staying at Westhouse that was recommended by my business partner. Clean, modern with friendly and helpful staff. Thank you Christian the bellhop for your professionalism. I also appreciate Sean the concierge’s knowledge of NY and setting up our itinerary before our stay. Walking distance to the theater district and times square. If you don’t mind walking the hotel is located near Central Park  and 5th Avenue. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC and Westhouse was by far one of my nicest stays.

title: Great location, nice interior design, otherwise very surprisingly poor
text: A disappointingly poor hotel. This doesn't check the five star or boutique hotel boxes. There is no coffee in the rooms and despite two different front desk staff saying they would send up a coffee maker it never materialised. There is no room service and no restaurant in the hotel. At check-in there is no mention that there is no food of any sort. There is an odd "resident's fee" which is not advertised on hotel.com. The room, due to a connecting door, had almost no sound proofing. The conversation from next door was clearly audible. It is located near Columbus Circle which is great and the bed linens and bathroom products are very nice.

title: Best surprise
text: I am amazed by the quality of the service, the amenities and the small details. Thank you very much for a wonderful experience. Great location, great price, great service and great bed, shower and breakfast. See you soon

title: Perfect for us
text:
Just got back from a lovely 4 night stay at this hotel with my teenage daughters.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The beds and pillows were so comfortable we would have brought them home if we could, and our room had a great view.  The terrace on the 23rd floor was great and the evening nibbles and drinks were a bonus as was the excellent wifi.  The location is super, within walking distance of Central Park, Fifth Avenue and Broadway, but also close to subway stations.

Thank you for making our holiday so lovely.

title: Fabulous
text: Came to the hotel with family for 5 nights. Can only say great things. Was well aware of the residents fee. It did not apply to under 18 year olds. It provided us with breakfast, which was very nice and great selection, all day coffee, coke,sprite, bottles of water and an evening buffet of food. Also really nice wine beer and soft drinks for 2 hours in the early evening. Room was lovely and clean. Staff were so accommodating especially server in the evening. Hotel is well located and an easy walk to 5th avenue and broadway. Plenty of choices of food of all prices near by. Would definitely recommend and will stay here again next time. Thanks for a fabulous holiday!

title: Great hotel near Central Park!
text: Beautiful room! Great breakfast and wine hour which are fantastic! Perfect location, just blocks to Central Park, the Hudson River and an easy walk to theaters and Times Square. Nick at the front desk was awesome!

title: Fabulous hotel! Great location!
text: First visit to NY. WestHouse was amazing! Gorgeous room, great view of Time Square but very quiet. Delicious full breakfast and yummy happy hour treats including wine, beer, prosciutto, cheeses, etc. Super attentive staff. I mentioned in a note that it was my daughter’s bday and they brought up cupcakes and a sweet note. Awesome location—walking distance to Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center. Worth every penny. I would 100% stay again!

title: Fantastic Trip in NYC
text: We were recommended by a friend to stay at the West House Hotel , New York and it certainly didn’t disappoint , it’s in a really great location not far from Times Square , Grand Central and 5th Avenue , it’s both cosy and luxurious and with a lovely buffet style breakfast included and free wine or champagne every evening in the 23rd floor bar is really a hotel well worth visiting , the staff are friendly and nothing is too much trouble I couldn’t recommend staying here more highly will definitely come back.

title: Not sure yet
text: We called the hotel directly for reservations and were reassured more than three times that the hotel was dog friendly and offered a “dog run or green space” upon arrival we were told that was not true and felt like we were the baited and switched. The valet guy was not very customer service friendly and neither was the front desk guy either. Their idea of a dog bed is a pillow they give you with a plastic bowl. They also didn’t review dog weight with us or their policy on how it is against the rules to leave the dog EVER. We would never leave our baby for more than a couple hours but still this was not said to us. To add to more frustration we were told over the phone that we booked a king size bed and when we got the email it was a reservation for a queen. When I told the gentlemen this he said “oh that’s weird they never make mistakes like that” almost insinuating that I was lying. So far I would not recommend this place to anyone especially for over $1100 for two nights. I’m worried about our car too with how loopy the valet guy seemed. I just feel unsettled. We will see how breakfast goes as that is supposed to be free and also see what other surprises await us......I’m kind of regretting not booking at Park Lane Hotel down the road now!

title: Exceptional Service with Olde World Grace
text: I want to acknowledge the Director, Front Office who remedied a travel date oversight with old world grace;  I was treated with respect and courtesy for which I am ever-so grateful.  I look forward to my 4th visit. I've never had a complaint other than an ever-so minor one: a wish for a better blend of coffee at the sumptuous breakfast buffet which would reduce the line at the specialty coffee machine. I mention the coffee issue to ensure review credibility!  Having a wonder of the world -Central Park-just steps away enhances the pleasure of staying at Westhouse!

title: Awesome Hotel
text: We loved our experience at The WestHouse Hotel in New York. It is beautiful, clean and in a quiet neighborhood but still in walking distance to Time Square. It has a great hot breakfast in the morning and our favorite was the happy hour in the evening. Great food and great wine. Thank you Rafael for taking great care of us at Happy Hour. Thank you also to Vanessa at the front desk. She is wonderful and very helpful.

title: Great location and service
text:
The room was clean, comfortable and had a nice view of Times Square as advertised.  No issues with the elevator or air conditioning.  

So here is why I rated it as an excellent stay - the service and location.  The concierge was so patient and helpful with directions.  We were in town for the Yankee game and he personally walked us to the easiest subway station while giving a little history tour along the way.  That was above and beyond standard concierge duties and so very much appreciated.

The location is absolutely perfect for seeing the sights in Manhattan. Times Square, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue, Theater District and Central Park are all an easy 5-10 minute walk.  Any kind of food or drink are a stones throw away.  Subway stations are very close and busy Columbus Circle is within a 5 minute walk.    

I will comment on the daily residence fee. They are very transparent about the fee so we weren't at all surprised.  And even with the fee, the rate is not overpriced.  I'm just not sure why they don't add it to the nightly rate and save us the extra calculation.  But hey, I will do a little math for this one - it's worth it and we would definitely stay here again for a New York weekend.

title: Hidden Gem
text:
I am always afraid of trying new hotels in New York because so often they disappoint. But the reviews were very good and heartfelt.
I took a leap of faith and I booked it for a whole week. So happy I did.
This elegant, quiet boutique hotel is perfect for the business traveler or visitor.
Discreet, elegant lobby, secure key elevator access, beautiful hallways and large elegant rooms with luxurious bathrooms ( though they could be a tad bigger).
What I did not know, and this is important,
There’s a fixed daily per person fee of about $50 bucks for breakfast buffet and dinner buffet wth wine.  The hotel offers a lounge/club level for the whole hotel. The sun terrace and lounge are lovely, but just know about the fee. 
I didn’t know about it, so I had not budgeted for it, but it paid for itself. The hot breakfast buffet is very good and ample, though more fresh fruit would be lovely.
I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Second Stay - Not Disappointed
text:
I cannot go on enough about the service in this hotel.  From Rafael at the bar to Christian the Front Office Mgr, or Nick at the check in desk.  Every member of staff goes way above and beyond to make sure you are happy and comfortable.  When I say this, I am not just saying, within minutes of checking in, we had a call from Christian and an email asking if our room was satisfactory.  Of course it was.
And did I mention in my last review the hotel custom "scent"?  It's magic in your nostrils!
The terrace where they serve breakfast and hold happy hour in the evening has a view of Midtown that I would dare to say cannot be rivaled.

We enjoyed our stay...once again very much.  We have already started planning a trip back.

Book directly and tell them Jennifer Bradley sent ya! :)

title: Excellent location and helpful staff
text:
Stayed for a couple of nights recently.The location is excellent -a few minutes walk from Times Square,Broadway,Carnegie Hall and Central Park.
Staff were helpful and nothing was too much trouble.
The breakfast and happy hour on top floor was excellent (especially as could eat on the terrace). 
Peter the hotel manager was very personable and checked that everything was to our liking.
Would stay again.

title: A nearly perfect application of lipstick on a pig
text: Despite frequent visits to New York City, I'd never heard of this hotel, so was intrigued when it came up as a "five star" hotel at a four-star price. The room descriptions looked very good, with up-market decor, a nice walk-in glass shower and "Luxury King" listed as the least costly room. The room pictured included a desk and chair, two windows, nightstands adjacent to the bed, a nice side chair with accompanying small table and is listed as "approximately 295 square feet". You might imagine my surprise after checking into my luxury king at 1 AM to find no desk, no nightstands, no side chair or accompanying small table, all luxuriously located on the smallest corridor I've ever seen in a hotel anywhere in the world. The corridor outside the room was literally just 3 feet wide! Breakfast was a required included feature, yet other than two kinds of batch-prepared eggs, was an only slightly upgraded version of what one can expect in a Hilton Garden Inn. To be fair, the staff was quite nice, yet when I asked why the room had no desk (I hate using a laptop whilst sitting on the bed - the sole seating device in the not-even-close to 295 square foot chamber), the individual manning the desk offered another room, but said I'd have to pack my things and move as if it was my fault I'd been given the wrong room. I've had far better service offers from big chain hotels like Hilton when a room proved unsatisfactory. Now it's possible that there are some "luxury kings" of the size described, but the room map appeared to contain the same very narrow and long room repeated throughout the floor, with the odd suite mixed in. To top it off, the hotel occupies floors 19 - 25 of the dilapidated old queen which now apparently forms three "boutique" hotels and is served by just two nicely decorated, but decidedly old elevators. I did very much like the generous bath, the well-appointed shower and the intimate lobby, all of which were finished beautifully. I've had far more functional rooms in hotels which are decidedly three-star by comparison.

title: An Assault on Your Sense of Smell
text:
This is the most heavily scented hotel ever. Avoid at all costs if you have asthma, allergies or other sensitivities.  I have a fragrance sensitivity (yes, this is a real thing that affects millions of people) and from the moment I stepped into the lobby I was assaulted by their very strong “lobby scent.”  This hotel proudly announces it is “smoke-free” but pollutes their own air with an overabundance of artificial scents. Some artificial fragrances can disrupt women’s hormones, your endocrine system and even be carcinogens!  It’s like walking through the perfume section of a department store that exploded.  And you can’t escape it, not in the bar, or hallways, or lounge, so I walk the halls plugging my nose.  Fortunately, the kept them windows open to air out my room before I checked into it or I’d have to leave. 

It’s very unfortunate because otherwise it is a nice hotel.  It’s an excellent location close to Time Square and Central Park.  The 5-7p happy hour set up was nice. Although, I can see how at times there may be limited seating there when the Terrace is crowded. The king suite is a nice size and fair price for the area. I wish the bathroom had two sinks instead of one.  There is no room service but I believe you can order food to be delivered through a third party website, Seamless.

title: Excellent Stay!
text: Our room was lovely, Tarick, at the front desk was wonderfully helpful!  There is a breakfast and happy hour, on the top floor, with a terrace that was excellent.  Peter, the hotel Manager made his rounds during these times.  He was very helpful and personable.  Will definitely stay there again!

title: Hotellerie der Oberklasse
text:
Nachdem ich von meinem ursprünglich gebuchten Hotel so enttäuscht war, dass ich das Hotel wechseln wollte, bin ich ins Westhouse um mich nach Kapazitäten für weitere 5 Nächte zu erkundigen.
Ich wurde von Ethan Fishbane, Director of Front Office, begrüsst und betreut. Er war so freundlich mir vorab wie gewünscht, Zimmer im WestHouse zu zeigen und mir die weiteren Annehmlichkeiten des Hotels vorzustellen. 
Der Aufenthalt im WestHouse mit seinen geräumigen Zimmern, dem reichhaltigen Frühstück, der kleinen Dachterrasse, wo man sich wie zu Hause fühlt und der grosszügigen Happy Hour, haben mich vollends überzeugt.
Hierher werde ich auf jeden Fall wiederkommen weil das Hotel Komfort, Sauberkeit, Freundlichkeit, Qualität und eine hervorragende Lage bietet.
Ein Extrakompliment an Ethan, der selbst nach seinem Dienstschluss prompt auf meine email geantwortet hat. Das ist eben Hotellerie der Oberklasse!
e mai

title: Some great and some average
text:
Yeah.
So we had a reservation somewhere else and the WestHouse was recommended. We read the reviews and felt it was a no-brainer to switch.

Long story short, I don't quite think it lives up to the reviews. I would never call this a 6 star hotel or anywhere near that.

Here is my opinion:
-  Lovely Staff
-  Clean room
-  Great location
- Nice Room overall, nice amenities in the bathrooms.

So really, overall it was good, but it did not leave me wowed and when I pay over 550 for a room, I kind of want to walk away going "wow, that was pretty remarkable".....

Mostly, the resident fee we were pretty stoked about, because hey, free wine and prosescco and beer during happy hour, what is not to love (had those on the roofdeck, which was great), but the breakfast, sweet baby jesus, I am not expecting a  la carte service, but the entire thing was such a conveyor belt thing, with super average food. Large catering dishes overly filled with scrambled eggs and bacon, then a couple of cereals (ok, maybe 3), pastries that had no crunch and NYC mini bagels. 

Two staff members racing around cleaning up as quickly and efficiently as they could...no complaints there.

Bottom line: For a small luxury hotel label, I expect a moment of wow. I never got it here.

title: Loved this hotel
text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel this passed weekend and we had a great experience. Our room was nice with beautiful view. We enjoyed very much the complimentary breakfast every morning and wine and cheese in the evening. The people at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. Great great hotel.... will come back. Thank you

title: Outstanding Hotel
text: The hotel is in an excellent location, rooms are great, warm and comfortable.  Nothing is a problem for the hotel staff. The subway is right next door and close to Broadway and central park.  Definately highly recommend

title: Six star hotel!
text: Yes, I would give it six stars if I could.  Just finished my fourth stay at this wonderful hotel.  The rooms are roomy and comfortable (and clean!), the bathroom is beautiful, the staff is outstanding.  If you have the option of breakfast and "Hour of Indulgence" included in your package, you will enjoy a bountiful breakfast and cocktail hour buffet, with beverages included in the evening.  The outdoor terrace is outstanding!  I look forward to my next stay at Westhouse.

title: The best hotel with the best concierge in manhattan!
text: If I ever give 5 stars I have to say this hotel makes the grade. I was just there with my wife for an anniversary weekend and the Westhouse went above and beyond in many ways. Greeted with wonderful bellman, Christian. True professional, Sean one of their excellent concierges was able to secure a reservation for us at one of the most sought after restaurants in the city(I’ll keep that secret). We know the native NYers go there so we know how difficult reservations are. After this trip we have officially named Westhouse as our new family hotel. Hotels in the city should aspire to operate as the Westhouse does. They made us feel like family.

title: Hôtel bien placé dans Midtown.
text:
Sur la 7 ème Avenue, à mi-distance entre Times Square et Central Park, à quelques mètres d'une bouche du métro ligne orange et à 150 mètres de la ligne bleue, cet hôtel assez discret, va vous accueillir chaleureusement. Chambre très propre mais pas très spacieuse, très bonne literie, nuit calme (surtout côté cour), bouteilles d'eau à volonté, salle de bain plutôt petite.
A noter un "happy hour" exceptionnel entre 17 h et 19 h autour d'un bar à vin gratuit qui permet dans cette ambiance de bavarder avec d'autres clients.
Conciergerie très efficace, à l'écoute de toutes vos demandes. Merci.
Bagagerie aussi efficace.
Tout cela participe pour un excellent séjour à New York.

title: BEL HOTEL ET TRES BONNE SITUATION
text:
Nous venons de séjourner 5 jours dans cet hôtel, situé près de Times Square et de Central Park. Très bon accueil, chambre agréable et confortable, avec bonne literie.
Petits déjeuners simples et bons, petit bémol la salle est un peu petite lorsque plusieurs personnes arrivent en même temps, mais le must est sa situation au 23e et sa terrasse avec une super vue. Personnel très sympathique.
Le soir vous avez également "Happy Hour" de 17 à 19H au 23e, avec apéritif et petit buffet offert, très bien.

title: Worth a try
text: Surprisingly nice mid size hotel. Wonderful staff, particularly Ashley who was super helpful throughout my stay. While it doesn’t have a scene per se, rooms are comfortable & quiet. Great terrace too.

title: Birthday/Business Getaway
text: I stumbled upon this boutique hotel after doing some searching and reading reviews - this hotel was reasonably priced and photos of the rooms were very inviting.  We travel to NY a few times and year and were still looking for that place that we could rely on but at decent price point.  Before I even got to the hotel, I was already impressed with the quick email responses from Ethan and the concierge staff.  This hotel is by far the best I've encountered in terms of guest services - the staff at the front desk, in the Terrace and at the bar were all so friendly and attentive!  The rooms are nicely appointed, beds are comfy and we actually got a good night sleep the last few days.  We really enjoyed the breakfast and hours of indulgence as we found it quite convenient and who can say no to bottomless drinks?  We will definitely be returning on our next trip and can't wait to try WestHouse again. Thank you to Ethan and the team!

title: Una grata estancia
text:
El hotel está muy bien situado, tiene un buen equipo, siempre dispuesto a ayudar.
Para nosotros el plus han sido las habitaciones amplias y la terraza en el piso 23.
Al tener todas las noches espectáculos, la posibilidad de comer y tomar algo antes de la representación ha sido muy agradable. 
Felicitaciones, volveremos

title: Excellent European Style Hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: I've been traveling to New York for almost 10 years and I can't believe I just found this perfect hotel. The staff is exceptional. Mo took care of us at check in and every staff member we encountered throughout our 3 night stay was professional, accommodating and a pleasure to speak with. The atmosphere is elegant. The rooms are stylish, well appointed, spacious and Quite! The later being a miracle in Mid-Town. No garbage trucks and sirens, just peace - heavenly. The icing on this cake is the hotels' hosted complimentary breakfast and late afternoon light meals and beverages served in the top floor suite with outdoor balcony to take in the NY skyline. All for very reasonable rates. This is the type of hotel that people usually keep a secret. In fact it's so fantastic my only concern is that they'll be booked the next time I want to stay with them! Enjoy a real, exceptional hotel experience - stay at the West House.

title: Delightful!
text: I stayed here for 4 nights in September & had a very pleasant stay. The location is perfect, walking distance to all the major attractions (Central Park, Broadway, 5th Ave, Rockefeller Centre & Empire State Building). I was surprised by how large the rooms were and mine on the 20th floor had great city views. The staff are very friendly & attentive and the hotel itself is quiet so you can ensure a peaceful night sleep.

title: Wonderful!
text: I stay here about 4 to 6 times a year, so there are many things I like about WestHouse.  The room size is great...not your typical shoebox NYC hotel room.  The bathrooms are also good size.  Everything is modern and clean.  Each room has an empty mini frig, so you can bring in your drinks.  Staff is always super friendly and helpful.  Tarik in particular always takes wonderful care of me.  Highly recommend this hotel.  Oh, and try the taco place across the street.

title: Wow. When can we go back?
text: Stop looking for other hotels. You found the right one. From the moment we checked in, the staff (especially Vanessa) went out of their way to make us as happy and comfortable as possible. Everyone is kind, happy and so accommodating. The rooms are great and perfectly clean. The bed was super. The happy hour was out of this world with fabulous wine and hors d’oeuvres. I hear breakfast is amazing too so we were disappointed we couldn’t stay. Check out the rooftop terrace!! The location is great!! Now we’re just looking for reason to go back!

title: Our Anniversary
text:
My wife and I decided to celebrate our anniversary in the city. We picked WestHouse hotel. It was the right choice. 
Very pleasant staff, beautiful amenities, nice quiet room with great views. We will be back for sure.

title: Fantastic!
text: Wow, such an impressive property! Can't beat the location or all the extras that this hotel offers its guests. It's a beautiful hotel with a staff who go out of their way to accommodate and personalize each person's stay. The rooftop terrace is a great place to enjoy breakfast or cocktails. Thank you Mo, Tristan, Juan and Petr for adding special touches which made our stay so memorable! Hope to return soon!

title: Fabulous hotel and customer service
text: My sister and I stayed only one night at the WestHouse Hotel and it was way too short. We were treated like queens and got upgraded to a fantastic suite. I can't say enough about the wonderful people who work at the hotel. Ashley ( I think that's her name) was beyond wonderful and welcoming. 5 stars.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: Simply can not say enough about the amazing staff, amenities and property.  This hotel is my new fav in NY. Location ( Central Park) combined with breakfast, happy hour, Mo, Tristian and Juan all make this a MUST STAY hotel.

title: Amazing staff! especially Ashley Clarkson!
text:
Even though we arrived and had a pretty rough start... the front desk staff, with a very special thank you to Ashley Clarkson, changed everything for the better! 

The front desk and Ashley took care of our every need and made sure we’ll feel comfortable and that we’re been taken care of. 

Rooms are clean. 
The location is great. 
There is a wired thing about the shower in the bathroom of the room and The breakfast was a bit repetitive.

title: Second time here and still great!
text: Thank you thew Westhouse team for making us feel at home once again. In this busy city, this hotel knows how to make you feel welcomed and special. This is a great location  with very reasonable pricing especially for the customer service, quality and amenities you get. Loved the complimentary breakfast and the appetize/drinks in the afternoon before a show or a night in town. Would 100% go back here again.

title: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G and then some!
text: I believe this is the Hotel you go to before you actually go to Heaven.  The staff was exceptional from the front door to the floor we were on.  We were celebrating our 30th anniversary.  When we arrived "Moe" greeted us and from that point we felt like a King and a Queen.  I love Vanessa and Tarik at the front desk.  They were so very helpful and accommodating.  We were close to everything and Rafael (our evening host) was a wealth of knowledge.  The service and the entire staff were topnotch!  No need to look any further,  The greeting by the staff, "Welcome Back"

title: The Hotel which makes your day better
text: After a long search of Hotels we finally found WestHouse, which have an absolutely amazing atmosphere. The staff and everyone in the Hotel is really kind and helpful. At the lounge part from 5pm to 7pm they provided one course dinner, cheese, ham and nice drinks for the evening. This has often enlightened our days. I truly recommend this 5 star boutique Hotel if you are looking for a stylish place to stay in NYC.

title: Bad service
text: Been here for a little over an hour so far... Horrible experience due to lack of professional customer service. Something as simple as picking up laundry, and they keep saying someone is on their way and 90 min passed and no one showed up. I keep calling and they keep stalling and making up excuses.

title: Best service in a long time!
text: We visited for a single night and loved the WestHouse. Our king-sized room was clean and spacious. Complimentary breakfast and happy hour were both excellent.The location is in close walking distance to Central Park and theaters. We send a warm shout-out and big thanks to the staff, especially Cathy, Tariq, Vanessa, Marcello and Rafael. Peter, the hotel GM, is energetic, personable and made sure every guest felt welcomed. We highly recommend WestHouse and look forward to our next stay here!

title: Liars!
text:
So, this was my first time in New York. My dad had booked a hotel (Westhouse) for me from India. He said that he will take care of the hotel bill. In short, he didn’t want me to spend money on the hotel as this was his treat. 

I was going to see a friend in New York. So, we called the hotel to ask if they charge extra fees for the guest. They said that she can stay with me and they won’t charge anything. They had added a breakfast in my hotel bill which was a compulsion and we both had to pay $40 per day.

Now, when she reached there they took her card for the hold which is understandable. She confirmed with them twice if they are gonna charge anything from her card. They assured her that they won’t. I arrived late at around 11 pm. I went straight to the reception to confirm with them about the card they had kept for the hold. The receptionist said that they will not charge anything from that card. Everything has been paid already.
Then we stayed there for two days. Rooms were good. View was good too. Breakfast for which they charge $40 was nothing like $40. It was something that I would get in Vagabond inn. 

After we checked out, my friend informed me that she was charged $120!! The hotel staff said that this was mandatory fees and they already had done a favor by not charging her the guest fees. I am okay with paying the resort fees. But it shouldn’t come with a lie. I would have happily given them my credit card if they were going to charge anything from her card. I felt so stupid. Even after paying a huge amount my friend was charged with $120 which I don’t think is a small amount. This was not what I had expected from the hotel with this standard. I really felt stupid in front of my friend.

Dear Westhouse New York,

If you want to charge your guests, just let them know. Don’t lie to them or give them surprises/shocks after they leave your hotel. We would have happily let you charge the resort fees but you lied which I think is kind of a verbal fraud!

title: We will be back for sure!
text: Stayed here for a quick NYC getaway with a friend and loved the hotel. Rooms were clean and spacious and staff was great. Breakfast and complimentary happy hour are well worth it and the location is in walking distance to all the great best locations and top restaurants. We highly recommend it and can’t wait to stay here in the future.

title: Best hotel in nyc by far!
text: We absolutely fell in love with this hotel. Staff is beyond friendly and the location is great!  Marcelo and Sanday at the complimentary happy hour was always so attentive and took such great care of us, as well as the hotel manager Peter who was always there to make sure our stay was meeting our expectations and giving us great advice on what to experience in the city. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Fun NYC getaway
text:
We had the best time! Great hotel & location !! Lovely rooftop area for drinks & breakfast included in our room. It was perfect. Staff was outstanding -
Our son & his wife asked for another room due to view out window and they were able & so nice to accommodate! 

Would stay there again & have since reccomended it friends.

title: Amazing Stay!!!
text: On Saturday, September 15th, my family and i stayed at the Westhouse Hotel for my older sons 9th birthday. We made it a family overnight stay to celebrate. From the moment we stepped in Juan, Vanessa, and the Westhouse Staff made us feel so incredibly special. They went out of there way to make my birthday boy feel special. Juan even remembered my boys name and they loved it. Our room was more than adequate, with plenty of room. We were close to Central Park and Times Square. My husband and I were so pleased with the hotel that we already have discussed we will be back! Thank you again WestHouse for making our stay AMAZING!

title: Perfekt beliggenhed, super service og lækre værelser
text: Jeg har inden for de sidste to måneder boet to gange på WestHouse Hotel - og det har jeg været meget glad for. Hotellets personale er meget opmærksomme og giver en god service - og værelserne er store, rene og pæne. Det er et hotel der er rart at komme til, man føler sig hjemme. Beliggenheden er også perfekt - midt i Hell's Kitchen og tæt på Central Park. Jeg glæder mig allerede til mit næste ophold på WestHouse Hotel:)

title: Best Location great atmosphere
text: The WestHouse Hotel is a hidden gem. It's location is great and the staff are just the nicest people, they are kind, helpful and sincere. We loved the rooms and hotel's atmosphere a lot. Would highly recommend it.

title: Awful
text:
We booked into Room 2120 on Friday September 14 and left on Monday September 17.
The exterior of the hotel is covered in scaffolding and looks very run down.
On arrival and registration I could not understand why the lighting was so low that we 
 were in darkness. My husband was asked to fill in a registration form but it was so dark we could hardly see. We were told there was no room service and no restaurant but a compulsory fee would be charged for the terrace level on floor 22 where they served a breakfast buffet and a 2 hour evening slot when they served a buffet of  light snacks and drinks.The breakfast, juice,  coffee and pastries were fine but the scrambled eggs were pure rubber and inedible. The 2 hour slot in the evening was just not worth attending. The hot food was of poor quality, the setting  resembles a  cafeteria.
Our room 2120 was so small and so dark that I did not know how I could stay here.It had one narrow window which looked out onto a brick wall. The lighting in the bedroom consisted of 2 bedside wall lights each had 2 switches, one could choose 1 candle light or 2 candle lights. one of the light switches was broken so we stumbled  around in the dark, unable to read or see to unpack.
The bathroom was so small that it was a closet. The shower measured 48 X 48 inches
the washbasin was just a washbasin 32 inches wide, with no place to lay out toiletries.
Multiple trips from the bathroom to my suitcase to collect the various toiletries required to start and finish the day.
By Saturday night I was in despair and wishing I could develop sonar navigation to get around in this hellhole. All the doors had been so badly fitted with new hinges that none of them closed properly. The carts containing supplies for room cleaning were left in the corridor permanently. they were never removed to a service area.
There was no toilet brush in the bathroom and no extractor fan.
There was one wastebasket in the bathroom but no wastebasket in the bedroom at the desk area.
The bar area adjacent to the lobby was completely empty for the duration of our stay. The lighting in this hotel is  so dark that a bat would have difficulty negotiating its way around, it was  soul less, lifeless, unfriendly staff,   depressing and deserted. I was so glad to leave and see the light.

title: Great Hotel With Extras
text:
We had a very pleasurable stay at the Westhouse for our first trip to NYC. We decided to stay here due to the extras that the hotel provides and the proximity to Central Park, 7th Ave Subway and 5th Ave shopping all being very close by. 

It is customary for many Hotels in NYC to charge a residency and city tax on top of your room rate and is done due to governing forces - however the Westhouse actually gives back to their guests by offering daily breakfast, an evening meal with wine, beer or bubbles and offers wifi, telephone calls and bottled water all as part of the enforced taxes. Many hotels do not offer any of these extras but still enforce the tax.

We also found the price for a suite was very impressive. Having searched through many websites looking for a good hotel, the Westhouse suite was by far the best offer we came across coming in at the same price as many standard queen rooms offered by other hotels.

Our suite, on the 22nd floor consisted of a seperate lounge and dressing area, a full size wardrobe, 2 tv's, kingsize bedroom and a bathroom all well decorated and well appointed. The bed and pillows being extremely comfortable and the room very quiet. We were glad to be on the 22nd floor as we did not experience any traffic noise, just the distant ever present hum and car horns that one may expect in the city that never sleeps. 

Concierge was very helpful suppling us with maps, tips and hints about what NY has to offer the first timer.

The rooms are serviced daily and a turn down service is offered.

All the staff are friendly and welcoming and do their best to make sure that your stay is one to remember.

title: Great hotel!
text: Excellent service and value. Lovely hotel with great amenities in a fabulous location. Beautiful rooms and terrace serving coffee all day, breakfast and light evening fare included in room rate. Terrace space serves as an extension of the room, so nice!

title: Our "go to" hotel in NYC -- 10th stay!
text: Just back from three nights at Westhouse, and our 10th stay there.  As before, excellent accommodations and service.  Very convenient location -- adjacent to the theater district, multiple subway lines within two blocks, and easy walk in Midtown and into the park.  Very good breakfast and happy hour.  Particular compliments for the front desk, staffed with people who sincerely want to help.  We'll be back in a couple of months!

title: Back again!
text: This was our second stay at the WestHouse. We requested a suite so that we could take advantage of the meals served on the 23rd floor and the extra space a suite provides. We were again very pleased with our room. It was very clean and quiet. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Nick made our checkout effortless. He gave us a helpful suggestion for a lunch spot and they kept our bags until we returned. The location is great. Close to Central Park and an easy walk to Broadway and other popular spots. They will grab a cab for you if you need one and had a cab waiting to take us to the airport. I highly recommend the WestHouse and we would certainly stay there again.

title: Outstanding Service!
text: My mom and I stayed at WestHouse for her 49th birthday and it was the best weekend we could have asked for! All of the staff are extremely nice already, but once they found out it was her birthday, they really went the extra mile!  A special thank you to Food and Beverage Manager Jason who was so sweet and took time to chat with us every morning and evening during breakfast and hours of indulgence (which by the way both are incredible amenities!) Jason brought my mom a special bottle of champagne and desserts and even treated us to a round of complimentary cocktails at the bar on her birthday. Unfortunately he wasn’t there on our last day but he told his other manager Anthony about us and he found us instantly and treated us to a special round of mimosas! We then found out that Jason left us a bottle of one of the wines my mom loved from the hours of indulgence to keep! I’m not sure if they do this for all birthdays and celebrations but the smallest gestures really go so far and they truly work hard to make a personalized one of a kind experience! A special thank you to Jason, Anthony, and the entire Food & Beverage staff for making my moms birthday weekend such a fabulous one!

title: It is wonderful every time!
text: I make sure to stay at the West House every time I am in New York. Took a recent weekend trip for my son's birthday. Winston was there with a warn and friendly smile as soon as we arrived, and Nick was fantastic at the front desk. Was treated to an upgrade which gave my son a great view from the veranda. I love this hotel! The people, amenities, and location make it one of my favorites. Can't wait to see you soon!

title: I’d stay here again
text:
Well, at first I had my reservation based on the location which is great if you’re coming to NY for the first time like it was in my case, then I came to trip advisor for reviews (I know it often happens the other way around, but whatever). Anyway, reading the reviews I got scared thinking it could be a bad experience but it wasn’t the case at all. I read the towels were in bad state, it was not the case, I read you could hear everything happening outside the room wherever they changed you to, I didn’t experience this. Other people wrote here that it wasn’t clean enough, I even looked for filth to see if there was any, couldn’t find anything filthy. They wrote that the breakfast buffet wasn’t good enough because it didn’t have many options, well I think it has what most people have and it’s just fine. People also complained about the personnel for not being kind enough but Vanessa at the reception was really nice, cleaning personnel, people at the restaurant, concierge, everyone helpful and caring. The only thing I’d put an asterisk on is that once you are there, they will tell you about an extra of 50 per day per person for the breakfast and drinks at the hotel terrace, this is not optional so have it in mind when booking because it’s on the small letters (still worth it). Overall this was a great experience, I’d stay here again, The correlation between the price and the place is excellent. Thank you again to everyone at Westhouse!.   

Esther & Rossana.

title: Very plush boutique hotel. Excellent breakfast buffet!!
text: We love this Hotel. We were just so pleased with the entire experience. There was nothing we could pick that fell short for our expectations. The rooms were perfect and the breakfast buffet with all the options was outstanding.

title: perfect Manhatten location
text: this hotel lives up to its 5 star rating. easy walking to Broadway, 5th,6th, 7th Aves. 5 minute walk to Central Park. our room was quiet and the furnishings excellent. The hotel staff was went out of their way to make our stay a great experience. Ethan and Nick at the front desk were tops! Truly a small luxury hotel with all the amenities.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Excellent location. Friendly, helpful
Staff. Resident fee for Terrace amenities was well worth the charge, especially after a day of exploring the city, convenient and delicious with extensive breakfast and evening light menu and bar. Well appointed rooms with comfortable beds. Will definitely stay again.

title: Excellent service
text: It was my second time to stay at WestHouse Hotel in NY. I arrived a little bit early, but the front clark Ashley upgraded my room to Prestige Suite(I think it was called this) because I stayed there before, she said. I don't think it was the only reason, but I was very satisfied with the room. I wish I had had more time to spend at the room, but definitely I will come back to the hotel. The location is perfect to access 5th Avenue, Central Park and other attractive spots.

title: NYC Vacation
text: Located only a few blocks from Times Square and Central Park this hotel was just close enough to quickly get to many NYC attractions but just far enough away so that the bright lights and noise aren’t bothersome. We had a larger room and balcony which was great because we were travelling with 2 kids. A hideabed in the living room for the kids and separate bedroom for the adults. The bathroom was small, and tricky with 4 people but would have been fine with a couple instead of a family. There is an extra charge per adult each night for the breakfast and evening food service which might be overlooked when booking so pay attention. It was just under $50 USD each, per night, when we went in August. The quality of food is good but the selection is limited and breakfast had no rotation, so if you stay more then a couple days you’ll be sick of the food. There’s free alcohol in the evening but staff expect a tip which is a bit irritating considering how much you pay, and it’s only available for a couple hours. If you miss it, to bad, you still pay. Overall the hotel was clean, staff was nice, and the rooms were nice. For what we paid though, if we ever go back to NYC, we’ll probably stay somewhere else.

title: Superb service, wonderful hotel
text: We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was absolutely perfect for two girlfriends to have some privacy but also hang out together. It felt like an apartment (a large apartment!!).  The pull out sofa was very comfortable and they provided a turn down service each night - so it was ready when we came back to the hotel after dinner.  The breakfast and evening fare was spectacular!!  The staff was just wonderful - in every regard.  The hotel earns its 5 star rating!!  Would definitely stay here again. If you can, ask for room 2504 - it had spectacular views of the city from the 5+ windows in the room.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: My friends and I rare gently stayed here and the hotel was beautiful and the rooms were so nice and well done.  However, the staff was AMAZING.  They were so nice and accommodating.  Especially the manager Juan and Q!  We will be back!

title: Excelente hotel y trato
text: Desde que llegas al hotel recibes un excelente trato por parte de Tarik ... te explica bien las horas del desayuno y happy hour, los cuartos son excelentes grandes y limpios con decoracion muy linda... excelente ubicación

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: The Westhouse is a Fabulous Hotel the staff are truly  wonderful!  Juan, Vanessa, Jason, Asheley, Tarek, Nick and Chris are just an example of the The Westhouse's great staff.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: An uptown gem
text: Have stayed here twice now and its a quiet calm in a city of crazy!  The reception, rooms and professionalism is all first rate!   THE breakfast and happy hour treats are such a great touch and having a quiet/clean and well appointed room in such a great location for the price was fantastic!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: Loved this hotel! The hotel itself is beautiful, very comfortable and in a great location, but it was the staff that truly made our stay exceptional. Everyone that we encountered made our stay that much more memorable. We were in NY celebrating my daughter's 13th Birthday, my Mom, my sister, my daughter and myself. From the moment we checked in and met Tarik at the front desk we felt very special. He went out of his way to accommodate any requests we had. Hazma who helped us with our luggage was great too, Sandy Dixon, who went out of her way to surprise my daughter with a yummy birthday treat in our room (which absolutely made her day!) was super sweet. I don't know if what we experienced was just a normal day at the West House or not, but it didn't go unnoticed. We don't travel to NY often, but I can guarantee when we do return we will be booking at The West House Hotel again.

title: Fantastic
text: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Peter the manager was so helpful and friendly and made time to speak to his guests. Special thanks to Vanessa who went the extra mile to find us a room that met our requirements. I have stayed in New York many times but never before received this level of service and friendliness from every member of staff. Thanks for the bubbly to celebrate our special occasion.

title: Great spot
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights for our 10 year anniversary.  It really is a great spot.  Close enough to walk everywhere without being in the total chaos of Times Square.

The rooms were very nice and modern and the breakfast and evening food was fabulous!  It was great to have the convince of breakfast/dinner and all day coffee/drinks available.  

It was very short walk to central park and subway stations.  

Staff was very friendly and always available.  We were able to store our luggage for the afternoon until our flight.

title: Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff
text: After a horrible cab ride on a sweltering NYC night we got to the Westhouse just after midnight and we’re greeted by lovely cool air conditioning and beautiful hardwood floors and most importantly two of the most lovely staff. They checked us in super fast and upgraded our room too! The hotel has a great little gym and an awesome shower which is essential for a good holiday. After a long day of travel the staff absolutely made our day. Our room is incredible and it’s so close to Broadway and everything you could possible want in New York City. Thanks Kathy and Kourtney. If anyone from the Westhouse is reading this, you should give those two amazing ladies a promotion or a pay rise...or both!

title: Boutique hotel with personal approach
text:
This is a great boutique hotel in the very heart of Manhattan. I picked it because of the location close to the Venter Park and after the reference of a friend. It turned out to be a very good choice. Not a typical chain hotel, serving breakfast and afternoon snack. Rooms are modern and cosy on the same time. The staff is very helpful and friendly. I needed to find the lunch for my 1-year old son and the chef made it especially for him and brought it up to the room. 
Definitely recommend it for the next New York stay.

title: So Close to Greatness
text:
This hotel is a really great value and while I wanted to give it 3.5 stars, it would easily get a 4 if they tended to the little things. The lobby is awesome, breakfast is definitely more than adequate with meats and eggs to complement pastries, yogurt, cereal and fruit, and the staff is super friendly. But that 4 rating would’ve been gotten easily if not for the water damaged ceiling, random screw missing in the bathroom doorknob, a couple stains on the carpet, an iron that didn’t fully function, and an outlet that didn’t work. These things are pretty trivial in my book, and I wanted to give it a 4 for the terrace alone (where breakfast is served). But yeah. 5 is def too high and 4 would be if the little things went right. 

I’d stay here again but I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone I wanted to impress. Or I’d recommend it and give the disclaimers.

title: Favorite Hotel in Manhattan
text: Every time I go to NYC, I first check the availability at WestHouse. I stumbled upon it during one of my work trips, and now I won't look elsewhere unless I have to. The staff is friendly and courteous first and foremost. And, I have NEVER had a bad room in the hotel.

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here 3 times and each time is a joy - we always ask for a higher floor room with a good view and we are never disappointed.  Staff are very friendly and helpful, breakfast is exceptional and the evening drinks and food is a great bonus to start the evening - we look forward to our next trip!

title: Vorrei ma non posso
text: Albergo in ottima posizione per le necessità di visita della città come turisti. Come in tutti gli alberghi americani il brutto vizio di applicare una Resort fee (50$ ad adulto) per servizi non utilissimi (aperitivo gratis tra le 5 e le 7 ad esempio). Camera molto piccola(avevamo camera con due letti per 4 persone). Servizio molto deficitario e carente dal punto di vista pulizia(addirittura un giorno hanno dimenticato di rifare la stanza). Personale gentile.

title: MUST STAY HERE
text: This hotel is extremely classy and chic. The staff was absolutely AMAZING and super accommodating. Anytime we asked for anything, they immediately brought it to us. Not to mention, it smells like a spa. HIGHLY recommend

title: Amazing Stay
text: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed for 3 nights at the WestHouse. We felt very safe and the accommodations were awesome. Delicious breakfast of bacon, eggs, pastries in the morning and hot appetizers and wine in the evening for guests. I wanted to thank Juan Vargas who works for the WestHouse who went above and beyond for us in customer service. He was so kind and took such good care of us. He made the stay even better!

title: The Hotel was very clean, with nice updated amenities.
text: Nice, clean, updated room amenities and the most delightful and helpful staff (especially the front desk) we have ever experienced in New York. For those who like a quiet drink before dinner the upstairs and rooftop bar and lounge on the 23rd. floor is a great way to start the evening. Again, the staff was the very best!

title: Small Romantic Getaway
text: Took my girlfriend to New York as a surprise and came across this beautiful hotel.  Everything was as expected.  Booking process was easy and the staff were wonderful the moment that we got on site.   Located in a very nice street with a lot of things to do around.  The view was spectacular and Ashley at the front desk was pleasant do deal with.  Would definitely stay here again when we come back to New York next time

title: Super! Loved it! soon again
text:
Eines der Besten, wenn nicht gar das Beste Hotel auf all unseren Reisen! Ohne zu viel zu versprechen wollen!

Vom Checkin, dem gesamten Einrichtung des Hotels (SLH!) der Sauberkeit der Zimmer waren wir mit allem mehr als zufrieden. Wir waren 4 Nächte in NY und im Westhouse. Hatten ein Zimmer im 25 Stock, die Wünsche vorab wurden alle berücksichtigt „The Terrace“ am 23 Stock, schönes Frühstück. Schöner als wie im Eigenen Wohnzimmer. Die happy Hour auf der Dachterasse mit einem inclusive! Glas Wein klingt nicht nur gut, hat auch eine top Aussicht um in den Abend zu starten.
Thx Peter for beeing our host!
Double thx to all other! Front Office, Service and Rooms.
Bis zum nächsten mal!

title: Wonderful friendly hotel!
text: Stayed here for three nights with my mother and 6 yr old daughter.  Room was lovely, the shower was epic!  Great view!  Ashley at front desk was so friendly.  Breakfast on top floor overlooking the city.  Definitely will return.

title: Very nice hotel excellent stuff  attitude
text:
Great location nice hotel specially the suite room stuff at the hotel extremely nice and helpful specially the front desk Miss Ashely 
Hotel is near bay best area Central Park 
Broadway time square there is a lot of nice restaurants around for sushi I recommend blue ribbon in 58st on 8Av

title: “A Most Sublime Hotel”
text: If you are even remotely interested in booking a room at a NYC hotel that combines sophisticated elegance with unpretentiousness and affordability than look no further by booking a room at the at the audaciously designed as well as alluring” “WestHouse” Hotel, located at 201 West 55th Street in Manhattan, New York City. Within the first few days of my “inaugural” visit, I had already concluded that this hotel will do extremely well primarily because it so apparently succeeds in attaining everything it tries to represent, which is an architecturally designed, decorative boutique hotel where sophisticated elegant interiors are infused with atmospheric elements of clarity, serenity and tranquillity. The final result from this juxtaposition of a myriad of specific design aspects is a cohesive artistic style that collectively offers an undeniably placid environment for all its guests to absorb from arrival up through departure. I can personally attest to this since it was the moment I first entered this hotel’s breathtaking stunning Deco” styled lobby and viewed the overall impressive geometric room layout, which is as close to jaw dropping perfection  as it can possibly get. What makes up the hotel lobby are rows of aligned vintage lamps with respective lampshades that hang from the sectional ceiling over grey colored modern couches with tangerine  colored pillows coupled with several interesting wood furniture pieces, a nice small fireplace and a terrific bar with a marble top and multiple glass shelves that are lit from underneath. Also, this hotel has one of the best “in house “ hard working staffs that I have ever had the incredible pleasure of getting acquainted with and special thanks to Ethan, Mo, Tarik and Nick for being so welcoming to me through my entire stay. The hotel room I was assigned to coincidentally is very closely to my own personal aesthetic and included: a very large decorative framed mirror, which was hung at the inside entrance, a  phenomenally designed “dark color lacquered painted low dresser with three “red” color lacquered painted roll out drawers, and an additional attached cabinet with an under the counter refrigerator topped off with a creamy white colored marble top; a black painted desk with a clear glass top and office style chair; a series of four early to mid 20th century photographs mounted in gold decorative frames; a king sized very comfortable sleeping bed painted glossy black and dressed with a half dozen goose down filled pillows, wrapped in eggshell white Egyptian cotton fabrics that perfectly matched the bed linens as well as several symmetrically shaped decorative pillows made with luxurious red and/or grey velvet type fabrics that overall tied the “four shades” of red, grey, white and black “bed look”, nicely together. Hung over the bedroom window are floor to ceiling grey color lovely blackout drapes, which is ideal for granting any guest an excellent night’s sleep. The hotel bedroom’s large bathroom is elegantly designed with a marble floor, marble walls and a marble ceiling and has a good sized glass enclosed shower with an inside matching white marble shelf and silver plated shower head that delivers forceful amounts of water, which ultimately leaves you feeling refreshingly clean! “WestHouse” offers a “no charge” daily delicious buffet breakfast from 7 am to 10 am, weekdays and  7 am to 11 am weekends and a “no charge” light fare” meal served daily in late afternoon from 5  pm to 7 pm. Served at the breakfast buffet included: freshly made scrambled eggs, buttermilk pancakes, sausage meats, perfectly cooked bacon, roasted yellow potatoes, assorted pastries, variety of bagels and freshly squeezed juices. They also have an excellent espresso maker that is extremely easy as well as fun to use and that inspired me to want to immediately purchase the exact model had I by now secured a lease on a new Manhattan apartment! At the late afternoon “lighter fare”, there were several good dishes for example, Fettuccine Alfredo, served, which also included a variety of wines to select from and eliminated the need for me to spend money on going out to a dinner at a nearby restaurant. In summation: The WestHouse Hotel is an extraordinary boutique hotel to stay at especially for all the style and beauty it apparently has a plethora off. “The entire hotel look creates a most wonderful elegant feeling on the inside while keeping all the noise and hustle bustle of the City strictly on the outside. It essentially is a hotel sanctuary for anyone who appreciates serene accommodations as well as styled and very tasteful interiors. I immensely enjoyed my stay and must admit that I never heard of this hotel prior to my arrival? However, I most certainly plan on being a “regular guest because I now realize how crucially important it is to try to remember to do something very special for yourself and as often as need be. Jeff

title: The Perfect Stay!
text: We recently spent 4 nights at the Westhouse for a family vacation (2 adults/ 2 teenagers). The Westhouse exceded our expectations in every way. The staff were wonderful - very friendly and helpful, the room was spacious and very nice and both the breakfasts and the happy hour food were excellent. Perfectly located near Times Square and Central Park, the Westhouse is a great location to stay in Manhattan.
