A special thank you to manager Eric, who was exceptionally friendly and helpful - giving us some great tips for tourist destinations and generally making us feel very welcome at the Westhouse. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

title: My Second Visit & Second Review
text:
We chose the WestHouse again for a family weekend in NYC. It was more crowded this time than it was during our last stay, but the level of service was the same. Our two rooms were not ready when we arrived at 2:45pm, so we left a contact number and our luggage to go for a walk. We returned around 4, and the lobby was more crowded. I went to the desk and found that one room was ready, so I handed the key to my parents. My room wasn't ready, and I could tell from the back and forth on the phone that it was going to take longer. When Vanessa got off the phone, she said she was authorized to offer me a one-bedroom suite at no extra charge and that it was ready now. Wow! Obviously, I took her up on the offer :) Thanks so much, Vanessa - you are the best!

The suite was large, well-appointed, and had a pull-out bed so my nieces could stay with me when they arrived. It even had a bathtub! As usual, all of the housekeeping staff greeted us warmly as we rolled our luggage down the halls. 

The 23rd floor lounge was very crowded, with many guests who appeared unaware that there were others who were also trying to get food and maneuver around the tight space. I could see that the attendants were a bit frazzled as they tried to maintain their politeness when trying to move through knots of guests while holding stacks of plates. However, they never lost their professionalism, and maintained a high level of service.

in my opinion, the WestHouse is the standard for a boutique hotel. You get a lot of value for your money, an excellent location, a warm & friendly staff, and a beautifully appointed hotel that has everything you need. Thank you to all the staff who helped my family, answered all of their questions, and made us feel at home.

title: I deserve nothing but the best and that's exactly what I got
text:
This quaint hotel on the corner of 55th and Seventh was much more than we could have ever expected.  This hotel comes hands down in terms of cleanliness, friendly service and all things great about New York.  Upon our arrival, we were greeted by two door men that brought us to the welcome desk while storing our luggage.  We were greeted kindly and given a key to a reception area to wait for our room to be available.  The reception area located on a top floor and was filled with gold, beige and brown antique decor.  Several seating areas including a outdoor patio flanked by sofa's on both sides.  And in a small nook, was a business center for any guest to use.  

We arrived to our room through a dimly lit hallway with black doors that jazzed up the space.  The ambiance screams "out with the old and in with the bold".  The rooms were plush and beautiful.  The bathroom was filled with spa like products "La Perla" that smell as good as they work.  

The reception area offered breakfast daily. It was reminiscent of a french bakery serving croissants, quiche, eggs, bacon, sausage and assorted juices.  In the evening, the champagne reception was pasta's, greens, breads and cheeses. On the side was a fridge filled with water and tiny little glassed bottle cokes and sprites. If you prefer, many guest forfeited soda for beer, wine or sangria.  
And in the world where service still means something, The Westhouse concierge team fits the bill.
My daughter had a request even before arriving at the hotel and the concierge, Sean made sure that it was filled. Service without asking, "now that's five star treatment. And the food and beverage staff understand that hospitality extends to making sure that all guest needs are met.  Many times, we arrived and our food and beverage manager escorted us to table to make sure we had a nice place to sit and enjoy time together.

Overall, if the service doesn't entice you to stay.  Just wait and see, how great this location is to everything (Central Park, Time Square, Fifth Avenue and great restaurants.

title: Desde el 2016,viniendo cada año. Nuestra casa en NY
text:
Desde hace tres años consecutivos elegimos el mismo hotel. El servicio siempre es excelente. Nick, el conserje,  es fabuloso y siempre nos soluciona rápidamente todo. Peter, el hotel Manager, se toma la molestia de ir a hablar con los clientes mientras desayunan o cenan, para saber su opinión sobre el hotel y continuar mejorando. 
Respecto a la ubicación, es inmejorable. A una de Broadway,  a 3 del Central Park, un Wholefood Marketing en el Columbus Circle, C21 a 9 cuadras, Cvs y Duanreed a 2 cuadras, Nordstrom a 2 cuadras, una estación de metro a metros del hotel.

title: Fantastic place to stay in NYC!!
text: We just spent a night at Westhouse for a special trip to NYC for my daughter’s birthday and had a WONDERFUL stay! Tristan the valet and Vanessa at the front desk were specifically warm and welcoming to our whole family, kids included!! The hotel was beautiful, and they were kind enough to upgrade our room AND leave my daughter a special birthday cake in the room. We LOVED the rooftop terrace for beautiful city views and the food was absolutely delicious!! (AND included in our room fee!!) Overall we were completely thrilled with our stay, from the facilities to the staff to the location and we cannot wait to return!!

title: Wonderful stay
text: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate our anniversary. We chose this place because they had a deal on Groupon and we are so happy we did. We were immediately welcomed by the gracious staff. Ashley checked us in and she was so kind and helpful. The hotel manager, Peter was also great and actually sent a bottle of champagne to our room when he found out it was our anniversary. The hotel also has a lovely dinner and breakfast.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in a great location in NYC. We will definitely be back.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Hotel perfecto, atención inmejorable, instalaciones óptimas,ubicación excelente y lo mas destacable su personal (educados, amables y risueños!!!). Desayunos y meriendas variados y frescos. Lo recomiendo totalmente.

title: My house away home!
text: Been staying staying here regularly for over three years and love it! Ashley is so helpful and always ensures I have a superb experience. The food is delicious and the accommodations so comfortable. The rooms are also nice and quiet. Go!

title: A Gem in the Heart of the City!
text:
My mom and I spent a wonderful weekend at the WestHouse for her birthday and it was so perfect mainly due to the hospitality and luxuriousness of this amazing hotel!
Not only is this hotel in the perfect location, walking distance to Times Square and 5th Ave for shopping, but the staff was absolutely phenomenal! They made our stay so welcome with having a homemade coconut cake (her favorite) with balloons and m&m's that said "Happy Birthday Clarice" in martini glasses. All I can say is they go the extra mile and more. Loved having the extra perk of drinks and small bites at 5pm on the terrace on the 23rd floor and breakfast as well every morning there. 
Five out of five stars to this amazing hotel and even more amazing team!

title: Wonderful experience!
text: I had called the concierge ahead of time to get some recommendations for dinner and activities to do with our children during our stay. They provided me with some great ideas and set things up for me when we decided what we wanted to do. When my family and I first arrived there was an issue with getting our room ready. The manager, Juan, took care of the problem and from that point on our stay at the hotel was amazing. The breakfast and Hours of Indulgence were great. The service from the staff was fantastic. Juan, Nick, Mo, Tristan and the whole crew went out of their way to make my family happy. Juan even had a cake sent to our room when he found out it was my sons birthday. My son was so happy he wanted to share his cake with all of the employees that he had met. He brought some of the cake down to the front desk for them to share. My family and I will definitely be back!

title: The Westhouse is the Best House!
text: I knew beforehand about the Westhouse Hotel's (located on top of the Park Central Hotel ) excellent reputation prior to our stay. Amazingly, the Westhouse exceeded my already high expectations. Upon being dropped off at the main entrance, my wife and I were promptly greeted by a team of doormen. What I immediately noticed, and then what I discovered to be a theme throughout our stay, was how genuinely friendly the staff is. Not the "I'm friendly because it's my job" friendly, but the "genuinely happy to see you" friendly. Doormen, front desk, housekeeping, terrace staff: every single person we encountered was super friendly and accommodating. The hotel manager, Petr, checked in with us throughout . After learning our tastes and preferences, Petr made spot-on restaurant recommendations. Not the touristy ones the everyone already knows about, but the small hidden gem restaurants that could otherwise go unnoticed except for a dedicated local following. Clearly, Petr genuinely listened to us. One of the many amenities that comes with staying at the Westhouse is the morning breakfast and the late afternoon "hours of indulgence". Going in, I thought wrongly - oh so very wrongly- that this would be a generic continental breakfast and a little meat and cheese spread in the afternoon. The breakfast always had freshly made eggs, meat and lots of other goodies. The coup de grace was the afternoon hours of indulgence. In addition to a wide selection of cheese, Italian meats and very delicious wines was a daily, freshly made hot item worthy of New York's best restaurants. Once, manicotti was offered, and on another day, the best seafood paella that I ever had the privilege to savor. I have been to NYC dozens of times in my life. I have stayed at quite a few very fine hotels. Without a doubt, my most enjoyable and most memorable visit was our stay at the Westhouse. Because of the kind, caring staff, their outgoing manager Petr, the great food and wine, and the luxurious rooms, I have absolutely no reason to ever stay anywhere else.

title: Great hotel!
text: Excellent overall stay, good clean rooms. This hotel is in a great location near Central Park, close Times Square and other NYC staples. The staff is awesome and very helpful. We were greeted with smiles upon entering. I definitely reccomend this hotel!

title: Sunny spot on a rainy day
text: Hotel is well located.  Staff could not have been nicer.  Room was pretty nice - felt a bit narrow - hard to walk around the bed but the location was quiet and the bed was super comfortable.  Lounge was very crowded on a Sunday night.  Breakfast just ok.  All of that said, I would return.

title: Good hotel but hidden fees
text:
I recently stayed at the WestHouse hotel. It's a nice boutique hotel with a great location. The staff is also very nice. 

However, when I arrived, I was informed that in addition to the room and tax fees, I prepaid for, there would be an additional "residence fee" of $47. At first, I thought this was a small amount, so I signed the acknowledgement form (even though I did not see anywhere on my booking site that this would be an additional charge).  At the end of my stay, I discovered that the fee was $47/person/night. As a result, my weekend stay costs essentially doubled. I travel a lot and never experienced such a high "additional fee." Ultimately, I left the weekend feeling disappointed in my choice and feeling, quite frankly, deceived. For future travelers, be aware of this charge before you book and take it into account when you budget.

title: Tahmina K our Reservation Agent was Fantastic - Property was average at best
text:
After having trouble with a 3rd party booking site (agoda.com) I contacted WestHouse directly and connected with Tahmina K in Reservations.  She was able to help resolve the issue with agoda.com without incurring any penalties.  At the same time I had booked another hotel (The Knickerbocker which we had previously stayed at and is great) to ensure we had something reserved.  However, because Tahmina was so helpful I wanted to give the WestHouse my business and she was great in helping to book the right room for my family while waiving some fees due the hassle we went through.  She is the only reason I have rated it a 3 - Average.  Otherwise it would have been lower.

All that said, we were not entirely impressed with the hotel itself.  Although the location was great for us, I agree with some comments in some of the other reviews.  An example I have seen repeatedly was a mold-type odor in the room - which we also had.  Another is rust on the light fixture in the bathroom (Room 1929)

Although the Residence Fee ($200+) was waived for us (thanks again to Tahmina) The Terrace offerings, included in the fees, do not really make up for not having room service or other typical amenities you would find in a "luxury" hotel.  Closing at 8PM limits the options for families to "relax" outside of the Lounge which was dark and totally empty when we were there.  We actually went to a different hotel for this.  Also, the doors were locked to the outside patio when we wanted to have breakfast and there were limited plant-based food options for breakfast other than bananas and dry bagels.

A little disappointing having brought the family in for our first Broadway show and my anniversary with my wife.

For the deal we received it was acceptable but will not stay in the future.
